column65: Nancy's Beach House is a charming getaway with private entrance, outside deck and patio amongst beautiful mature gardens. We are located minutes from Monticello, James Monroe's Highland and several wineries. Enjoy the fully equipped kitchen and all the comforts of home. It was originally decorated as a beach house because Nancy felt a beach vibe upon seeing the openness and ambiance of the space. In keeping with the beach house vacation feel, there are games, puzzles and music for you to enjoy. The space The house is a duplex and the host lives in the other apartment. There is an extra thick wall between the apartments so noise is rarely a problem. This is an old house in the country and the gardens have a wide variety of trees, shrubs and perennials. If you have asthma, allergies or immune deficiencies then this may not be the place for you. Guest access Separate apartment with a private entrance, covered porch and an adjacent deck with picnic table for guests' exclusive use. Also, there is a large front stoop with a bench. Other things to note Due to regulations by my local government, I am only allowed to rent the space for 30 days OR MORE at a time. Thus the price set at $50 a day works out to $1500 for 30 days. I would be glad to answer any questions. BEFORE YOU BOOK-Please review airbnb's cancellation policy for long term rentals.

column31: 32 inch HDTV with Roku, standard cable
column58: Spacious guest suite with a private entrance. Located on the cul de sac in a quiet neighborhood. Mountain views and the wooded property makes it feel like you're in the country yet your just minutes from all that Charlottesville has to offer (University of Virginia, shopping, dining, hiking, wineries, breweries, sightseeing). The space Guest suite provides an open living space with a full kitchen, a large bedroom, and a full bathroom. The path to the private entrance is a gradual slope, but you shouldn't have any trouble rolling luggage up or down the path.

column64: Farmhouse on 14 acres offers closest proximity to Monticello (4 minutes away). Jefferson Vineyard (1 min), Ash Lawn (3 min), Carter's Mountain & Michie Tavern (5 min), Downtown Open-Air Mall (14 min). Relax with a cold drink on the front porch or enjoy views of the mountains and pond from the back deck. There is plenty of space to breathe here. Full kitchen & laundry. Feel free to snack on whatever we have. Great views & country feeling but close to everything. Relax & make yourself at home! The space The master bedroom (upstairs) has a King mattress with pillow top. Also, the sitting room off the master bedroom has a queen bed. In addition there are two good size bedrooms with queen beds upstairs. There are 2 full bathrooms upstairs, and a half bath on the main level. You are welcome to the bacon & eggs in the fridge. Coffee, tea, sodas, and water are also complimentary. Actually, what the heck, feel free to snack on anything in the fridge or pantry. They are usually fairly well stocked. There is a second fridge in the garage with additional cold drinks. This is a modest farm house (not fancy in any way) but we think you will find it comfortable, relaxing, and convenient. We have a 56 HDTV with stereo sound in the living room and 32 inch HDTV's in all bedrooms. The house has Xfinity Fiber Optic Extreme Pro internet (800 mbps). Most major network and cable TV stations can be accessed through YouTube TV. There is also ROKU and / or Amazon Fire TV with Alexa, Netflix, Spotify, etc. The garage is also available should you want to use it. A remote will be provided. Guest access Upstairs: Guests have private access to the master bedroom suite which includes a walk-in closet & full bath. Also the sitting room off of the master bedroom is fully furnished and has an additional queen bed. There are two additional bedrooms (queen) along with a full bath in the hall. Main Level: You'll have access to the kitchen, living room, dining room, half bath, laundry room, back deck, and front porch. The large two car garage is also available for use. Please don't go in the basement as we only use that for storage. There are also a couple other rooms in the house closed off and used for storage. Other things to note Important...Please be sure to include all guests (including children) when booking.
column71: Thomas Jefferson Pkwy - Gateway to Monticello

column52: Historic Estate w/ land granted by Jefferson & where the first wine grapes were planted in 1773. Today, wine culture flows strong as the home of Jefferson Vineyards. The space This property has been selected for inclusion in The 100 Collection™, a global designation awarded to only the top professionally managed vacation rentals based on consistent quality and service. This 5 bedroom, 5.5 bath historical estate is surrounded with charm and character. Max occupancy is 10 people at all times - both overnight and during the day. Property’s History: Colle’s land was granted from Thomas Jefferson in 1773 to an Italian viticulturist from Tuscany, Philip Mazzei.  Mazzei planted vines and built the original Colle in 1773.  Around 1930, Colle was disassembled and it’s thought that parts of the home’s exterior were put to use for the renovation of Charlottesville’s Michie Tavern, located a few miles away.   In 1939 the Woodward family purchased the property and  rebuilt Colle on the original foundation.  Today, the wine culture still flows strong through out the property.   Directly across the street sits Jefferson Vineyards. Take a stroll over to their two tasting rooms and enjoy the beautiful Mountain View and sprawling vineyard. First Floor: King Bed with En Suite Bath with Bathtub Queen Bed Queen Bed Full Bath with Walk-in Glass Shower Large Living Room with Two Sitting Areas Dining Room Kitchen with Breakfast Nook Half Bath Second Floor: Queen Bed with En Suite Bath Full Bath Queen Bed Full Bath Small Second Living Room with TV Amenities: SubZero Refrigerator Wolf Gas 6 Burner Stove and Oven Charcoal Grill Standard Drip Coffee Maker and Tea Kettle Wi-Fi Flat Screen Smart TV to use Netflix, HBOgo, Pandora, YouTube, Hulu, Amazon Video Central Air/Heat Gardens Outdoor Patio Outdoor Swimming Pool (not heated, weather dependent & subject to change: open May - September) Parking for 8-10 cars No Washer/Dryer All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.

column69: 1900's farmhouse situated on 11 secluded wooded acres, backing up to Kilauwren Winery a short 10 min hike away! Rustic country feel with modern touches. Full Kitchen and dining area. Classic front porch with swing. Lots of yard to enjoy with mountain views. Screened in back porch to enjoy sunsets. Very secluded! Please note, if you are bringing your pet, further details on fees are below. The space We are super happy to welcome your pets to The Farmhouse. We charge an additional pet fee of $20 per night/per pet. This is payable upon booking through a welcome link you will receive. The Farmhouse was originally part of a 175 acre cattle farm in 1900. It now sits on 11.25 acres. The original 1900 structure consisted of the dining room, kitchen and the two bedrooms above them. There still exists the central chimney to heat the “2 over 2 rooms”. The windows in the kitchen and dining room and blue bedroom are original. There is a small creek on the property. Guest access Entire house and property Other things to note Many close wineries, from walking distance to 5 miles up the road. Pet friendly. Locally Owned Restaurants listed below: Jack Shop’s Kitchen: 10 miles. Located in the heart of Ruckersville Antique area, Jack Shop’s serves locally sourced food. You can eat and browse antique stores without ever re-parking your car. Best Local Food $$ Lafayette Inn: 8 miles. Our Stanardsville local, “fancy” restaurant, provides an excellent menu and dining experience. The building is civil war era and was once, among other things a hospital, boarding house and watch shop. Open Fri, Sat and Sun only. $$$ Bavarian Chef: 17 miles. Delicious German food and beer. Award winning family restaurant is a favorite among locals and has been open for over 40 years. Bring your appetite and expect to be served by professional wait staff. $$$ Fabio’s Pizza: 14 miles. An excellent strip mall local Italian restaurant. Totally more than just a pizza place, wonderful traditional Italian dinners made by Italian chefs! No kidding! Truly great food at bargain prices. $$ Sal’s Pizza: 8 miles: Tasty hand tossed pizza with all the regular topping options. Extensive hero and Italian fare as well. Open Mon – Sat $ Payton’s Market: (Best Fried Chicken in Greene County! ) This country store/gas station on Rt 33 business is the place to grab an excellent “to go” fried chicken picnic lunch before heading to a winery to sit on the lawn, enjoy a bottle of their wine and relax taking in the view. Open Daily $ Marybelle’s Market: (2 miles) Closest place to get beer or minimal groceries. This local General Store serves lunch and breakfast sandwiches and cold beer. It’s on the way to Stone Mountain, Moss and Glass house vineyards.

column46: Unwind in this secluded, charming, cozy loft nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains, with beautiful views. This well-appointed 2-bedroom with 1 full bath gives you all the conveniences of home with its fully functional kitchen and flowing floor plan. You will love the fresh, clean, bright and airy comfort inside and the deck to relax in the rockers or dine alfresco outside. Located 8 miles from Skyline Drive and 30 minutes from Charlottesville. Book this gem before your dates are taken! The space Granite countertops, microwave, cook-top, refrigerator and goose neck sink. Dine alfresco on the balcony overlooking the property with a full-sized replica of the Chartres labyrinth. New construction in 2018. Only 8 miles from Skyline Drive Swift Run entrance.We have qualified for the highest cleanliness standard with Airbandb and comply with CDC disinfection and cleaning requirements. Guest access Explore Monticello, Montpelier, the University of Virginia and Shenandoah National Park. Hike the Appalachian Trail! Vineyards abound and Charlottesville's farm to table culture and lively music scene offer many options for dining and entertainment. Other things to note Please note that there is a residence up the hill on the property and you may have a car driving up the same drive as the Loft from time to time. There are stairs to enter the Loft.

column91: Iconic home and Farm in Dyke, Virginia, circa 1891. Situated on the Roach River with views of the Blue Ridge mountains and pastures. Relax on one of the double porches or under on of the shade trees. The stone fireplace warms the heart and soul on a cool evening. Minutes from the Shenandoah National Parkway, the Blue Ridge School and several beautiful wineries. Approx. 12 miles from CHO airport, 20 min from Blue ridge Parkway, 10 min. to Standardsville and 20 miles to Charlottesville. The space Newly remodeled beautiful place. Has fishing pond and many grassy areas to enjoy the fresh mountain air. Situated on a 50 acre parcel with plenty of privacy and wildlife. Guest access You will have access to the home and the nature around it.

column50: This wonderful studio is perfect for any person traveling to UVa who wants to be right in the middle of everything! It's less than 5 mins to grounds and 15 mins to the JPJ Arena. You have a reserved parking spot out front, high speed internet, a TV with Roku and a full kitchen to keep the your food budget to a minimum. The space You have access to the entire apartment!

column64: Hello everyone! I’m not going to try to convince you to stay at this Airbnb but instead address the issues that guests have complained about in reviews. This listing is priced accurately and cheap because there isn’t much besides 2 king beds, bathroom, washer/dryer. There is a bit of noise from upstairs when people walk around but usually no later than 11 PM. Please keep in mind when reviewing that you’re not paying very much to stay here. If you’re going to complain, please stay elsewhere. The space Full access to lower level and yard. Unfortunately, there’s no kitchen on the lower level and not much furniture, but I hope to have it fully furnished soon. Perfect if you’re looking for a private spot to relax and sleep for the night. FYI: I’ve listed this as a 2 bedroom space because both rooms have beds. However, for the sake of not misleading my future guests, I’ve considered the main room as one of the bedrooms. Check-in: 7pm Check-out: 12pm If you need an earlier check-in, let me know and we might be able to work it out. The reason it’s 7pm is so I have time to clean before each guest. Heating is provided through three space heaters which adequately heat the entire space. Please keep in mind that this is a finished basement and not a hotel. I’ve received a few negative ratings because there’s not much besides the two king beds and other essentials. Also, there is a potential of noise because I like to play music and the floor upstairs has some squeaky spots. We will try to be as quiet as we can after 11pm. Please keep these things in mind before reviewing my place! Thank you! Other things to note There is a potential for noise because the basement ceiling isn’t insulated. You may hear some squeaky foot steps, talking, and music. I love my music! Regarding pets: I only allow dogs. No cats.

column62: This cabin sits on a 5 acre lot close to I.64 and Rt.250. It has nice mountain views from private back deck. It is close to (5 mins) the Blue Ridge Parkway and Skyline Drive. Also a short drive to all the local wineries and breweries. A Great location for hikers and cyclists! The Cabin is cozy/rustic with character. It has everything you should need to make your stay comfortable. Due to the coronavirus, we clean, sanitize and disinfect frequently touched hard surfaces between reservations. The space Afton and Veritas wineries ( two of the best in the region) are located on the same road. There are several breweries and distilleries close by for your enjoyment too! The Cabin is rustic but very comfortable. There is a large kitchen/ dining room with a large farm table and large window that looks out to trees and the mountains. There is a nice small deck at the back which offers some outdoor space and privacy, nice spot to have your breakfast or just a cup of coffee!(if it's not too hot or humid!) There is a cozy living room that has a sofa bed and a very comfy chaise lounge (my favorite resting place!) the bathroom is located off the living room. PLEASE BE AWARE: The stairs leading to bedroom downstairs is STEEP but with rails on both sides it's safe (but probably NOT suitable for elderly people or people with mobility issues or very young kids who need supervision). As you go down the steps you will need to  duck" your head slightly to avoid banging it against the overhead! (ouch). The bedroom is a large room that is the size of both rooms upstairs. There is one queen and one full size bed on each side of the room

column49: Cozy 1 bedroom Cabin with Amazing View of the Blue Ridge Mountains The space Tim's Cabin at Two Stone Row is located on a beautiful, 85 acre, northern Albemarle County property in Earlysville, Virginia. The cabin is nestled on top of a small hill surrounded by trees with an opening looking out to the Blue Ridge Mountains. It is the perfect place to enjoy a peaceful, Virginia countryside setting; relax by the fire, enjoy coffee on the porch, or fish/boat on the property's private pond.  You could also spend a day at nearby Moss Vineyards and Glasshouse Winery (both within a 20 minute drive) or head into downtown Charlottesville, just 12 miles away, for some dining and nightlife. This wonderfully restored log cabin was constructed with historic, white pine logs sourced from West Virginia and old heart pine- used extensively in the restoration. The cabin sleeps 4 with a queen bed upstairs and a pull out couch in the main living room.  The main level has an open floor plan providing a full kitchen, breakfast table for 4 and a living room centered around a stone fireplace. A flat-screen TV set-up with Apple TV is available to enjoy your favorite shows and movies. The upstairs bedroom offers another wood-burning fireplace and full bath. Off of the main level, on the backside of the cabin, is a porch that looks out to the Blue Ridge. Guests of the property also have access to walk the grounds and usage of the private pond nearby. We welcome you to bring your dog to this property for an additional $45 pet fee. Main Level - Full Kitchen Flat Screen TV w/ Apple TV Queen Sleeper Sofa Wood-burning Fireplace Back Porch with Views of Blue Ridge Second Level - Queen Bed Full Bath Wood-burning Fireplace Amenities: Wi-Fi A/C & Heat No Dishwasher No Washer/Dryer Cell service can be poor depending on the cellular provider Charcoal Grill Fire pit Standard Drip Coffee Maker Pet Friendly for $45 fee All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.

column53: A 2 bedroom cottage duplex in the woods, a mile from the stadium, just a few minutes drive from the hospital, and 3 miles from downtown. Guests stay in the full private apartment above, the owner and family are in the basement apartment below. Country privacy, city convenience. Large living and dining area, galley style kitchen with gas stove. Deck overlooking private wooded area. The space This is a spacious two bedroom apartment with a large living/dining area with a vaulted ceiling. The master bedroom and living area have doors onto the deck. The space is the upstairs part of a duplex. My family and I live in the downstairs part. Guest access The house has a basement apartment which is where the owner lives. The backyard is fenced for the resident dog, but the front yard is all yours, as is the upstairs apartment and deck. Other things to note This is a well-loved and lived in house. It is not a hotel. As time goes on, we'll be improving, but right now it needs paint and some work on the exterior. It is a beautiful space, with hardwood floors, and the deck is really large, but it is not a pristine guesthouse. It is a really nice, spacious 2 bedroom apartment for a reasonable price. There is a resident dog who stays downstairs. You might hear her bark. When thunderstorms are brewing and we are at work, she has been known to break through the barriers and head upstairs looking for solace. The door from the basement is locked, and she can't get through, but she has gotten up to the top of the stairs to whine. There is also a cat on the premises, who you probably won't see unless she decides to hang out in the window box--which has no flowers in it for that very reason.

column46: 2 bedroom cabin surrounded by 200 acres - perfect for a relaxing getaway The space Beautiful mountain views on a 200 acre farm. This recently renovated cabin is the perfect weekend getaway. Spend time hiking the Blue Ridge or relaxing around the Asado in the backyard. On the main floor you will find 1 bedroom, 1 full bathroom, living room with a wood burning stove, large kitchen, and office. The upstairs is an open loft with the second bed located in a closed corner for privacy. The cabin is 10 minutes from the town of Stanardsville, 20 minutes from Skyline Drive and Shenandoah National Park, 45 minutes from Charlottesville/University of Virginia, and close to many local vineyards (Glass House, Barboursville, Stone Mountain).

column41: If you like camping and nature you’ll enjoy this off-grid getaway! Our Yome is a Dome style frame structured tent on wooded deck. The entrance is a window door with an elevated forest view. Sit on the porch and listen to the rushing of the nearby creek. Day hike our wooded 70 private acres, with pastured chickens for fresh egg breakfast optional extra fee. Bring your own outdoor grill or camp stove for cookout. Wood stove inside for cold weather warmth. Cut dry wood provided extra fee. The space This is a unique outdoor camping experience for a single, couple or small family, and a nice break for avid hikers. The bed is a double wide futon with a lofted twin mattress. ( no railing) Furnishings include table and chairs and rockers with a rug. The Yome lighting is by battery powered lantern. Bring your flashlights or lanterns. There is NO electricity. The outside deck will accomodate your small grill but no indoor cooking please. (Breakfast is served by reservation at our house patio available for a nominal fee.) The dedicated private bathroom has electricity to power your phone or small electronics. This is an outdoor nature lovers respite for guests who enjoy wild places in comfort. If you hate bugs, occasional nesting mice, visiting deer and a possible bear sighting this is NOT for you!! Bring your sleeping bags or blanketed bedroll for best experience. Clean sheets and towels are provided. Bring your own cooking gear or eat out at the local brew pubs. Guest access Standing shower and utility sink with flush commode in private bathroom, available within a short walk through garden into our home walkout basement. Other things to note Outdoor enthusiasts will enjoy this glamping experience. Fresh water access in bathroom and provided by bottle in Yome. No electricity or cooking inside Yome. You can charge a cell phone via front porch outlets outside house or using a bathroom outlet. Weather appropriate footwear recommended for walking through grass to car and bathroom. Dress warmly for outdoor weather. Bring your own camping cookout gear.

column63: It's time for stargazing and views on rooftop deck. Our big house is minutes from where the Blue Ridge Parkway meets Skyline Drive and Rockfish Valley's 5 wineries, 3 breweries, cidery and distillery. Our site offers pastoral views and hikes in the forest on our 70 acres near the Shenandoah Valley. You’ll be learning about this straw-bale constructed eco-centric home. Our free range hens provide fresh eggs for your optional $12 full breakfast. This room is best for solo adventurers! The space This private room is best for solo travelers offering a full size bed upstairs with cozy chair view overlooking pasture, woods and mountains. The rooftop deck invites gorgeous stargazing views and daytime vistas of Rockfish Gap and the Blue Ridge. Guest access Front door access leads straight up one flight to your private room. Full large hall bathroom is next to your room. Your room is fully equipped with big fluffy towels, a personal terry-robe, and amenities. Guests are welcome in all outdoor areas on your own. Back patio offers a cozy fire outdoors. Private woods and creek are a short walk outside the door for a healthy hike or a private meditation. During your stay We want you to feel at home and welcome you to learn about Straw-bale home construction, geo-thermal heating and eco-friendly building methods, as well as local farming and the Nelson County Rockfish Valley. We have lived here since 2000 and happy to be your hosts and to provide local information that is of interest to you. We are very familiar with all the area offers to visitors and newcomers. We are a LGBTQ welcoming family home. Other things to note Take advantage of all that the surrounding area has to offer including hiking, skiing, antiques and arts market shopping, restaurants, live music, and all the wineries, breweries, and cideries along the Route 151 Brew Ridge Trail. Or just hang out at this big lovely estate. Bring back your favorite wine from one of 4 local vineyards and enjoy a glass here while watching the sunset from rooftop. Bring some local Bar-B-Q back and enjoy it on the patio with a cozy fire There are three bedrooms available for guests of more than 2 when added to our primary listing. Families visiting University of Virginia are encouraged to stay with us and check out the local scene. Wintergreen Resort visits and wedding guests at Veritas or other nearby vineyards are welcome to rest here. Uber and other ride services are offered if you reserve directly.

column66: wineries and the Brew Ridge Trail. Hike - Bike - Relax. We like questions: Airbnb parameters are restrictive. We try to accommodate when possible. column69: and breweries along scenic Route 151 plus many more scattered around the county. The house is over 100 years old and has been thoroughly modernized. The unincorporated Village of Afton was established in 1859 with the opening of a train station and Post Office. Richmond families escaped the heat of summer at the nearby Afton House Hotel. Air-conditioning changed habits and the Hotel was converted to a home that unfortunately burned to the ground in 1963. The freight station shipped tons of fruit from the surrounding orchards. The Albermarle Pippin (or Newton) apple was made famous by Thomas Jefferson and was one of the first apples exported to the U.K. when Queen Victoria lifted import duties on Virginia fruit to encourage the availability of her favorite apple. The train station was closed and demolished more than 50 years ago with a replica built as an attorney's office. The original rail line to Crozet's tunnel was replaced in the early 1940s with another line about 50 feet to the south. Amtrak's Cardinal still comes through 3 times a week in both directions during the afternoon making its way between NY-Chicago and unscheduled empty coal trains move westward with varying degrees of frequency. We estimated from 0-3 times per day on average and most often during the day but they also come through at night
column72: no schedule. The active track lies about a football field's length below the house. In 2021 we sold our Shenandoah Valley home and now reside in another cottage on the property. We also travel frequently in our little RV but are are always available to answer questions: local history

We consider our home dog friendly for responsible pet owners. Please bring a blanket to protect our furniture if your dog is used to being on furniture. Taxes Airbnb collects and remits only the combined state and county sales tax of 5.3% The Nelson County Transient Occupancy of %5 is not collected by Airbnb but is included in our posted rates for remittance to the county. Stays of 90+ days are tax exempt. Guest access Guests have access to the entire house and 1 acre +/- property with the exception of the crawl space
column81: eaves and the tool shed. There is a small storage shed with combo-lock available for guests to store items like skis or bicycles. Other things to note Afton is considered quiet countryside
column83: the house is 120 yards from an active rail line. There are 6 Amtrak passenger trains that pass through per week plus the occasional empty coal train or freight. Snow and ice during the winter can block the driveway so we provide a parking area along the primary road when weather threatens; we have no way to guarantee when the driveway will be plowed/safe. Stink bugs plague the east slope of the Blue Ridge for a couple of weeks in the fall during daylight hours. An afternoon roundup with the dustbuster and dumping that outside is all it takes to keep the house clear of the little buggers. Slightly more annoying are the Asian Lady Beetles aka the Harlequin Ladybird. They look like Lady Bugs but they're not. They sneak into the house in the fall and then try to find their way out ever sunny warm day until spring. Once again a late afternoon vacuum and release out of doors will provide a quiet night. This list may read like a nightmare but every house on the eastern slope of the Blue Ridge deals with most of what is written here. snow/ice/stink bugs and lady beetles. The train probably sets us apart. A lot of folks find the train exciting or charming;to each his own. As hosts our philosophy will always be to keep our guests well informed

column57: Afton Mountain Vineyards Guest House The space Afton Mountain Vineyards Guest House is the perfect way to celebrate a romantic weekend or a relaxing getaway!   This two bedroom, two bath cottage is located in the heart of a beautiful mountain vineyard. The views that surround this property are breathtaking.  Situated on the sunrise side of Afton Mountain, this property sits at 1000 feet in elevation.   Enjoy sprawling views of grapevines out your back door and the panoramic mountain view that surrounds them.  Please note that the Guest House is located near the Tasting Room. The property's kitchen is perfectly set up for those wanting to prepare the weekend meals.  Equipped with a gas range and stainless steel appliances, this newly renovated kitchen has all the amenities you will need.  The kitchen island is beautiful piece made from a stone from Madagascar called Big Blue
column58: and it really shines at night.   Want to take your meal and dine al fresco?  The outdoor patio has a table and outdoor seating for four!  However, your favorite room in the house may very well be the screened in porch with its stunning views.  Here you can sit and sip your morning coffee or evening glass of wine made from the grapes off the vines that fill your view. The King sized master bedroom has its own en suite bath.  The master bath has a marble, double sink vanity, tiled walk in shower, and a deep tub perfect for a relaxing soak!   The second bedroom is located on the terrace level and features a king bed and en suite bath as well. One of the biggest amenities is just steps from your front door.  Stroll on over to the Vineyard's tasting room where their knowledgeable staff can tell you about their assortment of wines that they make on site.  Afton Mountain Vineyards is one of Virginia's first farm wineries. The original vines were planted in 1978.  Those blocks are still in production today, and they now grow a total of 15 varieties on 24 acres. Afton Mountain Vineyard's Tasting Pavilion is only open Thursday through Sunday. No Smoking or Open Flames Allowed on Property No early check-in or late check-out permitted! Main Level: King Bed, and Full En Suite Bathroom with Tub and Shower Living Room Dining Area Fully Equipped Chef's Kitchen with Gas Range and Stainless Steel Appliances Washer and dryer Electric Fireplace Private Outdoor Patio with Table and Seating Screened-In Back Patio Outdoor Seating with Stunning Views of Vineyard Vines & Pond Terrace (lower) Level: King Bed with En Suite Bathroom, with Shower/Tub Combination Views of Pond

column37: Children’s books and toys for ages 0-2 years old and 2-5 years old
column65: Free driveway parking on premises – 1 space
column70: A contemporary carriage house completed in Fall 2019 Come stay at our new space created with guests in mind. Tall, 9’ ceilings, modern and well appointed kitchenette, and spacious bathroom. We are walking distance to the stadium (about 1 mile), centrally located in the Fry’s Spring Neighborhood for quick access to the Downtown Mall, local vineyards and breweries, Monticello Trail, and other local sights. The space Guests have access to the full 1 bedroom carriage house apartment (above our garage) in our backyard. Apartment features double pocket doors offering privacy or open concept. Spacious bathroom with full size tub and furniture grade vanity. Full size sleeper sofa. Kitchenette with 2-top electric burner & microwave. Air mattress available upon request. Guest access Guests have access and use of entire apartment ABOVE garage. Other things to note We have 4 young children, so you may see them or neighborhood kids playing around on our property. We have a great neighborhood with lots of littles ones, so please use care when driving on the streets. Carriage house is in our backyard, so it is only about 20-25’ away from our home. Apartment is ABOVE our garage/home gym/office that is used regularly. Access is from outdoor stairs, as seen in photo.

column73: Modern loft style 800sqft guesthouse. Lots of light and privacy in a quiet neighborhood, just 7-10 minutes to Scott Stadium/UVA/restaurants/downtown mall and Thomas Jefferson’s Monticello. Central to many wineries/breweries. You are in nature but close to everything Charlottesville. With a comfortable Queen size bed, and sleeping cot available if necessary. It is clean, comfortable and spacious. A great place to unwind for a good night’s sleep and sweet dreams. (discount apply to weekly/monthly) The space This renovated Scandinavian-inspired interior has all the modern amenities: shower and bathroom (bath essentials,hair dryer,iron), a fully functional kitchen (refrigerator, microwave, stove, dishwasher, coffee, tea). A large sofa, TV, cable and a dinning area, a reading corner, mini-split for air/heat, 2 Ceiling fans and 5 sky lights. A sunny deck on the front and a sliding door leading to a shady deck off the back. The house is under a row of tall cedar trees and about 150 ft in the garden area behind main house on a land of 4 acres. If you like to keep your outdoor exercise routine while traveling this is a good place for you. Guest access Entire guesthouse, the yard and all surrounding vegetable and flower gardens. Other things to note There are 2 guest houses on the property, Honey House and Honey B. They are separate but nearby, designed with maximum privacy in mind: different parking locations and separate building entrances. Ideal for 2 couples vacationing together. ﻿Honey B: https://abnb.me/auyZDKTTygb Or, zoom in map to see both listings.

column54: A perfect location for UVA or Cville visitors, this single-family home is in a residential area of downtown Charlottesville. Recently renovated, it has three bedrooms, two baths, and a cook’s kitchen - with a gas stove! Enjoy off-street parking, keyless entry, memory foam mattresses, Roku TV, and provided breakfast. One mile from UVA grounds and hospital, one mile from West Main, and 1.5 miles from the downtown mall. Bring your pup or your friends! Discounts automatically apply for long stays! The space Guests have full use of the entire house: three bedrooms, two full baths, dining room, kitchen, living room, and a small office. There is a large back yard where canine guests are welcome to roam around. This is an older home with recent renovations and modern amenities. Guest access Guests have access to entire home! Personal items are stored in closets; these are off-limits to guests. Other things to note This is my home, not a sterile, empty, dedicated rental. There are personal items in the closets and small layout and furniture changes may be made from time to time. You are very welcome to bring your dog, but the yard is not fenced. The house was built in the 50's, so it has it's quirks like any home. It is a true home share in line with the spirit of Airbnb!
column61: 3 bdrm home 1 mile from UVA, No extra fees!

column54: Charming, cozy 1940’s cottage is nestled in an historic neighborhood. One mile to Amtrak and Historic Downtown Mall. 10 WALK to UVA graduation/grounds, Scott stadium (Perfect for those here on UVA business, weddings, reunions, football games), UVA hospital, neighborhood cafe—restaurants and shopping at “the corner” district. Convenient to our many award winning wineries and breweries. Brewery Walking tours and trolley tours. The space The “Little Yellow Cottage” is located within the geographic heart of Charlottesville. You will find the cottage to be light and clean with hardwood floors throughout and tiled bathroom. Relax on the private deck/backyard while taking in the sound of water dripping off the rocks into the fishpond. Many lovely plants and flowers. Your steps away from UVA central grounds (Thomas Jefferson’s famed Lawn and Rotunda), The Corner District, Scott Stadium (UVA football games) and UVA Health System. A short trolley ride will take you to the historic Downtown Mall and West Main and local spots for boutique shopping, breweries, dining and entertainment. Guest access *An easy walk to shop and dine at the “UVA corner” *UVA grounds, Rotunda 5-7 minutes walk - take in the history and beauty *10 minute walk to UVA football games *Starbucks right up the street * “The Oakhurst Inn Cafe” is right around the corner - enjoy a short stroll to a charming cafe offering an espresso bar, pastries, breakfast, lunch and Weekend Brunch...highly recommend! Farm Bell Kitchen (The Dinsmore House) is closeby and offers great food and service in a lovely atmosphere. * Free trolley around UVA grounds and to Historic Downtown Mall *Historic Downtown Mall and West Main offer dining, shopping and entertainment *Skyline Drive and Blue Ridge Parkway within a 20 minute drive-breathtaking overlooks from Car or hike the many trails available. Pack a picnic lunch or stop at Greenwood country store for your gourmet lunch *Wineries and breweries in town and within lovely short drive *Hike “Rivanna Reservoir trail right up the street Other things to note *Monticello - the primary plantation of Thomas Jefferson located about four miles southeast (Winery on your way!) *Wineries - over 30 wineries within 25 miles of Charlottesville producing wines of national and international acclaim. Check out “The Monticello Wine Trail” website. Tour buses available * Breweries and tap rooms located both in town and the surrounding area *Cideries and Distillery a beautiful 20 minute drive away *Shenandoah National Park and The Blue Ridge Parkway- drive to scenic overlooks and hike various trails *Montpelier-home of James Madison is 30-40 minute drive *Hike the “Monticello Trail” - lovely, 3 mile wooded gravel path leading up to Monticello, cafe and gift shop. Worth the 10 minute drive!
column61: “Yellow Cottage”  10 min walk to UVA graduation!

column60: Brand new studio apartment in our carriage house walkable to UVA and close to the Downtown Mall! Designed with a modern aesthetic. Wood floors, lots of natural light, full kitchen with new appliances, queen bed, full bath, WiFi, flat screen Smart TV. The space Walkable to UVA and some favorite local coffee and restaurants, an easy 15 minute drive to one of our favorite wineries, Pippin Hill, a 10 minute drive to the Downtown Mall - we are perfectly centrally located to give you the best experiences of Charlottesville all while still being located in a beautiful residential neighborhood with a peaceful, private feel. We're also a 5 minute drive to 5th Street Station where Wegman's grocery store, Panera, the Alamo Movie Theater, and other shops and restaurants are located. The carriage house is studio style with a large open floorplan, plenty of windows for great natural light, a full bathroom with tiled shower, a queen bed, full kitchen, dining table and chairs, and living area with Smart TV so you can log in to Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, etc. Fresh, clean linens and towels are provided. A pack n play can be provided if needed. The kitchen is furnished with brand new appliances - stove, oven, microwave, dishwasher, and refrigerator with freezer. We also provide enough dinnerware for 6 guests, everything you'd need to cook a meal including pots and pans, a toaster, french press coffee pot and Keurig coffee maker with some Keurig pods for convenience. The carriage house is located above my flower studio. I'm an event florist and take on about 10 events per year so you may see some in-process flower work happening in the space below you. You'll enter the studio through a door with a keypad code and then use your key to open your private door to the staircase up to the studio apartment. Off street parking is provided in our driveway.

column73: Carriage house located on 7 acres overlooking 2 ponds. Firewood, linens, breakfast items, coffee included. Fully stocked kitchen w/full size appliances. Beautiful views from the deck. Peaceful neighborhood great for walks/biking. 10-15 minutes to downtown and UVA. Other things to note You have to climb a flight of stairs to access the living area. One bedroom with a sliding barn door is on this level along with the living space and kitchen. The other king bed is in a loft above the main bedroom and overlooks the living space so it is not private. We prefer that children be 10 and older if they are going to stay in the loft.

column64: This beautiful upstairs bedroom in our modern farmhouse has a double bed with a high end latex mattress. It has views of hardwood and white pine forest, a writing nook looking out on the garden, horse pastures, and Blue Ridge mountains and adjacent full bath and library/reading area. There is a second writing desk positioned with a view of the trees out of the double window. This is a lovely writer's retreat room or single getaway. The space Galleywinter is a working horse farm and healing sanctuary on 21 acres in Albemarle and Nelson County, Virginia. Our whole farm fosters a sense of connection with nature, deep restfulness and relaxation. We offer walking trails in the woods and many peaceful places to sit and reflect. Our yoga and mediation studio just 30’ from the house offers a calming space to sit or stretch out in your regular practice. Guest access Front porch access takes you straight up one flight of stairs to your room. A full bathroom equipped with natural fiber towels, shampoo and body wash, and other amenties (should you leave something essential at home). Park your car adjacent to the herb and flower garden stone walkway. This brings you to the back door entrance and access to the guest half bath. There is a coffee bar in the studio annex with an assortment of coffee and teas. You are welcome to explore our outdoor areas on your own. Private woods with walking paths allow you to commune with trees and plants, find a meditation sit spot, and be close to our horse herds. This is all close to the house and your room. During your stay I am available to create a relaxing weekend getaway or longer restorative stay. You can have as much privacy as you like, or request a special meal, or get suggestions about places to visit in our abundant area. Experience the stillness, peace and privacy of our sanctuary in the lap of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Other things to note We can house up to 10 people here - please view our other listings: I have rooms in the main house available for overnight or longer stays. Upstairs there are 3 bedrooms with an adjacent full bath, on the ground floor we have a private room with double bed, and shared space with living area and two twin beds; and a Cowgirl Bed in our Timber Frame Barn,

column61: The Lewis Catherine House, built in 1905, has undergone a full renovation; allowing this home to welcome groups of people that want to be centrally located to numerous vineyards, breweries, and restaurants. The Lewis Catherine House is located on 7 acres on Afton Mountain Road. Conveniently located near the entrance of Veritas Winery, the Lewis Catherine House is excited to have you! The space It includes a large dining room that can seat 14 people, 5 bedrooms can sleep up to 12 people. A full kitchen to cook and plenty of outdoor space to enjoy views and a glass of Virginia wine. Guest access The entire home is accessible. The red sheds in the backyard are original to the house and off limits due to safety. Other things to note We have a complete manual to assist in the prep for your weekend. It includes all local sites, our favorite restaurants, transportation recommendations for your wine/beer tours, and other quick notes. It is onsite in the home and can also be sent ahead of time. Parties and Events are not allowed.

column64: Sunny studio apartment with separate kitchenette in great location - walk to UVA and local restaurants, 10 minutes to downtown. Private entrance, queen size bed, cable TV, wireless internet, continental breakfast for arrival and off-street parking. Large grass yard and flower gardens in historic neighborhood. Well-behaved small dogs welcome. The space Large, sunny and airy suite with private entrance and cozy porch for morning coffee or evening relaxation. Separate hall with kitchenette and closet leads to bathroom. Bathroom has extra large shower, soap, shampoo and conditioner and hairdryer. Kitchenette has a small refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven and coffee maker. Kitchenette is stocked with continental breakfast for arrival, OJ, tea, coffee, cream for coffee, fresh fruit, jam, and chocolate. Guest access Please enjoy the yard and garden. Other things to note There is a train nearby, behind evergreen trees that border the property. Also, please drive slowly, as there are young children in the neighborhood.
column71: Sunny private studio, walk to the University

column36: Exercise equipment: free weights, yoga mat
column60: The east room of our modern farmhouse is ideal for a single guest or a couple. (The pricing is for an individual so please see the extra guest charge of $35 for a couple). This room has wonderful spring colors and dappled light with a big window overlooking hardwood forest and skylight. Very comfortable double bed with all cotton linens. Adjacent to a full bath and our library and reading area. The space Our whole farm fosters a sense of connection with nature, deep restfulness and relaxation. Our yoga and mediation studio is just 30’ from the house and offers a calming space to sit, stretch, or practice yoga. Enter the studio through the shade garden or have a sit on soapstone stool. Inside enjoy the quiet space, the poplar and maple walls and floor, woods view, birdsong and whatever your awareness brings into focus. Guest access Front porch access takes you straight up one flight of stairs to your room. A full bathroom equipped with natural fiber towels, shampoo and body wash, and other amenties (should you leave something essential at home). Park your car adjacent to the herb and flower garden stone walkway. This brings you to the back door entrance. You are welcome to explore our outdoor areas on your own. Private woods with walking paths allow you to commune with trees and plants, find a meditation sit spot, and be close to our horse herds. This is all close to the house and your room. During your stay We want you to feel relaxed and at home while staying with us at Galleywinter Farm. We welcome you to learn about local farming and the Nelson County Rockfish area. We are happy to provide local information that is of interest to you. We are very familiar with all this amazing area has to offer visitors and newcomers. We welcome people from all walks of life. Other things to note We have a 3 floor farm house with bedrooms upstairs, a common area with living room and two twin beds on the ground floor, and a Rustic Barn bedroom. In total, we can sleep 10 people if all the beds are needed. The upstairs rooms have aesthetically pleasing décor with restful colors, ample natural light, hardwood floors, ceiling fans for summer comfort, and lovely views of the woods or mountains. These spaces are perfect for a Writer's Retreat: each room has a writing desk, a view to go with it and the library nearby to feed your creative spirit. These other rooms are available and listed separately: The West Room - Azure and Sage colors | Double Occupancy/full bed. This private upstairs room has a big window facing the West and setting sun. From your bed you can look out into hardwood and white pine forest. We have a paper shade for added privacy and to block the afternoon sun. The writing nook alcove has a gorgeous view of the garden, horse pastures and the Blue Ridge a few miles away. Full size bed with all cotton linens. Adjacent to Full Bath and Library & reading area. The South Room – A Writer’s Room | Single Occupancy: This private upstairs room has a big window facing the South and the shade garden of the yoga and meditation studio. From bed you can look out into the treetops of our Hardwood Forest. We have a paper shade for added privacy and to block the midday sun. Large glass-top desk at the window allows for writing projects to spread out and then come together. Walnut Single bed with all cotton linens and plenty of pillows to find just the right one for your sleeping comfort. Adjacent to Full Bath and Library & reading area. The Barn: A birch and locust single bed with large private living area above 4 horse stalls that are usually empty at night. Vaulted ceiling and lots of natural wood - pine floor, poplar walls, walnut and hickory trim. Truly a delight for nature lovers, writers, artists, and free spirits.

column39: Owner occupied by 57 year old self employed masseur with Charlottesville office. I am a SGWM with occasional quiet tenant house mates. Often latchkey access if schedules are unmatched. Parking is easy on street directly in front of the house. Restaurants, library and grocery nearby. Big Box stores 3 miles. The space Upstairs with 9 foot ceiling, wood floor, nice area rug and coffee pot. window AC/ in season, ceiling fan, reading seating, claw foot tub in adjacent bath. Kitchen, bath, laundry, music and video library, patio, lawn. Square payment accepted for concierge services if needed and available. On arrival if available and engaged as needed. Breakfast may be continental or more depending on host schedule. Eclectic view of neighbors garden complete with giant Frankenstein by local celeb artist Mark Kline. Charming early 20th century homes in the Historic Tree Streets" neighborhood. Guest access Kitchen

column59: The Inn at Blue Mountain is a 4,000 square foot Cape Cod-style home on 2 acres of wooded countryside adjacent to the larger grounds of Blue Mountain Brewery. The brewery is easily accessible via a private walkway. In addition to comfortable, well-appointed sleeping quarters, a fully-stocked kitchen, and game room with pool table, the Inn features a welcoming wrap-around porch, large outdoor deck and patio areas, fire pit, hot tub, tiki bar, and gorgeous views of the Blue Ridge Mountains. The space Conveniently located on Route 151 in scenic Nelson County, the Inn is minutes away from some of the area's best wineries, breweries, cideries, and distilleries, and a quick 20 minute drive to the University of Virginia in historic Charlottesville, Virginia. 20 miles to the south, Wintergreen Resort offers a variety of ski, spa, golf, and various recreational options year-round. Numerous hiking trails, state and national parks are also in the nearby vicinity.
column66: The Inn at Blue Mountain Brewery

column67: Country chic cottage on a boutique farm in bucolic FREE UNION, 20-25 mins from Charlottesville and Crozet . NO EXTRA CLEANING FEE, PET FEE OR EXTRA PERSON FEE. Completely remodeled cottage with well-stocked gourmet kitchen, stone fireplace (wood burning) , firewood included. GE High Profile appliances and washer/dryer, granite counter tops and custom cabinets. WiFi. Each bedroom has ensuite bathroom (with walk-in shower) and porch. Last mile+ is on a gravel road. The space This is a quiet retreat off a gravel road. The gravel road is usually well-maintained as best a gravel road can be maintained. There can be some rough sports after a heavy rain or snowfall. Most folks don't have an issue with since it is a country/rural cottage on a small farm. It is what makes it unique. This is not suburbia. Guest access The guests have access to the entire house. Other things to note This is a working farm with Angora goats and livestock guardian dogs. We have coyotes and bears in the area and could not run a small ruminant operation without them. All dogs are in the pastures and do not leave their livestock. All the working dogs here are friendly to humans. Our two year old granddaughter just about mauls each one when she visits. If you are walking down the drive, they will react to to you by barking to let you know they are there. The brown and white dog is Anna. The dog up at the barn is Otis. Even thought these dogs are friendly, it is usual practice not to reach into the pen. Please be careful of the electric lines between the four boards. They are electrified. If you are walking with your dogs and he or she tries to go under the fence line, they will most likely get zapped. They will probably yelp a but but it will not harm them. It usually takes only one zap for animals on both sides of the fence to “respect” the fence line.
column74: The Cottage at Peavine Hollow Farm-No cleaning fee

column11: Private room in bed and breakfast
column34: At Foxfield Inn we love to treat our guests with a unique blend of luxury and ease to provide a warm, relaxing environment. Every one of our 5 rooms provides a relaxing getaway that will enhance your getaway from your hectic life. We have rooms with Jacuzzi jetted tubs and fireplaces to ensure an unforgettable stay. We are known for our delectable breakfasts and great coffee. Stay with us and leave with wonderful memories. The space The intimate Garden Room is a favorite room that overlooks the park-like backyard and its 200-year-old oak tree. While you rest on the queen bed with the fire glowing in the fireplace be sure to watch the birds at the feeder. An outside porch is just a few steps away for relaxing after your busy day. Our private gazebo is just outside if you want an outdoor space in which to unwind. Of course a nice soak in the deep Jacuzzi tub could do the trick as well.

column54: Absolutely breathtaking! This lovey Cape Cod style home is tucked away in the Charlottesville countryside within eyesight of the magnificent Blue Ridge Mountains. Decorated in a casually elegant fashion throughout, the cottage has a family room at one end which makes for a nice private spot to read or enjoy intimate conversation. There is a full kitchen, a living room and dining area combination plus a screened in porch with a panoramic view. The space This beautiful cottage offers an amazing Virginia country estate experience. Historic and spacious, this home offers plenty of space for friends and family with 3 bedrooms, featuring a king, queen and two twins with three baths. Nestled between Charlottesville and Crozet, you have access to the mountains and rolling hills of Albemarle County with wineries, breweries, hiking and more! The cottage shares the 78 acres with the Ramsay Estate home which is on the National Register of Historic Places. Guest access - For this property, maximum is 3 cars.
column61: Ramsay Estate | Historic 3BR Cottage w Mtn Views

column68: Large home, loads of attractions! Blue Ridge Pkwy/Skyline Drive (5 mi.), Charlottesville, Monticello, UVA (25 mi.), 2 resorts (20 mi.) 9 golf courses (10 mi. radius), 10 camgrounds (10 mi. radius). Guest access Guests will have access to the entire house plus washer/dryer. Off street parking is also available. Other things to note No parties or events.

column56: Garth Rd area guest house just 7 miles to UVA w/ wood-burning fireplace, private screen deck, skylights, forest views The space Cabell Cottage is cozy cottage located off of one of Albemarle County's most beautiful thoroughfares, Garth Road. Nestled in the woods on a quiet street, you will feel rested and relaxed after a stay at this well appointed home.  With all rooms on one level, and three parking spaces in front of the house, access could not be easier! The skylights in the house bring in ample light to the rooms to make the cottage cheery and lovely in its setting in this serene neighborhood. Walk into the house to forest views through the large living room windows. The living room, kitchen, and dining area are all open to each other.  The studio has a queen bed plus an additional twin and is located on the southern side of the house, with a half bath attached.  Walk to the northern side of the home to an additional sitting area with cable TV.  On the far northern side of the cottage is the master suite with a king bed, screened-in porch and en suite bathroom. Amenities:Master Bedroom with King Bed and En Suite Bathroom & Screened-In Porch Studio Bedroom Off Of Kitchen: Queen + Twin and a Half Bath Fully-Equipped Kitchen w/ Gas Stove Wood-Burning Fireplace Patio with Gas Grill and a Second Patio w/ Chiminea Basketball Hoop 450' Well - Providing Great Drinking Water Lots of Reading Material and Original Art to Enjoy Wingfield Road Neighborhood is a Perfect Place to Walk/Run Cable TV/DVD Player Wi-Fi Central Heat/Air Standard Drip Coffee Maker & Tea Kettle Washer/Dryer Private Parking in Driveway with 3 spaces Whole house generator All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.

column46: An ultra-relaxing and comfortable stay, the Ramsay Estate is one of the most breathtaking historic estates around Charlottesville. The Carriage House includes an expansive room w/ King bed, kitchenette, living area and large balcony with beautiful mtn views. Perfect for a couple wanting to visit the area's vineyards and breweries, take outdoor excursions, and visit historical sites. Just a short drive to King Family Vineyards, Veritas Winery, Pippin Hill Vineyards, and Shenandoah National Park. The space Gorgeous mountain views in Charlottesville on this private country estate from the upper deck on the cottage. As you enter this charming home, climb up the stair to a sunny and spacious living quarters featuring a queen bed, sitting area, kitchenette and private balcony with the best views. Fully equipped with all the amenities you need for a relaxing stay. If you want to take a true vacation and get time away, this is a great place to relax and enjoy all the luxurious of Charlottesville too! -For this property, maximum is 1 car.
column53: Ramsay Estate | Carriage House w/ Mountain Views

column77: Bliss Point Farm and B&B is a converted historical country store, built in 1891 on twelve beautiful acres in the Blue Ridge Mountains of central Virginia. Take an easy 10 minute hike to the Lynch river through the woods. Relax, play, hike in the Shenandoah National Park. We are only a 25 minute drive from Charlottesville. All a short drive through rolling countryside of bucolic farmland and boutique vineyards, which are set against a backdrop of the Blue Ridge Mountains.
column84: Bliss Point Farm and B&B, Garden Room

column70: Beautiful light filled home close to everything! Great home for a large family with two dedicated living spaces. Perfect for long term rentals! The space Home is equipped with two separate kitchens. One is upstairs in the main living area with a secondary kitchen in the lower level along with another bedroom and full bath.
column77: Romantic Cape Cod with a Cottage Feel

column34: 37 inch HDTV with Amazon Prime Video, Chromecast, HBO Max, Netflix, premium cable, standard cable
column76: A cozy Milton Grigg designed cottage and detached carriage house three minutes walk to the Lawn and ten minutes walk to the Stadium. Nestled in a wooded neighborhood. Perfect for visiting parents, UVA chapel weddings, med student rotations, and football games. NOTE: The cottage sleeps five adults and the carriage house two adults. There is one bathroom in the cottage and one in the carriage house. Please read through all the information in the 'Description' section below before booking. The space Perfect place to work remotely. Fast internet, carriage house loft makes a great office! A beautifully furnished, cozy, two-bedroom cottage with a fireplace and hardwood floors, and detached carriage house loft. Up to four guests can stay in the cottage and two can stay in the carriage house loft. There's a queen bed in the master bedroom and two twins in the second bedroom. There is also a convertible sofa in the living room that can sleep one adult or two kids. The twins in the second bedroom are great for kids. The kitchen is stocked with pots and pans and basic cooking supplies. The cottage was designed by UVA architecture professor Milton Grigg and built from salvaged materials in 1937. Grigg is known for his work on the restoration of Monticello and Colonial Williamsburg. There are many unique period details and trim work, including wainscoting, built-in cabinetry, exposed ceiling beams, fireplace, brass box locks, and more. There is also a loft in a detached carriage house with vaulted pine ceilings, wide plank pine floors, a deck, and its own full bath. There is a trundle bed that expands from twin to king size. Two guests can stay in the carriage house loft. Guest access Guests receive a unique number code to enter the house via keyless entry through the rear door. Guests have access to the entire cottage and carriage house, which are completely equipped for a comfortable stay. Other things to note Coffee is provided (and sometimes other goodies). There's a small TV in the living room with lots of OnDemand streaming, including HBO, as well as some basic cable channels. There is no separate kitchen in the carriage house studio. All bedrooms and bathrooms are upstairs and may not be accessible to folks with limited mobility. There is a railroad track across the street, but the passing trains are not loud, and most folks won't notice them when indoors. Outside you can hear the train. You can watch it go past through the open Dutch door or from the carriage house deck. Lastly, it is a university neighborhood and our neighbors do occasionally throw student parties. There are white noise machines in each bedroom in the cottage in the rare case the neighbors get noisy.

column62: The ideal destination for safecations, family reunions, or retreats. This estate is nestled in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains ~20 minutes from Charlottesville. There are stunning views from the house, pool, and hot tub. Located on a 50 acre working farm, only minutes away from vineyards, golf courses, breweries, and hiking. The house accommodates up to 14 guests. The space A pool and hot tub are just steps away from the house and an full outdoor bathroom is adjacent to the pool. In the house, there are two large great rooms, one on the main level and one on the terrace level. A gourmet kitchen is a highlight of the main level with 2 ovens, 2 refrigerator freezers, 2 dishwashers, a gas stove with 6 burners, cooking equipment, plates, glassware, etc. The kitchen has an adjacent pantry with dedicated entrance and a deck with a separate entrance containing a covered outdoor dining area and a large Weber grill. Three of the bedrooms have a private deck or porch with a dedicated entrance. Guest access The house is located on a 50 acre farm and guests have access to most of the property, unless there is active farming underway. The property is located between a vineyard and a farm that has both retail and opportunities to pick your own fruit. Other things to note An owner's contract is required, but this contract does not contain any additional fees or charges. column77: *Spacious, sunny, 1275sf 2-bdrm apt. with 9 ft. ceilings *2 kings or 1 king+2 XL twins; wide twin air mattress avail if >4 guests (small surcharge), upon request *Xfinity cable Wi-Fi *Desk+adjustable chair *15 min to UVA; close to hiking, wineries, breweries, and Monticello *15 min CHO airport *Panoramic views of rolling hills and lovely woods *Huge landscaped yard & over-sized bluestone patio *Exclusive setting along the picturesque Garth Rd. corridor *12 min. W of town; The space Other amenities in the apartment include: *Large blue stone patio looking on to spacious lawn and views *flat panel TV with local (over the air) stations as well as Prime Video and Netflix access *X-finity WiFi *Well equipped kitchen, private Washer/Dryer *Electric flat-surface range with built-in microwave oven and external exhaust system *Central AC/heating and state-of-the-art humidity-controlled environment *Ample private parking adjacent to the house for up to two or even three cars Guest access Full and private access to everything in the apartment, which is separate from the rest of the home and has its own entrance. Other things to note Huge backyard to enjoy the fresh air and views. PETS: Guests with a small dog could be accommodated (with extra deposit and pet charge) but this needs to be discussed and cleared by owner ahead of time. On a less happy note: Taxes: Our county charges a short term occupancy tax of 8% for stays less than 30 days but NO TAX if longer than that. The Commonwealth of VA likewise charges a sales tax of 5.3% for stays less than 88 days. AirBNB includes these charges but removes them if your stay/reservation exceeds the minimum (30 and 88 days, respectively, for the occupancy and sales taxes). Sadly, I have no control over these taxes...

column63: We warmly welcome you to our comfortable garden level suite, offering a separate, private entrance, convenient free parking for two guest cars and no stairs. Ideally located near UVA, Monticello and area wineries. Suite's French doors allow ample sunlight throughout the main room. A lovely well-equipped kitchenette with two burner stove top, sink and mini-fridge. Good Wi-Fi. Spacious well lighted bathroom, walk in shower, towel warmer and rain shower head. Large closet. Pleasant and relaxing. The space Bright and welcoming basement-level apartment completely renovated with lovely French doors, an open kitchen, sitting area and a spacious tiled bathroom. Queen bed with comfortable mattress, nice linens, seasonal blanket and four pillows. Leather loveseat, side chairs, coffee table and floor lamps. Large dining table with seating up to four. Laptop-friendly space with WiFi and 32' Smart TV. Guests may log into their own streaming services. Apartment's kitchenette is fully equipped with sink, under-the-counter refrigerator, two-burner stove, microwave, toaster-oven, Nespresso coffee maker, tea kettle, cutlery and an assortment of bowls and plates. For preparing light meals, guests will find pans, pots and cooking utensils. We include wine, champagne and shot glasses. Complementary Nespresso capsules and teas. Very large, well-lighted bathroom with tiled walk in shower and rain shower head. (Shower is perfect for tall person up to six feet six inches!) Cotton towels, towel warmer and extractor fan. Spacious built-in closet with removable lower rod for hanging longer graduation or wedding gowns. A chest of drawers provides more convenient storage. Before venturing out, inspect your evening attire in our tall standing mirror. Linens and towels are included. Amenities include iron and board, hair dryer and toiletries. Guest access This self-contained apartment, with a private entrance, is separate from the upper house and offers no-contact check-in. Guests have exclusive access to the suite. My partner or I frequently travel, but we do live above. We love to ensure that our guests get the most out of their Charlottesville visit. Maps and information are available. Requests for dining or entertainment recommendations are always welcome. Private dedicated driveway accommodates two to three guest vehicles and is in front of the suite entrance. Exterior lights for your nighttime convenience and safety. Other things to note We are UVA employees who occasionally work from home, which may result in some noise filtering into the apartment. This space comfortably accommodates two people. A third guest who stays overnight will be charged $50.00 and must be approved at the time of the reservation. We can sometimes accommodate requests for early check in or late checkout. If you wish to arrange either, please notify us in advance and pay an additional $30.00 through our Airbnb account. If we cannot accommodate your request, usually because of cleaning preparations, we will let you know. Early check in: 2:00PM; late check out:12:30PM. We are and have always been a home of non-smokers. No smoking. Internet service can be disrupted by inclement weather. Extreme weather may cause loss of power in our area. We do not have a portable generator in the event of a power failure. In the event of a heavy snowfall, park your car close to the driveway entrance for easier exiting. We usually remove snow with snow-shovels. Our cleaners are paid a living wage, yet always appreciate the occasional tip.

column53: Only available for 31+ days reservations. Please send a message about May 2025 dates. This classic 1970s duplex was renovated in late 2019 and refreshed in late 2024. With 960 square feet across two levels, the two bedrooms and full bath are on the second floor. The private, fenced-in backyard backs up to a private woods. It's on a no-outlet road in Fifeville, a central neighborhood close to the south grounds, stadium, and hospital full of families and grad students. The space Two bedrooms and a full bath on second floor; living room, half bath, and kitchen on first floor. The kitchen leads out to a tiny patio and a wild backyard shared with the duplex neighbor, with tall fences on the border. Both bedrooms and the living room have black out curtains. There is an Amazon Fire TV; extra sheets, blankets, pillows, towels. Linens were replaced in Nov 2024. Please know that the house is 55 years old and although it was renovated recently (including HVAC, and there is no basement), it has a slight old house smell. If you have a sensitive nose, it may not be the unit for you. Dog specific: a medium sized crate in the closet under the stairs. The backyard has a nice tall fence and no neighbors to the back. Note that the backyard is shared with the other duplex so dogs and people could interact -- please supervise! Child specific: pack n play under the stairs and travel high chair in the hall closet. Guest access Guests have private access to the entire unit but share the backyard. Two parking spots in front (4 total in the space so park closely) and additional street parking starting a few houses down. Other things to note This is the left side of a two unit duplex. Both sides are available individually but used to be rented as one four bedroom unit, so there is an access door between the two kitchens. That interior door has a dual, keyed-only deadbolt so neither side can open the door unless rented together. (Picture those hotel rooms that allow interior access between.) But only I have both keys. The current tenant next door is a lovely young man with a dog and cats who is attending grad school. He's very quiet but also happy to help his neighbors!

The kitchen is fully stocked with a gas range, stainless steel appliances, 2 coffee makers (Keurig and standard drip) and a large granite island with bar seating that separates it from the living area. The private outdoor space is perfect for warmer days to enjoy the patio and grassy lawn space. The main level also has the primary bedroom with en suite bath. A plush king bed and beautiful furnishings make this room cozy and light. The private en suite has a large walk in shower and vanity with double sinks. Upstairs you'll find 2 queen bedrooms and a shared bath with a shower/tub combo and double sinks. The 4th bedroom is an attached apartment that has its own private entry located just outside the main entrance. This apartment suite has an efficiency kitchen equipped with full size refrigerator, stove and regular coffee maker. The living area has a small breakfast table for 2 and a chaise lounge sofa with a mounted TV. The bedroom contains a queen sized bed and en-suite bathroom with shower/tub combo. column57: Located on 21 private acres, this charming apartment is located west of Charlottesville just 2 miles past the Boar's Head Inn and Farmington. It is attached to the main home and has its own private entrance. Featuring a king bed, full kitchen, and two bathrooms, as well as a small single bed. It's the perfect getaway. The space The large master bedroom has stunning furnishings with a KING size bed, a sofa to enjoy the mountain views, a ceiling fan, a walk-in closet, and French doors opening to a private deck. The master bathroom is finished in travertine marble and has a walk-in shower. The SINGLE bedroom and second bathroom are perfect for a child or a small adult to accompany you. The full kitchen also leads to the deck where there is an outdoor dining table. Enjoy the scenic ride and unwind when you arrive. Guest access Guests will have access to their own private space Other things to note Continental breakfast supplies are provided for your first morning. Price includes Charlottesville/Albemarle sales and lodging taxes. Property managed and listed by Guesthouses.
column64: Braeside Annex | Comfort Close to Boars Head & UVA

column77: This recently-finished basement apartment is the perfect place for 1-4 guests to spend a month or more in Charlottesville! Wonderfully located located ~1 mi from Scott Stadium and UVA, ~2 mi from UVA Hospital and the Downtown Mall, and The space This basement apartment uses an open floor plan in the kitchen/living space to give this cozy space a wide-open feel. The beautifully-tiled bathroom is the perfect compliment to two inviting bedrooms, each with a queen bed and plenty of storage. Guests also have their own private washer/dryer until for en-suite laundry at no additional cost! Our home uses energy-efficient lighting and appliances, and all provided paper products (TP and paper towels) are sustainably-sourced using bamboo. This basement apartment is entirely your own, with your own parking, separate exterior entrance, and even your own HVAC zone and thermostat. It’s a perfect spot to really make you feel at home for an extended stay. We've hosted students doing extended rotations at UVA, as well as many travel nurses working at UVA Hospital, often for months at a time. Although we can't guarantee absolute silence, we've often hosted night-shift workers and can accommodate relatively low-noise levels upstairs during the day. Guest access You'll have access to the entire (separate) basement apartment: the entryway, living/kitchen area, two bedrooms, laundry room, and the bathroom. We live upstairs, but the house is totally separate (duplex-style). You are welcome to use our spacious 0.5-acre backyard anytime you like. Other things to note Because we live above the apartment and, as wedding photographers, work extremely long days, our sleep is super important to us! We ask that you keep noise levels down between 10:30 pm and 8:00 am, and we do the same for you!
column84: 2BR Apt, Month+ Stays, Near UVA, Laundry + Parking

column42: This 1925 cottage is located within walking distance of the University of Virginia. Azalea Cottage was recently updated with a brand new bathroom, fresh paint throughout, and stylish, comfortable furnishings. The space Azalea Cottage has just been completely renovated and professionally decorated in a fun modern vibe. Walk to UVa, the Lawn, John Paul Jones Arena, Scott Stadium or several neighborhood restaurants! Azalea Cottage is located .25 miles from Scott Stadium in a quiet neighborhood.

column70: Only available for 31+ days reservations. We host lots of traveling professionals! Bottom unit in 2 unit brick house. New renovation with modern style. It was our first Charlottesville home away from home, so it's got everything we need and we hope it's perfect for you, too. Central location: 1 mile walk to the Stadium and 1.5 mile drive to South Grounds to the northwest or Downtown Mall to the northeast. The space Includes Amazon Fire TV (no live TV); extra sheets, blankets, pillows, towels; computer monitor & keyboard (in corner of living room). Dog specific: medium dog crate and a dog bed are under the king bed. The back and side yards are fenced in but the fence is a bit short so keep an eye on them. Child specific: travel high chair in kitchen; pack n play and separate bassinet in right bedroom closet. Outlets and utility closets are childproof and cleaning supplies are in upper cabinets. Guest access Guests have private access to the entire unit but share the backyard. Entrance is at the left side of the house and the upstairs tenant's entrance is the front, so you won't run into each other often if at all. Guests can use the left side of the driveway, but it is shared with the upstairs tenant.
column77: Long Term Only -- Central Cville Home

column68: A friendly space in a wonderful neighborhood within walking distance to UVA, the Corner, the Downtown Mall, and Forest Hills Spray Park. We welcome you! The space Your bedroom is equipped with wifi, a mini fridge, a microwave, a large desk and chair, and a bookshelf full of a variety of books. The living room has a TV, Roku with Netflix/Amazon/Beach Body On Demand, two gaming systems (wii, XBOX), and a large supply of kid and baby toys. We also have a collection of board games and decks of cards! Guest access Playground and patio in the backyard, toys for kids, living room with a TV and Roku, closet with games. During your stay We are happy to meet you or not, whatever you wish! Other things to note We are musicians and occasionally teach or rehearse in the home. If we need to do so, we will always check with you to be sure the timing isn't disruptive. We have a pullout couch that is available upon request for $20 extra per night. Also, we have two very happy children. We try to keep them as quiet as possible, but if you want absolute silence late into the morning, perhaps this isn't the place for you!

column48: A refurbished 1950's country cottage, adjacent to 80 beautiful acres, overlooks the Blue Ridge Mountains. The house has high-speed internet. Enjoy an amazing sunrise while sitting on your bedroom deck sipping coffee. View sunsets from the front porch with a glass of wine purchased from local vineyards. Whether visiting UVa, hiking in the Blue Ridge Mountains, touring the local wineries, craft breweries, or attending an event at the Barn at Edgewood - Sister's View will make your visit complete.

column92: Delightful and serene house in walking distance to the UVA lawn for graduation exercises. Completely renovated in 2014: four bedrooms upstairs with three bathrooms (two en-suite), and a sofa bed and full bathroom in the basement. Driveway has parking for several cars and the quiet residential neighborhood means ample street parking as well.
