column84: Thank you for your interest in staying here. We are taking every precaution possible to ensure the safety of our staff and guests by using CDC approved sanitizers exclusively and we are disinfecting all door handles, switches, remotes, cabinets, appliances etc. Your room is self check-in with private (key code) entrance, full kitchen and full bathroom. We are on the property in case you need anything. We allow up to two pets for a fee of $75. All amenities are open and operational at this time. The space _____________RATES_________________ 2 night minimum weekends, Fri/Sat or Sat/Sun. Room rate listed on the calendar is for one bedroom with maximum of 2 guests, so inform us if you require use of the locked second bedroom and a $30 fee per person per night will be added. __________THE GROUNDS______________ Secluded setting with numerous ponds, canoe, a floating dock, nature trails, picnic area with a fire pit, shelter & grill (hickory wood provided), stone & cedar gazebo, wood fired lunar sauna, cool dip pool, frisbee golf course, makings of a organic vegetable farm. Lots of birds, bunnies & squirrels:) Map of the grounds provided in each room. ___________IN THE LODGE_____________ NO cable or satellite channels in the rooms. GRACE AUDIO 18,000 station internet radio. Eco-friendly dimmable LED lighting. Wireless high-speed Internet. Locally roasted, organic, fair trade, coffee beans with French press. Electric hot water kettle for tea, all conveniently available in the lodge. Delicious well water from the tap. _____SHARED SPACES IN THE ZEN BARN_____ Massage room, sky lounge,game room and meditation room in barn accessible to all guests. Complimentary land line phone available for unlimited local & long distance calling in the communal kitchen. Movie theater is available with advance notice for $30 when available. You may bring your own BluRay/DVD or choose from our private selection. _____SHARED SPACES IN THE CASTLE_____ Green house lounge in the Castle accessible to all guests. Study room located at the entrance of the castle. __________________YOGA_____________________ With advance notice private yoga classes are available at our local studio. For availability/appointment & fees contact Kumud VanDerveer (Instructor/host) at (EMAIL HIDDEN) or (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). ___________________MASSAGE_____________________ With advance notice private massage can be scheduled both for couples and singles. For appointments let us know and we will connect you with the Massage therapist. __________ADDITIONAL GUESTS__________ There are 6 additional suites available in the Castle and 5 suites available at the Zen Barn. __________ ECO PRACTICES__________ *100% LED lighting in all guest rooms & kitchen. *All natural flooring (maple, marble, bamboo & ceramic) & pine ceilings. Poplar wood from our property is used in our guest closets. *All guest rooms in the Zen Barn have split AC/Heating with inverter technology. *All our energy efficient windows & doors use thermal shades or curtains. *We provide organic, fair-trade and locally roasted coffee with a french press. *We provide organic teas & fair trade sugar for our guests. *Our Mulberry farm follows all organic practices. *We use an Energy Star ‘HE’ Washing Machine and Dryer. We prefer to use clothes lines on sunny day & when we can work around our visiting guests. *All our laundry is washed with Eco-Friendly detergent (HE), made in USA. *All hand soap, shower gel, shampoo & conditioner provided are made of bio-degradable ingredients, paraben free, SLS free, no animal ingredients or testing & no artificial fragrances. *We compost our coffee grounds for our garden. *We provide eco dishwashing liquid, which contains no petrol chemicals and is 100% biodegradable. We use Green Works toilet cleaner & Seventh Generation Dishwasher Gel. *We provide 100% recycled paper napkins & 40% recycled toilet tissue. __________Pet Policy__________ We allow pets in Pond View Lodge for a fee of $75/pet . _________NEARBY ATTRACTIONS_________ We recommend you take the time to explore some of our many local attractions like Skyline Drive, check website hikingupward for hiking suggestions, Luray Caverns, Noon Whistle Pottery, Fabio's Italian Eatery, Mission Home Bake Shop & numerous antique galleries in Ruckersville, just to name a few. Close proximity to 30 vineyards along the Monticello Wine Trail. 6 Presidential homes including Monticello, Montpelier & Ashlawn. For a more comprehensive listing of attractions check the complete guide provided in the room. 15 minutes from the Charlottesville Airport 2 hours from Washington DC 15 minutes from Shenandoah National Park. Guest access Guest have access to common areas like lunar sauna, ponds on the map, stone gazebo, nature walk, lounges, frisbee golf course, meditation room & massage room. Guests are to observe all posted signage. Do not enter areas signed Private”. Do not explore areas not listed in the pictures as there are other guests and residents on the property. Other things to note Kindly note there is no good cell reception here and we recommend that you read up on all directions

column66: Balcony Suite at White Lotus Eco Spa Retreat

Welcome to our two bedroom 1940 renovated farmhouse on over 60 acres with unsurpassed mountain views to soothe your soul. Enjoy hiking, picnicking and stargazing as you explore the rural property. Relax by the barns, creek, hayfield and wooded knolls. Visit nearby Shenandoah National Park, local wineries, Bald top brewery and local potteries. Please note pet fee details below. The space We are super happy to welcome your pets to LongRun Farm. We charge an additional pet fee per night/per pet or $20. This is payable upon booking through a welcome link you will receive. A gas wood stove in the kitchen adds a warm touch to your mornings. The small creek called LongRun meanders across the property. There is a map in the living room outlining various trails, creeks and points of interest. Feel free to explore and wander through the paths and outbuildings. The cluster of trees in the center of the hayfield is a cemetery. Take a walk out there and see the beautiful gravestone of young Mary Jane born in 1821. Hike down the center path behind the house in between the two larger barns. Towards the end on the left is LongRun creek, cross it and walk up the hill into the mature woods for a beautiful view. Guest access A list of local wineries and breweries close to LongRun Farm. Dogs welcome outside at almost all wineries. Distance and size noted. Kilaurwen: (6 miles – Small). Our personal favorite. The owner makes award winning wines and embraces local art and music. Serene and quiet. Moss: (9 miles – Small) Lovely wines, a beautiful mountain view and a cool old cemetery by the boxwoods on your right, before you get to parking area. Stone Mountain: (11 miles- Medium) Excellent wines and an experience you will not forget. The views are incredible, and driving up the mountain is quite an adventure, (just keep going!) Glass House: (12 miles - Small) There is so much about this winery we love, the wine, the atrium, the banana plants, the local music and handmade chocolates. A pleasure! Baldtop Brewery: (15 miles – Medium), The first local brewery in the area is AMAZING! The drive there is through beautiful country, your soul will be soothed by the scenery. Bring your pup for a pint! Early Mountain: (12 miles – Large) Beautiful interior, friendly staff. Bring a picnic or order off the small plate menu. A lovely drive down route 230 this winery is also 5 minutes from the “Plow and Hearth” outlet. Barboursville: (12 miles – Large) Located next to the 5-star restaurant, Palladio. There are local ruins to explore and an outdoor theater. There are many others!  Other things to note Pet friendly.

column48: A spacious timber framed barn sitting at the wood's edge, furnished with hand-made farm-style furniture. Designed for the artisan, the second story windows allow generous amounts of natural light to flood the entire space. A full kitchen downstairs transitions into a living area. The second floor holds a double bed, bathroom, and single bed in an open studio design, with a balcony overlooking the kitchen and living room. The space Check-in anytime after 3PM Check-out 11 AM No pets, due to others allergy. . The ground floor is open with a kitchen area equipped with a stove, microwave, small fridge, toaster oven and coffee maker, the dining, and informal living room. Upstairs is the bedroom area and full bath. *Note: this structure is in a semi-rural area. Insects (wasps, lady bugs, etc) may make their way in despite our efforts. If you are allergic or sensitive, then please look elsewhere. Your comfort is important to us. Guest access The barn shares a driveway with our cottage (another rental unit). Other things to note *Our internet is Centurylink, the fastest this area has to offer. That being said, it can be unreliable and drop intermittently. If you need to do some important work from the house, this may not be the place for you.* The staircase is steep. if you have trouble with stairs this is not the place for you.

column59: The Maharaja Suite, nestled in the Zen Barn, offers a serene retreat with a comfortable queen-sized bed, a soothing jacuzzi bath, and a TV for your relaxation. This inviting space is thoughtfully designed for your comfort and serenity. Guests staying in this suite have access to amenities throughout the property, unless there is a private event happening, ensuring a rejuvenating stay. The space _____________RATES_________________ 2 night minimum weekends, Fri/Sat or Sat/Sun. Weekends are $110/night. ________GREEN BARN - SUITE B__________ Beautiful artistically designed suite in a 5000 sq ft, 2 story barn on 21 acres. Private deck & gas grill. Maple floors. Pine ceiling. Jacuzzi bath with marble tile surround. Wet bar with granite top sink & glass front refrigerator. Queen size hand carved solid mahogany bed. __________THE GROUNDS____________ Secluded setting with numerous ponds, canoe, a floating dock, nature trails, picnic area with a fire pit, shelter & grill (hickory wood provided), stone & cedar gazebo, wood fired lunar sauna, cool dip pool, frisbee golf course, establishing a organic vegetable farm. Lots of birds, bunnies & squirrels:) Map of the grounds provided in each room. ____________IN THE ROOM______________ 40 Samsung HDTV with a BluRay player & free Netflix. NO cable or satellite channels in the rooms. GRACE AUDIO 18

column79: Renovated lakefront apartment, downstairs from the main home. It is located on beautiful Greene Mountain Lake with year-round lake and mountain views. Wildlife on the lake includes geese, herons, ducks, osprey, eagles, turtles, and beavers. The setting is serene and peaceful. You will have a private entrance and a covered porch. Kayaks are available for your use on the lake. Unit approved with a Special Use Permit for Tourist Lodging by Greene County. The space This is a large living space with a private bedroom, a kitchen area, a living room and a dining/game area. There are views of the lake from these rooms. The kitchen has a full-sized refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker and sink. There is no stove, but a hot plate and electric skillet are available. The area is very private with lots of open space adjacent to the lake. Guest access This is a downstairs apartment that includes a covered patio, backyard and lake access. There is a fire pit with Adirondack chairs with cushions to enjoy the sunset and lake/mountain views. Other things to note We are conveniently located close to the Shenandoah mountains, hiking trails, Walmart and the towns of Stanardsville and Ruckersville. Charlottesville is only 30 miles south.

column69: Thank you for your interest in staying here. We are taking every precaution possible to ensure the safety of our staff and guests by using CDC approved sanitizers exclusively and we are disinfecting all door handles, switches, remotes, cabinets, etc. Your room is self check-in with private (key code) entrance, and full bathroom. etc. We are on the property in case you need anything. All amenities are open and operational at this time. The space This space is private, easily accessible with many common spaces to explore including, sauna, indoor and outdoor fire places, full kitchen, meditation room, massage room, poker room, pond with paddle boat, frisbee golf, organic garden plus many other common spaces. Other things to note I definitely recommend checking out all the amenities and spaces on the property. Hiking in the blue ridge mountains seems to be the most popular thing to do outside the property. Check out the information package we send out through airbnb for other ideas.

column68: - Visit Shenandoah National Park , a ten minute drive from The Loft - Take in the many local vineyards and wineries in the area - Canoe or kayaks available to paddle on our small lake and enjoy the views and wildlife The space The Loft is a two bedroom(Queen, Double) fully furnished upstairs apartment located on a 1/2 acre in a small lake community. It has a fully equipped eat-in kitchen and a large deck with a gas grill. Towels and linens are included. Access to lake for swimming and boating included. We are 7 miles from Shenandoah National Park and close to many wineries. We have a canoe and two kayaks available for use on the lake that is located a short stroll from The Loft. *Early checkin and late checkout available upon request. Guest access Guests have access to the entire upstairs apartment and deck as well as the half acre yard. Other things to note We are pet friendly. We believe many of our guest understand the pleasure of local shopping. New and different items are available when you skip the chains and “go local” Greene County Farmers Market: (2 miles) in the heart of Stanardsville, take a right out of the driveway onto Celt, cross 33, ½ mile on left you’ll see the vendors 8 -12pm Saturday Mid Apr-Oct. Noon Whistle Pottery: (4 miles) In the heart of Stanardsville, this local crafts store is a beautiful, pleasant experience. The friendly owners gather high quality pottery, wood crafts, jewelry, soaps, candles, wine, handmade paper and cards from local artisans. Open daily. Wooly Lamb Antiques: (12 miles) Clean, neat and well organized, this antique store has some real treasures at good prices. (take a left at the 29/33 intersection and it’s on your right about ¼ mile up. 33 Rummage Antiques: (7 miles) One of our newer antique stores, full of fun vintage items and pleasant owners. Have fun! (head east on 33, it’s right before rt 29 on your left, red/white/blue building). Big Red Barn Antiques: (10 miles) huge mecca of treasures you won’t want to miss, great prices, comprised of many vendors, full of some excellent finds. (at the 29/33 intersection) Hidden Creek Farms: (9 miles) Looking for a little equine experience? The owner is happy to provide 1 time lessons or just pleasure ring riding for children or adults. English, or Western where safety and fun are the goals! Blue Ridge Pottery Studio: On Rt. 33 towards Shenandoah Park, the setting for the studio and retail store is truly breathtaking. It includes the trout stream Swift Run" and a view of Saddleback Mountain. High quality one of kind pottery is available. Family owned. Plow and Hearth Outlet (16 miles) This “county living” retail store began in neighboring Madison County in 1980. This large catalog business has a retail outlet located a few miles from our local “Early Mountain Vineyard”. Tip: Shop at the outlet
column69: visit Early Mountain and then back to the loft. Greene County Pharmacy: (5 miles) Our family owned local Stanardsville pharmacy stocks stocks all your health and pharma needs. Great gift store too! Open Mon- Fri and Sat 9-12."

column39: 42 inch HDTV with DVD player, Roku
column84: Be in Shenandoah National Park in less then 15 minutes! Our home is special to us and we hope it will be to you as well. We are located on Swift Run, which is a stocked trout stream- you will need a Virginia fishing license and trout stamp. Outside we have a patio to enjoy sitting and relaxing listening to the river and grilling out along with 2 wood fire pits. Inside you can hear the river from both bedrooms. New 100 Mbps Internet!! The space We have a fully stocked kitchen available for your use. One bedroom has an antique full sized bed, and the other has 2 twin beds. Although our home is small, it's very cozy and comfortable. Kitchen towels, dish washing detergent, trash bags, hand soap and a dishwasher are provided for your use. Bathroom towels and wash cloths are also provided with bedroom linens. We have satellite TV and a DVD player along with CenturyLink internet for your convenience. There are 2 outside fire pits, we try to keep wood there, but it's not always guaranteed. Internet is apx 1.5 mbps Guest access We have a pack and play (and sheet) and high chair in the closet of the full bedroom. Other items may be available upon request. Other things to note We are 12 miles from the entrance to skyline drive and with in 30 miles to UVA. Conveniently located! Internet is 100mbps

column52: This charming two story cottage is set on rollingfarm land overlooking dry stacked stone walls and forest. Located 15 min to the park and 30min from Charlottesville. The first floor has an open floor plan with a stone fireplace at one end opposite the kitchen. A very cozy get away. The space A single bedroom upstairs hosts a queen mattress. There is a twin bed on the walk through area upstairs. A full bath is downstairs. The kitchen is fully equipped with a fridge, stove, microwave, toaster oven, coffee maker, crockpot, and an assortment of pots and pans. *Note: this structure is in a semi-rural area. Insects may make their way in despite our best efforts. If you have allergies or are sensitive in other ways, consider looking elsewhere. Your comfort is important to us. Guest access The Cottage shares a driveway with our barn that is also a rental. Once situated, guests are welcome to explore the property. Other things to note *Our internet is Centurylink, the fastest this area has to offer. That being said, it can be unreliable and drop intermittently. If you need to do some work from the house, this may not be the place for you.*

column57: The Lakehouse comes equipped with four bedrooms and three bathrooms, a lovely open floor plan in the main living space, fully equipped kitchen, and washer and dryer. Also includes a propane grill, internet, phone, and cable. On the lake with small dock and boats (kayak, paddle boat and jon boat). Convenient to Charlottesville (25 min. ) the Charlottesville Airport (20 min.) Skyline Drive (10 minutes) and Washington D.C. (90 min.) Guest access Guests have access to the entire house. Other things to note There is a local noise ordinance set at 10:00 pm each evening and consideration of the neighbors is appreciated.

column51: The Monroe House at Mulberry Spring is a historic two-story residence (c. 1750's) situated in a picturesque farm surrounded with barns, guest cottages, and outbuildings on 15.4 rolling acres. The perfect getaway for a family/families or pair of couples. The space The layout of the house is spacious and comfortable. The first floor consists of a living room, dining room, library/TV room, fully equipped eat-in kitchen, laundry room, and full bath with a shower. There are two staircases to access the second floor. Upstairs there are three bedrooms and one full bath. The bath has a classic claw-foot tub equipped with a hand-held shower. For safety and structural reasons guest should not venture out onto the porch upstairs. Attics are also off limits. *Note: this structure is in a semi-rural area. Insects may make their way in despite our best efforts. If you are allergic or sensitive, then consider looking elsewhere. Your comfort is important to us. The mainhouse is a “two over two” style farmhouse built on hand-hewn heart pine beams over a dry-laid foundation. The house was slated for demolition in the 1950's. Fortunately, a retired military couple, who appreciated its significance, bought it and lovingly invested in major restorations. Two subsequent owners continued the restoration process both to the house and property. Numerous fruit trees were planted and a local stonemason was hired to rebuild the rock foundations and the 200-year old stone walls. Guest access Guests will be contacted via this site with information regarding the location and entrance procedures.. Other things to note Cell phone service at Mulberry Spring is spotty depending on your service provider. *Our internet is Centurylink, the fastest this area has to offer. That being said, it can be unreliable and drop intermittently. If you need to do some work from the house, this may not be the place for you.* There are three other rental units on the property. This house shares a driveway with one of the other cabins.

column52: Mountain View Farmhouse The space Cozy, comfy, relaxing, peaceful, and serene. With perfect places for gathering inside and outside, you can enjoy quiet evenings by the fireplace or step out on the front or on the back porch to enjoy a cup of coffee - the choice is yours!  Take a dip in the hot tub that seats 6.  There are limitless opportunities for connections and memories to be made. Feel free to bring your fur babies - this farmhouse is pet-friendly and ready to welcome your whole family with open arms. With its unique style, the plethora of amenities, and proximity to it all, make this farmhouse YOUR place to escape! SPECIAL PROMO CODE:   EXTSTAYSPECIAL (use this code if YOU BOOK 3 NIGHTS to RECEIVE 1 FREE FROM 11/01/24 TO 09/30/25) Must book directly from our website to use the Promo Code.

column35: HDTV with Apple TV, DVD player
column70: The Inner Hippie Garden is a studio suite in a quiet neighborhood fitting two people comfortably. Minutes from vibrant historic downtown Charlottesville and vineyards, wineries and music halls. Check out the Inner Hippie Guidebook in listing. Man-cave for book and 60s music -lovers, full bathroom with tub/shower. Bed and living room space are separated by shelving unit (see photos) Queen bed lower to the floor (see photos) Private Hottub overlooks the mountain. The space Channel your inner hippie. This is a suite decorated with evident love of live music concerts and books leading through the Frenchdoors outside to mountain views in the private garden and hottub. Time to relax from the noise. Bed is a platform bed lower to the ground level with a comfortable mattress - a great suite to sleep in late! The bed is not optimal for people with knee conditions, however. If you are a pure minimalist who is used to sparse decorations in a hotel or motel this place is your worst nightmare- the space includes a books on shelves, posters from the Beat Generation or music and sports on the wall, with some tasteful decorative items (my husband loves to decorate and showcase things). It’s not moldy or creepy but it’s a style thing. We aim to meet expectations so we want people to feel comfortable and appreciative - not in distress (check out our photos) Grateful Dead fans super welcome! Suite with small living room, space with bed and limited kitchenette (no stove) with a full bath. Wine cooler and small fridge and coffee/tea service. It has a piano down there--feel free to use it. Apple TV available as well as DVD and LP player to play some of your favorite music. Bring your guitar, invite your best friend, your partner, your cherished pet. (Let us know if your fur babies are included) All are welcome. This Homestay is welcome to the respite of families who have members with cognitive disabilities who need a getaway. Our fabulous guests have been solo travelers, hikers, folks visiting people in the area, best friends, couples and close family members who don’t mind sharing the spacious queen. This space is cozy, a place to relax— soak in the hottub, watch some Netflix at night and order in food or to go out to experience the cuisine in this foodie-town. Guest access Welcome to the Inner Hippie Garden Your host: Elke Zschaebitz The bottom apartment level has everything you need except for a stove but that means you'll have to check out the fabulous cuisine in the area that is so famous. We have a variety of places that are affordable to the exquisite- many you'll want to book in advance if you have your heart set on one place for the eve because this is a vibrant college town. Parking can be tight in the driveway- you will park to the RIGHT to allow another car to get in and out. Parking on our alleyway is forbidden due to fire codes. -Access to the suite when you arrive through the RIGHT side of the house (when you are facing the yellow house) taking the stone pathway and steps down to the back garden. The pathway has solar lights to light the way in the dark. OR through our home into the lower level if you feel unsafe or if it is icy outside . We ask that guest take off their shoes when they enter the space, if you could. Just to keep the space hygienic and cut down on worries during our COVID outbreak. We did this when we lived in Germany and we really liked this habit. Other things to note Please let us know if you'd like the single Japanese futon pulled out for the floor for a petit guest or child in addition to the Queen that is listed. We are happy to set it up

column82: Fairwood Cottage is a light and airy retreat. All finishes are high quality including bed and bath linens, appliances, furniture and lighting. The house is private but not secluded. With porches and beautiful views, it's a great place to relax but still close to I64 and shopping. Many local attractions are very close by. The space Surrounded by fields and woodlands, the lot sits at the base of Carter's Mountain. The home was completely renovated by the current owners in 2019 and turned into the sweet 1 bedroom retreat perfect for Charlottesville visitors wanting a cozy spot close to activities and attractions. Guest access There is a smart lock for easy check in. The access code is changed between guests and sent to you on the morning of your arrival.

column51: Romantic, peaceful and breathtaking property nestled in a mountain valley overlooks mountain pasture, and yet minutes from Downtown Charlottesville & UVA. Your private lower level has separate entrance, full bathroom & living area with a kitchenette. Choose one or two bedrooms, one with a king bed and one with a queen. Outside enjoy the stunning views on the large deck with a gas fireplace, relax by the waterfall or sit in camp chairs by the bonfire. You will leave restored and uplifted! The space Mountains. Water. Fire. Air. Music. Peace. Love! Welcome to Mountain Time! Experience the immensity of the sky through a natural amphitheater of mountains and towering trees. We are perfectly situated to all Charlottesville area has to offer from Scott Stadium and UVA, to Monticello, wineries, breweries and the Downtown Mall. Mountain Time is romantic and rustic - the perfect space for the gathering of friends and family, singles or couples or girlfriend getaway weekends. Guest access Your own private apartment with a private entrance (Owner lives upstairs) , sometimes not on the premises.You'll have access to 30 gorgeous acres that include a waterfall, hammocks, bonfire pit, and a gas fire pit (we love our fires!) in a rustic setting. But as you travel up the winding gravel driveway through a former Christmas tree farm, over a creek and into the big sky setting of Mountaintime you will see how beautiful rustic can be. The property is yours to roam. In addition to the 2 beautiful bedrooms, your space has a roomy private bathroom with tub and shower and a living space with a very comfortable sectional couch and satellite TV. The kitchenette has a small refrigerator, microwave and toaster oven. Enjoy your morning coffee outside on our large deck if you would like or by your own private patio.can, At night you will be warmed by a beautiful blanket of stars and a field of fireflies in their season. Other things to note There is a 2 night minimum. If both bedrooms are used, it will be $50/night/person.

column71: Located remotely enough to fully escape, many amenities and attractions are just a short drive away. Guests from all walks of life can unplug & recharge at this haven of solace nestled in the serene foothills of the Virginia Blue Ridge mountains. The spacious farmhouse is fully equipped and modestly furnished, with light-filled living spaces flowing through to the outdoors. The main kitchen-dining-living area comfortably hosts group gatherings, while the large bedrooms offer plenty of privacy. The space Come to the quiet. Our recently renovated 100 year old farmhouse sits well-appointed in a clearing of pasture surrounded by 80 acres of preserved forest. The outdoors beckon, inviting you to immerse your senses in the beauty of the natural surroundings. Enjoy coffee on the front porch swing, a gentle 1/4 mile walk along Ivy Creek, or a 1.2 mile loop over up the back ridge, contemplative moments by the stream, warming your bones by a late afternoon fire. Get back to basics as you focus on rest, connection, and comfort in these tranquil surroundings. The open floor plan in the kitchen-dining-living area connects to the screened porch, back yard, and mudroom. This area can be closed off from the rear hallway, which leads to one full bathroom, the stairwell, and first floor master bedroom. The second floor holds another full bathroom, the remaining bedrooms, and a small sitting area. At this small working farm you may observe permaculture and agroforestry practices such as riparian buffer restoration, gardens, and livestock. Whether you choose to stay nestled within the 100 acres of our forests and pastures or venture out to explore the myriad offerings of the surrounding area, our wish is that you make the most of your time away from daily life and find ways reconnect with rhythms and activities that feed your spirit. The quiet is calling. Guest access You will have full access to all living areas of the farmhouse and the surrounding landscape including the backyard, fire circles, garden, stream-side areas, and forest footpaths. When hiking and enjoying the outdoors, demonstrate respect for your natural surroundings at all times. Please remain on the paths at all times and do not disturb any livestock or wildlife you may encounter. Guests accept all responsibility for any failure to exercise healthy caution or use good judgment. Caretaker quarters, farm buildings and equipment are off-limits to guests. Our livestock are friendly and somewhat curious, but please respect their pasture and always keep a fence between them and you. Do touch or climb over fences, as some livestock fencing is electric and board fences are old and unable to support weight. If you make use of the fire circles, ensure that flames are completely extinguished before leaving them unattended. While the property offers many intriguing objects for contemplation, guests may not remove any found objects, no matter how small, from the property. Take only memories and leave only footprints. Other things to note While deeply restorative, the forests and fields may also harbor hazards such as ticks, poison ivy, and (while rare) snakes and black bears. Prepare appropriately with bug repellent spray, long pants and sleeves, and hats; and be bear aware: In the unlikely event that you encounter a bear, do not run - it could prompt a chase. If in a group, stay together. Calmly leave the area, while making a bit of noise so the bear will not be surprised by you. If the bear has seen you, back away slowly while facing the bear and speaking softly. https:// www.dgif.virginia. gov/ bear-aware/ We ask that you do your best to leave the place as clean as you found it. An additional cleaning fee may be requested if house or premises are left in an unsatisfactory manner. Don't forget to sign our guestbook, replace the key on the table and have a safe journey home.

column67: The Winery Cottage at Eastwood Farm and Winery is located on the historic Woodland estate, built and owned by Jefferson builder, John Dunkum in 1810. Our 78 Cville acres include our family’s winery with indoor (year round) and outdoor (Apr-Nov.) tasting rooms, extensive wooded trails, incredible mountain views and apple orchard. Nestled on the same ridge as Monticello, Carter's Mtn, Jefferson Vineyards, Blenheim and Trump Vineyards. Five minutes to Belmont and Downtown Mall. The space The Woodland Cottage offers 3 fully furnished bedrooms, a kitchen, dining area and living room. Guest access Cottage property, terraces, hiking trails, and orchard. Message us or visit our winery's website if you’re interested in a reservation for our indoor tasting room or if you’d like to request wine to be chilled and awaiting your arrival. Other things to note Guided wine tasting available upon request, fee applies.

column60: Bright and open studio space that sits on a 2.5 acre parcel and is about 150 feet away from the main house where we live. It is less than 10 minutes to the airport and under 30 minutes to downtown. The space features a kitchenette, one full bath and an open lofted bedroom space (queen size bed) upstairs. The twin beds are located on the main floor. We can only allow a maximum of 2 cars due to limited space on the property. Use of candles or fire stove is not permitted. The space This space was originally built to be an artist's painting studio. The light quality and amount of natural light in the space is wonderful. Additionally, there are still some paint remnants from its former days as an art studio which add to its unique character and history. Reclaimed wood beams and other decorative salvaged antique elements and furnishings contribute to the cottage's eclectic charm. Guest access Entire home and the backyard meadow area and any herbs, vegetables or fruits that may be in the garden when they are visiting. Guests can park their car directly in front of the cottage on the driveway path but need to keep cars off the lawn. Other things to note Because we have limited parking space on our property, we have a 2 car limit for our airbnb guests. Candles and fireplace use are not permitted. We do not allow use of the fire stove or candles.

column79: Nestled in the rolling foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Still Pond Farm is close to Charlottesville, UVA, Shenandoah National Park, Monticello, and Virginia's wine country. Our farm offers beautiful ever-changing mountain views in a rural, peaceful setting. Our cozy 2-story cottage with loft and wrap-a-round porch is set near our stables providing views of our paddocks and natural pond. Ideal for wildlife and birdwatching, stargazing, and has incredible moon views. The space The cabin has a rustic, contemporary and open feel with textiles and wood mixed with accents of glass and mirrors to brighten the space. Our large and many windows bring nature views inside the cottage. Guests have their complete privacy as all living quarters on the farm are well-distanced. Additionally, lights are placed in front of the main windows in the cottage to shine on the glass at night and further shield the inside from view. We are a working farm so you may see boarders on horses, people attending to the horses and chickens, and farm equipment moving around. Guest access Entire farm, trails, however guests are not permitted inside the farm buildings or paddocks. We also restrict access to the deck round our natural pond due to the large amount of wildlife, migratory birds and plants that inhabit the space. Other things to note - Please note that the loft sofa bed is a futon double mattress - 54 Inches Sleeper Area Width x 75 Inches Sleeper Area Length

column57: Mountain Views Overlooking Charlottesville, Only 15 Minutes to Town The space The Broadhead Mountain Retreat is located just a short drive from the city-limits of Charlottesville, taking you out of town, while still overlooking it. Broadhead, completed in 2011, offers modern living with rustic charm and quality. There are two private bedrooms to choose from –a master bedroom offering a high-end Savy Sleeper queen sized mattress and private bath and on the opposite side of the home a bedroom with two twin beds. If you feel like sleeping by a stone wood-burning fireplace claim the queen sized sleeper sofa in the living room. The open living room, with wide plank floors and wall of windows gives you a breathtaking view of the Piedmont Valley and Blue Ridge Mountains. The view alone is reason enough to stay here. The kitchen is both practical and aesthetically pleasing, fit for a chef, with stained wood countertops, stainless-steel refrigerator, dishwasher, stove and plenty of cabinet space. Whether you feel like eating at the kitchen table inside, or sitting outside, you’ll be taking in the essence of Mother Nature. This is the ideal setting if you feel like getting away from the hustle and bustle but still want to be close; Broadhead sits on top of a private mountain on over 100 acres of private land. A short hike or drive up from the house is a private overlook with breathtaking views of Charlottesville. If you want to spend some quality time in the country, breathe in clean mountain air or just go for a hike, then this might just be the perfect place. **Please note that the last 1-1.5 miles of road to the property is not paved, it is gravel! The road is fairly winding.** Amenities: Master Bedroom with Queen Bed and En Suite Bath (Walk-In Shower) Bedroom with Twin Beds and En Suite Bath (Combination Tub/Shower) Queen Sleeper Sofa Fully-Equipped Kitchen Dining Area Living Room with Wood-Burning Fireplace Covered Deck Overlooking Charlottesville Flat Screen TV with DVD player Wi-Fi Central Air/Heat Standard Drip Coffee Maker Washer/Dryer Private Parking in Driveway All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.

column45: Hike our 2 miles of our beautiful, well maintained trails. The cottage and property are very serene and quiet. Ideal location: Only 1.5 miles to Route 151. About 3.5 miles hiking provides access to the Appalachian Trail from the cottage. Explore local wineries, breweries, and cideries. The space Located in the George Washington National Forest, Gracewood is a retreat from the mental and emotional activity of everyday life. This eco-friendly house was recently remodeled as a comfortable setting for couples or small families who want a break. We hold meditation retreats here twice a year, so it works well for a writer or artist or a contemplative to do a solo retreat. Upstairs is a full modern kitchen with new appliances. We made the cottage so nice that one of us could live there comfortably if we chose to do that. There is also a dining set and a comfortable full size futon couch. (Many futons are not that comfortable. We own an organic mattress company, so the mattress and frame are the best.) Downstairs is a queen size mattress and two Ekorness chairs (stressless chairs). We use Savvy Rest organic bedding. Within 12 minutes are several breweries, wineries, and a cidery. The property is 39+ acres, with 1/2 mile along Meriwether Creek. The volume of water varies with the season, but the feeling of energy is always powerful, calming, and clearing. There are about two miles of private trails suitable for hiking or running. Trails are well marked, and a map is available. Over the course of ten years we have seen a few bears, raccoons, groundhogs, bats, lots of box turtles, a few snakes, a wide variety of birds, along with plenty of deer and other wildlife. We took pictures of what appeared to be bobcat tracks one winter, but we haven't caught sight of the nocturnals. Please note that there is no television. Internet is fiber optic and reliable, but cell service inside the cottage is intermittent, although right outside it is usually pretty reliable. So it's relatively easy to unplug. Also note that the main queen size bed is downstairs, and the bathroom is upstairs if you get up in the night. We also have a full size futon upstairs if needed. (If you need to use it as a bed, we ask you to let us know ahead of time so we can prepare it for you, or show you how to use it so as not to ding the walls.) Upon your arrival you'll see that our house is close to the cottage, but there is landscaping next to both buildings; and the cottage is actually quite private. It's likely that you won't see anyone on our 40 acres during your stay. There are wonderful musical events spring to fall. Skiing at Wintergreen in the winter. Live music at our charming farmer's market in Nellysford. Regarding COVID preparation, we clean thoroughly, wash all the soft materials, and we particularly clean the hard surfaces and then disinfect them. We pay the cleaning folks well, and they do a really good job. :) For visiting nurses or doctors looking for a longer stay, ask about our longer term discounted rates. Guest access It's a beautiful 3.5 mile walk to the Appalachian Trail and from there less than a mile to Humpback Rocks. It's uphill, so you need to be in good shape. Other things to note 2 Miles well maintained walking trails, 1/2 mile along a bubbling creek. Serenity beyond words. Breweries and Wineries galore. Nice restaurants nearby. 4.5 mile walk to Humpback Rocks on the Blue Ridge Parkway, 2.5 miles to Shenandoah National Park. Savvy Rest organic bedding throughout, although the main mattress on the Murphy bed could not tolerate the weight of an organic mattress. The bedding on top is all certified organic. Low EMF Environment: Cell phones don't work in the cottage. We use only environmentally friendly cleaning supplies.

column91: Wake to gorgeous Mountain views & rolling green meadows bordering the Rockfish River on our family estate. Private attached unit with built in pool (mid April-mid Sept)in the Blue Ridge mountains of Nelson County Virginia on the center of the 151 Brew Ridge Trail. Much preparation has gone into making your stay beautiful, convenient and comfy. No need to physically interact if that’s your desire. Enjoy swimming, hiking, kayaking, horse back riding, skiing, snowboarding, and more! 3 nite minimum The space The Cottage includes: * Swimming pool outside the front door next to the patio with pergola sitting area and fire pit, loungers and tables open mid April through mid September. *Paved Parking for 2 or 3 cars near the front door. * ADA handicap accessible large doorways to master and large walk-in showers. * Private entrance with no steps. * 2 beautiful bedrooms, 1 king/ 1 Queen. * Double size futon and Sleeper sofa in living room. * 2 full beautiful baths with large walk in showers * HD Smart TV's in the master bedroom and living room with Netflix and Sling TV. * Full kitchen stocked with cooking supplies and basic seasonings including drip coffee machine and coffee included. *Herb garden in season for our guests with parsley rosemary, thyme, basil, chives, oregano and mint for your culinary use. *High chair, playpen available on request. * Partially covered concrete patio, gas grill and patio set with umbrella for outdoor dining. *Beautiful Lawn area right outside the cottage for sitting, children and lawn games. * Cornhole set available upon request. Guest access The swimming pool is available for you to enjoy. It’s also used by my husband and myself but we do give our guests priority. No children are allowed in the pool area without your direct supervision. Other things to note We’re committed to Airbnb’s enhanced cleaning protocol, which was developed in partnership with experts in health and hospitality. Here’s what we’ve done to clean and sanitize the space: We use disinfectants approved by global health agencies to help prevent the spread of COVID-19 We thoroughly clean all surfaces. Each room was cleaned using extensive cleaning checklists. Every surface sanitized. All high-touch surfaces have been sanitized, such as doorknobs, cabinets and light switches.

column93: Looking for a unique pet-friendly stay that accommodates up to 12? You’ve found it in amenity-rich Boogie Nights Manor a wildly spacious, 4,000+-sq-ft home on 3+ acres where every room is a feast for the eyes, filled with art and artifacts. Whether you’re an outdoor enthusiast, fall-foliage viewer, or fan of craft beverages planning to visit wineries, breweries, and distilleries on the Brew Ridge Trail, you’re unlikely to ever find a rental like this one! column167: half a mile away. You’ll find myriad hiking trails, crystal-clear fishing streams, and historic family orchards and farms. Hike the Blue Ridge Tunnel Trail and pass through a 19th-century train tunnel under a mountain. View gorgeous fall foliage from Skyline Drive, 60 miles away. Charlottesville, home of UVA and great music scene, is a 30-mile drive away, and Washington DC, Northern VA, Richmond, Roanoke, and the NC border within 2.5 hours. Boogie Night’s Manor is an easy weekend getaway for most of the state. See Location tab for more. Other things to note Up to 3 pets permitted on a case-by-case basis with prior approval. Once hosts approve, you’ll receive a separate payment request through the AirBnB platform for $55/per pet/per stay. The fee for each pet brought without approval is $150/per pet. Late checkout is available, as long as new guests are not arriving on checkout day. Weekends at Boogie Nights Manor tend to book up 4+ months in advance, so reserve early for your chance to stay at the weirdest (mostly in a good way). The longer you stay, the more interesting artwork and artifacts you'll discover. Neighbors reside on the firepit side of the property, so please avoid loud outdoor noise after 10 pm. At that time, please bring the volume indoors and utilize the outdoor spaces for calmer firepit and screened-porch activities. If you plan to use the firepit, picking up a couple small bundles of wood is recommended. Many local grocery and convenience stores carry them for $7-9 per bundle.

column80: This refurnished Farmhouse with spectacular mountain views is set up to accommodate large groups & families. Set in 6 acres of incredible surroundings makes for a picturesque stay to be remembered. Close to all wineries & breweries it Includes: large fully stocked family kitchen & dining room, front porch, fire pit & grill, WiFi, Netflix, private parking, laundry room, large flat screen TVs, Kuerig machine, fully air conditioned, all basic cooking supplies incl: crockpot. Self check-in provided. The space Wake up to breathtaking views of the Blue Ridge Mountains overlooking beautifully landscaped gardens and open meadows. This picture perfect Farmhouse is nestled in 6 stunning acres where many of its original features remain untouched. You will be sure to re-charge your sole in this quiet, unique and wonderful country setting. The clear, crisp views of Humpback Rock will make you appreciate the natural beauty that surrounds Blue Ridge Farm. You will be staying in the most central location along the Brew Ridge Trail. *Please note there is an additional $75 fee for pets* Maximum of 2 pets please *Firewood & Charcoal can be purchased locally from Ashley’s market, gas stations or other local stores as this is not provided* *pack’n’play available upon request. Subject to availability* Guest access The guests will have full access to the Blue Ridge Farmhouse and the surrounding sprawling land. The farm is shared with two other small properties. (The Blue Sky Cottage and the Old-New Barn) We offer keyless entry for your convenience. Other things to note The Brew Ridge Trail (aka Route 151) is THE place to be for Virginia wine, craft beers, cider, local food and recreation. It really does have it all for EVERY season and EVERY one! Nelson County gets you outdoors and back to nature: -There are so many great hikes just a stones throw away. -Visit the many wineries, breweries, cideries & distilleries -Explore the stunning Blue Ridge Parkway and Skyline Drive enjoying scenic drives with phenomenal overlooks -Take time to explore the numerous historic places and museums the area has to offer including the Walton Mountain Museum -Nelson County is renowned for its many Farms & Orchards. Critzer Family Farm and Chiles Orchard are two of our favorites. Or you could go a little further a field to Carter's Mountain -Wintergreen Resort is also right on your doorstep. Offering something all year round from The Performing Arts Summer Festival in the summer to Ski, Snowboard and Tubing in the winter So, get ready to explore, hike and wonder the area around you!

column60: Architect-designed 2,900 sf home sits on a high ridge. Main living space optimizes dramatic views of Humpback Mountain. Covered porch wraps around entire second floor. Situated on 25 private acres within the George Washington National Forest. House is only 1 paved mile to Rockfish Valley Road, Rt. 151 (aka the Red, White and Brew Trail). 30 minutes from Charlottesville, Va. Close to breweries, wineries, hiking & excellent restaurants. The space Located on a ridge with views of Humpback Mountain, the house has an open concept floor plan with gourmet kitchen, and high end kitchen equipment for cooking fabulous meals. The second floor main living level includes a large master bed and en-suite bath, as well as second guest room and full bath. The great room includes a wood burning fireplace. A third bedroom and full bath is found on the first floor, as well as a second family room which also serves as a fourth bedroom with an interior door, its own ac/heating unit, full window shades, and a jumbo down-stuffed sectional that sleeps two adults, one on each end - bedding is provided. The downstairs foyer also has a queen futon couch for additional sleeping quarters. The backyard is fully fenced in, with wire fencing between the wood boards - suitable for small and large dogs. Note: A mini modern cottage on an adjacent hilltop opened in 2022. This 2 person cottage was sited and designed to maximize privacy for all. It has its own private parking area, and is listed as a separate Airbnb rental. Guest access Free run of 25 acre property for relaxing, hiking and dog walking. Neighborhood has many other adventures and hikes nearby, including a three mile hike on public access road to Appalachian Trail and Blue Ridge Parkway. Other things to note DOGS are welcome but by pre-approval only. An additional $100 per dog per visit cleaning fee will be added. Your dog should be friendly and house trained. Your dog must be supervised by you at all times or crated in the room if left alone. You will be responsible for picking up pet waste in the enclosed backyard and disposing it. You will be charged for any damage caused by your dog.

column79: The space Situated on the east side of the Blue Ridge, this renovated farmhouse in beautiful Nelson County is surrounded by 15 acres of vines and has stunning views of the mountains. The house has all the amenities you could wish for while keeping its charm. The farmhouse is a very private and idyllic residence. There is a front porch with a bench swing and a hammock, as well as a small flagstone patio with wrought iron furniture for your relaxation. The pool is around back and is fenced in. The large deck above the pool is excellent for basking in the sun or watching it set over the mountains. If you run out of wine, you can walk down to the winery's tasting room and stock up, listen to (occasional) live music, or enjoy a bottle on their patio for a change of pace. The beauty of Nelson County and the Cardinal Point Farmhouse will help make your stay one of the most relaxing you could ever imagine. **We do allow pets with an additional charge of $50/day. If you will be bringing your pet, please let us know and we will adjust the price accordingly (airbnb.com does not have an automatic fee to be added on when booking). All parts of the property are accessible EXCEPT THE BARN. This is a working vineyard, so there are tools, equipment and chemicals that are not appropriate for guest access. Someone should be available by phone or in person for any questions or problems you have. Our farmhouse is conveniently located on the same property as our winery(!): www.cardinalpointwinery.com. Also, within a few miles, there are three other wineries, three breweries, a distillery and a cidery. From May through October, nearby Nellysford hosts a phenomenal farmers' market. Charlottesville, with its vibrant arts and restaurant scene is 25 minutes away. On the other side of the Blue Ridge Mountains (just 15 minutes away), you can go to the movies, out to eat, grocery shop, etc in Waynesboro. But, honestly, there is a good chance you may not want to leave our farm at all. There is no public transportation in our area, but there are many services to take guests on winery and brewery tours. They are a great and worry-free way to sample what the area has to offer! As this is a working vineyard, occasionally there may be someone on the premises taking care of the grapes. We will be sure to let you know when someone will be on the property. Guest access Access to whole house

column75: The Blue Ridge Farm and Farmhouse dates back to the 1840’s. The majority of the house standing today was constructed in the 1880’s. This listing also includes three other small properties on-site (The Blue Sky Cottage, The Old-New Barn and The tiny house). The space The guests will have full access to the Blue Ridge Farmhouse, The Cottage, The Old-New Barn, The tiny house and the surrounding land. Book the Farm and have the whole farm for a family reunion, corporate retreat, wedding party. Talk to us about organizing and hosting your wedding and reception on the Farm. Subject to availability* Guest access You have access to all outdoor spaces, The main farm house, The cottage, The Old-New Barn and The tiny house. Sleeping and beds for up to 24 guests.

column45: A private apartment in the hills of Nelson County is located in an addition to the owner's rustic home. The property is surrounded by forest and stream with a mountain view. The Blue Ridge Mountains, the James River, Wintergreen, Infinity Downs , and Charlottesville are all within easy driving distance. A great rural location, perfect for nature lovers and birdwatchers. The owners are a resource for information on the area and can provide recommendations on attractions and activities. The space Woodland Hideaway is part of an owner-built home which has expanded over the years, the apartment was converted from an area once occupied by the owners' book business. The complete kitchen and bathroom with shower with tile floors are all new. The bedroom has a queen-sized bed and a small sitting area. Both the bedroom and kitchen/ dining area are climate controlled individually. The apartment is accessible by a private entrance with your own parking area. A small deck with a soapstone bench and table are at the entrance to the apartment. The owners' office and library is adjacent to the apartment.

column48: Hosting guests since 1987 in unique, 10-bedroom Inn (once a barn!) Homemade breads, muffins, fruit cobbler, coffee & juice for breakfast. Near Wintergreen ski & golf, Blue Ridge mountains, dining, brewpubs, wineries, nature, great cycling & hiking! The space Bedrooms listed (10 in all) are in what we call The Inn---a renovated horse barn, still sporting stall doors! Each room has one double bed, desk, wardrobe, side table and big window. The Inn has two kitchenettes, two common areas, a wrap-around deck, a patio, and several shared Men's and Ladies bathrooms (6 toilets, 4 showers). The Inn is separate from our home, which is the office where guests check in. We live on 34 acres, with views of meadows and the Blue Ridge Mountains, in beautiful Nelson County Virginia. Guest access The Inn's two kitchenettes include microwave ovens and refrigerators. We also provide an outdoor grill---But due to health dept regulations, no conventional stove or oven is at the Inn. During your stay One of us is almost always here to greet you and settle you in when you arrive. And if for some reason we can't coordinate this, we'll write you a note. (So be sure to keep us posted on your eta!) Continental breakfast each morning gives us a chance to chat and touch-base. We love meeting and swapping stories with our fascinating visitors! Other things to note Our premises are ideal for retreats, small weddings, reunions of all sorts, and groups of friends---OR just perfect as a get-away for an individual traveler. According to cyclists (from near and far), the Inn is especially suited for those who love tackling mountains and back-road adventures on 2-wheels!
column55: One of ten guest rooms at the Inn""

column79: Oak Tree Cottage is located in Waynesboro, VA at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains. The Skyline Drive and the Blue Ridge Parkway meet here, so it's a great place for your family to meet too! The four-bedroom house sits in the edge of the forest, overlooking the open fields of our farm. It's secluded, yet easy to get to, only five miles from Interstate 64. Relax and enjoy nature or head out to explore nearby wineries, breweries, history, biking, hiking or the arts. The space We are adjacent to the George Washington and Jefferson National Forest and the Sherando Lake Recreation Area, and only fourteen miles from the skiing, golfing and tennis at Wintergreen Resort. Yet we are yet so easy to get to -- tucked in the crossroads of Interstates 81 and 64, only five miles from exit 96 on Interstate 64. We are only 27 miles from the University of Virginia and Monticello in Charlottesville, VA and only 150 miles from Washington, DC. Oak Tree Cottage sits in the edge of the forest, overlooking the open fields of our 1,000-acre farm. We have hiking trails, wildlife and bird watching galore, and restored meadows. We have globally-rare wetlands with rare salamanders and plants. In early September, monarch butterflies migrate through the farm. Guest access Oak Tree Cottage is the guest house on our farm. You will have exclusive access to the entire house. The only shared space is the pool and the only other people using the pool would be our family. The first floor of the house has a living room, a full kitchen with island, a large dining table with seating for nine, a glass-walled room that provides a full view of the forest, as well as two bedrooms and a full bath. On the second floor, there are two more bedrooms and another full bath. The house has hot-water-baseboard heat. New for 2020: air conditioning! We also have a private pool available for the use of our guests - it is open from Memorial Day through Labor Day. There is no lifeguard on duty. Other things to note Let me make packing easier! Linens and towels are included, including Lands’ End and Company Store brand sheets and down comforters. There is a washer and dryer in the house. We’ll provide enough laundry detergent to get you started or for emergencies and plenty of dryer sheets. If you plan on doing laundry, you will want to pack more detergent. The kitchen is stocked with everything you will need, including: Aluminum foil, plastic wrap, and food storage containers Olive oil and vegetable oil Salt and pepper Keurig coffee maker as well as a traditional coffee maker and filters Crockpot, blender, toaster oven and traditional toaster Hand soap and liquid dish soap Kitchen towels and sponges The bathrooms are stocked with hand soap, bar soap, hair dryers and first aid kits. You should bring: (We will have some of each of these in the house to get you started. You will want to bring a supply to last your stay.) Dishwasher tablets/detergent Paper towels Trash bags for the kitchen Toilet paper You should also bring your own personal toiletry items, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. Special packing instructions: If you want to walk/hike on the farm, you might want to bring waterproof footwear/boots. If you want to walk at night or look for animals, you may want to bring flashlights.

Bunkroom sleeps 4, living room sleeps 2 on sofa bed. Clean and sanitized to standards. Microwave, mini fridge, wet bar. NOT a full house rental. The space Private space with private bathroom and private entrance, attached to host home. Formally a mother-in-law suite. NOT a shared space. Microwave, mini fridge, wet bar. This is not a full house rental. Bigger than a hotel accommodation. Welcome to use front porch, it is for your private use. Guest access Two rooms. Room 1, a bunk-room with two double bunks. Room 2, a cozy sitting room with comfortable sleeper sofa that sleeps two. Private bathroom. Wet bar, mini fridge, microwave in suite for private guest use. Front porch for your private use. Porch is great for relaxing in the summer, or skis and muddy shoes in winter. Swing out back and colorful Adirondack chairs to relax in and enjoy view. Fire pit behind airplane hangar. We reserve the back porch for our own use. You may walk around, but please don’t walk on grass runway. Other things to note Space for car and bikes in driveway. Please park in space to the right. Room for several cars. Located just off route 151 in private neighborhood. Glider Port, and grass runway in backyard. Weekends come and watch the gliders fly. We are at the foot of the mountain. No long drives back up the mountain from the wineries and breweries. Bold Rock walking distance, or your bike. Silver Fox Lavender Farm just down the road. Devil’s Backbone very close. Hiking trails in neighborhood with picnic tables and wading spots. There is cell service and FIOS internet. We are not that far from civilization, just closer to nature!

column54: Take in the beauty of nearby Blue Ridge Mountains from this private guest suite in Lovingston, Virginia. Recently constructed, the Carriage House is bright and airy, and is conveniently located close to nearby wineries, cideries and the Virginia Distillery Company. The suite includes a King-sized bed, and a futon, fast wi-fi, and amenities to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable. The space Enter the suite from your own, exterior entrance. The private suite includes a King-size bed, as well as a futon. Suite includes a 75” smart TV, internet access, microwave and mini-frig, and access to a private deck for relaxing or cooking on a gas grill. Guest access You will have complete access to the Carriage House. If you need anything from us in the main house, I'm happy to assist in any way needed!

column82: Buck Creek Lodge located on 33 very private acres: ~ Cove, creek and mountain views ~ Walking paths through woods and meadow ~ Ample porch for dining, relaxing and viewing ~ Stone-accented designer gardens ~ Secluded and quiet, perfect for wildlife sightings ~ High speed fiber optic WiFi ~ Rural, yes, but so close to so much. ~ Very near breweries, wineries and distilleries. ~ Half hour from Charlottesville, the AT, Blue Ridge Parkway and Wintergreen Resort ~ Very clean! The space Welcome to Buck Creek Lodge! Carved out of 33 wild acres over 45 years by a landscape designer and production potter, this home includes gorgeous gardens, site-specific sculptures, and private walking trails that wind from the eponymous creek to a pond to the woods and back again. This peaceful retreat puts you in direct touch with the natural world and its secrets. Fall asleep to a symphony of frogs and crickets or the patter of rain on the metal roof. Wake up to breakfast on the veranda, where light streams in, birds sing and the wind chimes jingle. The interiors are filled with pottery, which was fired on site. The spring-fed water on tap, Buck Creek Wonder Water" is filtered through an ultraviolet light. The Lodge includes two bedrooms

column87: Beautiful 3-bedroom home outfitted to accommodate a variety of visitors with high-speed internet, 2 large screen TVs, whirlpool tub, hiking, wildlife, and a huge deck. Nestled in a quiet cove in the beautiful Blue Ridge mountains. Located on Nelson's Craft Beverage Trail and a short drive to Charlottesville, Lynchburg, Staunton, Wintergreen, and Skyline Drive. Close to Oak Ridge for music festivals/events. Larger parties, see the Three Springs Plus listing. EV charging available for $20/night. The space Only 3/4 mile from U.S. 29. Six miles to Infinity Downs (home of Lock'n , Festy, and other events) and Oak Ridge Estate. Easy drive to Charlottesville for UVA events, concerts, Monticello, and other historic attractions. Wintergreen, Bold Rock Cidery, Devils Backbone, Wild Wolf Brewery, and Blue Mountain Brewery are only 15-30 minutes away. Virginia Distillery (winner of several Scotch awards) and Woods Ridge Brewery are about 3 minutes away. House is located on a dead-end state-maintained road, so great spot to get-away from it all to the peace and quiet of the country while still having all the attractions and conveniences nearby. Other nearby attractions include: Crabtree Falls, Sweet Briar College, Appalachian Trail, James River, Walton's Mountain, Fortune's Reserve, craft breweries, distilleries, and wineries. Bedrooms have new Saatva Organic mattresses and top-of-the line linens and quilts. House is newly painted throughout the interior and new hardwood flooring has been installed in the past year in the bedrooms. New leather living room suite. Bottom floor is not rented separately, so privacy is guaranteed. Expansive deck with grill and lots, lots of privacy. Guest access Guests have access to the main floor (two steps to front door with deck and stairs in back) with three bedrooms and 2.5 baths. Garage is not accessible. Walk-out basement with full kitchen, bath, laundry room, living room, and queen bedroom can be made available for extra guests on request and for an additional $125 +$25 cleaning fee. Basement is also newly painted with hardwood floors, widescreen TV, wi-fi connectivity, and gas fireplace/heater. Other things to note House is accessible through remote locks. Guests will be given an access code upon confirmation of arrival. Code is reset for each guest. Gas fire pit on deck. Stream just down the hill from the house for taking a nice quiet stroll or walk along the road in front of the house (1 mile round trip). Interior of house has been remodeled with fresh paint and new hardwood floors throughout. All new kitchen appliances and filtered water. Can accommodate seating for up to 14 for dining events. With basement rental, house can accommodate comfortable sleeping for up to 8.

column85: Experience the Blue Ridge Mountains and country life of central Virginia and enjoy everything Nelson County has to offer. The Cottage on the Knoll is a comfortable 3br/2bth that’s centrally located in Nelson County, offering the perfect mix of modern comfort and country charm. The Nelson 29 and Nelson 151 craft beverage trails await you, while plenty of hiking, fishing, and mountain views will appease any outdoor recreation lover or nature enthusiast, making it the perfect getaway. The space This three bedroom / two bathroom home features a bright and comfortable main area that includes a large kitchen area and living space that is fully stocked with all amenities. Adjacent to the main living area are two bedrooms featuring queen beds and a full bathroom. A large recreation room downstairs includes a ping pong table, a selection of board games, a mounted TV, and extra seating for fun nights in. The third bedroom with king sized bed and full bath is located downstairs beside the recreation room. After a day in the mountains, cook a meal in your fully stocked kitchen and kick back and enjoy your evenings outside, where you’ll find a wood fire pit in the yard and a gas fireplace and hot tub on the large covered porch. High-speed internet and a smart TV with limited channel access will allow you to connect to your own streaming accounts. Private in-ground swimming pool is available for cottage guests and apartment guests to use during your stay. We will gladly heat the pool during your visit for an additional cost of $25 per day during cooler months. Please indicate if you would like to have the pool heated during your stay at the time of booking so the costs can be adjusted. ** Please note the pool could meet the max number of 8 people if both rentals use it at the same time ** If you would like the pool to yourself during your stay, reach out for additional cost and availability. ****Pool will be CLOSED November 1, 2024 - spring . 2025 for repairs and maintenance***** The Draw Of Mountain Life - About The Property Behind the cottage is an additional rental (https://www.airbnb.com/slink/DaBRW2a0) and a working farm, so be prepared for our rooster’s wake up call in the morning! You may see us working around the property from time to time, but we will never intrude on your space. With mountain living comes lots of activities! Below we've listed out a number of popular locations and their proximity to Lovingston, VA and where you'll be staying. Local Wineries & Vineyards Mountain Cove Vineyards - 3mi Lovingston Winery - 6mi Hill Top Berry Farm & Winery - 10mi Del Fosse Vineyards & Winery - 11mi Cardinal Point Vineyard & Winery - 17mi Flying Fox Vineyard and Winery - 17mi Pippin Hill Farm & Vineyards - 18mi Afton Mountain Vineyards - 19mi Valley Road Vineyards - 19mi Veritas Vineyard - 19mi Loving Cup Vineyard & Winery - 20mi Wisdom Oak Winery - 25mi Local Breweries Wood Ridge Farm Brewery - 6mi Blue Mountain Barrel House - 7mi Wild Wolf Brewery - 12mi Devil’s Backbone Brewpub - 15mi Blue Mountain Brewery - 19mi James River Brewery - 25mi Local Cideries Bold Rock Cidery - 14mi Blue Toad Hard Cider - 15mi Potter's Craft Cider - 24mi Local Distilleries Virginia Distillery Co. - 1mi Silverback Distillery - 15mi Ragged Branch Distillery - 22mi Outdoor Recreation Fortune’s Cove Nature Preserve - 3mi Rockfish Valley River Trail - 14mi Appalachian Trail via Tye River Bridge / The Priest Wilderness - 18 mi Appalachian Trail via Reed’s Gap / Three Ridges Wilderness - 22mi Crabtree Falls - 22mi Blue Ridge Tunnel - 23mi Wintergreen Resort - 23mi Stoney Creek Golf Course (Wintergreen) - 23mi Devils Knob Golf Course (Wintergreen) - 23mi Blue Ridge Parkway (Afton) - 24mi Shenandoah National Park (Rockfish Gap Entrance) - 24mi Humpback Rocks - 29mi Other Points of Interest Drumheller’s Orchard - 4mi Oak Ridge Estates - 7mi Infinity Downs Farm - 7mi Saunders Brothers Farm Market - 8mi Seaman's Orchard - 10mi Pharsalia Plantation - 15mi Silver Creek Orchards - 16mi Dickie Brothers Orchard - 16mi Quarry Gardens at Schuyler - 17mi Albemarle Ciderworks - 19mi Montebello State Fish Hatchery - 26mi Charlottesville - 27mi Lynchburg - 32mi Guest access Be aware that the driveway to the cottage is gravel and while short in distance, it’s considered steep to some. Four-wheel drive is not necessary, as you can simply drop to a low gear and ease up the driveway. This is a shared driveway with the guests and farm behind the cottage. You'll find plenty of parking adjacent to the cottage. The pool is shared with the apartment so, please, no skinny dipping 😬 Pool will be closed Nov. 1 until spring. Other things to note Your cottage is what you rent, and we pride ourselves on giving 100% respect for all guests’ privacy. We are always happy to chat with guests if you feel social, but understand if you want to remain 'away' from people on your trip. The road can be heard from the front porch, but not an issue from inside the house with the windows closed. There is more traffic noise when the leaves are off the trees in the winter, one of the drawbacks to being so convenient to Route 29. We take great care to ensure every fabric surface is washed after each stay including shower curtains, all bedding and duvets. All hard surfaces and furniture are sanitized between each stay. Additionally, mountain life draws ladybugs and stink bugs and is not a reflection of cleanliness but rather a normal part of what to expect in this area. We take protecting our guests seriously and value keeping a very clean space for you to enjoy. About the Hosts Hi! We’re Bobbi and Keith. We’ve been renting on Airbnb since 2015 and love country life and all things outdoors, whether it’s hiking, kayaking, gardening, or tending to our goats, chickens, and cows. We love to travel, but just as happy hanging out on our porch with our two dogs listening to music and enjoying a cold beverage in the evenings. We love for people to experience Nelson County and everything that our wonderful home has to offer. That's why we started our first Airbnb, with plans to eventually expand up the mountain on our property to accommodate more guests. We’re always interested to know what makes our guests happy when they are here but value their need for privacy. If you have any comments, suggestions, or issues, we would love to know what they are and have left a comment book for such things and are only a call away. Time away with friends and loved ones is essential to a good and productive life! We really want to help our guests feel comfortable enough that they have only to worry about what beer they will drink next. Cheers, friends!

column68: Buck Creek Paradise is located on 33 very private acres: ~ Cove, creek and mountain views ~ Walking paths through woods and meadow ~ Ample porch for dining, relaxing and viewing ~ Stone-accented designer gardens ~ Secluded and quiet, perfect for wildlife sightings ~ Very near breweries, wineries and distilleries. ~ 30 minutes from Charlottesville, the AT, Blue Ridge Parkway, Wintergreen Resort ~Excellent WiFi and a quiet work space The space Buck Creek Paradise is a three-bedroom home with separate entrances for the one-bedroom efficiency upstairs and the two bedrooms and full kitchen downstairs. Downstairs, you'll find two bedrooms, each with a queen bed. Between the bedrooms is a shared bathroom with a large soaking tub and shower. The living area is a large open space consisting of two comfortable sitting areas, one contains a smartTV and DVD Player. There is a lovely dining table, opposite a butcher block bar/prep area, and a well-stocked kitchen. This kitchen offers a coffee maker with filters, a bag of gourmet ground coffee and also a coffee grinder if you wish to bring your own beans. Sugar and powdered creamer are also available. In the cooking area, you'll find salt, pepper, olive oil, and vinegar. You will have all the pots, pans, glasses, and dishes needed. The kitchen and dining area open onto a large porch with a cozy couch, lounge chairs, and a table for outdoor meals. Beside the door is a basket containing the chair pads and placemats. From the porch, you'll see the gardens, a cove meadow and pond, as well as Diggs Mountain. Upstairs is apartment with its own bathroom and separate entrance. To reach this space, one goes up an outside wooden stairway, onto a covered porch with a comfy loveseat, chairs, and views of the woodland property. Just inside, is fully stocked small kitchen with an island and two stools for dining. Here you'll find a two-burner stovetop, a toaster oven, a microwave and a refrigerator. Across from the kitchen is a sitting area with a loveseat and two chairs. The sleeping area includes a queen bed with bedside tables and reading lamps. Across from the sleeping area is a desk and chair. Just beyond is a dresser and two closets. There is a bathroom with a sink, commode, and shower. In sum, the efficiency is a charming hide-away upstairs over the downstairs kitchen and dining areas. Buck Creek Paradise is cleaned by a professional cleaner, according to COVID requirements, with everything wiped and disinfected before each new guest. (If you study our listings, Paradise combines the Buck Creek Lodge with an additional upstairs bedroom) VISITING DOGS: We welcome your pets, for a fee of $45 each, per pet, per visit, which you will be prompted to pay through Airbnb closer to your visit. We have a few requests regarding dogs and cats: Please keep your pet on a leash around the buildings and gardens. There are fields along Buck Creek, as well as woods on the property, where pets may run free. If your pet sheds, as a courtesy to our housekeeper, please bring a crate, pet bed, or blanket, to minimize hair. Unless you have a crate, please do not leave your pet unattended inside. We provide 'waste bags' and we appreciate you picking up your pet's waste, particularly when near the buildings and in the gardens. Thank you! Buck Creek Cabin is another Airbnb rental available on this property. It is hidden by the woods. Both Paradise and the Cabin are very private. Guest access Only guests who rent Buck Creek Paradise, a 3-bedroom home, are invited to use the entire home as they wish. On the property, there are lovely designer gardens to visit and wonderful creek-side and woodland walks. In this rural farming area, it is considered a courtesy not to walk or trespass on neighboring properties. A detailed Walking Map of Buck Creek’s 33 acres, with various paths, is included in the Handbook. For their safety, unaccompanied young children are not permitted in the Kiln Shed area. For everyone's safety, use of the farm-pond and dock are not permitted. By law, outdoor fires are not permitted. Other things to note By law, there is no hunting or discharging of firearms on the property. By law, no outdoor fires are permitted. Please note that while there are no animals in residence at our property, there are friendly neighborhood dogs who sometimes stop by to say hi. They are identified in photographs on the fridge. Simply tell them to Go Home" with some authority."

column47: We've hosted guests since 1987 in our 10-bedroom Inn (once a barn!) Homemade breads, muffins, fruit cobbler, coffee & juice for breakfast. Near Wintergreen ski & golf, Blue Ridge mountains, dining, brewpubs, wineries, nature, great cycling & hiking! The space Bedrooms listed (10 in all) are in the building we call The Inn---a renovated horse barn, still sporting stall doors! Each room has one double bed, desk, wardrobe, side table and big window. The Inn has two kitchenettes, two common areas, a wrap-around deck, a patio, and several shared Men's and Ladies bathrooms (6 toilets, 4 showers, in all). The Inn is separate from our home, which is the office where guests check in. We live on 34 acres, with views of meadows and the Blue Ridge Mountains, in beautiful Nelson County Virginia. Guest access The Inn's two kitchenettes include microwave ovens and refrigerators. We also provide an outdoor grill---But due to health dept regulations, no conventional stove or oven is at the Inn. Other things to note Our premises are ideal for retreats, small weddings, reunions of all sorts, and groups of friends---OR just perfect as a get-away for individual travelers. According to cyclists (from near and far), the Inn is especially suited for those who love tackling mountains and back-road adventures on 2-wheels---(especially because Martin is a member of that tribe!) That said, no worries for guests who prefer their feet on the ground"---Plenty of fun to be had adventuring on area trails
column49: accessible just 13 miles up the hill at Reid's Gap."
