column59: We call this our hidden gem because it's not too far from town, wineries, UVA, Monticello and more that Charlottesville has to offer, but yet it's far enough away from the hustle and bustle. The renowned Clifton Inn, a popular destination wedding venue is less that 1/4 mile away. Thomas Jefferson's Monticello is a 7 minute drive. The campus of UVA is a 15 minute drive. We call this our studio loft because it has the feel of a mountain cabin. The views are gorgeous and the setting is peaceful. The space I love to decorate so I’m particularly grateful to do so in this barn studio. I want my guests to feel like they are in a home not in a hotel room. I carefully hand pick and oftentimes paint my own furniture finds. The balcony is a great place for morning coffee while breathing in the fresh air and taking in the Mountain View’s. We have a fire pit and a pool for our guests to enjoy. We provide the kindling, fire wood, blankets and lighter. All you need to do is bring your glass of wine! We have another guesthouse on the property so all guests have access to use the pool. Guest access Guests have access to our private pool located up by the main house (pool is seasonal.) We ask that if you want to use the pool after 6:30 p.m. that you send us a message and request to do so (we like to swim laps after work usually around 6:30 or so…after that, no worries!) Liability Waiver: Owners are not responsible for any incident, or accident that may occur while using our pool. You understand that swimming in the pool is at your own risk and that special risks may be involved with swimming. You accept full responsibility for any bodily harm arising from swimming and hold the owner harmless. You agree to use only plastic cups (provided) when drinking liquid in the pool area. You agree to be fully and solely responsible for any accidents you may incur. You understand the risk discussed above and agree that you will assume all responsibility. You agree to waive any claim whatsoever against the owner for accidents or claims arising from swimming or using the pool. In booking this Airbnb all guests agree to this waiver of liability. Other things to note There is a fire pit on the property that all guests have access to. It is shared with guests staying in our other 2 person Airbnb on the property. We live about 5 minutes from Monticello and there is a great 4 mile walking trail just past the entrance to Monticello that is so nice to walk. Check it out.
column66: Hidden Gem near town and Monticello with a pool

column70: Mindful Mountain is a secluded country guesthouse: 4+ Rms- LR, DR, kit, BR, sleeping loft, 1 Bth, laundry, deck & yard. Wifi, cable TV & HBO, all utilities included. On site parking. Bicycle available. UVA and Martha Jefferson Hospital nearby. Suitable for travel work assignment, medical stay, quiet retreat, family visit, relocation. Extended stay rates. Hosts want your stay to be comfortable and stress-free. Check our reviews! Dates still available. The space Private setting overlooking deer fields, small stream, woods. Additional private yoga class is available for $25. Guest access Rental is for entire guest residence. Self check is included. Host assistance is available. Other things to note CDC disinfect guidelines for all surfaces. Separate guesthouse, edge of C'ville, 6 miles to UVA, 10 minutes to downtown. Minimum one month or longer stays.

column84: Lovely cottage beside Stony Brook. Only 2 miles to the city of Charlottesville! You are invited to explore the land and enjoy the brook that runs through it. Guests love the fire pit and large lawn for playing with the kids. The large, covered outdoor entertaining area is for you to use as well! A drop in to the Rivanna river is only a mile away at Darden Towe park for tubing, kayaks and more. The space The cottage overlooks the stream and woods of the property. Each bedroom has it's own bathroom (tub shower) and the kitchen is stocked with all the basics (plus some treats!). The main room is shared with the kitchen and has a large sofa for lounging, smart TV and lots of board games! There are 3 areas to dine. Inside, the kitchen table can accommodate 4-5 people, the porch attached to the kitchen is great for easy kitchen access and the large entertaining area outside is complete with party lights, a gas BBQ, sofa and large table for dining. Below the cottage is my ceramic studio. The studio has a separate entrance which allows us to keep our work private. We strive to give our guests privacy so I bet you won't even see us! We live in the farmhouse on the property (7 acres), so we are available to our guests (if they choose). Guest access We have a huge parking area for guests to use and access to Route 20 is right out the driveway. From there you can zip up and down to wineries and onto UVA grounds in minutes! The cottage and outdoor entertaining area is exclusively for your use while you stay with us. The basement of the cottage is not for guest access. The carport is not for guest parking. Other things to note *Are you staying with children? Let me know their ages and I can be sure to leave some fun toys, games or books out for them. If you are lucky enough to catch us during a good snow we have a great sledding hill (and sleds to borrow). *If you would like the kitchen stocked upon arrival, we can arrange to take delivery from one of the grocery delivery services and put the items in the kitchen* *Have a well behaved dog? Let us know if you need to bring your pooch along and we can work something out* Our cleaning regimen is in accordance with the recommendations from airbnb and we have left additional cleaning supplies for our guests to use. These include hand sanitizer, paper towels and disinfectant.
column91: Cottage in the Country (close to UVA!)

column77: An adorable home with breathtaking sunset and Blue Ridge mountain views unlike anywhere in the Charlottesville area. We are 5 miles from downtown and minutes to some of the best vineyards and restaurants in the Piedmont. Enjoy comfortable beds, a fire pit and Adirondack chairs. Walk our country roads, feed the horses, enjoy the views of the mountains. We welcome all people, base price is for 2 people so sorry no pets or children under 10 for safety. The space Tranquil Estate is a very special place where the big sky meets the Blue Ridge mountains. We moved here because Charlottesville is small city that has farm to table values and a countryside which makes you feel like you’re on vacation. The decor is industrial farmhouse and all of the amenities are new; including the beds! We will leave a few necessities in the kitchen like coffee, tea, salt seasonings and olive oil. There is a Keurig and a drip coffee maker with coffee pods. There is a new cuisinart induction cooktop and a new cuisinart fryer, toaster, and baking oven. There are two mini-splits. There is a window AC unit you can control along with ceiling fans and stationary fans. Let us know if you are too warm or cold so we can make you comfortable! We have a huge 10+ acre field with horses and cows over the fence. It is a very peaceful property. There is a large table to work on - perhaps write that novel sitting in the back of your head. The property also is the perfect place to paint en plein air. Bring wood, paper and marshmallows for the fire pit! Sorry, pets are not allowed. Base price covers two people. Guest access You’ll have the cottage to yourself and there are tall evergreens separating the view between houses so it is private. Since it is a small farm you may see me out and about as I take care of the property and animals. We are mindful that you are here to rest and relax and always do our best to accommodate guests needs. The dogs are in and out all day but if you prefer not to see them just say so and we will do our best to keep them inside. Their names are Foster the Basset Hound, and Pippa our young Corgi. Other things to note Horses: Ruby the paint horse is 10 years old. The small black and white pony is named Daisy-Mae. Both are sweethearts and very beautiful unless it is muddy...ugh. Sometimes they are in a paddock up close to the cottage which is really fun for our guests. They are kept in an electric fence but love a visit. They enjoy real food like apples and carrots and hold your hand FLAT when giving them these treats. Fire Pit Stuff: Bring wood and paper for your fire pit and the MARSHMALLOWS!!! If you forget something just ask- we probably have it! First time Airbnb users need to know that being a part of the Airbnb family is super unique. We have traveled the world this way. We welcome new people when we see them enjoying our property. When we travel, our hosts are those who share their restaurants and “must see and do” information not found on line.Meeting new people is what Airbnb is all about- not just staying at a place- you’re staying in a part of a home. We think that’s so cool. We look forward to hosting you at our beautiful estate. Cynthia and Chuck

column71: Our place is a newly constructed barn loft in our 1960's barn. Enjoy beautiful views of the surrounding countryside from large windows and a private balcony. The barn is surrounded by our horse pastures and neighboring fields. Self check in with the key lockbox. This loft is separate from the main house where we live. Private parking and entrance for our guests directly outside of barn loft (this is separate from the main house driveway). The space One bedroom with queen bed (semi-private with a half wall). Spiral staircase leads up to a loft with two twin beds, easily adapted to queen if desired. Large open living space with full kitchen. One full bath. Laundry closet with washer/dryer. Guest access The entire loft is yours. The field across the road from us is our neighbor's property, as well as any land outside of the black fence. Our property is surrounded by the black fence.

column46: The house is incredibly comfortable and spacious. Only ten minutes from downtown, yet the wooded 2 acre property has a natural country feel. Lots of privacy from neighbors! The kitchen is huge and wonderful for cooking. Lots of counter space. Over all it’s a very special space with a magical atmosphere! The space This beautiful space feels like a luscious yet humble retreat. Comfortable and roomy. Enjoy a short walk around the two acre property. There is a lovely wooded yard that borders a clean, bubbling creek. Relax in chairs and savor the sweet sounds of the water. There is also a small but sacred labyrinth on the left corner of the property. Huge deck to enjoy or practice yoga/tai chi or to get your dance groove on! Guests are welcome to have their meals out on the picnic table. Other things to note It’s possible that I may occasionally stay in a small camper on the property in the evenings. But, I would absolutely respect guests privacy and pretty much keep out of sight.

column87: This is a full private apartment located in the lower level of a house in the Greenbrier neighborhood in the heart of Charlottesville, VA. It is self contained and includes a bedroom, living room, utility room, game room with pool table, darts and ping pong, small gym, and full kitchen and bath. 5 minutes from downtown and UVA. Under 5 minutes to JPJ, Amphitheater, downtown mall and Scott Stadium. Perfect for hiking, brewery and wine tastings, weddings, vacations, graduation, etc.! The space The space is in a friendly quiet forested neighborhood in the city limits. Easy to get anywhere in town as it is located so close to main throughways, downtown, UVA and airport. Easy and cheap to Uber anywhere. The Rivanna trail system (which runs throughout the city and river), is in the neighborhood for easy trails and walking. The apartment is completely private and lockable, and has lots of space. There is a fenced in forested backyard with some chickens, with their eggs in your fridge. Parking is easy and private, and you have your own private entrance with keys. The apartment is the lower level of the house, I live above in the main house. There is a game room with a pool table/ping pong table and a dart board. Utility room is at your disposal with new large capacity washer and dryer. Also there is a workout area that includes a Precore elliptical. Guest access The entire apartment is yours. You may access the game room with pool table/dart board anytime as well as the utility room with washer/dryer/gym/ironing board. Access to back yard and driveway, with outdoor chairs. I provide a mess of snacks, coffee, tea, juice, bottled water and basic essentials for your pleasure upon check in. There is also a water filter on the tap for drinking, and plenty of refrigerator and freezer space with ice should you need it. Enjoy!

column60: This is a private space in the basement of our ranch home in Charlottesville, Va. We live in a quiet neighborhood just off of 29N. We are minutes away from Charlottesville Airport, John Paul Jones Arena, Walmart, Target, Kroger, The University of Virginia (UVA), UVA Hospital, Martha Jefferson Hospital, the Downtown Mall, Stonefield Shopping Center, Fashion Square Mall, and Monticello. Lots of outdoor activities to enjoy! Mountpelier, Richmond, and D.C. are all a short drive away. The space We live in an excellent location in the heart of Charlottesville! You will have a private entrance to come and go with ample parking. A very safe place to park your things and explore the area! There is a private kitchenette with a Keurig, cooking utensils, and pans. We offer light snacks, water, and breakfast items complementary. Other things to note Our guests have loved the accessibility of our home. It’s a great place to come and go from. If you’re looking for a place to escape and lay around for a quiet stay, this may not be the spot for you! We have a large active family who lives above the space. We do our best to keep the noise level to a minimum, but you will hear little footsteps from time to time. It is important to note that all outside equipment, trampolines, swings, and swing sets are off limits to guests.

column64: Our 800+ square foot suite can be your home base for your Charlottesville visit. Spacious suite offers privacy & quiet comfort, with amenities including home gym, laundry, and kitchenette. Minutes from UVA & downtown. The space Come and go on your own schedule with your separate entrance: guests have complete and private use of the suite, including full bath, bedroom and sitting area, during their stay. Elbow Room suite features private bedroom with comfy queen-size, pillow top mattress. Private bath and kitchenette area, with under counter refrigerator, microwave and Keurig coffee maker. Spacious adjacent living area with dining/work table and chairs, comfy sofas and recliners, television, etc, is all yours during your stay. Private entrance, and off-street parking in large driveway in a quiet neighborhood - can accommodate more than one car if needed. Sleeps 4: Queen bed in the bedroom, plus an available queen-sized Murphy bed if there are additional guests (additional fees apply whenever guests request use of the Murphy bed for their reservation). Also available is a single cot w/sleeping pad - best suited for children and younger guests. All bedding supplied. Guest access Guests have complete and private use of the suite during their stay. Shared space is an adjacent utility area of the basement where shared laundry and gym equipment (treadmill, elliptical, and universal gym) is located - although it's rare that we enter this shared space when guests are staying with us. Wireless internet throughout, Apple TV, Netflix, Amazon video, Disney+ access in the sitting area. Note that there is not a television in the bedroom. Alarm clock with USB charger in the bedroom. Other things to note Elbow Room is equipped for a continental breakfast if you choose to bring things like cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc. You will find coffee, tea and hot chocolate, along with a few necessities like plates, silverware, coffee cups, corkscrew, etc. If there's something in particular that you might need during your stay, please let us know in advance - if we can, we'll have it waiting for you! Our nightly rental for two guests does not include use of the Murphy bed, however we will set this up upon request - and charge the extra guest fee for doing so. Note that our preference is to accept a two-night minimum rental for weekends, but if you contact us with a reservation request no more than 14 days out, we will consider a single night weekend reservation if the space is not already booked. We're proud to be one of the airbnb properties in the Charlottesville area that is properly licensed with local officials and compliant with required inspections. You can be assured of a clean, comfortable and safe stay with us, and know that your hosts are compliant with local ordinances concerning short term lodging. As such, Airbnb collects and remits all state and local taxes for all stays less than 30 days. Thank you for helping us comply with local regulations and thus be good citizens and good neighbors.
column71: Spacious private suite in quiet neighborhood

column42: Our highly popular, turn of the century, farm cottage is the perfect place to escape the city and immerse yourself within the farming culture of central Virginia. It is ideal for a family traveling or a small group! Make your stay unforgettable by letting the kids see chickens and farm animals or by taking a horseback riding lesson! The space Our Farm Cottage is located in the hub of all farming activity. Adjacent to the barns and ancillary farm buildings it overlooks much of what we do everyday. The cottage itself is comprised of four beautifully appointed bedrooms, one very nice full bathroom, a living room with cable tv, a kitchen, and a laundry room. There is a wonderful backyard for cooking out and entertaining. There is a screened in porch out front that overlooks paddocks and farming operations. Additional Offerings: If you have children between the ages of 5 - 17, be sure to ask about our Summer Lesson Program operating between June - September, Monday - Friday 9:00 - 3:00. Fill their weekdays with horseback riding and farming activities while you get to explore everything Charlottesville has to offer. $650 per week, or $120 daily drop in rate. Non - Summer Program Horseback Riding lessons are also a possibility upon request. A lesson is $60.00 per person and lasts around 45 minutes. $80 per couple or two person lesson. Professional Photoshoots available -- $200.00 see our Instagram account (roslynfarm) for examples of previous photoshoots done for our Airbnb guests! (Usually about 200 images per shoot and lasts around an hour or however long is needed) Guest access We encourage guests to explore the property, after we have explained where they can go. Other things to note The heat source for the cottage is an Amish made gas stove that stays on at all times in the winter. It is completely safe and puts out a good deal of heat. In the summer the cottage stays very cool with window units. Inviting guests that are not also staying the night and therefore included in the overall price of the rental is not acceptable. This puts undue stress on parking and resources and therefore total number of guests must be negotiated before arrival.

column55: Short Drive From UVA The space We are excited to offer this perfect 3 bedroom oasis for your friends and family to feel like they never left home while traveling in Charlottesville. This rental is conveniently located just a short drive from Charlottesville and the University of Virginia. Enjoy a quiet tree-lined drive on your way to this property while passing the beautiful Rivanna River and Ivy Creek Natural area. Inside this spacious single-level home find a dining room with seating for 6 and a separate breakfast nook that gives a great view of the lawn and woods in the back yard. The full sized kitchen includes a dishwasher, electric range, microwave, and all necessary cookware and dishware to enjoy meals at the house. The living room has plenty of seating, built in bookcases, a large TV, and a gas fireplace that you're sure to gather around with friends and family. The vaulted ceiling and skylights add the perfect sunny ambiance to the serene accent colors in the space.  The back yard has additional seating during the warmer months and a screened in porch with a fan to keep you comfortable in the shade. To the left side of the house find, a master bedroom with a King size bed, TV, and an en suite bathroom with a soaker tub (no shower). A guest bedroom features a Queen size bed and another guest room features 2 Twins and access to a screened in porch.  There is another shared guest bathroom with shower. All bedrooms provide plenty of light and views of the outdoors. With parking for 2-3 cars, a quiet back yard and of tons of amenities, this home base is a great resting point during your stay in and around Charlottesville. The guest house is joined to the main house and there's complete privacy because walls only join to a two car garage, so no noise transference. The home also has easy, low traffic access to the airport and numerous vineyards while keeping UVA and Downtown Charlottesville only a short drive away. Amenities:King Bedroom with TV and ensuite soaker tub (no shower) Queen Bedroom Two Twins Bedroom Hall Bathroom with shower Full Kitchen and Dining Room Gas Fireplace in Living Room WIFI and Cable TV Washer/Dryer Standard Drip Coffee Pot & Keurig Backyard with swingset High Chair & Pack & Play Gas Grill Parking for 2-3 cars All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.

column95: Rustling Meadows is a secluded and quiet farm with horses, livestock, gardens, vineyards, a fishing pond, bamboo forest, historic cemetery, grassy rolling hills, magnificent hardwood forest, and a network of walking and riding trails. While centrally located in the urban ring of historic Charlottesville/Albemarle County, and the University of Virginia you can enjoy the uniquely wonderful offerings of the best creative comforts and/hoteling your horse at the beautiful Rustling Meadows Stable. The space Four bedroom living space or home with kitchen, living room w/ wood burning fireplace, dining room, butlers kitchen, laundry room, mud room w/ exercise ball, free weights, exercise charts, 2 full baths and half bath. Master bedroom suite is equipped with its own separate kitchenette, stacked laundry, electric fireplace, master bath with private toilet enclosure, double sink vanity, large partially glass standing shower and separate full tub. ​ Home has 4 full size leather sofas for stretching out. Ceiling fans in all 4 bedrooms and Living Room. Guest access Guests have access to the entire home and will have complete access to the large deck, terrace, hot tub, grill, tree hammock, chair hammocks and all of the outdoor grounds. Other things to note Rustling Meadows Stable in conjunction with our sister and adjacent farm, Roslyn Farm & Vineyard, offers a variety of event hosting services such as weddings, receptions, reunions and parties. Additionally, please come and enjoy our wine tasting room where we serve a variety of refreshing wines. Our unique packages include lodging, event space and wine for your enjoyment and convenience of keeping both family and friends on the farm. HORSE HOTELING Have space for horse travelers who need an overnight stay for horses and themselves. Paddocks located close by offer comfort to the owners knowing their animals are safe.

column91: We are empty nesting, professional parents of 4 kids - all of whom are off to college or in their careers. My husband and I live upstairs. Our home is in a very nice, quiet neighborhood that is close to everything. 3 miles to the Down Town mall, 3.5 to John Paul Jones arena, 3.5 to UVA, 6.2 to CHO Airport and many more popular destinations. We added insulation between the floors and closed off the stairs while adding a w/d for each unit so there is no longer shared indoor spaces or amenities. The space There is street parking and your own access with a key-coded lock to the outside door. Free WIFI, Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, washer, and dryer. The kitchenette has been updated in this apartment and should everything you might need. The pool is available during the summer and we also have a nice patio with a firepit that you are welcome to use. This home has one indoor/outdoor cat living upstairs in the main part of the house. If anyone in your party has cat allergies, I do not recommend booking this apartment. Though the cat does not have access there is still a chance of sensitivity to those with cat allergies. Guest access You'll have access to the entire apartment downstairs of our split level home. Feel free to use our pool, patio, back yard, barbeque, and basketball hoop. Other things to note The kitchenette has a sink, cooking plate, microwave, toaster oven, convection oven and 2 mini refrigerators for you to use. We also offer tea options, a keurig, a coffee maker, cooking and serving essentials and a smoothie blender.

column65: Modern & spacious terrace level 900 sq ft garden apartment complete with kitchenette - just 2 miles from the major intersection of Rte 29-N & Rio Rd. The charming, quiet neighborhood is conveniently located to all services & about 10 minutes from both downtown and UVA grounds. Only 12 minutes to I-64, providing access to Richmond (less than 1 hour) and the Blue Ridge mountain trails and scenic roads (30 minutes). Note: UVA Graduation weekend: 2-night minimum required. The space Freshly painted, spacious bedroom has one queen bed, a closet, 2 bedside tables and lamps, USB charging cords, a luggage rack and a full length mirror. Large living area has plenty of floor space for our additional queen air mattress, upon request. Linens provided for both. Ample seating, large TV, ping pong table, basketball hoop and air hockey table, too! A basket of kids' toys are provided, too. Kitchenette with sink, wine cooler/mini-fridge, 10-cup coffee maker, single-serve coffee maker, microwave, dishware, silverwear and corkscrew includes a separate eating nook with large, 4-chair table. Coffee and tea (plus fixings) are provided. Guest access Family will remain on the top two levels of the house. There will be no interaction with family, unless requested/necessary, after the host provides a brief tour of the space. While self entry is technically an option, access through the main floor of the house is preferable because of additional amenities & entertainment features that have been added to the space. Guests have preferred this set-up! Other things to note This garden level apartment is 900 square feet with a 3/4 bath and a kitchenette. Linens and towels provided as well as shampoo, conditioner, soap, hairdryer and other essentials. Queen air mattress and additional linens provided upon request. Dining table seats 4. Large living area for relaxing with TV (ample sofa seating!), basketball, ping pong and air hockey. Parking available in the driveway. No RV parking permitted. No pets.

column60: Experience luxury living in the country by residing at this 5-bedroom, 5-bath vacation rental apartment in Earlysville. The home sits just minutes from the airport, the Historic Downtown Mall, and the University of Virginia, making it easy to get anywhere around town. Spend your day outdoors at Meadowcreek Golf Course or check out Jefferson Vineyards - there will be something for everyone to do here. Return home for more fun with the hot tub, deck, pool, playground, and inviting living space. The space Outdoor Seating Area | 3,835 Sq Ft | Dining Deck | Lower Level Apartment Unit Filled with luxurious amenities and at-home comfort, this spacious home is perfect for a group of friends or family seeking a private and relaxing escape. Bedroom 1: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: King Bed | Bedroom 4: Queen Bed | Bedroom 5: Queen Sleeper Sofa | Pool House: Sleeper Sofa OUTDOOR LIVING: Gas grill, fire pit, stand-alone fire starter, seasonal heated pool (open late May - October 1st), hot tub, backyard, playground, poolside pavilion (attached to the pool house) INDOOR LIVING: Flat-screen Smart TVs, 2 dining tables, fireplace, jetted tub, wood-burning stove, open floor plan KITCHEN: Fully equipped w/ blender, drip coffee maker (main house & pool house), cooking basics, hot water pot, stainless steel appliances, breakfast bar GENERAL: Free WiFi, linens/towels, trash bags, paper towels, air conditioning, beach towels, central heating, complimentary toiletries, clothes washer/dryer FAQ: 2 dogs on-site (separate yard) PARKING: Driveway (10 vehicles) Guest access Guests will have access to the entire property via keyless entry Other things to note - No smoking - No pets allowed - No events, parties or large gatherings - Must be at least 25 years old to book - Additional fees and taxes may apply - Photo ID may be required upon check-in - NOTE: The property requires stairs and may be difficult for guests with limited mobility - NOTE: The seasonal heated pool is open from late May to October 1st - NOTE: The homeowner lives on-site, in a separate unit with a separate entrance, and may be present during your stay

Memory foam mattress • Well lit entry Private Entry • Fast Wireless WiFi • SmartTV • Central A/C and Heat • Private Washer/ Dryer • Gas Stove • Located by Railroad tracks. Still, we are just a text, voice or email message away to take care of any questions or unanticipated needs. If we are around please say hey! There may be guests upstairs in Apartment A so please be kind to each other. Thanks in Advance! Guest access You have exclusive access to Unit B and an inviting Backyard area with private entrance. There is a private laundry room for your use. Private off street parking for your exclusive use. We do not receive packages or mail for our guests. Private 2-3 car Parking is about 25 yards from the door. We offer no-contact check-in Other things to note The property is professionally cleaned and serviced with fresh linens and towels. For longer stays, guests are responsible for basic living supplies once the initial ones provided run out. Mid-stay cleaning and fresh linens are available upon request for fee. Lost key fee is $20.00; damage to the linens will be a fee of $50.00. One important note about the stairs to the apartment, is that they are steep and you will need to take your time going up and down. Please note there are exterior only cameras with flood lights for your added security. Please note there will be noise from passing trains, hot water heater, and Apartment A upstairs foot traffic. We ask our guests to keep that to a normal level. The neighborhood is generally a sleepy quiet place on the river with miles of trails and hiking opportunities. Super convenient to downtown Charlottesville and Monticello.

column46: Large studio-like room located close to downtown Charlottesville (1.8 miles) and the Rivanna River (.2 miles.) This spacious room has a sleeping area and a living room space that looks out into the green space of Riverview Park. Its a quite hideaway, with its own private entrance tucked in amongst an urban neighborhood. Riverside Hideaway is perfectly located to enjoy the area attractions and offers you a relaxing space to rest after your busy day. Owner lives in the same house. The space Riverside Hideaway is on the garden level of the owners home. Access is through a private entrance. Guest space includes a private bathroom, sleeping area, and living space. There is sweet eating area equipped with a refrigerator and area to make hot beverages. While this area is perfect for a snack or light breakfast, there is no kitchen. Guest area is separate from the main house buy a locked door and decorative curtain. Guest access Guests will have access to the guest area through a private entrance. All other areas of the house are without admittance. Access to laundry facilities are not included in the stay.

column63: Nestled in a quiet cul de sac next to a city park and pool, our home is a short walk from the unique Downtown Mall, great bars and eateries, and a lovely river trail for recreation. A short drive from UVa., Monticello, the Blue Ridge Mountains, vineyards, Ash-Lawn, Montpelier, Wintergreen, etc, our location offers easy access to all that our beautiful and historic region offers. The space Our home is a friendly and welcoming place for all! We have a large bedroom along with a bathroom on the second floor of our house. We live on the first floor so your space is very private. There is another bedroom on the second floor that we occasionally use as an office, but for the most part we won't be up there and we won't use the bathroom. If you need a second bedroom for up to two more people, please message me to work out pricing/availability. The guest room has a double memory foam bed with all cotton 600 thread count sheets, AC, desk, closet space, two luggage racks, alarm clock, yoga mat, dresser, guitar, and a ceiling fan. There are various books and games available as well as DVD's. The New York Times is delivered on the weekends and you are welcome to read it. There is a mini-fridge and an electric tea pot on the second floor along with an assortment of coffee, teas, bottled water, milk, half & half, and ramen noodles. For breakfast: instant oatmeal and light snacks. If you need to use the microwave in our kitchen, please ask. Guest access You will enter our front door and walk upstairs to your own private space. The key is in a lock-box outside, so you can come and go as you please. Bathroom is at top of stairs and the bedroom is on the left side of bathroom. We sleep and reside on the first floor. Other things to note We have a large backyard which can be accessed from the outside. There is a hammock in the summer months. Children can play in the back but must be supervised. Since the park is across the street, kids (and adults) have plenty of additional place to spread out and play.

column59: Lovely 1940s cottage located in beautiful downtown Charlottesville. Less than 1 mile to the downtown mall, with coffee shops and top Belmont restaurants close by, some within a 5 minute walking distance. The cottage is across the street from Meade Park and the Wednesday farmers market from May to September. Perfect for a romantic couples getaway or a family vacation. The space is ideal for a traveling professional in Charlottesville and needing to be close to the University or the Hospital. The space Coffee, tea, yogurt and cereal are provided for breakfast, and basic condiments for other meals. Let us know if you have any special requests. Guest access Guests will be able to use the entire cottage, as well as the yard. We provide for your use while in the cottage access to HBOMAX, Netflix and Apple TV+. The local TV channels for ABC, NBC, CBS, PBS & FOX can be accessed using the HDTV antenna Other things to note If guests have a baby, upon request we can provide a Pack and Play and/ or a high chair -although guests will need to provide their own sheets for the baby. column64: The space The 'Treehouse' is a small, charming, rustic, 2 story house on stilts. Air conditioning. Woodstove in winter: Each floor is 12 ft x 12 ft. Downstairs there is a double sized futon bed, and a small kitchen (with refridgerator, toaster oven, and hotplate, electric water heater, coffee pot and basic kitchen supplies including cutlery, plates, pots, pan), and a table. The upstairs is accessible by a steep staircase. It has a queen-sized bed, a dresser and a desk. Pets are permitted but please ask first. Please pick up after your pet.Dogs must be kept on a leash when in the yard at all times. No exceptions. Large dogs May not be permitted. Please share the breed of your dog when inquiring. Thanks very much. Downstairs is cozy with the wood stove and a window A/C unit which cools the place down quickly in summer. The upstairs does not cool down as well due to the vaulted ceiling, but there is a ceiling fan and there are windows on all four walls to allow cross ventilation. There is a wrap-around porch with a couch and a great view of the creek, and the surrounding greenery. The half bathroom is located in an enclosed room on the porch (toilet and sink.) The hot, private OUTDOOR shower is adjacent on the porch. Unusual! And yes, we do have guests in the winter! We are located 1 mile from the downtown mall in Charlottesville, which is full of delicious restaurants and entertainment. There are also several good restaurants a few blocks away. The Treehouse is across the street from a lovely riverside trail: great place to walk dogs, bike and stroll. By a creek with a black walnut tree with a swing, vegetable garden and free-range chickens in the yard that inhabit the coop under the Treehouse. This is an Eco-friendly house. We do not use harsh chemicals, so occassionally seasonal bugs may make their way into the treehouse (ladybugs, etc..) Onesty Family Water park is 2 blocks away with a lazy river, slides, lap lanes at certain hours, and obstacle courses. ACAC gym is 1 mile away with excercise classes, warm water salt pools, jacuzzi, sauna and a rooftop deck. Thomas Jefferson's Monticello is 10 minutes away, and many fabulous restaurants are in walking distance (10 minute walk.) Access to the lovely Riverside Trail is just across the street. Great place to walk dogs, bike and stroll. On bus line WiFi: Loghouse password:lovekitty No extra charge if extra guests are children. Two night minimum on weekends. Would you like to participate in our Treehouse for Charity" program? This is how it works: We will donate $50 from the money you have already paid for your reservation to a charity. You choose from one of the three charities listed in the Treehouse. The current charities are the SPCA (Society for the Protection of Cruelty to Animals)
column66: or a local Urban Agriculture Collective
column67: a non-profit that brings organic gardens to the community. We hope that you will participate in this program. It is of no extra cost to you
column68: and we can work together to help out some of our less fortunate companions on this earth. The charity folder is in the Treehouse. Guest access Lockbox code:1234 Other things to note There is plenty of street parking. Please do not park on the grass
column69: and please do not park on the grass driveway alongside the creek
column70: nor in the loghouse driveway. Feel free to park anywhere on the street. I do not recommend parking on the far side of Fairway Avenue near the bridge because cars whizz quickly around that corner.. Thanks!"

column66: This private bedroom and bath in downtown Charlottesville features a garden entrance, spacious bathroom with picture window and claw foot tub. The home is a hundred year old historic property on the bus route and within walking distance to the mall, the river and several awesome restaurants and coffee shops. Simple old world style Apartment walks out into the gardens ..lots of trees and places to enjoy coffee or a glass of wine ..:. The space This guest room and private bath are located down a set of steps into a courtyard garden ,with private entrance and kitchen it is best described as a “cottage “ feel . A true country experience in downtown Charlottesville with Rock walks, trees, gardens, hammock and several sitting areas . Interaction with us is as needed. We are casual and respectful of privacy ,but we are musicians and also own a wedding flower business so will be on the property! We can offer as much or as little as you need . This is a great neighborhood ,also a short walk to the river, biking trails and Monticello just a short drive. you can actually see Monticello and Carter's mountain from here . This home is on the bus route and one mile from the central downtown mall . The river, park, trails and water rentals are just down the street ! the wool factory is a new project at the bottom of Market Street, a short walk down to the river from the apartment, and offering coffee with fresh pastries, a restaurant actually to restaurants and trails for biking and walking off the river we are walking distance to firefly, beer run, salvage brewing and within a mile of the Belmont district in downtown mall Guest access The garden apartment is accessible from either walkway around the house ., and through either garden arbor out front! Take steps through the Rock walls and enter through the only door under the shed breezeway . the home on this property is over 100 years old. a lot of it is original and yes there are stairs on either side of the house 👍 Other things to note We have parking our front on either side of Market Street and we request you park just below the white wooden garden arbor on the right if available. Thank you !! We are also primarily booking short stays ..we Are happy to consider special requests, but the space doubles as a workspace for my wedding flower business and I do not usually rent more than a few nights at a time.… It is a lovely quiet private space including the kitchen and we love hosting… Thank you…

column56: Just listed for grad wknd! Completely renovated in 2023. Our porch is great for celebrating! 3 night minimum for graduation weekend. Classic Virginia farmhouse beauty w one of the best front porches in Cville, in a parklike setting with landmark trees and buildings and only a few blocks to the downtown mall. Quick drive to all the best our region has to offer: Monticello, Univ of Virginia, wineries/breweries, Shenandoah NP. Five bedrooms and a huge third floor playroom. The space We love living in downtown Charlottesville, steps from the energy of the pedestrian mall and a ten-minute walk from Belmont's cool restaurants and art galleries. We're one of the only houses on our street and have nearly the entire inside of our block to ourselves. We've truly got the best of both worlds and are excited to share our home with you. Guest access You'll have access to the whole house! Other things to note We're an adventurous and busy family of five living, working, and going to school in downtown Charlottesville--we love are home and are excited for you to explore this great corner of the world.

column52: Walk to the downtown pedestrian mall, Belmont neighborhood and restaurants, and wooded trail along the river from our two-bedroom basement guest suite with a full bath and living area. Built in the 1940s and fully renovated in fall 2017, the home retains original character while boasting modern amenities, comfort, and cleanliness. We live upstairs with two dogs. NO SMOKERS OR SMOKING, PLEASE. The space Our walkout basement features two bedrooms with Queen beds and blackout curtains. There is a full bath and large living area with a leather sofa and love seat, plus an expandable table and chairs. Please note there is no kitchen and no TV (but great WiFi for steaming on your own device). There is a mini fridge, hot water kettle, Keurig coffee machine, basic dishes, and drinking water provided. You will enter the space by walking around the side of the house, through the fence and to the back patio. There is ample, free street parking in front of the home. Please note this is our full time home and we live upstairs with two dogs. You may see our very friendly hound roaming the backyard from time to time. You will likely not see much of our chihuahua as she is not friendly, but you may hear a few barks from upstairs (not at night - she loves her sleep and so do we!). You may also hear them prancing around; we work to keep the noise to a minimum. If you are allergic to or uncomfortable with dogs, this may not be the best place for you. Check in is done by you via a lock box. Detailed instructions can be found in the app upon booking. We have a Tesla home charger available, included with your stay. Please let us know ahead of time so that we can plan accordingly and shuffle our cars for you. Guest access You will have access to the entire property. Other things to note Our space is ideal for a total of 4 humans. We will consider additional children on a case by case basis - please inquire!
column59: Cozy basement guest suite, 15 min walk to downtown

column72: Walk to the downtown pedestrian mall, Belmont neighborhood and restaurants, Ix Art Park, and wooded trail along the river from our 2100 sq ft completely renovated home. Built in the 1940s and fully renovated in fall 2017, the home retains original character while boasting modern amenities, comfort, and cleanliness. Two off street parking spots and plenty of on street parking, fenced backyard, front porch sitting and backyard patio with grill and ambiance. NO SMOKERS OR SMOKING, PLEASE. The space The main level features a cozy living room with a gas fireplace and TV (local channels and Apple TV), dining room with seating for up to 6, and open kitchen perfect for cooking or socializing. The entire second floor is the Master Suite with a Queen bed, full bath featuring a rainfall shower head, and plenty of space to relax. New and modern washer/dryer is just off the master bedroom. The walkout basement features two bedrooms with Queen beds and blackout curtains. The basement has a seating area and a full bath. Walk out the basement to the patio with plenty of seating, a gas grill, and a fully fenced and quiet backyard. This is our full time home, not a vacation home. We are neat and tidy and want you to make yourself at home here. Our fridge will be mostly empty for you, but you’re likely to find some condiments and msc produce. Please use or rearrange them as you see fit! There is a mini fridge in the basement if you need more space. We have a Tesla home charging station available for your use, included with your stay. Guest access You will have access to the entire property.

column64: Architecturally-renovated 1890s farmhouse located within walking distance of Charlottesville's historic Downtown Mall. Four bedrooms, office space, 2.5 bathrooms, full kitchen, living room, family room, open back porch, huge yard, perfect for entertaining! The space Our home is your home; if you let us know what you may need during your stay, we can likely have it available for you! Our first floor living space consists of a formal living room, and open kitchen/dining/family room, making it the perfect space for entertaining. As there is one step from our front walkway into our home, and our master suite is on the first floor, our first floor is very accessible to persons with mobility challenges. (It is not ADA accessible; our cased openings and doorways are 29.) We hope that you enjoy the clawfoot tub and chandelier in the master bathroom! Guest access You are welcome to our entire home with the exception of our basement
column65: which will be locked. You will have access to our Sling TV
column67: and Ting (fiber internet) Wifi accounts. Other things to note We can make a pack-n-play available to you if you let us know that you need one."

column58: Lovely 1940s cottage located in beautiful downtown Charlottesville. Less than 1 mile to the downtown mall, with coffee shops and top Belmont restaurants close by, some within a 5 minute walking distance. The cottage is across the street from Meade Park and the Wednesday farmers market from May to September. Perfect for a romantic couples getaway or a family vacation. The space is ideal for a traveling professional in Charlottesville and needing to be close to the University or the Hospital. The space Coffee, tea, yogurt and cereal are provided for breakfast, and basic condiments for other meals. Let us know if you have any special requests. Guest access Guests will be able to use the entire cottage, as well as the yard. TELEVISION and INTERNET We provide for your use while in the cottage access to HBOMAX, Netflix and Showtime. The local TV channels for ABC, NBC, CBS, PBS & FOX can be accessed using the HDTV antenna . Other things to note If guests have a baby, upon request we can provide a Pack and Play and/ or a high chair -although guests will need to provide their own sheets for the baby.

column50: This relaxing private suite in a newly-renovated basement apartment is located in a safe, quiet, family friendly neighborhood and only a five minute drive from downtown Charlottesville and a 10 minute drive to UVA. Guests will have their own full bathroom, wifi access, mini fridge, coffee maker, kettle, and self check-in to their private entrance using a keypad. The space comes with a queen-sized bed. Maximum 2 guests allowed unless traveling with a baby. There is free parking on the street. The space COVID-19 UPDATE Both hosts are fully vaccinated. We are accepting guest bookings as normal, but we ask that anyone showing symptoms as outlined by the CDC to please stay home. Because we provide directions for self check-in, you will have no in-person interaction with the hosts. Also, please remember to bring a mask when going out to local shops and restaurants, as some places in the city and outskirts still require one. OK, BACK TO THE LISTING: The space has a mini fridge, coffee pot, coffee, electric kettle, and small assortment of teas. There is NO microwave, so please plan accordingly. The TV is setup with basic public cable channels as well as a Chromecast so you can access your own streaming accounts (Netflix, HBO, YouTube, Hulu, etc.). We leave comprehensive instructions on how to use the Chromecast in your room. The space also has a brand new heating and cooling unit that is separate from us so you can control the room temperature yourself. It is very important to us to maintain an eco-friendly household - we use non-toxic cleaning supplies & offer non-toxic soaps, shampoo, conditioner, and laundry detergent. We are strictly a non-smoking household and do not allow smoking on our property. We are not pet owners and do not allow guests to bring pets. No exceptions. PARKING Parking is free and abundant on the street in our neighborhood. Please do not park in our driveway. GUEST ACCESS AREAS Guests only have access to their private suite. There is NO access to a full kitchen, just the mini fridge, coffee maker, and kettle that are already in the room. There is a small concrete patio outside the room, so you're welcome to utilize that and the patio furniture. Other things to note We do have a house cat, but he never is allowed anywhere in the guest space or outside.

column64: Giallo House Guest Suite is ideal for couples, business travelers, small families, or those who are looking to stay in a quiet neighborhood close to downtown. It is ideal for up to 4 people (notes that there is 1 bathroom*) The space We are pet friendly (dogs only*) , but please confirm with us if you'd like to bring along your furry friend. Pets are $50 flat fee per pet (up to 2 Max). This will allow us to cover the costs of wear and tear and additional cleaning for our cleaners. We're proud to pay our cleaners living wages! Please note that we do NOT have a kitchen in this unit and the only sink is located in the bathroom. This makes the guest suite ideal for short stays. We have a dirty dishes bin for guests to leave and we clean all dishes upon checkout. •Master bedroom with a king size memory foam mattress, vanity and extra closet space for luggage storage • 2nd bedroom with a twin bed, luggage rack, and shelves full of games and books •Extra spacious living area that includes a large dining table, coffee and tea bar (coffee and tea provided!), 55-inch smart TV, and two comfy Lazy Boy sofa beds •Microwave, toaster, and mini fridge for your beverages and leftovers (no kitchen*) •Bathroom comes stocked with shampoo/conditioner/body wash and black makeup remover towels •Free street parking in a quiet neighborhood •Short drive to prime attractions in Charlottesville like the downtown pedestrian all, Monticello and UVA. Guest access You'll have a private entrance in the bottom half of the home which is completely private. Other things to note This is an LGBTQIA friendly space and we welcome people from all nationalities, races, cultures, religions, and nuerodiverse backgrounds. Once you enter the house you will see a locked door beyond the dining area. This door leads up to our half of the house and remains closed and locked during your stay. I do not enter your part of the house during your stay.

A beautifully renovated basement apartment in a family friendly neighborhood. Two blocks from our neighborhood park, with a connector to the Rivanna Trail. A 30 minute walk downtown, a bus stop one block away, & bike & scooter rentals make it much faster! Easy access to 250 bypass make Downtown & 29 North equally convenient destinations! Perfect for a couple with a young baby or toddler! Guests must acknowledge that footsteps and sound from our living area can be noisy! The space There is a flagstone patio offering a nice view. A charcoal grill or fire pit can be made available, just let us know if you'd like to use either. You must provide your own firewood/charcoal. Guest access Guests have access to a flagstone patio, full kitchen and living room, bedroom and private bath. Other things to note Guests must acknowledge: while we do our best to be quiet before 9 AM we do live upstairs, so the basement apartment you are renting will not be silent, footsteps and playing sounds transfer.

column39: Cheery suite with private entrance, consisting of bedroom, attached private screen porch & private full bathroom. Attached to house, but entirely separate from rest of house. 1.6 mi. from downtown. Fridge, electric kettle, all-organic breakfast (coffee, hot donuts, fruit) included. Access to walking trails along Rivanna River just a few blocks away. The space The feel of our house is woodsy cottage. Our house is steps away from access to the Rivanna Trail Network which encircles Charlottesville, and three blocks from a bus that will take you downtown. It's a beautiful 30 minute tree-lined walk there. The room has a queen bed. Most importantly, our family business is organic DONUTS which means complimentary hot coffee and donuts every morning for our guests. The house is on a cul-de-sac in a residential neighborhood. Ample street parking. The screen porch connects with the bedroom, and has a table, games, a ceiling fan, and comfy chairs. The connected and private full bathroom has a shower but no bath. There is an electric kettle and small refrigerator in the room, ironing board/iron. Towels, sheets, and dishware/utensils provided. Sheets are 100% cotton. Maximum occupancy: 2 persons (Couple with small child is fine) Guest access Guests have access to private room with private entrance, bathroom, and screen porch. Other things to note NOISE: We own two dogs. They do not have access to the guest quarters. It's possible you will hear them barking although we do our best to keep them quiet when guests are here. We are an active family with friends coming and going so during the day you may hear us going about our life, but we are generally quiet after 9pm. We are not bothered by late night arrivals or talk/laughter in the guest suite. Sometimes in the summer, our yard gets overgrown with various plants getting the temporary upper-hand. If you visit us then, its possible you could see grass in need of a cutting and wineberry bushes luxuriating in their territory grabs. SPECIAL NOTE FOR GUESTS BOOKING WITH US FOR FRIDAY NIGHTS, APRIL THROUGH NOVEMBER: On Saturday mornings during those months Matt and the kids and I run our donut stand at the C-ville Farmer's Market, so cannot serve breakfast to you at home on Saturday mornings. However, we invite you to please come visit us at the Market (Water St. off downtown mall) It'll be our pleasure to serve you up complimentary donuts hot from the cooker and fresh perked coffee in situ!

column78: A charming and private terrace level apartment overlooking the Rivanna River and Darden Towe Park with two bedrooms (queen bed and twin bed) and one bathroom. Private, wooded backyard along the Rivanna River. Quiet city neighborhood 2 miles from Charlottesville's downtown mall. Guest access Private entry. No pets (no exception), no smoking, no candles or fire, no guests without prior permission. Not suitable for small children. If you have a special request, please let us know.

Most guest love this and say they get their best sleep ever because of it. WiFi, granite counter-tops, modern kitchen appliances, SMART LED TV, Coffee maker & much more. The space The Rivanna Trail connects to a trail behind our house. The Rivanna Trail is a 20-mile rustic urban wilderness" hiking trail built and maintained by volunteers that encircles the City of Charlottesville. The Trail meanders through forested buffers that protect the City's streams and rivers. It serves as a community-wide resource for play
column61: and nature-related recreation and education. The Trail passes through many neighborhoods and connects six City parks. It is open for hiking and jogging from dawn to dusk. column58: In a quiet area, this upstairs bedroom has a large bathroom with bathtub and shower. There is a smart TV in the room, no cable. A Red Bull mini fridge is also included. We have a dog-friendly outdoor space, fenced in with medium size dog door. Located 1.6 miles from downtown Charlottesville and next to the Rivanna Trail. The bed's a full futon (orthopedic-type). Guests must be pet and gay-friendly. WE DO NOT DISCRIMINATE against people of color, mental illness or physical disability. The space Our space comes with an adorable French Bulldog Dash, who is a fun, enthusiastic and friendly dog. Our neighborhood is close to downtown but not on a busy street--in fact described as a quiet street. Walking trails and creek are nearby. Please keep in mind if you are thinking of bringing your dog, the dog must be friendly to other dogs, cats, and furniture/belongings. We must know that your dog is coming too. We do not accept cats as guests. We have a fenced in back yard and a patio. I don't usually offer breakfast, but can help with something modest if in a pinch, like cereal, a bagel, or fruit. Guest access Guests are welcome in the kitchen and living room. They will have mostly sole access to the upstairs, but sometimes we need to go into the office across the upstairs master guest room for office work or for Amy to use the treadmill. During your stay If we are here and the guest(s) comes downstairs, we will converse with guests, just check in with them and see if anything is needed. Otherwise we leave guests alone to enjoy their space. Other things to note Park wherever you like, that includes in the driveway (ours is the one on the left facing the house); in front of the fire hydrant parallel to the street (really, no one EVER tickets), or across the street along the wooden fence of our neighbors.

column63: I welcome you to explore Charlottesville and its offerings. Then in the evening retreat, relax and refresh in my peaceful home and yard alongside river, creek and wooded trails. Note: due to a landscape project this fall, the backyard is not open, just the deck and private front porch. You'll feel at home in the cozy bedroom here. I'm always welcoming to all people. Enjoy your proximity to Monticello and the Historic Downtown Mall. Catch a free trolley to nearby UVA from the Downtown Mall too! The space I am offering one bedroom in my home. I welcome you to come and retreat after a day full of fun in Charlottesville and its lush, surrounding countryside! While here you will enjoy the house's natural light, the comfy bed, thick, plush chaise lounge couch/ bed and your private full bathroom with a recently installed shower. You are welcome to use the microwave, frig and dishes if you would like to warm anything to eat. Each morning you can enjoy the fair trade coffee, herbal and black tea we provide. An inviting front porch and generous backyard deck with fish pond and private, landscaped wooded gardens complete the picture. My home's guest bedroom wing is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families too! Side note: I once owned a Montessori preschool so am well stashed with things for infants through preschool to explore! Guest access When not in your bedroom feel free to relax outside on the front porch or in the front yard. You are also welcome to go through the garden gate to the back deck and private, wooded backyard. As I mentioned earlier, you have the frig and microwave for warming things and refrigerating food. I ask that you clean up after yourselves and leave your space as you found it. There is parking in the driveway and on the street. During your stay I am happy to help you get oriented upon arrival and anytime I am free to help you. I am always a text or phone call away if not home or in my tiny house. I am usually nearby if needed but never in the way!

column52: Quiet, peaceful location with separate/private entrance. Listing includes: 2 bedrooms each with a queen bed and ample closet space, 1 spacious full bathroom with gorgeous tile shower located between the bedrooms, a modified kitchenette with small fridge/freezer, sink, microwave and coffee/tea maker. Ample street parking with well lighted pathway to the entrance. Guests may access a rooftop deck with amazing sunset views! Just a 5 min drive to the Historic Downtown Mall with Uber/Lyft available. The space My space is close (walk, bike or drive) to some really nice attractions such as: the historic downtown pedestrian mall, Farmer's Market on Saturdays between April and December, University of Va events, and many walking/jogging trails. Once inside my space you will have nearly all the comforts of your own home including 2 queen sized beds, a sitting table, closets and clothes storage, a kitchenette with coffee/tea and a wonderful full bathroom with toiletries in case you forgot yours. And don't forget to access my rooftop deck with amazing sunset and sunrise views! Guest access If you arrive with bicycles, feel free to store them in my outdoor shed. During your stay I will be available via text.

Separate entrance for total privacy. Access to peaceful backyard. The space Apartment has its own full-sized washer and dryer, ironing board and iron. There is a small patio for your use and my entire yard available for your enjoyment. AS APARTMENT CAN COMFORTABLY ACCOMMODATE 4. Queen bed in bedroom and queen plus sleeper sofa (no bars! very comfy) in living room. Guest access There are two interior doors that will be locked and labeled, as they lead to my part of house. column63: Dog Friendly/Gated yard is a 1 bedroom, 1 bath apartment very close to the Charlottesville downtown mall, Pantops and UVA. Nearby grocery stores, shops and UVA hospital. The Rivanna river is across the street for a walking trail outdoor activity. Wineries and distilleries are a short drive away. NO cats allowed. Dogs are accepted. DOGS ARE NOT ALLOWED ON THE FURNITURE The space Dog Friendly Airbnb Cville is a renovated 1 bedroom, 1 bath apartment very close to the Charlottesville downtown mall, Pantops and UVA. We welcome you and your doggo friend! Limit 1 dog per stay. Sorry NO cats. Thank you for understanding The apartment is only 1 of 2 apartments on the second level. Below the unit is an office space. Just 4 steps up and through the gate and you're at your new home! Bright, sunny and generous size rooms welcome you and your pet. There is a small yard for you to enjoy and dog waste station for your pet. Relax in the convenience of your own place. Amenities: Queen size bed Full bath Smart TV *no cable* Fast internet Full kitchen with range, refrigerator & dishwasher Coffee Maker Linens and towels provided Washer/Dryer in unit A/C and Heat Apartment on the 2nd floor 1 Dedicated parking spot behind building Keyless door code for easy access Guest access Guests have access to the entire place.

column66: Return from sports and events at nearby UVA and unwind with a beverage on a raised deck overlooking a wooded area. A smart renovation to this mid-century house has produced a living room with a vaulted ceiling for a generous feel of light and space. Rated #1 Airbnb in Charlottesville by TripInsiders https://tripinsiders.org/airbnb/airbnb-charlottesville-va/ -Two bedrooms- King beds and a premium mattress and high-quality linens -Coffee station fully stocked -Two cozy private living room -High-speed internet (1000mb/s) -Two TVs with cable and Netflix -Desk and chair -Both bathrooms come stocked with shampoo, body wash, conditioner, towels, hairdryer, and first aid kit. -Laundry with a washer/dryer and complimentary detergent/ dryer sheets. -1.5 miles from the downtown mall, close to UVA grounds and Belmont. Easy access to 250, 29 and 64 - Beautiful, quiet neighborhood that's great for walking - Back deck with chairs for lounging - Free onsite parking Guests will have full use of the entire house including both bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms, 2 living room areas, the dining room, and kitchen. Guest can also lounge on the back deck and use the laundry machines. When I rent out my entire house that usually means I'll be out of town myself. I'll be available via Airbnb text but will not be onsite. Please enjoy my entire house to yourself! The house is in a quaint, quiet neighborhood close to the Downtown Mall, the Belmont neighborhood, and University of Virginia. It's minutes from great restaurants, shops, bars and breweries, and music venues. Access to the Rivanna Trail is close by. Free on-site street parking and potential access to the driveway. There is plenty of street parking available so parking shouldn't be an issue. The downtown mall is within walking distance and there is access to a bus stop on Route 11. column85: 3 BR shabby chic home sleeps 6 at base price. (Up to 9 at $25/night per extra guest). For all of you out there who enjoy a homestay experience that is delightfully unlike a hotel, we've divided our enormous old house just outside of Charlottesville into two completely self-contained homes. 12 min to downtown, 15 min to Monticello or UVA. Convenient to the region's best wineries and right off one of the most beautiful scenic byways in Virginia. Sunny walkout deck with grill. The space Please note: the price for this space may vary depending on the day of the week and the season of the year. Please put in your specific dates - the price shown when you search without dates may not be the price you get for your specific dates! We have an enormous sprawling old house just outside of Charlottesville, and have divided into two completely self-contained homes. Your space is completely private, and we will be right next door and are available for any questions or needs that may arise. The spacious house has everything you need to serve as a home base from which to enjoy Charlottesvile and the surrounding countryside. The feel of the house is vintage cottage/barn. To the chagrin of those who gravitate toward the newly built, this is an older home and is lovingly maintained yet decidedly old fashioned in character. Besides the Great Room with its fireplace and exposed beams, there is an overlooking loft den, one extremely large bedroom (king bed) with a walk-out deck, and two smaller bedrooms (one queen, one full), all upstairs. The loft den has two day beds. Each bed has an excellent mattress and sheets are either cotton or vegan silk (bamboo fiber). The fully-equipped kitchen has a slate floor and soapstone counters with a big old fashioned sink. Wood/slate floors throughout most of the house. Washer and dryer on premises. There is only one television in the house, located in the Great Room. Accessing media on your personal devices is easy and fast, and the television reception is basic but adequate. There is a fantastic library and plenty of common spaces for enjoying the company of your family and friends. The quiet beautiful neighborhood streets are perfect for walks and runs, and the Rivanna River and a riverside trail is a short walk away. Downtown C-ville and UVA are twelve minute drives away. Note that our neighborhood is a suburban/rural one - though we're very close to town, the feel of the place is very quiet, with woods and countryside abounding. Not a great choice for those in search of an urban experience! Lastly, this is an old fashioned house built in the 60's and has not been updated- expect to find some loving wear, quaint aging and charming patina both inside and outside. Important note about the layout of the house: The full bathroom is situated upstairs between two of the bedrooms, Jack and Jill style. If you're comfortable passing through a bedroom on the way to the shower, this is a fine layout. If, however, you are a more private group, this might not be such a good fit. Note also that the vintage, shabby chic aesthetic of our house extends to the bathroom. While very clean and spacious, it is also very basic - none of the bells and whistles of more sleek and modern salles de baines. You will find, however, that the books I've selected for the bathroom are top notch single sitting reads. Lastly, a note about insect life. If you don't hail from the Mid Atlantic or Southern parts of the US, you may not be familiar with the presence of the invasive species of stink bug which has flourished here. You are very likely to to encounter at least a couple in the house, despite my best efforts to banish them outdoors. Note that our house is an older one in a rural area, and that we have a more thriving insect life than the air-tight homes in urban areas. If encountering a bug is something that would detract from the pleasure of your stay, this is not the house for you! I am scrupulous about ridding the house of all insect life when I clean the space, but bugs do have their ways of coming in. Guest access Guests have access to the whole house. The space is yours to enjoy, and everything in it is yours to use. Books, instruments, kitchen supplies, etc. The only space not accessible is back patio, which our family uses for outdoor dining and garden projects. However, you are more than welcome to use the patio to get out into the large yard and to access the stairs that lead up to the deck. The yard is shared; you may see us out there also. Other things to note This home has a very good library and delightful common spaces for spending time with family and friends. The atmosphere of this house is wonderfully vintage and shabby chic. if you're looking for a modern, luxurious, mint condition space for your group, this house is not a good fit. Please feel welcome to charge your EV using our Level 2, 9.6kW, J1772 charging station.

column58: The 1100ft cottage sits on an acre of manicured grounds in a nice downtown neighborhood. Amenities include an open floor plan, elegant furnishing, large great room, light-filled sun-room, sleeping loft and a master suite with a king bed. The space As a spacious guesthouse on the grounds of a distinguished estate near downtown Charlottesville, the 1100 square-foot cottage overlooks an acre of manicured grounds and gardens, along with a patio and full access to the property's two fire pits, barbecue grill and regulation-size shuffleboard court. The cottage boasts a large great room with two sleep-sofas, a stunning sun-room with access to the back patio and abundant natural light; dining room, sleeping loft with a single bed (please note the loft is accessible by ladder); and a large master suite with a king bed and large closets. With its own patio and two parking spaces, this guest house is completely self-sufficient and offers the same level of privacy expected of a private, detached dwelling. For families traveling with small children, cribs and any other special accommodations are available free of charge upon request, as is a large, frequently updated selection of movies on DVD and periodicals covering myriad interests. Guest access Guests have full access to the property's two fire pits, barbecue grill and regulation-size shuffleboard court, as well, of course to the entire acre of manicured yards and gardens -- perfect for entertaining, or just relaxing in peace and quiet. For families traveling with small children, cribs and other special accommodations are available free of charge upon request, and a large, frequently updated selection of movies on DVD and periodicals covering myriad interests. The cottage is equipped with a keypad entry, so guests can check in and check out at their own convenience. Other things to note The property is cleaned and serviced with fresh linens and towels before every new guest arrives. For longer stays, mid-stay cleaning and fresh linens are available upon request.

column52: Stylish Downtown Villa The space This renovated two bedroom home is only a quick drive to Charlottesville's historic Downtown Mall.  Bright and sunny light fills the space making you feel instantly welcomed. This one-level layout is very well appointed and offers great seating areas both indoors and out. The master bedroom has a large king bed with a full en suite bathroom.  The white tile and soaking tub give this bathroom a luxurious feel.  The second bedroom has a comfy, queen size bed.  The second bathroom is located just outside the door in the adjacent hallway and features a tiled steam shower. Feel like cooking in?  This kitchen is well equipped with new appliances and a great gas range.  Want to eat al fresco?  Walk outside to the two level terraced decks where you will find a dining table and ample seating.  When on the deck you can look around and see the beauty this neighborhood has to offer.  Walk down through the wrought iron gate and take a stroll through the private neighborhood garden.  Feel like reading a book or enjoying your favorite glass of wine?  The sunroom is the perfect, quaint location.  If you are looking for dining, music, and shopping options, this house is in a wonderful location and close to all. Note that although guests are not permitted to bring their dogs to this property, we want guests to be aware that the owner does have a dog, in case any of our guests may have allergies. Amenities: Master Bedroom: King Bed with En Suite Bathroom with Jacuzzi Tub Guest Room: Queen Sized Bed Hall bath with Walk-In-Shower Fully-Equipped Kitchen with Gas Range Living Room with TV Gas Fireplace Sunroom Private Outdoor Patio with Two Terraces Access to a Private Neighborhood Garden Standard Drip Coffee Maker Wi-Fi LCD Cable TV Central Heat/Air Washer/Dryer Plenty of Off-Street Parking in Driveway All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.

column57: Recently renovated, fully furnished and self contained basement unit with private entrance located in a serene neighborhood 12 minutes from UVA. Its 2 bedrooms comfortably sleep 4. Just minutes from the Downtown Mall, UVA & Rivanna Trails! The space The Locust House lands you in one of Charlottesville's most beloved neighborhoods. It's right downtown, yet one of the quietest areas in the city. The home's recent renovation by its owner-architect takes full advantage of the home's excellent orientation; sunlight fills the cheery rooms from dawn til dusk. Beautiful finishes such as the original hardwood floors & new soapstone counters---combined with original art and new lighting--give the eye wonderful places to roam.
