column52: If you're like many of my guests, you will not want to leave at the end of your stay! This is my primary home but I have decided to offer it up to folks who want to have a wonderful experience in the amazing town that's Charlottesville. Centrally located in the city on a wooded 1/3 acre lot with easy access to the historic downtown mall, the University of Virginia, and all the amenities that make this such a special town. Please come; you will love it! The space Beautiful, private and spacious home in wonderful location. 2 big bedrooms, 2 full baths. Both rooms feature comfortable queen sized mattresses. Modern open kitchen, dining room, LR, large screened in porch directly off dining room and a large two-level deck. Wonderful, well appointed home recently renovated with many great amenities. Ample off street parking on charming residential street in Locust Grove neighborhood. Less than 2 miles from the downtown mall and a stone's throw from the bypass providing easy access to a direct trip anywhere in town. Great for UVA visitors or anyone coming to enjoy the many sites in Charlottesville. By car, 9 minutes to the UVA Rotunda, center of the grounds. Home has FULLY FURNISHED, TERRACE LEVEL APARTMENT available to you, making it 3 full bedrooms, 3 full baths. Apartment is well-appointed with full kitchen: all new construction, modern bath, comfortable living room, full laundry room, outdoor seating area. It is listed separately and may be booked at same time if you desire both spaces. If interested in both spaces, contact me for rate. Listed on site as Fabulous Terrance Level Apartment". Guest access Everything listed."

column79:
Come home to a peaceful spot after a busy day at the wedding or touring wineries. Cheery, with artsy colors, warm finishes, open plan, views, location, and clean ambiance. Perfect fit for 3 couples, 3 business travelers or a family of 6 in 3 beds. We have no extra bed. Small, quiet city cul-de-sac is 1.5 miles to the Downtown Mall, Farmers Market, Ix Art Park, Violet Crown, Paramount Theater. 3 miles to UVa, JPJ, Wegmans. CHO is 25 minutes. 5 minute walk to park, creek trail  & playground.

Your entry from the driveway is one step up to the front door. Leave your shoes at the door. Main floor has open plan living, dining, kitchen, breakfast room and powder bath, all with hardwood floors. Space to do yoga, solitude to meditate. Gas fireplace between October and April. The upper level has three colorful queen carpeted bedrooms. The front room master has an en-suite tiled bath which includes deep soaking tub, separate shower and view of the garden below. Blue or green queen bedrooms share a bath with tub/shower. All rooms have great woodsy views and privacy. In the closet you will find porta crib, for the wee one. Enjoy the private back deck or front garden for cocktails and morning coffee or to watch the wildlife and birds outside the large windows. Lower level basement apartment is where you can find us if you need anything. Please use quiet feet up there during the hours 10 pm- 8 am.

We don’t mind hosting small children, but we will need to know at the time of your reservation to put away any special breakables that could cause harm or unhappiness. You may enjoy an early or late check in or checkout by request. Normal checkout is noon, but  if you let us know, you can linger so you can brunch or sleep in. Since this is our home, too, please respect that we are downstairs and value peace and quiet. We are here to help whenever you need but value your privacy. There is a locked door between our apartment and you, so you wont come in to contact with us, except for maybe in passing outside or as needed. Quiet, shoeless feet after 10 pm.

We will be downstairs at night or close by during the day working on all kinds of projects. We welcome messages any time you feel that you need something (a battery for the remote or whatever) or have a question. Its very important to us that you have an enjoyable stay. We appreciate being informed immediately if anything goes awry or breaks to discuss replacement or repair.

Our street is a quiet, friendly, family place with kids playing, people walking dogs and often hot air balloons overhead. Below our house is a trail which is part of our citys Rivanna Trail. It circumnavigates our city and can be accessed on the next block. The city bus can be picked up one block over and Uber/Lyft is very useful when you just plain dont want to be bothered driving.

CAT is the name of the bus service. It will take you anywhere you want to go. The closest stop is two blocks over. Local scooters and bike rentals available through the city. 
The Downtown Mall (1.5 miles) is amazing for art, eating, coffee, shopping, music, live shows and movies. You can walk to it in 25 minutes and not worry about parking. IX Artpark is a completely amazing experience with great parking and restaurants. The new Stonefield shopping extravaganza is just 4 miles, has tons of parking and all the fancy shops you can think of.

Only the person who booked the reservation will be given access to the key for check in. If there is an extenuating reason for the booking guest not to be present at check in, you must make previous arrangements with us. Let us know if there is something you feel you might need for your arrival and your stay and we will do everything we can to make it happen. Our housekeeper strives for such high standards for us, we expect the same of our guests. Please leave our home as you found it.

column86: Beautiful architectural home provides spacious rooms, comfortable amenities, and much more. The entire home sleeps a large group of guests (if sharing beds). The space Great location! Close to wineries, breweries, downtown Charlottesville, historical sites and shopping. Bright contemporary space. Able to accommodate small events (only for guests renting the house), graduations, family gatherings, and other celebratory occasions for maximum number of guests (please check w/Host). Entire home sleeps a large group of guests (if sharing beds). Resident Manager resides on property. Guest access Main Level - kitchen, dining area/ sunroom, deck, living room, family room, Bedroom 1 has 2 double beds. Bedroom 2 has queen bed, 1 single sleep sofa & private bath, Bedroom 3 has 2 single beds, Bedroom 4 has 2 queen beds, 1 single ottoman pullout, 1 single bed & full private bath. Lower Level -Bedroom 5 has queen bed & sitting area w/fireplace. Common area has queen sofa bed. Also on lower level full kitchen, dining area, living room, exercise equipment, laundry room, game room, full bathroom, outdoor terrace space, handicapped accessible entry Large covered front porch w/rocking chairs Other things to note No smoking on front porch allowed. Please keep outside noise levels down after 11:00 Please bring your own towels for makeup removal NO COACH BUSES allowed on street; NO OVERNIGHT BUS or RV PARKING allowed On Check-in date the guest that reserved the house will meet the Host for the check-in unless prior arrangements have been made

column33: 42 inch TV with Roku, standard cable
column64: Minimalist private apartment in a popular downtown neighborhood. Private entrance w/ free/safe street parking. Enjoy a cozy queen bed, full kitchen, full bathroom, TV, all in the perfect location. Free specialty coffee roasted by a neighbor. ACTUALLY WALKABLE to the Historic Downtown Mall, breweries, and the hip Downtown Belmont restaurant scene. Ten minutes to both Monticello and UVA. 15 mins to numerous breweries and wineries. 20 mins to Shenandoah National Park/Skyline Drive and other hikes. The space Totally private apartment. Stairs from entrance door to apartment. Queen Bed. Full Bath. Oven, Stove, Microwave, Refrigerator/Freezer. TV with cable, Coffee Maker. Dining table. Numerous closets. Shampoo/Conditioner available. *There is an adjacent apartment below this unit. We have sound proofed the area, but there may be some residual noise from below. This unit is completely separated from the other. Guest access Private apartment with a private entrance. Other things to note Free Street Parking parallel right in front of the apartment. We will stay out of your hair unless we are needed. Don't hesitate to contact us with an issue and we will respond and resolve it promptly.

column65: Renovated luxury apartment with private entrance. Gourmet kitchen for entertaining or having a relaxing weekend away! We are steps away from Belmont with some of the best rated restaurants in Cville. Also, you are a 5-10 minute walk to The Historic Downtown Mall. Great OPEN space to come back relax with private porch. The space: - Designer/Luxury Apartment - Quiet neighborhood - Parking - Walking distance to DTM - Sleeps 4 - Great for cooking - Soundproofed - Washer & Dryer The space - Designer/Luxury Apartment that’s been beautifully decorated and curated. - Gourmet Kitchen - Amazing for cooking and wine tasting - Giant Concrete Kitchen Island - New Designer Queen in the Primary - Premier location Charlottesville Street - A block away from the BEST Restaurants - Beautiful and quiet neighborhood - Parking - Walking distance to everything (Including the Historic Downtown Mall, Restaurants & Pavilion) - Great for cooking and tasting wine - New Gas Range Stove & Oven - Newly Tiled Bathroom w/ Shower - Great for walking - Close to the Pavilion - Soundproofed - Washer & Dryer - Open space - Owners that live above for convenience - Kid friendly - Great Deck w/ Seating - Very private from the neighborhood - Plenty of Safe Street Parking in front - Minutes to The Historic Downtown Mall & Pavilion - Separate HVAC - Designer Lighting Guest access The Front Porch is just for you and your guests. Other things to note Please let us know if you’re looking to move here as we know all the good realtors and have other rental properties commercial and residential.

column37: HDTV with Hulu, Amazon Prime Video, HBO Max, Netflix
column38: Google smart speaker Bluetooth sound system
column66: Private room with separate entrance located in the back of the house with en suite full bathroom and direct access into a beautiful and relaxing garden. It is a short walk to the restaurants, bars, and shops on the famous downtown mall and to the Ting Pavilion. Also a very short walk to amazing restaurants in historic downtown Belmont. Close to many attractions including Monticello, wineries, and breweries. Easy access to I-64. Plenty of street parking is typically available close to the house. The space Guests have access to garden and patio/bbq area to relax in before their night out on the mall, or before their day of hiking or local wineries and breweries nearby. Multiple amenities including a mini fridge, microwave, toaster oven, and French press as well as use of laundry is just outside the bedroom. We have also provided a folding desk and a chair that are located in the closet, which can be easily set up for a work space or for playing games/cards. Guest access Guests have access to their private room and bathroom separated from the rest of the house with a private entrance. As well as the laundry room and patio/backyard . Other things to note Room has separate ac/heating from the rest of the house, so you are able to control with the remote in the room. We live in one of the most desirable neighborhoods in Charlottesville, but it is in the city. You may occasionally hear sirens and buses and people driving by with loud music, and you may see a police car drive by. We have always felt very safe here and walk everywhere, including at night. If these are things that will make you feel unsafe or think our neighborhood is “sketchy” this is probably not the right fit for you. We love our yard and patio and think it’s a beautiful spot to relax in. It is full of plants and flowers that bloom from spring into the Fall. We do not use weed killers (everything is done by hand) and it’s possible that as you walk down the walkway a plant may brush your leg. We hope that these things will not bother you, and that you will enjoy our outdoor space as much as we do!

column38: One of four boutique hotel rooms at The Townsman on the Downtown Mall The space This property is coming off the short term rental market as of the end of November 2024! We do not know if or when it may be back! A black-and-white color scheme with bronze accents gives the Poe room an urban sensibility touched with a mid-century chic. It’s perfect for those who dream by day. The Townsman is the newest concept in hotel accommodations. Instead of charging you for things you’ll never use, we’ve pared ourselves down to the essentials. Incredible locations. Beautiful rooms. Great prices. Once you book with us, we’ll give you a code that grants you access to the hotel and your room. After that, all you have to do is show up. No check-in. No hassles. Just a boutique hotel, steps from the places you most want to be. Where are you located exactly? We’re at 211 West Main Street, right on Charlottesville’s historic Downtown Mall.  The location can't be beat in the middle of the downtown action!  We like to note to future guests that this is a popular area (especially on the weekends) and the noise level on the Downtown Mall may be higher particularly on Friday and Saturday evenings. Where do Townsman guests park? Parking: Parking for guests is located at 300 Preston Ave. in Charlottesville. There is one spot for each room located directly to the left of the main sign for the parking lot. Each Spot has signage that has The Townsman" and the corresponding name of the room on them. Please only park in the spot designated for your room. How does the code work? Our front door and the door to your room will feature a keypad into which you’ll enter your personal code. The code we give you when you book is given to no one else and only works for the duration of your stay. What services do you offer? What we offer is a room you’ll love in a downtown location that can’t be beat. To keep our prices where you want them

column46: Great Location! One bedroom in a Single Family Home 1 mile from the Downtown Mall, UVA hospital, & about a half mile further to the UVA main campus. The room includes: queen sized bed, roomy closet, cable TV, wifi, and small fridge. Access to full bath (shared with another airbnb room when occupied), off street parking & kitchen. Mountain views! The space You will find that this room is large, cheerful, has ample closet space, a small refrigerator, and the bed is really comfortable. Guest access You will have access to a full bath across the hall that is only shared if another room in the same home has airbnb guests. Otherwise you will have a private bath. You will also have access to the kitchen amenities as well as off street parking. During your stay I like to meet my guests when they arrive if at all possible. I will be available to my guests as they need me. I will be home when guests stay here. Other things to note A detailed guest information document is in the room in an attempt to answer any questions the guest may have. Local restaurants and attractions guides are also in the room.

column67: The apartment is located in the charming Belmont neighborhood of Charlottesville, walking distance from parks, restaurants, the Downtown Mall, & a wine tasting locale. The apartment faces a garden and the nearby Moore's Creek and parts of the Rivanna Trail. It includes a queen bed, full bath with a tub, a kitchenette, storage space, a living & dining area. The apartment has a small deck with a table and chair to enjoy a coffee break or a view of the Monticello hills that overlook the home. The space The apartment has access to a yard, a stream and a wonderful view of the mountains near Monticello. It is a modern, cozy and comfortable space. Guest access The apartment has independent access to the street and is located on a lower floor of a new home.

column45:
Our private bedroom apartment is a great escape just minutes outside downtown Charlottesville. Our home is on a private lake with views of Carter Mountain and Monticello. We are 5 minutes from the Belmont area restaurants , 8 minutes from the downtown mall, and 10 minutes from UVA. We are in a safe and quiet neighborhood with a touch of nature and wildlife. There is a private path and entrance to the apartment space and easy parking along the street.

Private basement apartment with a living room, a bedroom, and a two sink bathroom. Private deck has views of Willow Lake and Carter mountain nearby.

Full basement access with a living room, bedroom, bathroom, and private deck. There is also a private walkway and entrance for the basement apartment. Just a heads up there is a decent amount of stairs down the front from the street to the house and along the path to the back. Just something to be mindful of if you have large bags. We ask that you respect our space and stay on the basement floor.

You won’t see or hear us but we are a quick call or text away if you have any questions or need help with anything.
column52: Private basement apartment just outside downtown

column33: 52 inch HDTV with Amazon Prime Video, Hulu, Netflix, standard cable
column75: This adorable, professionally-decorated 2BR/1Ba house is set in the middle of the city, yet located on a quiet private road. Walk to the restaurants, bars, and shops of downtown Belmont, the historic downtown pedestrian mall, and the IX Park. The huge yard and nearby park are great for kids and pups. Hiking and mountain biking trails are just a few minutes away. Centrally located to all the area vineyards. Or just stay home, sip coffee or wine on the screened porch, and enjoy the views. The space You will love this cozy, beautifully decorated cottage situated in a quiet, peaceful neighborhood in downtown Charlottesville. The house has amazing light and a great feel, and it is stocked with everything you’ll need for a perfect stay. It’s situated in a little tucked-away neighborhood, yet in the middle of the city. You’ll enjoy your proximity to everything: you’re just a few-minutes' walk from the IX Park with its amazing restaurants, coffee shops, yoga studios, and shops (Brazo’s Tacos, Carpe Cafe, Sweethaus Cafe, Three Notch’d Brewery). The cottage is also an easy walk (10-15 min) to downtown Belmont with its own list of superior dining: Tavola, Mas, The Local, Lampo, Junction. And the downtown mall is just a 15-20 minute walk away. Monticello is a quick 5-minute drive, and you’ll be centrally located to all the vineyards and wedding venues in the surrounding areas. UVA hospital and Grounds are 5 minutes away. The house has been painstakingly designed by a professional designer to provide you with everything you’ll need to make your stay enjoyable and relaxing- luxurious linens, comfy, high-quality mattresses, a lovely mixture of contemporary and antique furniture, high-quality cookware, and provided essential pantry items. We are also extremely proud of the care with which we treat this house- you will always find it sparkling clean, and we use only all-natural cleaning products, so you can be assured that you are in a healthy and responsible space. The house has two bedrooms (one with a queen bed, one with a pair of twin beds), a full bath, a living room, eat-in kitchen, and marvelous screened porch which overlooks a neighbor's urban farm and mountain views in winter. It’s a perfect place for people with pooches and kids- we have a great, large yard set back from the road, and a beautiful park (Belmont Park) just two blocks away with walking/bike paths, play ground equipment, lots of green space, and a splash ground. If you click on my profile picture and scroll down, you’ll find two guidebooks- one general guidebook to Cville, and then one guidebook for visiting Cville with kids. Guest access Guests have full access to the whole house an its amenities.

column58: The perfect destination for your Charlottesville visit in the hip neighborhood of Belmont. From this modern apartment, you can walk to the best restaurants the city has to offer as well as the popular Downtown Mall and IX Art Park. The University of Virginia and Monticello are each just a short drive, and the home is convenient to the Monticello Wine Trail and Skyline Drive. The space There are a few stairs down to your private patio and entrance to the 1-bedroom modern basement apartment. The couch (recently upgraded, gray in color, and have photographer scheduled so reflects in listing photos) turns into a full-sized bed and the queen bed is located in the bedroom, where you'll also find a spacious bathroom (with great water pressure!). We've had many guests who rave about the bed, especially those who love a more firm mattress. There is a fully stocked kitchen with a full size fridge, a dishwasher, and coffee maker. There is a 50 Smart TV and high speed Ting internet. Although we don't have cable
column60: Amazon Prime and YouTube from the Smart TV. The apartment is perfect for a getaway for two but we can accommodate up to four. The main part of the house (top 2 floors) has its own separate entrance and is also listed on airbnb on a much more limited basis. If you are looking to bring a larger party please check out that listing (Belmont Home with Hot Tub - Steps from Downtown). Please note the Hot Tub is NOT available for guests in the basement apartment. The heat/AC control is in the Upstairs Home
column61: but we have remote access to adjust temperature. We consistently monitor the AirBnB app so quickly can adjust temperature upon guest request. While there is no reserved parking
column62: there is typically plentiful street parking
column63: including the street directly across from the apartment. You may NOT park in the Belmont Lofts parking lot or in the reserved spaces in the back of the house. Please note that do have a security camera of the exterior of the home
column64: on the front porch and another that is focused on the parking area for the upstairs home. The cameras are motion activated and record audio and video. Guest access You'll be in the basement apartment and have use of the private patio in front of the apartment. You will not have access to the upstairs or the back patio unless you have also rented that space. Other things to note We do live upstairs
column65: so you may hear footsteps from time to time
column66: as you would with any basement/garden unit. When we are out of town we do hosts guests in the upstairs home. We're happy to greet you or leave you to yourself to enjoy your stay. We live near a train
column67: but it is incredibly quiet! We rarely even hear it unless we are outside on our balcony. Because of our proximity to the hospital
column68: the train must go slowly and is not allowed to sound any whistles
column69: so you may not even know it is there. What you usually hear are the sounds of birds chirping and the faint hum of music when bands play at the Amphitheater on the Downtown Mall. You'll have a private patio
column70: and a serene space on our quiet street. Our neighbors are terrific and many will happily tour you around their gardens or welcome you to the neighborhood. Even though our corner is extremely quiet
column71: given that we’re only blocks away from downtown and just steps from bustling Belmont
column72: you will hear city sounds from time to time and noise from upstairs. We do provide a sound machine in the bedroom
column73: but would not recommend this listing (or any basement unit) if you are extremely sensitive to sound."
column80: Modern Belmont home - steps from Downtown Mall!

column58: Well designed studio apartment with beautiful details in a diverse, friendly neighborhood. Located just off of West Main Street in an ideal location, 10 minutes walking to UVA and downtown. Make this your home away from home! The space Come stay in the spacious 2nd floor studio in this newly renovated turn of the century house in Fifeville. This unique apartment enters through the front porch (enjoy our classic porch swing in the evening), entrance way and then upstairs into the studio apartment. Enjoy the vaulted ceilings and unique design. The bathroom boasts unique tile-work and a spacious walk-in shower. The apartment is a large one-room studio with a kitchenette and a full fold out futon for sleeping. The Futon mattress is Tempur-Pedic and comfy. We provide all sheets and linens as well as maps and info on Charlottesville. The apartment has its own heating and air conditioning. There is one off-street parking space that is shared between the two apartments in the house. Generally, it is first come first serve, but please let us know if you have specific parking needs and we will try to accommodate you. The house is divided into two apartments; upstairs and downstairs, and separated by a double locked inner door (there is no access between the apartments for your privacy). Contact If you need us for anything at all, feel free to call us: Oliv(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Natasha-(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Location Our house is perfectly situated in a great neighborhood where folks stop to talk on the street and walking/biking is the norm. We are just three blocks from West Main Street, a 10 minute walk to the Downtown Mall, and a 15 minute walk to UVA and the Corner. Extremely convenient to the train and bus stations. Restaurants (Main Street - within 5 minute walk) Blue Moon Diner - Hip little diner around the corner on Main Continental Divide - Further up main towards UVA . .mex-usa . Orzo - Lovely food in the mainstreet market Maya - On main street across from 7th . . Bellas - Nextdoor to Maya, fantastic Italian family style Shops (Main Street -- within 5 minute walk) Calvino (coffee shop) Albemarle Baking Company (best bread and desserts) Feast (high end grocery) Organic Butcher Seafood @ West Main Cherry Ave Exxon (Excellent beer selection, 2 minute walk) Pets We love animals and understand that you want to bring yours with you, but are also aware of the impact that animals have on a house. To help accommodate your pet we are willing to consider pets for a $25/night minimum pet fee/pet, depending on the length of stay. Please inquire about specifics and always please let us know if you plan to bring your pet. Laundry We have a high efficiency stacked washer and dryer available for your use. Kitchen Our upstairs studio comes with a wonderful little efficiency kitchen. Plenty of counter space along with a full fridge, sink, dishwasher, double electric burner and microwave/convection oven. Perfect for making a quick snack, breakfast or a home cooked dinner. We keep the kitchen stocked with everything you need for cooking and enjoying a nice meal. About Us Oliver grew up in Charlottesville and we have both lived here for the past eight years. This apartment is in a house that we renovated and maintain for Natasha’s parents who live there part-time. Guest access The upstairs studio apartment with private entrance and front porch.

column52: The Plum Cottage sits on a spacious, historic property that is less than 1 mile from the Downtown Mall, and 1.5 miles to UVA's rotunda. The Cottage is its own unit that contains two private entries, off-street parking, a full kitchen, and a washer/dryer. We regularly hear from guests that Plum Cottage is one of the nicest Airbnbs they have visited. As such, at this time there is a three-night minimum booking for all reservations, including UVA graduation weekend. The space The cottage is able to accommodate up to four guests - two in the queen-sized bed in the bedroom area and two on the queen-sized sleeper sofa - however with an open floor plan the two sleeping spaces are separated by a wall and are NOT private rooms. Other things to note The Plum Cottage is equipped with Ting high-speed internet and contains two Roku televisions.

column56: Enjoy your stay in Charlottesville in our adorable private cottage! Fully furnished kitchen, bath, and closet with separate living and sleeping quarters. With a short walk downtown and easy access to I-64, you'll love your stay with us! The space The cottage has plenty of space for two! The space features lovely a queen sized bed, terra cotta tiles, lofted ceilings, stained glass skylights, and a private patio for your enjoyment. There are two rooms--a fully furnished kitchen, and a large living and sleeping area. Guests enjoy privacy with access to everything Charlottesville has to offer! A quick 5 minute walk to the heart of Belmont takes you to coffee, cocktails, fine dining, and barbecue, and a ten minute walk gets you to the heart of Charlottesville's Downtown Mall. Guest access Guests have full access to the cottage and it's patio, a kitchen and it's amenities, and shared access to a large fenced in backyard. Other things to note The cottage is in an easily walkable neighborhood with convenient street parking, and being just minutes from Interstate 64 makes travel and arrival convenient.

column52: Beautiful 2 bedroom apartment in the Belmont area 5 mins from downtown. Walking distance from restaurants and the historic downtown mall. Quiet neighborhood (residential and commercial). 2 bedrooms, 1 full baths. Small front yard. Little patio with table and chairs. 2 parking spaces (back of the house in front of the garage) and street parking. Fridge, coffee maker, tea, toaster available. No full kitchen in the apartment but kitchenette area in a separate room.(perfect for breakfast in the AM) The space The apartment is in a cute 2 level house. Guests have fully access to the main floor with private entrance. Nice fenced front yard. 2 minutes from the interstate I64, close to Monticello and local wineries, breweries and local historic places. Guest access A code for the front door keypad will be provided to guests for easy access to the house. Parking: you can easily park on the street or use the 2 parking spaces in the back of the house in front of the little shed. Other things to note -Smart TV available / you can use Netflix, prime amazon & Hulu. You can also log in to your own account (HBO etc) . No cable TV. The TV is located in one of the bedroom -Bed linen provided -1 bath towel, 1 hand towel and 1 wash cloth provided for 4 people.

column60: Comfy, clean, modern basement suite ~2 miles from both downtown Charlottesville & UVA, with easy access to Route 64. It offers a private entrance, full bathroom, 1 bedroom with queen bed, a loveseat with pull-out twin bed, a comfortable living space with a large sofa, a kitchenette with coffee, tea and snacks, TV, a dining area, good wi-fi, and a brick patio. The space The suite is almost 600 square feet, located in a quiet neighborhood on the lower level of our 3-story home. The entrance is located at the back of the house. We reside on the upper two levels, so you may occasionally hear us, but the suite has complete privacy. The kitchenette has a microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker, and sink. There is a loveseat sleeper that turns into a comfortable twin bed that we can set up for you on request, as well as a big comfortable couch with chaise that can sleep one adult or two children, and a portable crib that can be set up. We clean with natural-based products. We love hosting and try to give our guests the best experience possible! Guest access You'll have the entire lower level of the house to yourself, with a separate entrance at the back of the house. The lower level is separated from the main level by a door at the top of the stairway, which stays locked at all times. Other things to note Parking is on the street in front of the house. There is no separate thermostat for this level, but it stays very comfortable, and space heaters are provided. The fireplace is not operational. Any guests beyond the number listed on your itinerary will be charged a penalty at $50 per person per night. We reserve the right to terminate your stay without refund if you exceed the maximum occupancy of 4 guests.
column67: Clean modern suite—private, near UVA & downtown

column49: Quiet West Wing of my home, was newly renovated February 2020. The West Wing has a private entrance set in a mature garden. Two bedrooms upstairs sleep up to four people. One w/queen size bed and views of the garden.The 2nd has 1 full and 1 twin bed, plus walkout balcony. Each floor has a full bath. The 1st floor has a combined living room/dining area with a counter, bar sink, microwave, coffee maker, toaster oven andTV. Pet dogs only are welcome. The cleaning fee is included in the base price Guest access Guess are welcome to wander around and enjoy the mature gardens. Pet owners please keep your dogs on a leash while walking them in and out of the guest house and garden. Bring your own towel to wipe your pets paws before entering the premises. Keep your dogs off the furniture. Other things to note Please use the make up remover pads provided. Do not use the Wash clothes,face towels or bath towels to remove your make up

column70: Well designed one-bedroom apartment in a diverse, friendly neighborhood located just off of West Main Street walking distance to UVA/downtown. Fully stocked kitchen, clawfoot soaking tub, beautiful heart pine floors and marble tile bathroom, screened in porch. Make this your home away from home! The space Come stay in the 1st floor apartment in this charmingly renovated turn of the century house in Fifeville. This unique apartment enters through a covered porch and into a private downstairs apartment. There is an open kitchen/dining room ready for preparing and enjoying your gourmet cooking. Bathroom boasts beautiful tile-work, claw-foot tub and spacious walk-in shower. The bedroom features a comfortable queen size bed with a Serta mattress. There is a pack and play. We provide all sheets and linens. The house is divided into two apartments with a double locked door between the two (no access between apartments, you have the downstairs all to yourself). We generally only accept two night (Friday and Saturday) reservations on the weekends unless it is last minute. Location Our house is perfectly situated in a great neighborhood where folks stop to talk on the street and walking/biking is the norm. We are just three blocks from West Main Street, a 10 minute walk to the Downtown Mall, and a 15 minute walk to UVA and the Corner. Extremely convenient to the train and bus stations. Pets We love animals and understand that you want to bring yours with you, but are also cognizant of the impact that animals can have on a house. Thus, we charge $35/per night/per pet (negotiable for longer stays) and also reserve the right to learn more about the size, etc. Laundry We have a stacked washer and dryer available for your use. Kitchen Plenty of counter space along with a full fridge, sink, dishwasher, microwave, gas range and convection oven. Perfect for making a quick snack, breakfast or a home cooked dinner. We keep the kitchen stocked with everything you need for cooking and enjoying a nice meal (no food). Restaurants (Main Street - within 5 minute walk) Blue Moon Diner - Hip little diner around the corner on Main Continental Divide - Further up main towards UVA . .mex-usa . Oakhart Social--our current favorite, lots of yummy, interestingly prepared vegetables, meats and seafood. Also good cocktails Orzo - Lovely food in the mainstreet market Shops (Main Street -- within 5 minute walk) Albemarle Baking Company (best bread and desserts) Feast (high end grocery) Cherry Ave Exxon (Excellent beer selection, 2 minute walk) About Us Oliver grew up in Charlottesville and we have both lived here for the past eight years. This apartment is in a house that we renovated and maintain for Natasha’s parents. They live here during the winter and we rent it out during the summer and some in the Spring and Fall. Guest access All of the downstairs apartment and side porch. The driveway is shared. Other things to note There is an upstairs studio apartment also in the house. Driveway parking is shared.

column46: Designed by an award-winning architect, our gem of a studio (completed in 2018) has city and Blue Ridge views and is a five minute walk both from the downtown mall and Belmont restaurants. Private 2nd floor entrance and reserved parking space off quiet alley. Secluded yet super-central, it's the perfect getaway for solo travelers and couples!

column60: Conveniently experience the Belmont neighborhood and City of Charlottesville! Enjoy our freshly renovated, 100% solar house as you would your own home. Take in the local wineries, grab dinner on the downtown mall and then come back and sip a cocktail on the front porch swing. Solar powered EV CAR CHARGER on-site for your use! The space We also Airbnb the basement of this home. It's completely separate, so there is no interaction between the two (think of it as an over/under duplex), however, the back yard is a shared space and we allow dogs, so we ask the gates to be kept closed & to clean up after your pets! Guest access You'll have full access to the upstairs apartment, shared fenced in yard, electric car charger and private driveway/ ample FREE street parking out front. Other things to note Due to COVID 19, and our stringent cleaning requirements, no late checkouts or early checkins can be accommodated if there are checkouts/checkins on the same calendar day. Thank you for your understanding!
column67: 100% Solar Home! Guilt Free Living 1 mile from DT

column77: Basement apt in a quiet neighborhood 1 mile from UVA Hospital and Downtown Mall and 2 miles from UVA. Two bedrooms (2 memory foam King beds new in Spring '24, a Twin XL bed, & a toddler bed), a full kitchen, coffee/snacks, washer/dryer, bathroom, toiletries, a living area with a Roku TV & Netflix, free parking, & a private entrance with a patio. Our guests love the value, amenities, & cleanliness! No smoking of any kind. Please read note about the slope to the entrance and potential for noise. The space This is a great space because it is close to so many things (downtown mall, shopping center, easy access to the highway to get to the vineyards), yet also has a quiet and peaceful feel to it. Our home is on a quiet street that backs up to a forest with walking trails. This basement apt has 10 foot ceilings and over 1000 square feet, so it feels very spacious. **The apt is in the back down a medium sloped hill.** We provide coffee and snacks! Additionally, we provide anything you could need in the bathroom--shampoo, conditioner, body wash, soaps, razors, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc.! Guest access You have access to the entire private basement. Other things to note Please note that, because this is a basement apartment, we live in the main area of the house and you will likely hear some walking around and talking. I have elementary school aged children. They are mostly at school during the day, but you will likely hear some noise during the dinnertime hour. The private entrance is in the back of the house down a medium sloped hill. If there is any concern about walking down the outside to the private entrance, you may want to search for another listing. Absolutely no smoking. A $200 fine will be added if you smoke in our home. Because one of my children has extremely serious reactions to pet hair, we are a no-pets property. We can accept a non-shedding, hypoallergenic service animal who does not get on any furniture, but please be considerate of the safety of our family if you need to bring a service animal. No children under 2, please

column48: Located in the popular Belmont neighborhood, just a stroll away from the Downtown Mall The space Settle into our newly built, cozy, and contemporary Belmont Flat: ideally located in the heart of the trendy Belmont neighborhood and within easy reach of Charlottesville’s historic Downtown Mall. Walk to your pick of Belmont’s well-known local restaurants or enjoy live music at the Charlottesville Pavilion, located a stone’s throw away. Tucked away on a quiet street corner, this alluring studio apartment offers a perfect escape from reality with just the right amount of access to town. The open floor plan includes a fully-stocked kitchen, spacious bathroom, sitting and dining area, and a queen sized bed. Soak in the natural light that filters through the bedroom’s large French doors – one of many thoughtful details that makes this intimate space feel roomy. Enjoy dinner for two on the generous wrap-around porch, complete with bistro table, neighborhood views, and ample outdoor lighting. With well-appointed modern finishes and furnishings – clean lines, black accent details, white subway tile, Edison light bulbs – The Belmont Flat is a stylish haven in the center of Charlottesville. Amenities:Lower Level of Building Queen Bed Twin Size Air Mattress Full Bath with Walk-In Shower Kitchen with Stove Flat Screen Smart TV - no cable; Access to apps Wi-Fi Outdoor Wrap-around Patio Charcoal Grill AC/ Heat Washer/Dryer Plenty of Street Parking All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.

column72: Bright clean and sunny small HOUSE with hardwood floors and high ceilings. Walk to the downtown mall and concert pavilion in less than 10 minutes. Or just enjoy neighborhood restaurants and bars right here in historic Belmont. 2 minutes walk to Mas, Tavola, The Local, Junction, Belle coffee , Beer run and BBQ. Very close to highway 64 Monticello and all vineyards. Private driveway cable tv WiFi and all amenities. If you’re looking for longer than 5 days or even several months just contact me. The space Very clean sunny HOUSE minimal and clutter free. With hardwood floors high ceilings giving a spacious open feel. Comfortable back porch with out door grill. The sleeping area is small but comfortable and the living room area is big and plenty to stretch out. If you are interested in renting for several months to a year you are welcome to contact me and we can work out details and arrangements. Queen size bed with Apple TV in room Self check in with smart lock Guest access Full use of the kitchen back porch High speed wifi. Cable television. Apple TV and Bluetooth stereo. Apple TV in bedroom. Other things to note I’m open to long term rental options. If interested we can discuss more in person.

column67: This bright&airy 3BR/1BA newly renovated home w/huge fenced yard sits in the middle of the city,yet on a quiet private road.Perfect for couples & families with pups.Inquire about renting as a 5BR/2BA house.A quick walk to the IX Park restaurants and yoga studios;1/2 mile to Belmont's trendy restaurants;3/4mile to the restaurants&boutiques of the historic pedestrian mall.Easy access to all vineyards,easy 5-min drive to Monticello and UVA & Martha Jeff hospitals. A perfect home base in the city! The space Newly renovated, professionally decorated, and thoughtfully designed, this spacious home provides a perfect respite for travelers to Charlottesville. Can also be rented as a 5BR/2BA house. Centrally and conveniently located to amazing restaurants, boutiques, and local attractions (including a wonderful park just two blocks away with splash grounds and play equipment), plus sporting a huge fully-fenced back yard and expansive front yard for your pups and kids, this home is perfect for families traveling with dogs, couples in town deciding whether to retire here, or traveling nurses looking for a house close to all local hospitals. If you click on my profile picture and scroll down, you will find two guidebooks- one general guidebook to Cville, and one guidebook that provides recommendations for traveling with kids! Please feel free to reach out with any questions. Other things to note The house can be rented as a single-floor home with 3 bedrooms, 1 newly-renovated full bath with tub/shower combo, an light-filled, open-concept living room/kitchen/dining area with a chef's kitchen and all of the tools and amenities you will need to prepare wonderful meals, including a Vitamix, All-Clad pots and pans, and Wustof knives. The living room has a smart TV (no cable) and comfortable seating area, and the dining area is surrounded by windows overlooking the backyard, nearby houses, and mountains and trees beyond. You can also rent the house as a 5BR/2 BA- listed separately on airbnb. When rented as a 5 BR/2 BA, the house also includes the lower level. We do NOT rent out the top and bottom levels separately, so there is no need to worry about noise from other guests if you just rent out the top. However, if you would like a little more space and an additional full bathroom, renting out the house in its entirety is not a bad idea! The bottom level has an additional two bedrooms (one with a king bed, one with a queen), a newly-renovated full bath with tub/shower combo, a cafe kitchen with a second full fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster oven, sink, and door out to the fenced back yard. Additionally, there is a dining area which can make an awesome office space for work-from-homers who would like privacy from the rest of the family upstairs. There is also a second living area with couch and second flat-screen smart TV.

column69: This secure and private TOP-FLOOR suite is the perfect place to relax when visiting Charlottesville. Located in Charlottesville’s premiere Belmont neighborhood my apartment boasts high ceilings, large rooms, and an irresistibly comfortable bed. Free coffee! The spa-quality full-size soaking tub in the bathroom will melt your stress away. You deserve to stay here. 420 friendly. The space Built in the nineteen hundreds, this wonderfully preserved one hundred and twenty-year-old farmhouse is loaded with charm. Heart pine floors have been beautifully restored to their original state, original antique doorknobs occupy every door, and a modern bathroom and kitchen round things out. Your private (not shared) living space includes the front foyer and the entire upstairs floor! - the foyer (good for storing bikes!) - bedroom (comfortable queen bed and fantastic bedding. A great open closet space for clothes and bags and a comfortable lounge chair) - an entertainment room with a very comfortable couch, 50 inch HDTV (Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Prime can all be streamed from your phone) and a dining table and chairs that doubles as a desk - a kitchenette that has just about everything you would need for your stay including an electric range and griddle, toaster oven and more (shoot me a message if you need something that isn't up there) - a big bathroom with a nice big soaking tub The space comfortably sleeps two and arrangements for an air mattress in the living room can be made if you have three or four guests staying (be sure to specify the number of guests in advance). The couch is also big enough to comfortably sleep someone up to 6 feet. Guest access Enter the house through the front door. Once you do you will be in the foyer, this space is yours as well so feel free to store larger items like bicycles there. Head upstairs and the entire top floor of the house is also yours! NOTE: Do not under any circumstances enter the backyard or the side entrance. Other things to note Enter the house through the front door. The backyard is private, do not go into the backyard for any reason. The side entrance to the house is also off-limits. Once you enter the house you will see two doors to the right of the staircase. These doors are permanently closed and locked. They used to lead to my half of the house. I do not enter your part of the house during your stay. The internet password, additional house rules, and other resources are available once you check-in and can be found in the living area on the table.

column63: Our cottage was completed in July 2019 (edit: due to COVID we have not made it available since March 2020). Super walkable to several breweries, restaurants, and music venues (Cville’s downtown mall; downtown Belmont). If you want to park your car, relax, and walk to everywhere Charlottesville has to offer our place would great for you. Or hop in the car and hit the trails and other super fun spots (Shenandoah NP, Brew Ridge Trail, and Monticello). 1.2 Miles to UVA The space The space is private, located less than .5 miles to the downtown mall and downtown belmont and a few steps away from the IX art park. It has a full kitchen, quartz countertops, full size dishwasher and full size washer/dryer. Upstairs is a memory foam queen bed. The living room also has a queen sized memory foam sofa bed. All of the windows feature room darkening shades for a good night’s rest. Guest access Guests have access to the entirety of the cottage and a private entrance. Other things to note Gigabit internet access

column78: Colorful 1948 home in a safe friendly neighborhood. plenty of books to read and spices to utilize if you choose to cook at the house during your stay. Located approx 1 mile from Charlottesville's historic downtown walking mall (lot's of restaurants and venues), 12 min drive to Monticello, 2 miles to UVA campus and next to an awesome public park:) The space Well kept, cheerful home in the quiet and convenient neighborhood of Bellmont. Just 5 minutes drive from the downtown mall or I64! House is next to a park, and a bus stop which goes to UVA and beyond, 10 minute walk to several restaurants in Bellmont area or 20 min walk to the historic downtown walking mall (many shops and restaurants and the Ntelos Pavilion), 10 minute drive to Jefferson's Monticello and 8 min drive to the UVA campus. A gas station with convenience store is just 2 blocks away. 1st bedroom has a double bed, 2nd bedroom has a double bed, and the futon couch in the living room folds out to a double size bed. Plenty of closet space, hangers and iron provided for guest use. Can accommodate up to 5 people House has an cozy eat-in kitchen, single bath with tub, comfortable living room with wi-fi great books to read and an awesome back yard with: deck, patio, a lovely garden and a fire pit. Plenty of parking along the street in front of the house. There is a TV which can be hooked up to a computer or the DVD player, but no cable (pretty much no channels at all). All linens, bread for toast and locally roasted coffee provided. Guest access In addition to the 2 bedrooms, there are a living room, bathroom and eat in kitchen. The kitchen is fully equipped and encouraged for your use. There is plenty of room for guest items in the fridge and space in the freezer to keep your cold things cold. Wifi is the router in the living room under the window. Sign in details are written on top of the router. It is plugged into a power strip to save energy when not in use.

column50: Located in the center of everything. Short walk to the Downtown Mall & Downtown Belmont. Easy access to great restaurants, local brewery, seasonal farmer's market, boutique shopping, and Monticello. A quaint starting point for all Cville Adventures! The space Comfortably furnished cottage style home with 2 Queen beds and 2 full bathrooms. Living/sitting room and full kitchen with dinning area. Enjoy the spacious back deck and Weber grill in the warmer months. Wireless internet and basic cable included, washer and dryer units available for use as well. Guest access Enjoy the privacy of the entire house's space. Happy to welcome guests personally but also not offended by those who want to go about their trip. House has a number code lock to allow guests easy access. Code will be provided the week of arrival. Never far away if needed and hope to help you enjoy your stay as much as possible. Other things to note University of Virginia only a short car ride or free public trolley away. Enjoy the University's many events without being in the center of the student congestion.

column50: Stylish Belmont Home, Walk to Downtown Mall The space Looking for somewhere to stay with a mix of modern amenities and style, and historic Virginia charm? The stylish woodworking of Corner House is just the place to make your stay in Charlottesville a memorable one.  Located in between Belmont restaurants and the Downtown Mall, this home is perfect for those wanting to explore Charlottesville by foot! Recently renovated, this home has touches of walnut throughout the flooring, ceilings, decorative walls, shelves, and furnishings. With three bedrooms upstairs, Corner House can sleep up to six people. The full bathroom upstairs and half bathroom downstairs were updated in the most recent design. The stone patio at the rear of the house is perfect for grilling with family and friends. The beautifully updated kitchen has copper lamps and a gas stove.  Although you're walking distance to some of the best places to eat in the Charlottesville area, you may not want to leave your home away from home! First Floor:Designer Kitchen with Gas Range + Farm Sink Dining Room with Wet Bar Living Room Half Bath Front Porch with Seating Light-Filled Sun Room Patio Second Floor:King Bed Queen Bed Full Bed Full Bath with Walk-in Glass Shower Amenities:Central AC/Radiator Heat Flat Screen TV with Cable Wi-Fi Standard Drip Coffee Maker Washer/Dryer Charcoal Grill Off Street Parking for 2 + Street Parking All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.
column57: Corner House | Stylish Belmont Home, near Downtown

Upon booking, you will receive a unique code that gives you access to your room. column81: Perfectly situated 1 mile from Downtown, 2 miles from UVA and a short drive to the interstate for vineyard access, this home is the perfect fit for large families, weddings, bachelorette parties! With 2,000+sq ft, 5 queen beds, and a fenced-in backyard, there is plenty of room for all! Early check-in is usually available upon request, depending on other bookings the week of your stay. Please see our guidelines below for hosting bachelorette parties in the home :) The space This 4-bedroom, 5-bed home is ideally located in Charlottesville. It's a few minute's drive/Uber from Downtown C'ville, and only a few minutes further from UVA. The home itself features a sunny, open kitchen leading onto a back deck and fenced-in backyard. The living room is also a warm, open and inviting place, completing the main floor as a great location for small gatherings. With three independent bedrooms and one extra-large double room, this house is an ideal spot for a friends' weekend, a low-key bachelorette party, a large family get-together or multiple couples and families enjoying Charlottesville together! Guest access When you arrive you'll find your beds made and ready for you, along with all the necessary towels and toiletries laid out for you upon arrival. In addition, you will have access to a full kitchen, spices, and coffee essentials. There is parking in the driveway, and plenty of parking on the street in front of and beside the house. Every guest that stays gets their own 4-digit code to access the house, which is changed before and after every stay to ensure your safety. Codes are sent the morning of your stay. Upon booking, we won't share the exact address of our home until after your free cancelation" window has passed. All of this is to ensure maximum safety for current and future guests! column69: This 350 sq ft cottage is a tiny home concept space, boasting an airy entry, living area, storage landing, kitchenette, bathroom and sleeping loft. Perfect for a romantic getaway, a work retreat, a stop through town on the way to another location, a small family, or a group of friends participating in the many events held in Charlottesville- weddings, concerts, triathlons. Accommodates 1-4 people looking for a relaxed, stylish, modern and comfortable place to stay. The space Looking for a centrally located, unique and quiet home base during your visit to Charlottesville? Oxford Cottage is a modern Tiny House. Built in 2014 and updated in 2020, it is larger than a standard hotel suite and provides everything you need for a comfortable stay. Tall ceilings, glowing natural light, and a modern aesthetic with fun decor, the space just feels good. The building is energy efficient and insulated and feels like a tree house. Situated behind the main house on a .18 acre lot in the City, you can enjoy a contactless stay and get to everything Charlottesville has to offer within minutes. There is plenty of space for 1-2 people, but 4 adventurous souls could stay and be cozy. The beds and furnishings are comfortable and well appointed and linens and towels are provided. There is central heating and air, a ceiling fan and an air purifier. There is no TV, but there is free, super fast fiber Wifi so you could stream away on your phone, iPad, etc. The kitchenette has a microwave, 3 burner induction cook top, crock pot, toaster oven and a refrigerator/freezer. Kitchenette is well appointed for simple meals and there are dishes and silverware, mugs, cups and wine glasses for up to 4 people. One important note about the stairs to the loft, is that they are steep and you will need to take your time going up and down. Use the handrails and watch your noggin at the top. It's easier to come down them backwards, like you would a ladder on a boat. Toddlers and folks with knee or hip issues should not use them. (We can provide a safety gate if you have a little kiddo). You can also just decide to sleep on the futon in the living area if you do not wish to navigate the stairs. They are sturdy and well built, but they are not a standard stair case. We have taken care to build and maintain a low impact building. Please turn off the lights when leaving the cottage and be aware of water usage. Please do not flush anything other than the usual and toilet paper (especially condoms or feminine pads) down the toilet. These will burn out the sewer pump and render the bathroom unusable. We provide low impact shampoo, conditioner, soap & body lotion and toilet paper and paper towels. There is a hair dryer and clothing iron. The cottage is also available for rent along with the main house if you have a larger party during the Holidays or Graduation. Guest access Free parking Use of the yard and fire pit
column76: Oxford Cottage: Cville’s favorite tiny home!

column45: This is a beautiful bedroom and adjoining sitting room on the top floor of my home with a private bath just across the hall. The bedroom has a queen-sized bed, closet, and antique dresser. The sitting room has a chaise lounge, table and two chairs, mini-fridge, coffee maker, and TV with local channels & Roku. Just about a mile from UVA and the Downtown Mall on a large lot in a lovely neighborhood. The space The two-room suite and bathroom you are renting are private. There is another suite on the same floor, which is only occupied during the week so you will not cross paths with anyone during your stay. There are two other spaces that I rent on the lowest level of the house so please be considerate of noise levels when arriving or departing, particularly at early/late hours. There is one thermostat that controls the temperature for the top floor of the house - you may adjust this up or down a few degrees as needed. The bedroom has a ceiling fan and there is also a small tabletop fan to help regulate the temperature. This space is designed for one or two guests. Please note - there is no kitchen and laundry room available to use with the rental of this room. Guest access Please note - there is no kitchen and laundry room available to use with the rental of this room. During your stay We may not meet in person, particularly if you are only staying for a short time... I am just a phone call or text away so please don't hesitate to reach out! Other things to note Check-in is anytime after 4 pm. I always appreciate knowing when you intend to arrive but I've set things up so that self-check-in will be a breeze. If I am not on-site I will be available by phone, should you need assistance. Check-out time is 11 am. A later check-out time may be available upon request, with advance notice, providing there is not an incoming guest.

column85: Location, location! Newly-renovated bright and clean downtown modern farmhouse in the heart of downtown Cville. Just a 4-minute walk to the Ting Pavilion, the downtown mall, and the heart of Belmont. Roughly 1 mile to Univ. of Virgina. With a beautiful open downstairs floor plan, 4 upstairs bdrms, three full baths, dining room, laundry room, and wrap-around porch, this is a perfect spot to explore all that Cville has to offer. 2 off-street parking spots and a small backyard patio space. The space *photos of entire house not currently available. Will update in 2023. Please request video tour if interested in booking* This 1912 modern farmhouse usually is the home to our family of four, but we sometimes host to Airbnb guests from around the world as we like to get out and travel, too! We've spent the last four years turning this old house from a condemned eye-sore into a bright, modern home (when one spouse is a builder and the other an architect, you tend to take on house projects)! Given the location, you can't get much closer to everything downtown--so close to the downtown mall and the heart of Belmont. You can walk almost everywhere, but we also have two dedicated parking spots for guests, with other easy parking on the street. The house has an open downstairs floor plan with tall ceilings connecting the entry, living room, kitchen, dining room, mudroom, and one full bath. Upstairs contains four bedrooms comfortably sleeping up to 7 guests, 2 full baths (one is a master bath), and a sunny laundry/craft room. There is also a lovely wrap-around porch great for sitting out and watching the neighborhood go by. The backyard contains a nice patio area leading to one of the parking spots off an alley. The house is fully stocked for out-of-town guests to live comfortably for a weekend or longer stay. WIFI and Smart TV. We also have lots of kids books, toys, some plastic cups and bowls, and stair gates (upon request) for the little explorers out there! Guest access Guests will have access to the entire house and outdoor property. Keys will be kept in a concealed passcode box on the property to be returned upon checkout. Other things to note Guests must follow the house rules, which include quiet hours. It is not a party house. We have a two-year-old, and all that comes with it! We've placed fans in every guest room to provide a white-noise option. Two off-street parking spot are available. On-street parking is free and often readily available directly across from the house. Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and bath towels are all provided. A welcome-sheet will provide more info on your stay, a basic map, and personal recommendations for restaurants--all within walking distance. We are always happy to take your call or text during your stay. We will also provide emergency contacts that live within a mile from the house.

column96: Our home has been the preferred landing pad for friends and family for over 20 years, and we love welcoming new folks! The house has lots of great rainy day activities (PS4, records, puzzles, comically large TV, and more), abundant outdoor hangout space, and astonishingly fast fiber internet. Our neighborhood, Belmont, is the best! It's eclectic and diverse in every way, close to the Downtown Mall and UVA, and super walkable. The space My wife and I are old pros at hosting and have tailored our home to be inviting to new and old friends alike. Our common spaces are meant for socializing. We know the party happens in the kitchen, so we have a great island for cheeseboarding, and a lovely table for coffee talk or a group dinner. Our living room has the world's best leather sofa (nicknamed Violet Beauregard!) for relaxing while listening to records or catching Saturday Night Live after a night out. Outside, watch the neighborhood from the front porch swing, or cozy up to the fire pit on the back patio. The kitchen is well stocked with the essentials (coffee, tea, beer, condiments, etc) and we encourage you to make yourself totally at home. Cooks can rest assured that the pans and knives are good quality. Use the Vitamix to make cocktails or smoothies! The bedrooms all have memory foam mattresses (Leeza, Avocado, Zinni brands) and great bedding - nice cotton sheets, down comforters, fresh pillows - the works! The king and queen bedrooms are designed to be tranquil getaways, with spare furniture and art. The teen room will make you feel young again! The living room has a a trunk of bedding for potential sofa sleeping, and there's a twin-sized air mattress that can be thrown in any of the rooms. The bathroom features a heated bidet(!), nice towels, and good toiletries. Plus, we don't mind sharing the miscellaneous stuff that can be forgotten while traveling, like heartburn medicine or dry shampoo. Homebodies rejoice in the wide selection of entertainment options. The Apple TV has Netflix, HBOGo, Amazon Prime, YouTube TV, and other apps loaded and ready to go. We have a PS4, with a few games loaded up. Play board games, build with Lego, or put together a puzzle. We have hundreds of records spanning many decades and genres, or you can play your iTunes from the Apple TV. Cleanliness is very important to us - to protect guests and our own family. We clean laundry using an ionizer (like hospitals and hotels!) - we wash blankets and comforter covers between each guest, and wash pillows and down comforters monthly. We disinfect door knobs, light switches, remotes, and all other frequently touched items before each guest. We beat rugs in the sun and employ a robot army of Roombas to make sure there are no dust bunnies under the beds or sofa. We're big fans of the sterilize setting on the dishwasher. A few possible detractors for guests: our indoor stairs do not have a handrail, we have few overhead lights (but tons of lamps!), and the house isn't baby proof" but we have some strategies to help parents create more yes than no! column63: The main floor of this house with private entrance and a nice, beautiful walk to the Historic Downtown Mall-near hit restaurants, arts, live music & shopping. Your own apartment for your Charlottesville stay! 2 outdoor porches give great spots to relax. Decorated throughout with the work of great, local artists. Super-Fast WiFi, all kitchen necessities. Each with its own queen bed • Full kitchen with all cooking appliances and essentials • Fast Wifi • Smart TV with YouTube TV provided (similar to cable)-also all major streaming apps are installed for you to use your account. • 3(!) porches. column39: Secretariat Room The space This property is coming off the short term rental market as of the end of November 2024! We do not know if or when it may be back! Designed for those who love classic comforts, the Secretariat room features antique woods, leather accents, houndstooth patterns and gold finishes that create a warm, Virginian retreat. The Townsman is the newest concept in hotel accommodations. Instead of charging you for things you’ll never use, we’ve pared ourselves down to the essentials. Incredible locations. Beautiful rooms. Great prices. Once you book with us, we’ll give you a code that grants you access to the hotel and your room. After that, all you have to do is show up. No check-in. No hassles. Just a boutique hotel, steps from the places you most want to be. Where are you located exactly? We’re at 211 West Main Street, right on Charlottesville’s historic Downtown Mall.  The location can't be beat in the middle of the downtown action!  We like to note to future guests that this is a popular area (especially on the weekends) and the noise level on the Downtown Mall may be higher particularly on Friday and Saturday evenings. Where do Townsman guests park? Parking: Parking for guests is located at 300 Preston Ave. in Charlottesville. There is one spot for each room located directly to the left of the main sign for the parking lot. Each Spot has signage that has The Townsman" and the corresponding name of the room on them. Please only park in the spot designated for your room. How does the code work? Our front door and the door to your room will feature a keypad into which you’ll enter your personal code. The code we give you when you book is given to no one else and only works for the duration of your stay. What services do you offer? What we offer is a room you’ll love in a downtown location that can’t be beat. To keep our prices where you want them

column70: Vintage cozy attic apartment a short walk to the Downtown Mall in C'ville's trendy upscale north downtown neighborhood. Attic in early 60's home. Off street parking. Kitchen w/ mini fridge, microwave, rice cooker & stove/oven. Keurig, toaster & blender. Wifi. Breakfast, snacks, coffee, tea & cream included. Sleep under heavy quilts handmade by my grandmother. Walk to Belmont, ride the Free Trolley to UVa, convenient to 29 and I-64. Key access via lock box. Self check in. The space Feel as if you have stepped back into a simpler time. Vintage attic apartment with sloping ceilings..knotty pine cabinets...lots of windows...sleep under grandmother's heavy handmade quilts and afghans...just like today's weighted blankets. Approximately 700 square feet with lots of sunny windows & plants. Easy walk to the downtown mall. Please note that this is a true airbnb in the sense that I also live here when there aren't guests. I want you to feel welcome and at home. There isn't a maid service. I'm the maid and I have personal items in the space. The plumbing is old and needs to be treated gently. Visualize hippie grandma vibe.... Guest access Upstairs through front door. Self check-in. Off street parking. There is a yard and a private back patio. Other things to note The Attic feels as if you have slipped back a few decades in time. I am slowly collecting pieces to add to the space. The furniture in the bedroom is 1950's Scandinavian from Switzerland including the colors. The dining table is from the 1950's. The counter tops and cabinets in the kitchen are original to the early 1960's home. I also stay in The Attic at times. This space is not suitable for infants and young children.

Enjoy our comfortable 3- bedroom home overlooking Charlottesville with beautiful sunset views! Our quiet neighborhood is just a short walk or drive to popular attractions including the Downtown Mall, UVA, Belmont and Cvilles most popular restaurants and breweries. Very easy access to I-64 and Wegmans shopping center with private driveway parking. 
With modern decor in a newer construction home, we offer WiFi, Roku TV with Netflix/Prime Video and beautiful west-facing deck with grill access.

3 small steps to enter with main floor living/dining and 3 bedrooms upstairs. Master bedroom has a queen size bed with ensuite bathroom. 2nd bedroom has a queen bed, 3rd bedroom has a double bed and those rooms share their own full bathroom. Double vanities. Sleeps up to 6 people. 1 parking space in the driveway with plentiful on-street parking. Coffee, tea and full kitchen appliances available for use.

All parts of the house except the unfinished basement are accessible to guests. Feel free to make our house your home away from home!

We live nearby in Charlottesville and are available to assist in person as needed. Happy to give you as much space as you like. Were also readily available for restaurant/excursion recommendations to help you enjoy your time in Charlottesville!

Ridge street is very close to many of Charlottesvilles most popular attractions. 5 minute drive to the Downtown Mall, UVA, The Pavilion and Belmont. 20-30 minutes to the best local wineries. 30 minutes to the Blue Ridge Mountains and Shenandoah National Park.

We are a 3 minute walk from the CAT bus line which connects throughout the city via Downtown and Veoride bikeshare bikes are frequently close on the sidewalks. 1 private parking space and plentiful street parking. We also are close to the Rivanna and Monticello hiking/biking trails.

column68: Lise and I are excited to offer the beauty and convenience of our historic home to guests coming to Charlottesville. This has been our family home for more than 25 years and we welcome you into it. We are on the edge of UVa Grounds, three (3) blocks from the UVa Rotunda and “The Corner” restaurants and shopping. And we are walking distance to John Paul Jones Arena & Scott Stadium. The nearby free shuttle provides easy access to Downtown Mall restaurants, shopping, movie theater, etc. The space PRIVATE Space on 2nd floor includes: 1. QUEEN ROOM: private bedroom with one queen bed, ceiling fan, chest of drawers, closet with hangers. 2. Private upstairs BATHROOM which includes an antique clawfoot tub with a shower. Entrance to the bathroom is from the common hallway, immediately adjacent to the bedroom. 3. The dedicated WORKSPACE: desk, chair, mini-fridge, Nespresso machine, electric tea kettle, reading chair, lamp, and ceiling fan. Ultra-high speed internet connection (fiber optic 1,000 Mbps) throughout the space. NOTE: A 2nd private queen bedroom adjoins this space and the two queen rooms can be booked together by using this link: airbnb.com/h/cville2rooms SHARED Space with Host includes: 5. The LIVING ROOM: a large room off of the entrance foyer that includes comfortable seating, a fireplace, two ceiling fans, and a TV. 6. The FRONT YARD with native gardens. Includes outdoor table and two chairs. Guest access Guests have access on the 1st floor to the front foyer, the staircase, and the living room. Guests have access on the 2nd floor to the upstairs hallway, their private bedroom, their private bathroom and their private dedicated workspace that are accessed from the hallway. Guests are welcome to enjoy the native gardens in the front yard that includes a table with two chairs. Note that there is no guest access to a kitchen or laundry room. During your stay Host and family members work from home, and one of us will likely be available to answer your questions in person during the day and evening. Our work from home often includes often being on phone calls, video calls or video meetings. So there may be times when we are present in the home but not available in the moment to answer your questions. During your stay, we ask that you support us in creating a safe and relatively quiet environment that allows everyone in the home to enjoy the space. Other things to note We have two friendly dogs and a fenced yard. We want to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. We respect diversity and inclusion of all people. If there is something that would make your stay especially wonderful, let us know. We will strive to make it happen if it is feasible for us. Note: We have two other options for rooms available at our home ... 1. If you would prefer two private Queen Rooms (sleeps up to 4) instead of one (sleeps up to 2), then book our Two private Queen Rooms" with a shared private bathroom

column59: Perfect location for your Charlottesville visit! Walking distance (~0.5 mi) to almost everything - the Downtown pedestrian mall with restaurants, shopping, & music, UVA, the train station and more. This inclusive and welcoming home is the downstairs apartment in a charming 1925 single family home converted to an over/under duplex. Like most near centenarians - her floors sag a little in places, but it only adds to the charm! The space Although this is a first floor apartment, it is not wheelchair accessible as stairs are required to access porch, and doorways are narrow. The kitchen is stocked with basics such as salt and pepper, oil, coffee, and tea - as well as dishes, pots and pans. Wegman's is just two miles away for your shopping convenience. Internet is provided and there is a Roku Smart TV where you can log into your Netflix, Hulu, etc. accounts. No cable but the over-the-air antenna will get you ABC/NBC/FOX/CBS etc. Guest access - One off-street parking space, additional street parking available though limited - Use of porch, yard, charcoal grill (charcoal not provided), cornhole boards - Washer/dryer in unit, along with outdoor clothesline
