column71: Quiet, historic, 3 blocks to Downtown Mall. Private entry 2nd floor suite, wood floor, queen bed; loveseat, electric fireplace, study w desk, double bath --4' clawfoot tub, shower, 2 sinks & 2 toilets. Private coffee room/library, compact refrigerator, microwave, ceramic cookware, cutting board, full dish set, flatware, wineglasses, cups, electric kettle, pour-over coffee carafe; locally ground coffee & bakery breakfast bread, NO KITCHEN or stove. Support local restaurants. The space Keyless, self-check-in, and separate entrance, completely private. Nothing shared with owner or other guests. Perfect for the wedding guest, business traveler or scholar--lots of light on sunny days, attached study and library. Second floor so there is a full flight of stairs to and from this guest suite. Nice views to the neighborhood. If you need an additional sleeping space for your 2-person reservation, there is an additional tiny bedroom (historic trunk room w double bed) on your same private floor. This tiny room is never used by others during your stay. Its occupant will share thedouble bathroom and must access it through your primary bedroom--so, best for family member or closest of friends. This is a completely smoke-free home so there is no smoking inside or outside. Guest access This is a second floor suite with no use of the first floor without prior request and paid fee. There is on-street parking in front of the house. Permit parking during the weekdays w owner providing free and returnable permit. Other things to note This is my family home--not a resort or spa space-it is homey, and not a standard, designer venue. Our intention is for a comfortable and convenient place to visit the area and use as a home base while in Charlottesville. I provide self-service breakfast bread, coffee and tea, sweeteners and individual half and half containers so that you will not have to shop upon arrival. I do not provide bottled water because our city has a high quality granular activated carbon treated water supply. Please let me know if you prefer that I not provide coffee or breakfast bread--I cannot offer substitutions or discounts.
column78: Spacious, Sunny 1 Bedroom, Office, Double Bathroom

column65: We are a family of six living in downtown Charlottesville, on the edge of the Belmont neighborhood and just off the downtown mall. We are fortunate to be in the best location in the city - able to walk to shops, parks, and the library, and biking distance from UVA. The best restaurants in the city are within 2 blocks, and we can hear the pavilion's music from our porch. Kids will also love playing in the yard and exploring the children's museum, a five minute walk away. The space Our home is a character-rich American farmhouse with modern updates, fully renovated with an addition completed in 2019. The main level has a largely open floor plan, with a spacious foyer, bright kitchen and dining room with a large skylight. The sunroom's windows look out onto the back yard and screened shed, which has a wood burning stove and is perfect for gatherings in the fresh air. There is a first floor master suite with a queen bed and barrier free shower for easy access. The library is tucked away for when you need your own space, warms you up with a Jotul gas stove, and doubles as the music room with a Kawai electric weighted keyboard. Enjoy the sunset and watch the world go by from the covered front porch while swinging on the porch swing. In the basement you'll find the entertainment center, with a 75 inch smart TV. The basement also has a full bath and queen American Leather sleeper sofa. On the second floor you'll find four bedrooms, one with a twin loft bed, one with two twin beds, and one with a double bed. These bedrooms share a full bath with a shower and bathtub. The master suite on the second floor has a queen bed and a luxurious bathroom including a shower for two with a skylight and vaulted ceilings. The laundry room is on the second floor. You'll find ample street parking in front of the house, and play space for children in the yard. The backyard is fully fenced and accessible by car through an alley behind the house. There is a ramp from the backyard leading to the mudroom for handicap accessibility, and through the mudroom you can access the main living space and the basement. Other things to note We have a medium sized short-haired dog who will be away during your stay, but we want you to be aware in case of any allergies.

column58: Professionally cleaned, intimate space, walking distance to all of C-ville then you have found the right place! Come stay with us and enjoy everything this amazing city has to offer. It is centrally located with a 5-12 min walk to the Amtrak, west main shops, Preston Ave, downtown mall, The Corner, and UVA. See Space" for more details. column59: check out by 11:00am 3) Due to pet allergies we can not allow animals The Carriage house is a private studio apartment that sits on top of the lot behind our main home. column85: We continue to take extra steps to carefully clean/disinfect before and after guests are in residence. Cleaning supplies are available for you to continue this process during your stay if you wish. Butternut Cottage is curated to be a colorful, clean, serene space from which to venture out and then return for restful recharging. The space Two blocks from Amtrak, impeccable accommodations situated halfway along the mile between Downtown Charlottesville & UVA's Lawn in a walkable, friendly neighborhood. The train station is close enough for an easy walk but not so close as to disturb. Butternut Cottage is a small, well-appointed urban home just off West Main Street. It's an easy walk to UVA and to Charlottesville's Downtown Mall, about 5 blocks in either direction. The free trolley stops just a few blocks away as well and can help you get to UVA, Scott Stadium, JPJ Arena, and more. The cottage is fully furnished and outfitted for your stay. There is wireless internet, basic cable TV plus Roku, radio receiver, and 5-CD player. Additionally, there is off-street parking, A/C, iron and board, and other amenities for your comfort. See a more complete list of equipment & supplies in Photo 22 of my listing. This is a non-smoking residence. Dogs may accompany guests with advanced permission and an additional cleaning fee of $60. (So sorry but I'm allergic to cats.) If you'll let me know in advance what kind of bread, cereal, milk, etc. you like, I'm happy to provide it, along with organic eggs, coffee, and teas. There are also plenty of condiments, spices, baking supplies, etc. (Although the bakeries around here are insanely good...) Food waste is important to me and since many guests dine out, I'll just pick up what works for you. The entire house, grounds, and driveway (along with a tag for street parking for a second car) are included in the price/rental. No more than 2 cars please! My neighbors are all great and ready to help if anything comes up. We have artists here, world-class fiddle players, IT experts, moms and babies, retirees, students, PHD candidates, you name it. I love the eclectic, friendly vibe here. Just a block up, on West Main Street, a free trolley travels back and forth between UVA and the Downtown Mall. Check the schedule for current times. Guest access The entire house and gardens are ready for your sole enjoyment, except for my small office, which is closed. This is a one-level home and, while the basement is not as guest-amenable as the main level, feel free to do an emergency load of clothes if needed. (NOTE: I keep a wireless cam on top of a clothes cabinet down there so I can monitor my sump pump in times of storms and possible power outage.) The garden is usually in a state of wild order, depending on the season and day of the week. If you have permission to bring a dog, note that a large dog could possibly escape over a 40 picket part of the fence right in front. *PLEASE keep dogs out of the flower beds and pick up after them daily. Other things to note IMPORTANT! I have a small 1-car driveway and a permit for street parking for 1 additional car. This is a very short street and my neighbors have very little parking to share among them. Please be respectful and do not allow guests to park cars on my street. If spaces are limited

column84: BEST sleeping arrangement of any C'ville Airbnb-10 Beds/6 Bedrooms (4 Kings, 6 XL Twins)! More 5 star reviews than any other large house in town! -1 Mile from Downtown Mall -2 miles from UVA -Easy access to highways & vineyards Perfect for weddings, bachelorette parties, families, & large groups exploring Cville. Lots of amenities. All guests sleep on thick memory foam beds & pillows. With 3257 sq ft, 6BD, 4 Full Bathrooms, 2 Kitchens & 2 Living Rooms, there is plenty of room to spread out! The space I own and operate this property and I have been doing it for 9 years. I love that my home is the gathering place for making special memories every weekend, and I always go the extra mile to make sure that you have a great time in Charlottesville! Basics: Lots of space in city limits! 6 Bedrooms (4 King Beds & 6XL twin beds (plus a toddler bed and multiple pack n plays not included in bed count), 4 bathrooms, 2 living spaces, dining room, 2 kitchens, 3 TVs, huge deck, patio, and large backyard. Coffee, snacks, and drinks provided. Air mattresses available upon request. Every room includes: a sound machine, a phone charger, a fan, a night light, and extra pillows and blankets. This 6 bedroom three-story house is ideally located a mile from the Downtown mall and two miles from UVA. Ideal for bachelorette weekends, wedding party weekends, UVA reunions/football games, and family vacations. Our home stands out because we have a lot of space and a large backyard within the city limits. ***While we are excited for you to be in our home for your special occasion, we live on a very quiet and family friendly street and our neighborhood does not allow loud noises past 9:30pm, so please consider this when booking. *** This home features a sunny, open kitchen, gas fireplace, back deck overlooking the Rivanna walking trails, and a finished basement with its own backyard entrance. We have four young children, so we have a kid-friendly home. We provide coffee, drinks, and snacks! The Main Floor: One of the things that made me fall in love with this house was the open concept of the main floor and all of the natural light that enters through the windows. It is easy to cook a meal in the kitchen while watching the game in the living room! One of the guest rooms is off of the kitchen and has a king-sized bed and a full bathroom attached to it. There is an open living room with huge, comfy couches, a dining area with a table that can fit 12, and a kitchen that are all open. The upstairs: The master bedroom has a king-sized bed, a XL twin-sized bed, and an attached master bathroom. The view outside the master bedroom is of the mountain that Monticello sits on! There are two guest bedrooms on the top floor--both with two twin XL-sized beds. There is another full bathroom and a washer and dryer on this floor. The basement/lower level: The lower level has access to the backyard, which is perfect should you have family members/friends that need to come in later at night than everybody else. There is a full kitchen, a couch in the living space, a full bathroom, a TV, and two rooms, one with a king bed and one with a king bed and a Twin XL bed. There is a full bathroom as well. Off to the side is a board game closet with lots of group games! The backyard: The backyard is great because it is unusually large for a house being inside the Cville city limits. We have a grill on our back deck (which is off of the main level) and the yard is perfect for a group BBQ or one of the lawn games we provide (soccer, bocce ball, and croquet)! Guest access Please help yourself to all necessary linens, toiletries, etc., which will be laid out for you upon arrival. In addition, you will have access to all diningware, spices, and cooking needs. We can fit 3 guaranteed spaces for cars in front of the house. If you plan to bring more than three cars, please let us know and we can direct you to extra parking in the neighborhood. Other things to note NO PARTIES: As a home in a residential neighborhood, we ask that only you and the listed guests spend time in our home during your stay (unless given special permission). Please be respectful of our neighbors by moving any activities indoors by 9:30pm and not playing loud music indoors after then. We have great neighbors, but they are very sensitive to noises since the houses are close together. BACHELORETTE PARTY RULES: While our above house policy states that there are no parties" allowed

column42: Welcome to the center of Cville! Our newly renovated second floor balcony apartment is centrally located on historic West Main Street in the heart of Midtown. We are seven blocks from UVa campus/hospital, four blocks from the Downtown Mall and directly across from the Amtrak station. The free trolly stops are right outside your door along with many of Cville’s best reviewed and acclaimed restaurants. Join us and experience Cville from the inside out. The space We are located above the main floor dining room of Maya Restaurant, one of Cville’s premiere farm to table restaurants. The outdoor porch provides wonderful views of the surrounding mountains, the oldest church in Cville and the walkable Main Street landscape. Our brick building was built in 1917 and our space boasts twelve foot ceilings and lots of windows. The couch in the living folds out to a full sized bed should you require extra sleeping space. Please note this bed is a tight squeeze for sleeping two adults. Youtube TV is available through our Apple TV box and you are welcome to stream your favorite apps. The kitchen has an induction stove top, coffee pot and microwave. The bedroom is furnished with a queen size bed and reading area and you will find plenty of closet space. Guest access You will have access to our space via West Main Street. Both the hallway entrance and apartment door are key coded. Other things to note Many of a Cville’s breweries and distilleries are in walking distance. Twelve of Cville’s best restaurants are located within three blocks as well as a coffee house, bakery, wine, cheese and local produce shop, locally sourced butcher and a famous tattoo parlor just in case you are in the mood for some ink. Midtown also boasts a yoga studio, day spa and a locally owned toy store if the kids are joining you.

column55: Walk to Downtown Mall | Historic Stately Home with Pool Table & Open First Floor Living - near Ting Pavilion - Includes In-Law Suite The space Welcome to The Pryor-Haynes House! There is so much to love about this charming, historic home in the heart of Charlottesville just a few blocks from the Downtown Mall. Sleeping eight comfortably, the Pryor-Haynes House is the perfect getaway for your next family vacation or reunion with friends. As you enter the beautifully styled foyer and cross into the home’s elegant interior, you’ll find an open floor plan bathed in the natural light of the surrounding windows. Enjoy an evening at home, cooking in the full chef’s kitchen with all your guests gathered around the kitchen island, lounging in the living room, or playing a game of pool in the adjacent sunroom. Dine in the formal dining room, take your meal outside to the deck, or take a short walk to one of the many restaurants on the mall. As night settles in, you’ll have your choice of beds in one of four serene bedrooms, one of which is within its own suite complete with cozy living space, kitchen, and bathroom. Come stay at The Pryor-Haynes House; if you never want to leave, we’ll understand. This house is in a quiet, residential neighborhood. Please note for the Pryor Haynes House that the front and back Porch curfew is 10pm and is strictly enforced by our good neighbor policy. Main Floor Formal Living Room with gas fireplace Formal Dining Room TV Room Renovated Kitchen with Gas Range and Bar Stool Seating Game Room with Pool Table Half Bath Deck Second FloorMaster: King Bed with En Suite Bath Queen Bed with En Suite Bath Third FloorQueen Bed with En Suite Bath Terrace LevelPrivate Suite (Access from Side of House; No Interior Staircase): King Bed Full Bath Small Kitchen Sitting Area Amenities:Wi-Fi Cable TV Standard Drip Coffee Maker Small Charcoal Grill Washer/Dryer Street Parking All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. column55: Modern Downtown Retreat w/ Rooftop Terrace, 3 Levels, Across from The Ting Pavilion & C&O Restaurant, 1 Block Off Downtown Mall. Overlooks the C&O Railway (1 Garage Parking Spot) The space This property has been selected for inclusion in The 100 Collection™, a global designation awarded to only the top professionally managed vacation rentals based on consistent quality and service. Situated right in the center of the vibrant downtown area, the Water Street Condo is a spacious architectural gem that is sure to delight. With three floors of living space, this brand new, impeccably designed home is an entertainer's dream. From the chef's kitchen featuring a custom waterfall bar to the two expansive decks, there is plenty of room for you and your guests to relax. The retractable doors leading to the main level patio help create the perfect indoor/outdoor experience, the ideal space to gather for al fresco dining on warmer days or you can enjoy listening to concerts at the Sprint Pavilion from your own private roof deck. Right outside your door is all of the best that Charlottesville has to offer- with C&O Restaurant across the street and the rest of the Downtown Mall less than a half block away, you can spend your afternoon exploring the promenade and immersing yourself in the heart of C'ville. During the temperate months, be sure to head to the seasonal farmer's market on the other side of the block to grab your Saturday morning coffee and other local delights. On the main living level, you will find an expansive living, dining and kitchen area and a covered patio. The wing located off the kitchen has two Queen guest bedrooms. There is a full bathroom in the hallway across from one guest room and the other guest room has an ensuite full bath, giving a hotel-like experience for your guests. On the next level you will find the master suite, complete with an open-concept bathroom and a spacious bedroom with a King. The top level has a desk for the travelling professional to retreat and work for the day and an expansive rooftop deck. With this rental, you receive access to one private garage parking space located in the Water Street garage. Access instructions will be emailed upon confirmation of your reservation. All other guests must find street parking or can park in the Water Street Parking Garage that is a block away for $12 overnight. **Please note that this property is located next to train tracks. Trains pass by several times a day and at least once at night.** There is no elevator in this unit! The main living space and 2 bedrooms are on the second floor, the third bedroom is on the third floor and the rooftop deck access on the fourth! First Floor: Private Entry with Coat Closet Second Floor: Upgraded Kitchen Living & Dining Area Queen Bedroom with TV & Ensuite Bathroom Queen Bedroom with TV Full Bathroom Outdoor Deck with Sliding Glass Doors & Great Views Third Floor: Master Bedroom with King Bed & TV Full Bathroom Open to the Bedroom with Heated Floors Washer/Dryer Fourth Floor: Desk Incredible Outdoor Space All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House during your stay. column66: Custom renovated, family home in the historic Belmont neighborhood of Charlottesville. Well appointed space, embracing a blend of mid century style. Walkable to some of CVille's best restaurants and breweries. Easy 5 min walk to the Downtown Mall, Sprint Pavilion, and Arts Park. Great neighbors, in a tree-lined, family friendly part of town. Easy access to the burgeoning Cville wine scene, Grounds for alumni events and walks down memory lane. The space We are new to Hosting on AirBnB, but not a stranger to using the service, and hope that we can recreate some of our best experiences for you. We love Cville and can furnish recommendations for restaurants and bars, as requested. Some of our favorites are just a stones throw from the house. The house is originally from the 1910-20s, and we have carefully renovated to preserve the historic charm, original hardwoods, and trim details. All systems are up to date for the comforts of modern living; best of both worlds. Other things to note We have streamlined access to the Green House so that you can check in/out with an August Lock access. We can be flexible with your groups arrival/departure, as needs arise; just let us know! When you book, download the app, and link your AirBnb account to the August Lock app. Please remember, out of respect to our neighbors and the neighborhood, no parties or large outdoor events

column55: Nice rancher style home located in the heart of the Belmont area of Charlottesville. Walking distance to Belmont’s hot spot restaurants, bars and the Downtown Mall. A very short drive to the UVA Campus and The Historic Monticello. Professionally cleaned after each stay. Transportation available through Mario’s Transportation Service. Winery Tours, Wedding Partys and Airport Services. Servicing CHO, RIC, IAD, DCA and BWI drop offs. Groups welcome. The space This home has two bedrooms, one queen bed in each room. Both rooms have flat screen T.V.'s. The living room has ample space with a flat screen TV, and a mini fridge for your convenience. Guest access Our guest will have access to two clean private bed rooms, and one private bath. Linens and bath towels provided. The living room is equipped with a mini fridge. Shared large backyard with outdoor patio seating, and a gazebo. Other things to note The Historic Monticello, Carter's Mountain Orchard and multiple vineyards and breweries are a short drive away. We are six minutes away from UVA (1.5 miles). Host is not responsible for injuries or accidents during your stay.
column62: Newly Renovated Walk To Downtown Mall
column65: {error": "Missing price line items: Listing has no availability"}"

column66: Private, fully fenced-in, light, airy and open house nestled in the heart of the city. The space The modern treehouse retreat is the perfect getaway, offering a beautifully curated designer interior great for groups + families-with three bedrooms, two bathrooms, and open concept living. Fully renovated, light, and peaceful- this oasis is a piece of paradise in the heart of the city. All new appliances and high end upgrades throughout the home including soft linens, west elm furniture, wrap around porch, Cali-king organic latex mattress, soaking tub, and basic cable/high-speed internet. With a gorgeous wraparound porch and a designer kitchen that opens up to the large living and dining area, this home offers plenty of space to enjoy your meals indoors or outdoors. Designed with our love for cooking in mind, this newly renovated kitchen boasts counter to ceiling subway tile, a beautiful quartz waterfall island, 5-burner slide in gas range, french door refrigerator with water filter system, and a Bosch dishwasher. Not looking to cook? Our home is centrally located in a beautiful, walkable neighborhood full of new restaurants and bars. You and your guests will be a short walk to The Corner, the Historic Downtown Mall, and amazing restaurants off of West Main Street. The modern treehouse retreat is an ideal location for exploring UVA’s Grounds, taking a day trip through Route 151’s wineries and breweries, or going on a beautiful hike through the Blue Ridge Mountains. This home offers plenty of space for a memorable family vacation or a peaceful getaway unique to Charlottesville, VA. Guest access - 1 Cali king size bed with organic latex mattress and west elm bedding - 1 Queen European pillow top mattress - 1 Full deluxe mattress - Access to queen size blow up mattress upon request - Living room with beautiful West Elm Crosby 2 piece sectional with chaise - 2 Full bathrooms - Bath linens - Full sized washer/steam dryer - Bosch Dishwasher - Fully upgraded open concept kitchen - Stainless steel appliances - Artisanal dinnerware and modern flatware - Microwave (upon request, stored away) - Smart TV - High-speed internet - Radiator heating and central air with smart sensi temperature control - Gas fireplace - Large wraparound porch with suspended swing and additional seating - Private fenced-in yard - Access to permitted street parking for up to 2 cars (upon request) - Wireless home security system - August smart lock with smart keypad and doorbell cam - You will have access to the entire home except for our son’s nursery and main bedroom closet. Other things to note There can be no events or parties at our home. There can also be no gatherings at our home with any visitors that are not included in the booking without our prior approval and additional paid fees. Additional visitors will entail additional charges for tenants. We have an illy espresso maker (with eco-friendly reusable pods) and French press available for your use during your stay.
column73: Modern Victorian Treehouse | Btwn UVA +Dtwn Cvill

column75: Just a 5 minute walk to the downtown mall. This place is amazing! You will not find a better location in Charlottesville! The space This is a very cool cottage located on McIntire Road just a 5 minute walk from the downtown mall. It is the closest house to the downtown mall on McIntire Road. The house has two bedrooms and a loft all with Queen size beds. The loft bedroom is accessed by way of a very unique ship's ladder which makes you feel like you're sleeping in a luxury fort (people staying in the loft should have the physical ability to climb a ladder). This house will very comfortably sleep three couples. Not to worry, I am a superhost and you will not be disappointed, this place is really nice. However, please be mindful that this is a family owned residence and try to keep things quiet, tidy, and respectful. Guest access There's a key outside in a lockbox. You will be given the code when you rent the house. Other things to note Not at this time but please ask.
column82: Downtown Cottage Walk to the Mall!

column41: Charming Victorian remodeled by architects with a wonderful vibe. Ikea kitchen. Perfect space for relaxing with family and friends. Secluded garden. Health center, walking mall, eclectic restaurants, transit all within 5 min walk. UVa 10 mins by car. The space It's all shabby-chic with exposed brick, distressed cabinets, high ceilings, hardwood floors, original artworks by family and friends. There's a lovely secluded garden out back with Wisteria-covered deck, hammock, pond and hand forged fire pit. We love it and you will too! Guest access Bedrooms--Master (TemperPedic King), Bedroom 2 (Queen), Bedroom 3 (two twins), Bedroom 4 (full). Access to attic prohibited. TV—Please access movies/shows on your own devices via free wifi. Bathrooms--There's full bathroom (toilet, sink, bath/shower) on the second floor, and new shower/WC/sink on first floor. Internet--Wifi with strong signal. Kitchen items—Access to plates, pots, utensils, juicer, blender and basic supplies, including decent coffee and tea. Parking—Always available on our street. Max 3 vehicles. Towels & Linens—We provide these and refresh them too. Heat & Air Conditioning—All in good order. Toiletries—Hairdryer, soap, shampoo etc - let us know what you need. Outdoors--covered porch, chairs and table, fire pit, gas grill, pond, hammock. Financial Times is delivered daily. Other things to note We have a black lab who loves everyone. We can take JJ with us, or leave her if you'd like company.

column87: We welcome you to enjoy our cozy, clean and light-filled home on a quiet street in the Charlottesville neighborhood of Belmont. The space Our 2,200 square foot, three story home features a middle level with two bedrooms, one full bathroom, an open living / dining room area, and kitchen. The upper level is a brand new bedroom suite with a beautiful lofted ceiling, roof deck and private bathroom with tile shower and private toilet. The finished portion of the lower level serves as a large playroom / second living room. The unfinished portion contains a washer/dryer, treadmill, office nook and storage space. The home, fully renovated in 2021, features solid oak and tile flooring. The home is especially suited for singles, couples, and families with up to 4 children. The lovely back yard is fully fenced in and features a play set, trampoline, table and chairs, fireplace, and grill. Guest access All spaces are accessible to our guests except use of the treadmill and shed. Other things to note We ask that you be good stewards of our neighborhood by being courteous and respectful toward our neighbors, as we desire to build and maintain quality relationships.
column94: Family-friendly 3BR on quiet street in Belmont

column34: Beautiful home in the heart of downtown Charlottesville. Just steps away (literally!) from some of the best area restaurants in the Belmont area and just a short walk to the downtown mall. This home is full of 1920s charm but has been fully renovated with every modern convenience. The yard gives a feel of being in the country right in the middle of the city with a playset for families to make use of and beautiful gardens. For UVA visitors, we are only 2 miles from UVA.

column41: Jeff Studio 302: Each room is individually furnished, with a distinct personality. Think effortless cool, creamy suede, and desert colors with pops of quirky humor. To ensure privacy and true getaway vibes, The Jeff was designed to be entirely self-service (no front desk or need for check-in). Upon booking, you will receive a unique code that gives you access to your room. The space Jeff Studio 302: Each room is individually furnished, with a distinct personality. Think effortless cool, creamy suede, and desert colors with pops of quirky humor. To ensure privacy and true getaway vibes, The Jeff was designed to be entirely self-service (no front desk or need for check-in). Upon booking, you will receive a unique code that gives you access to your room. The Jeff Hotel Studios feature a luxurious, custom-made king bed - perfect to settle down in after a hard day’s rockin’ with a flat screen TV. A Marshall amp speaker is provided to kick back and enjoy your favorite tunes. Each room is equipped with a Nepresso machine. Our spacious en-suite bathrooms boast high ceilings and walk-in showers. Purchase of each room comes with one, single-use parking voucher ($12 max) for the nearest parking garage – about a 3-minute walk from the entrance. Being on a pedestrian mall the hotel has no on-site parking, but we think that having Cville’s most popular bars, restaurants and music venues mere steps away is a great trade-off! Other amenities: •High speed internet •Clothes steamer •Hair dryer •Heating and cooling •24-hour guest support *Note – The Jeff Hotel is located in a historic building above the nationally renowned Jefferson Theater so it has no elevator. Each room is only accessible via stairs, in some cases multiple flights. Due to the active nature of the theater below, there will be times where there may be crowds outside of the main entrance waiting for an event or during an event. Pet Friendly Room with $75 pet fee! 1 dog max. Please mention to us that you plan to bring a pet. We will charge a $150 fee if we are not notified of pets staying in the space. Please do NOT leave pets unattended in the space, unless crated. Guest access One, single-use parking voucher is provided in the room for the nearest parking garage (3-minute walk). Unique codes will be provided for entry. Stairs are required. column51: Corner 1 Bedroom Unit Overlooking Downtown Mall (Like Oceanfront Property). Walk to Restaurants, NightlIfe, & Boutique Shops. Parking Included. Above Popular Old Metropolitan Hall The space This property has been selected for inclusion in The 100 Collection™, a global designation awarded to only the top professionally managed vacation rentals based on consistent quality and service. Situated in Charlottesville's historic downtown and completely renovated in 2021, this 1 BR, 1.5 BA 2nd floor walk-up apartment represents what locals love: history and the Downtown Mall. Located on the corner of 1st and Main with views of the Downtown Mall, this lovely one bedroom encompasses the heart of Charlottesville and is at the center of great cuisine, art, theatre, live music, and incredible spectating. With its original heart pine floors, this apartment boast quality and craftsmanship with features like granite counters, 6 ft tall windows overlooking the Mall, 9 ft ceilings, and modern design furnishings. The location can't be beat in the middle of the downtown action!  We like to note to future guests that this is a popular area (especially on the weekends) and the noise level on the Downtown Mall may be higher particularly on Friday and Saturday evenings. There is an event venue below the apartment that may have considerable activity into the late evening (12:00am). Amenities:King Bed (with full en suite bath) Queen Pull-out Sofa Half Bath Washer/Dryer Standard Drip Coffee Maker Wi-Fi Apple TV/ Local Channels w/ HD Antenna Overlooks Downtown Mall One Free Parking Discount code provided for the public lot behind the building All guests of Stay Charlottesville receive exclusive access to Common House. Common House is a local membership based social club that offers a unique space to work, dine, and engage. There is a co-work space available during weekdays, a full service restaurant offering breakfast, lunch, and dinner as well as a roof-top terrace with sweeping views of Charlottesville.
column58: Old Met #202 |  1 BR  overlooking Downtown Mall

column71: This is a newly built addition to our property, but is a separate 2 BR apartment with an equipped kitchen/living room and one bathroom. One bed is a queen, one is a double. Your entrance is separate, but we share a courtyard and driveway. The front stoop is just a few steps from your parking spot (there are 5 steps down, and one up) and a balcony in the back that looks over our backyard. Grad weekend 2025 booked at separate listing, airbnb.com/h/RRR-UVAgraduation (three night minimum). The space Convenient, quiet and private apartment, with everything you need! Newly built addition to owners' house. Easy keyless check-in. Blazing wifi, 250 mps, more than ample speed to work from home, have multiple zoom meetings, or stream web content. Smart TV (for your Netflix/Amazon, etc)- local broadcast channels only (no cable). You can input signal from your laptop to the TV via an HDMI jack also. Bluetooth stereo- play your music from your phone. Coffee, tea and food in the fridge or cupboards is for you to enjoy. Outdoor balcony outside of bedrooms, looks out into backyard. Plenty of overhead fans inside and out. Kitchen has a superfast induction stove and compatible cookware. High quality filtered tap water. New appliances. EV charging station (level 2), 32A. Great central location, close to most everything in town, including the University, without the noise. Quiet and safe residential neighborhood, great for walking. Many excellent restaurants nearby. Blocks away from Barracks Road Shopping Center (more restaurants, pharmacy, shopping) and Dairy Market. Easy driving distance to local breweries and wineries. Garden courtyard in the front- you can have some of our homegrown tomatoes, in season. The back balcony overlooks the yard. There is a chicken coop with about 8 hens in a corner of the yard. We host many families- children older than 7 considered. Feel free to let us know about any needs you have. We are happy to help with information or amenities. Price includes 8% city occupancy tax. Guest access Parking in driveway for 1 car; advance notice needed if you need parking for 2 cars in driveway. Additional street parking also available. Bedrooms open up onto your own balcony, which is adjacent to our family patio. Please do not use the trampoline. Other things to note This is a duplex; we live in the other half. Shared driveway, separate entrances. We are readily available to assist you! Community Fee" is the Charlottesville occupancy tax (8%) plus Virginia sales tax (5.3%). Again

column75: Add your story to this well-loved home where three beautiful children had roots, grew wings, and flew away. Nothing too modern or fancy, just a welcoming cared-for space on a peaceful wooded lot in an established neighborhood cul-de-sac close to all-things Charlottesville. Within a five-mile radius: Scott Stadium, UVA Rotunda, Downtown Pedestrian Mall, JPJ Arena, Saunders-Monticello Trail, Carter Mountain Orchard One mile from Route 64 and 5th Street Station (Wegmans, Alamo Drafthouse Cinema) The space Main Floor: Relax in the TV room; read, work or play piano in the study; socialize in the great room which is open to the dining area and kitchen. Half bath on this level. Second Floor: Enjoy private space and a great night's sleep in one of the four bedrooms. Two full baths on this level. Outdoors: Savor a cup of morning tea on the deck, or on a crisp evening, relish watching the sun set in the backyard woodlands. Guest access This listing includes the top two floors of the home. During your stay, owner may be in basement level with private entrance.

column67: Located in the National Register Ridge St. Historic District, this bright, beautiful Victorian home is just a two minute walk to historic Downtown Mall and vibrant W. Main District and 5 min drive to UVA grounds. Entire house with off-street parking. Visit Virginia Wine Country with a curated tour. No events or parties allowed per Airbnb rules. The space Enjoy the quintessential Charlottesville experience of the Downtown Mall and W. Main St, both literally less than a 2 min walk from this grand Victorian home. You are a 5 min drive from the university grounds and UVA facilities and the new Wegman's shopping center. Walk to movie theaters, Cville's best restaurants, live music venues, live theatre, the Paramount Theatre and more. For a Wine Country tour, company driver can pick you up right at The Cottage to visit wine country for the day and drop you back off for another night of walking to enjoy the dining, music, movies or theatre life on Downtown Mall- Cville. Visit area breweries, cideries, distilleries, historical sites such as Monticello and Poplar Forest. Hike in the Blue Ridge Mountains, float on the James River. We can help you arrange any of these visits for a weekend perfectly suited for you and your friends and/or families. Just minutes off Interstate 64 and Rte 250 Bypass and less than 20 min to CHO airport. Below is a clear description of sleeping designations: SLEEPING SPACES: SECOND FLOOR: Bedroom 1: Queen bed Bedroom 2: Queen bed and twin hide-a-bed Room 3: Walk through room with wooden screen: 1 queen Bedroom 4: Full bed adjoining area with one set of bunks, sink in room MAIN FLOOR: Study with French doors: Full hide-a-bed Gathering room with door: Queen Murphy bed Other things to note If you decide to visit Ankida Ridge Vineyards, just let us know of your interest and we can help you plan your trip to one of the most beautiful vineyard views in the country and taste some of the finest wines on the East Coast (and I'm not exaggerating! :) Come see for yourself! Cheers!

column53: Belmont House has 4 bedroom / 2 bathroom combinations from private to shared for those traveling together. Email for pricing and options ranging from $99 upward. We are located within a 5 minute walk of the Historic Downtown Mall where you will find many restaurants, cinema, bars and shops. Parking is no problem and take the free Trolley 5 min through the historic areas 1.4 miles to UVA as well as other bus lines. The airport is a 20 minute drive. Special 4N min. The space Park your car for the duration of your stay and hop the various bus lines which seem to go everywhere with ease! The farmer's market on Saturdays is a great place to meander and catch some breakfast or just a 2 minute walk down to the Belmont historic main street offers great choice both for breakfast or a drink/dinner in the evening. The neighborhood is great to walk around after dinner yet you are a stone's throw from the downtown mall where everything you could want is available. Guest access At Avon House the greatest compliment you give your host is to make yourself at home! Bring in groceries, use the kitchen and above all, ask for anything you need and I will try my best to help. During your stay I am available but try not to be intrusive and if guests need the kitchen if possible I let them have the run of it.
column60: Belmont House  Double Bedroom - Downtown Mall

column52: Recently renovated first floor home just minutes from downtown in the hip Belmont neighborhood. Master Bedroom with queen bed and en-suite private bathroom. Guest bedroom has a double bed and adjacent bathroom. Modern kitchen with breakfast nook and an adjacent bistro porch. Walking distance to the best restaurants the city has to offer as well as the popular Downtown Mall and IX Art Park. The University of Virginia and Monticello are each just a short drive away. The space Recently renovated first floor home just minutes from downtown in the hip Belmont neighborhood. Master Bedroom with comfy queen bed with custom made bed frame and connected private bathroom. Guest bedroom has a double bed and an adjacent modern bathroom. Modern kitchen with brand new appliances, gas range; with breakfast nook, bar stools and an adjacent bistro porch. The living room has a television with cable and AppleTV.

column52: Newly renovated historic brick home corner Avon/Belmont Ave on tree-lined Belmont area, free parking & a 5 minute walk to downtown mall w/restaurants, cinema, bars, shops/buses. Take free trolley 10 minutes to UVA or enjoy a 45 minute walk through the pedestrianized mall & Main St. Room has super kingsize bed (is ziplock so also makes into twin beds) There are two bathrooms, one w/ clawfoot tub/shower and other a shower room. Have coffee on the porch! Walk to outdoor market! Airport 20 min. The space Unlike many houses, the tall ceiling height on the 1st floor is the same as the ground floor living area providing Belmont bedrooms with an open feel. Guest access All of the living areas on the ground floor are available to everyone! During your stay If you don't know Charlottesville as I didn't when I came, google the Belmont Historic District and learn what a fantastic location it is for not only the nearby downtown mall and bus station with the free trolley to campus but its own historic main street 2 minutes walk to great restaurants and bars. The best homemade pizza place in town is equally close! Other things to note Parking, unlike a lot of guest houses, is not a problem ever, both on street and off if preferred.

To ensure privacy and true getaway vibes, The Jeff was designed to be entirely self-service (no front desk or need for check-in). The Jeff Hotel Suites feature a luxurious, custom-made king bed - perfect to settle down in after a hard day’s rockin’, two flat screen TVs, and a seating area with an additional sofa bed (Suite 202 has a double sized-pullout) and large windows overlooking the Downtown Mall. A Marshall amp speaker is provided to kick back and enjoy your favorite tunes. Each room is equipped with a wet bar, mini-fridge, and Nespresso machine. Our spacious en-suite bathrooms boast high ceilings, skylights, and walk-in showers. Purchase of each room comes with one, single-use parking voucher for the nearest parking garage – about a 3-minute walk from the entrance. Being on a pedestrian mall the hotel has no on-site parking, but we think that having Cville’s most popular bars, restaurants and music venues mere steps away is a great trade-off! Other amenities: •High speed internet •Clothes steamer •Hair dryer •2 heating and cooling zones •24-hour guest support *Note – The Jeff Hotel is located in a historic building above the nationally renowned Jefferson Theater and has no elevator. Each room is only accessible via stairs, in some cases multiple flights. Due to the active nature of the theater below, there will be times where there may be crowds outside of the main entrance waiting for an event or during an event. column88: Favors UVA med /grad student types on short rotations. (Not taking traveling nurses yet unless they graduated from UVA). Private room and bathroom, own frig/freezer. We encourage cooking in our great kitchen! Large bright LR/dining rm. 4 UVA degrees in family but we’re out sailing sometimes! ON-SITE PARKING. UVA & City bus 1 blck. 15 min walk to Hospital (Madison/14th). Slowly updating outside so may look a bit ruddy! No smokers/vapors (even outside); we have no pets and sorry but no pet rule. The space Please make sure you’ve mapped our property. We shy away from people asking “how far is it to…” (unless you’re from overseas and need help) because it indicates they didn’t bother to read our descriptions herein where we have provided the most detail we’re permitted to give w/out giving out the actual address, which isn’t permitted (nor safe). This is a single family home. We live and work at home (mostly because our offices and bedroom are downstairs) but have lots going on. In the summer we are often off sailing a week here a week there. I’m a ‘84 and ‘13 graduate (past UVA engineering prof), w/ 2 alum millenials : ‘14 (engineering) at Intel in Oregon and ‘15 math major in NYC doing her hedge fund thing! So we have space to help rotating med students, interns and other UVA-affiliated visitors. No other people but us will be here renting while you’re here. Rarely but it happens, one or both of our 2 millennials will return for something and their rooms are on the other side from yours. (But they’re funny and smart and love meeting all those who’ve intersected with them when renting here!) These are your “location” hints for mapping but the circle on the map is indeed almost spot on. Our place is one long block from the Madison Street/Washington park UVA bus hub. Also a few steps from the City bus trolley. And a few houses off of famous Rugby Road (so we are between Rugby and Madison on Preston Ave.) Lots of parking in front on Preston but your spot is the one in front of the front door. Room: Private Queen bedroom and bathroom (shower). 1/2 size refridge w/ freezer (about 4 ft tall 1.5 ft wide so larger then a dorm fridge) in your own room for your food. Hi-speed wi-fi, basic cable TV in your room. Dresser, couch, small closet, queen-sized bed, allthe linens, blankets, comforter and pillow choices you could want/ get! Preston Avenue is a main 2-way 2-lane street with a light in the next block so you have access to everything in 3 directions (downtown historic mall 30 min walk south; to hospital/UVA Rotunda 15 min walk west; 20 min walk (north) to Barrack’s Rd shopping center all somewhat equi-distant). NOTE: if you're a light light sleeper, think about if this is for you. We just changed out all the windows in the house (2020) to beautiful double-paned windows but if you need absolute dead silence, even a bird chirp irritates you, this might require you to stay at a place farther out of town. Good news is you won’t hear any noise from us from in the house and it’s not an apartment building! Because we basically live and work downstairs. Central A/C / heat. Great kitchen with everything from sous vide to slow cooker to electric/ oven stove, blender, coffee every morning at 7 am by my husband. (Starbucks Morning Blend he grinds up at night when we’re here.) Keurig-type maker within the coffee machine available for your own K-Cups also. We love meeting new people but we expect you’re here to study or make classes and we respect that! If you’re here because you need to work at home, we’re unlikely to approve that as we aren’t looking for roommates. We work at home (downstairs) and always have. And the house is too small to accommodate those that will spend a bulk of their time in the house. But don’t hesitate to indicate your circumstances and ask. Guest access Front door access. Parking on premises right out front in upper parking lot next to my husband’s BMW. You come right in the front door. Gravel front parking lot (until we finish upgrading the outside of the property. We just dug out and had installed new drainage around entire property down 8 ft so if you’re looking for a beautiful outside of a house 2022-2023 probably aren’t the years! ) During your stay We live and work at home (office work) and have for years. So one of us is usually around, and we manage our real estate holdings. But we have a sail boat and travel also. We love it when our guest grabs their bowl of cereal or in the case of med students, microwaved meal and shares the large dining room table or spreads out their work there. But we also have many that get up in the dark morning hours and head to their rotations and get back very late who we don’t see much. Just let us know. Starbucks Coffee ground and made for all of us at 7 am by my husband. If we drink it all, we’ll make more! Full kitchen / cooking use expected and hoped for (like the Big Chill movie!) including use of all our condiments (but you get your own small fridge freezer in room for your items as fridge not big enough for both of us!) If you intend to have any family or guests come to town to see you (including drop off and pick up for those getting ferried here), you’ll need to book a hotel for them or in the case of a spouse or significant other you can stay with them there. This location is intended for people working hard to earn degrees or accreditations or teaching at UVA. And conjugal visits are really weird in a house this “cozy”. And, well, Covid. We’re fully vaxxed and boosted (a/o Oct 2021) and my husband had Omicron in Jan 2022. The rest is a crap shoot. We don’t care if you are vaxxed or not but we don’t wear masks in our home. The rest is your life your choice. However, if you do get Covid while here and have to be quarantined and stay home, we’re here and you can stay and ride it out. No problem. We’ll get you some chicken soup! Study or work right outside your door at the large dining room table. We’re rarely upstairs except for making meals and then taking them downstairs to eat, work or watch a movie ! But we share the living room, dining room, kitchen and that LR tv with you so that is considered “shared space” though we have duplicates of that downstairs. Back porch with table and chairs faces east for morning coffee if you’re so inclined and feel free to play the piano! Other things to note We love interesting people and we love helping UVA-bound rotaters coming to town. You can bike from here to UVA as we do for football and basketball games (10-15 minutes), and you can take the bus to UVA, the hospital. Or, you can just walk up Madison in about ~25 minutes to the UVA Hospital. We are equidistant to Barrack's Road Shopping Center as we are to Shenandoah Joe's. But if you're coming without a car like from another country which we get often, the city bus stop is a house away for groceries at Barrack's Road Kroger or Harris Teeter or you just get them delivered for your little refrigerator.

column78: A wonderfully unique house 4 blocks from the Downtown Mall and close to UVA sleeps six. Hard to describe its awesomeness in words, so please view the pictures and find the video for a better feel for a place which is simultaneously old and new! The space The Recycled House is a unique structure in Charlottesville's lovely North Downtown neighborhood. It is constructed primarily from materials that have come from somewhere else and are getting a second life. It took over six years to collect the materials and use them in a thoughtful way. The house was designed as a guest house and a lot of effort has been put into building a place that's welcoming, interesting and fun! The materials give the place a lot of soul, the light from the 33 windows is fantastic and the location could not be better! Charlottesville's historic Downtown Mall is just 4 short blocks away giving you access to over 60 restaurants within walking distance as well as movie theaters, concert venues, grocery stores and some great shopping. The University of Virginia is less than 2 miles away and accessible by the free trolley service. Monticello is less than 5 miles away--about 10 minutes by car. There's a king-sized bed in the main bedroom. The upstairs loft has a sleeper sofa that sleeps two, and there's a queen-sized sofa sleeper downstairs in the living room. All the linens and towels are provided. The kitchen is fully equipped with top-of-the-line Bosch appliances. There's a side porch, an upstairs deck outside with a treehouse feel, and another deck (made out of aluminum bleachers!) off the kitchen in the back yard. There's a grill in the backyard you're welcome to use. A washer/dryer is available off the upstairs bath. Free wi-fi access is available. The house is suitable for families with children. The staircase is a little steep, so you'll have to watch the little ones. If you're searching for a really unique space in a great location, I welcome you to The Recycled House! Guest access I don't live in The Recycled House. It's yours to enjoy. Other things to note The house is not baby-proofed. I have hosted many families with little ones, but the house is probably best suited to kids 3 years and older. The stairs are quite steep and can be challenging for little ones and older folks. When inquiring, please tell me a little bit about yourself, the purpose of your visit, and any special needs or requests.

column63: Located in beautiful Downtown Charlottesville, this historic 1830s treasure is the longest-standing Row House in the city, Located one block away from the Downtown Mall in the beautiful Historical Courthouse Square Section of Downtown Sleeps 8-10, includes full kitchen, has spacious living & dining room areas. Washer & dryer available for stays of ONE WEEK or more. Please shut off the a/c and lock the doors when you leave. Please do not use the fireplaces - they are not in working order.

The Do Drop Inn" is a charming

column73: English Basement with private entry at a downtown Charlottesville estate listed on the National, State and Local historic registries. Only one mile from the Downtown Mall and just off Rt 250, meaning easy access to attractions in all directions. Brand new carpet! Fiber internet - 1,000MBPS! The space Built in 1859, Enderly was originally the preeminent home of the Locust Grove neighborhood and later served as a tourist home taking overflow from the Monticello Hotel just off the downtown mall in court square (now the Court Square condos). Once surrounded by an orchard, this city home still offers beautiful landscaping including a secret garden, large old magnolia tree, vegetable garden, and two outbuildings boasting historic character. The English basement offers a private entry on the ground level, just beneath the home's front door. Inside the unit you will find two bedrooms and two full baths. There is also plenty of room for a blow up Queen air mattress which is available. Kitchen includes all pots, pans, dishes, silverware, coffee, etc. along with seating for four. The living room offers a 50 TV equipped with Apple TV and Netflix subscriptions. Adjoining the living room is a wet bar with mini fridge and second microwave. Laundry is shared with the owners who live upstairs and is easily accessible in the rear of the basement. Two parking spaces directly in front of the entry are provided. Unrestricted street parking is also available."

History buffs will enjoy visiting Thomas Jefferson's Monticello, James Madison's Montpelier or any of the Civil War sites in the area. Wine/beer lovers, artisans and antique shoppers will also find plenty to explore. Anyone in search of a peaceful country getaway will be right at home in either the Riverside or Fieldside apartment at Edgewood Farm. Other things to note The barn loft apartments, both Riverside & Fieldside, are located on the second floor, up a significant staircase. Sorry, no elevator is available. Each apartment has a private entrance off a common sitting room at the top of the stairs. The Cottage is our latest addition located next door to the main farm house. It is on one level with a handicap accessible ramp. For information regarding our Barn at Edgewood for Weddings & Events, visit our website called Barn at Edgewood" in Stanardsville

column72: Fulton Belle Vue is a completely renovated Farmhouse conveniently located in the heart of the 151 Brew Trail and close to many breweries, wineries, distilleries and restaurants. Lovely outdoor spaces with a screened in porch to enjoy your morning coffee or relax in the afternoon. The house was built in early 1900's; the bedrooms are large, kitchen is spacious and open and there's a large family room with lots of seating. We'd love to host you for your next weekend getaway or special event. The space The Farmhouse is named after Fulton Henderson who lived in the house for many years. People say he would sit on the front porch in the evenings singing and playing the banjo. We’ve tried to preserve as much of the history of the house as we could while completely updating the kitchen and bathrooms. The kitchen table can seat 12 people, 5 bedrooms can sleep up to 11 people. There's a beautiful front porch with rocking chairs, and the back has a deck and screened in porch. The kitchen has all the amenities for cooking and we have an outdoor grill as well. This is our 2nd Renovation and our newest listing in the Afton area, heart of Nelson County Breweries and Wineries. We are Airbnb Superhosts so check out Rockfish Farmhouse to see reviews on our first property. Please contact us if you have questions about the property and we'll be updating this listing with more pictures and details. Guest access You will have access to the entire house. Other things to note Breweries and distance (miles) from our house. Always check on-line to confirm hours and services. Blue Mountain Brewery (Food) – 3 Brewing Tree Brewing Co. (Food) – 1.5 Wild Wolf Brewing Co. column46: Private basement suite in historic Woolen Mills. Walk to the downtown mall, Belmont, and the brand new Wool Factory ships and restaurants. Private entrance with self check in. One bedroom with queen bed and en suite bathroom. The futon in the common space has a queen size memory foam mattress, can quickly and easily be set up as a queen bed. Mini fridge, toaster oven, dishes and eating area. TV with roku, good WiFi. Flexible check in with prior approval. The space The house is brand new. Beautiful finishes. Has it’s own HVAC so guests can control the thermostat. There is a mini fridge, coffee maker and toaster oven as well as flatware, plates, bowls, glasses. Private entrance. Off street parking for up to two cars. Use of beautiful deck and big backyard is welcome. Other things to note Cleaning protocol: I take covid cleaning seriously! Everything gets washed, sheets, towels, bath mat, throw blankets, duvet, shams. I wipe all touch surfaces including light switches, tv remote, thermostat and of course door knobs. Plus vacuuming, mopping and all the usual cleaning one would expect. I wear a mask and gloves while cleaning and use bleach where appropriate. I also provide spray disinfectant for you to use if you like. My reviews speak for themselves, our place is clean!

column50: Shire Suite is a very unique handcrafted Suite with plenty of amenities inside and out. Located on 25 acres at the foot of the Blueridge Mountians and built within a 5,000 square foot barn. The space Welcome to White Lotus Eco Spa Retreat, your destination for tranquility and wellness in Greene County. Our lodging and event space offers a range of spa services, including Swedish massages and invigorating Thai massages, with the added benefit of a woodstove sauna, known for promoting relaxation and detoxification. Situated just a 16-minute drive from Shenandoah National Park, our retreat provides easy access to numerous hiking trails for nature enthusiasts. Immerse yourself in our diverse offerings, from hosting weddings and community events to facilitating wellness retreats that foster connections and creativity. Set on 25 acres, our main property features serene ponds, resident geese, ducks, and abundant wildlife, creating a peaceful environment for relaxation and reflection. The Zen Barn at White Lotus Eco Spa Retreat, our main event space and sanctuary for communal gatherings. Housing five suites, this unique venue boasts a conference room, a communal kitchen, and a movie theatre available for private reservations. Find tranquility in the meditation room or relax in the skylounge within the beautifully crafted interior made of wood, featuring posts that resemble trees, creating a truly distinctive atmosphere. Stay connected with our included WiFi as you immerse yourself in the serene surroundings. The Zen Barn's grand hall, with its unique and captivating design, serves as the central space for larger events and gatherings. Whether it's a conference, a shared meal, or a movie night, the Zen Barn is a versatile and welcoming space for a variety of occasions.
column57: Shire Suite at White Lotus Eco Spa retreat

column48: Beautiful, petite guest suite with garden level private entrance and patio. This private nook is a serene and quiet space, ideal for one or two people. The space This space has a queen-sized bed, lovely antique and vintage furnishings, tv with Roku, eclectic selection of books, a newly re-finished bathroom, mini-fridge, coffeemaker, and microwave. Guest access You will have full and private access to this room and bath suite, which is a one-room studio with private entrance on the ground level of my home. Other things to note There are three other spaces in my home where I accommodate monthly guests. Please be conscious and respectful of the presence of others while out in the yard and parking areas.

column71: Luxury furnished 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo adjacent to University of Virginia Medical Center and a quick walk to downtown/UVa Grounds. Enjoy this bright, airy, updated space, completed with vaulted ceilings, stainless steel kitchen with Viking range, digital baby grand piano and 2 balconies. The space This spacious 2 bedroom 2 bathroom condo is flooded with natural light and offers everything you could need for a comfortable, furnished stay. Amenities include: - 2 renovated bathrooms with new flooring - master bath has a fully functional jetted jacuzzi tub - vaulted ceilings and skylights throughout - modern stainless steel kitchen featuring a Viking range - Bosch “Silent” dishwasher and brand new LG fridge - digital baby grand piano in living room - King bed is a 10 memory foam mattress that sits on a remote controlled adjustable base for the ultimate lazy Saturday experience - 55” Smart TV in living room on an articulating mount- easily watch your favorite show while cooking - 50” Smart TV in bedroom - spacious front balcony complete with a brand new stainless steel 4 burner grill and dining furniture. This balcony has 2 sides to it and doesn't have a divider- one side is for this condo and one side is for the neighbors. It feels very separate and the sides are easily defined - all of the windows/doors for this condo look out on this condo's "side" of the balcony
column72: so it remains very private. - back balcony off the master with a table and 4 chairs- ideal if you want to rent the condo with a roomie- you can have your own private outdoor space. - brand new washer/dryer that is located in a separate room in the building and shared with one other condo (where a young professional couple lives). There is keypad access to the laundry area. You do have to go outside and around the building to access the laundry. The guest bedroom is tiny but functional. It has a brand new full size bed and it’s own closet. The guest bedroom also has a stairway up to a loft storage area. The owner will maintain this space for their own private storage. This is the perfect spot for entertaining a small group of friends; there is so much room indoors and outdoors to host! This condo comes with one paid parking space that is located in a lot on 10th street
column73: about a half block from the condo. Parking is very limited in this area but there are almost always spots out front for the neighboring takeout restaurants where you can easily load/unload groceries
column74: etc. A car is not necessary to have a great experience here as the area is incredibly walkabe and Instacart will deliver groceries from all major stores directly to your door! Please note that there is an Asian quick-service takeout restaurant located below. Their food is incredibly good (a few of the sushi rolls and their dumplings are my personal favorite along with a lot of great standard Chinese dishes). They are open 10am-10pm daily minus Tuesdays. There is not much noise associated since it is not a sitd-own restaurant but you will note the door sometimes closing hard below you if you're in the living room of the condo. From the bedroom you can occasionally hear the faint sound of pots and pans being moved around. This has never been bothersome for guests/tenants and the benefit of this building is your are not stacked with condos all around like most downtown apartments. There is only one apartment next door with a working professional couple. The best sound machines are provided in each bedroom that are incredibly effective in drowning out any nighttime downtown noise (from ambulances going to the hospital

column55: Newly furnished third floor walk-up apartment with beautiful mountain views where Monticello & Carters Mountain reside. It is in an ideal location on the fringe of Belmont neighborhood -- minutes drive to bars and restaurants on the downtown mall (25 min walk) and downtown Belmont (15 minute walk) along with quick access to highway 64. This top level 2 bedroom apartment with a pull out couch, can sleep 6 people and is perfect for a family or friend group looking to explore Charlottesville! The space Newly furnished third floor walk-up apartment with beautiful views of the mountains where Monticello and Carters Mountain reside. It is in an ideal location on the fringe of Belmont neighborhood -- minutes drive to bars and restaurants on the downtown mall (25 min walk) and downtown Belmont (15 minute walk) along with quick access to highway 64 just down the road. All basic amenities are included along with a parking pass and plenty of off-street parking. Great for weekend getaway or home base while in Cville. This top level 2 bedroom apartment with a pull out couch, can sleep 6 people and is perfect for a small family or friend group looking to explore all Charlottesville has to offer! Please note this apartment is on the top floor with no elevator access - 3 flights of stairs required to access. **1 dog considered, please inform us whether you plan on bringing a dog as there is an additional $75 fee. - 1 space in lower level garage with pass from apartment; other cars park on street free *Maximum of 3 cars Guest access Guests have access to entire apartment. column68: The Residences at 218 is Charlottesville's premier, upscale condominium community, located just one block from the Historic Downtown Mall in a beautifully designed glass building offering spectacular 360-degree views of the City and mountains beyond. Unit 606 is a chic luxury condo with incredible views. Come experience the best Charlottesville has to offer! The space This condo is an incredibly modern gem, offering you a unique atmosphere while overlooking the heart of downtown and views of Mountains. We are sure that from the minute you walk through the door to the very end of your stay, you will be in utter awe of the space, finishes, and thoughtful touches in this condo. The large kitchen overlooks the spacious, yet cozy living and dining areas. Unbelievable views can be seen from every inch of the common area through the panoramic windows. The his and hers bathrooms (yes, bathrooms) in the master bedroom will make you never want to leave! This condo sleeps up to 7 guests in the two bedrooms, den, and sun room (4 sleeping rooms total). Sleeping Arrangements: Master bedroom - king bed Second bedroom - queen bed Den - full size pull out Sunroom - twin size daybed You are directly above the Historic Downtown Mall that is bursting with shopping, restaurants, theaters, nightlife, and so much more. You are less than 10 minutes to the beautiful campus of the University of Virginia; this condo puts you in an ideal location for UVA Graduation, Parents Weekend, Alumni Events, football and basketball games. Charlottesville is considered a destination wedding location due to the countless wineries, breweries, rolling hills and farms just on the outskirts of town. The hosts are not located on site, but are in town and will be able to assist you if you ever need us. Please do not hesitate to ask any questions, we are here and happy to help! Guest access Guests will have full access to the entire apartment. Other things to note This is a residential condo building with OTHER owners. All guests must be RESPECTFUL and QUIET in the commons areas. Please be mindful of EVERYONE in the building. This is access controlled building. You will receive a key card upon check-in. There is construction going on in and around the building during the week days. This should not hinder on your stay over the weekend, or after 4pm on the weekdays.

column65: The house is ideal for families with young babies and toddlers, but still comfortable for a group of adults as well. Enjoy the comfort and serenity of a quiet neighborhood, but the convenience of a 5 minute walk to the Downtown Mall. The space The Main Floor has an open floor plan, with the focus being the newly renovated kitchen. This flows into a dining room, which is near the living room. Towards the back of the house is full bathroom, and a children's playroom that has a pull out full bed. Upstairs, we have a full bathroom, two bedrooms with queen beds, one children's room with a bunk bed (1 twin, 1 full), and a nursery with a crib and children's cot that can also be used for an air mattress. The backyard is fenced in, with a massive wrap-around deck and a swing set. A note about our home if you’re thinking about booking it: This house was built in 1920; over the last 100 years there have been countless changes, additions and renovations. It is full of quirks and character. We think this and the way we had outfitted it for our small children makes for a fun and flexible city experience for families visiting Charlottesville. We love sharing this special home with traveling families looking for the convenience of walking downtown and built in baby/ toddler equipment. If you are looking for a more luxury experience, there are many other homes and hotels in our area that might be better suited for your stay! Other things to note Let us know if you are bringing young children, as we can make available things like a pak-n-play, stroller, car seats, a bike with a baby seat, etc. Or if you are a group of adults, we can store a lot of the kid's items elsewhere.

column68: Lise and I are excited to offer the beauty and convenience of our historic home to guests coming to Charlottesville. This has been our family home for more than 25 years and we welcome you into it. We are on the edge of UVa Grounds, three (3) blocks from the UVa Rotunda and “The Corner” restaurants and shopping. And we are walking distance to John Paul Jones Arena & Scott Stadium. The nearby free shuttle provides easy access to Downtown Mall restaurants, shopping, movie theater, etc. The space PRIVATE Space on 2nd floor includes: 1. 1st QUEEN ROOM: private bedroom with one queen bed, ceiling fan, chest of drawers, closet with hangers. 2. 2nd QUEEN ROOM: an adjoining private bedroom with one queen bed, ceiling fan, chest of drawers, closet with hangers. 3. Private upstairs BATHROOM which includes an antique clawfoot tub with a shower. Entrance to the bathroom is from the common hallway, immediately adjacent to the bedrooms. Note there is only one bathroom for both rooms. 4. The dedicated WORKSPACE: desk, chair, mini-fridge, Nespresso machine, electric tea kettle, reading chair, lamp, and ceiling fan. Ultra-high speed wifi connection (fiber optic 1,000 Mbps) throughout the space. SHARED Space with Host includes: 5. The LIVING ROOM: a large room off of the entrance foyer that includes comfortable seating, a fireplace, two ceiling fans, and a TV. 6. The FRONT YARD with native gardens. Includes outdoor table and two chairs. Guest access Guests have access on the 1st floor to the front foyer, the staircase, and the living room. Guests have access on the 2nd floor to the upstairs hallway, their private bedrooms, their private bathroom and their private dedicated workspace that are accessed from the hallway. Guests are welcome to enjoy the native gardens in the front yard that includes a table with two chairs. Note that there is no guest access to a kitchen or laundry room. During your stay Host and family members work from home, and one of us will likely be available to answer your questions in person during the day and evening. Our work from home includes often being on phone calls, video calls, or video meetings. So there may be times when we are present in the home but not available in the moment to answer your questions. During your stay, we ask that you support us in creating a relatively quiet environment that allows everyone in the home to enjoy the space. Other things to note We have two friendly dogs and a fenced yard. We want to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. We respect diversity and inclusion of all people. If there is something that would make your stay especially wonderful, let us know. We will strive to make it happen if it is feasible for us. Note: We have one other room available at our home ... A private Cozy Twin Room with a private bathroom, private entrance, screened porch and backyard area. airbnb.com/h/cvillequeenroom

column69: Welcome to the heart of the best that downtown Charlottesville has to offer! This 1945 home has been restored with love and is the perfect home base to explore the city from. Three bedrooms (including a first-floor bedroom with en suite bathroom), two new tiled bathrooms, and an updated kitchen will have you enjoying life's little luxuries in between your adventures in C-Ville! The house is just a 5-minute walk to the downtown mall, and a 15-minute walk to UVA. Available for rentals of 30+ days. The space We have put so much thought and love and time into renovating our historic home and we are excited to share it with you! We have tried to create a relaxing oasis of comfort and calm, while thinking through every detail to ensure an experience that will live on as part of your fond memories of Charlottesville, the city we love so much! We hope you enjoy our home as much as we do. Guest access The whole house is all yours! Other things to note Parking at the house is street parking only, being so close to downtown. There are no permits required and ample free street parking all around the house -- but the house does not have its own dedicated parking spot. Well-behaved pets are permitted for an extra fee of $100/month.

column51: The Hummingbird is a cozy, quiet, apartment in my home. It has a private entrance, is 2 rooms and is perfect for a getaway. It is centrally located in a quiet neighborhood. column69: NO AIRBNB SERVICE FEE ADDED TO THE LISTED PRICE! You are seeing the all-in price! Minimum stay is based on a total minimum rental amount of $1,000. However, we accept 2 day bookings on weekends (checking-in on a Friday) when the nightly rate is normally higher. We accept 3 day bookings if checking-in on a Thursday as well. Weekly discount and monthly discount also apply. We are flexible so if you can't book your desired dates, please feel free to send me a request. The space We cannot directly accept reservations as I need to check with the house manager first if she is available to turn the property around in between bookings. “La Maison des Ours” is located in Earlysville, VA. 15 minutes away from downtown Charlottesville. The house is set on 2 acres right off Earlysville Road, between the reservoir and the airport. The airport is 5 minutes away with direct flights to DC, Chicago, New York. This is the ideal vacation house for a couple with children. Or for parents visiting their kids at the university. It's fully equipped: full kitchen, washer/dryer, business corner with printer, BBQ grill, Cable TV, Wifi, central aircon/heating. The house has 3 bedrooms: a master bedroom with walk-in closet and ensuite bathroom; a guest bedroom and a kid’s bedroom with shared full 2nd bathroom. All located on the 2nd floor. On the 1st floor you will find a large open-kitchen with dining table, a study/office, a living/TV room, and a recreation room with a foosball table. There is a deck in the back with a BBQ grill. There is plenty parking space in the driveway. The garage is not available as it is being used for storage. The location is super quiet and the trees all around provide good privacy. The mall is 10 minutes away. It has good restaurants, Charlottesville’s first IMAX Theater, Pier One and a Trader Joe’s... Guest access Guests will have access to the entire house except for the garage.
