column87: Where old meets new! We’re a 1950’s brick home, recently uplifted with the addition of a front porch and an Italian limewash finish. Our refurbishment has been a labor of love and we hope you feel at home & love it too! We trust you to please take care of our home and be respectful of our neighbors. Traveling with children? NorthEast Park is an easy 3 minute walk, just two streets away. A walking trail along the Rivanna River is also just beyond the end of our street! The space You’ll be occupying the ‘main home’ on our property; our personal cottage (currently undergoing renovation) is down the end of the driveway. Really it could be the next door neighbor.. Disclaimer: Our cottage is work in progress; contractors ‘might’ come and go on weekdays. Our rates have been adjusted accordingly. Your key code for check-in will be sent to you the morning of your stay. WiFi and utilities are included in your rental. An additional bi-weekly or monthly cleaning fee can be added for long stays. No smoking, vaping or e-cigarettes are permitted inside the house. No unauthorized visitors are permitted unless otherwise notified in advance. Please avoid moving heavy items of furniture. This is our primary home and it would be expected that everything is returned to us, as it was found. Guest access Full access to the main home on the property.. ie. We’ll try to avoid interruptions on the weekends. During the week, some trades people might still be making progress but as best as we can, you will be notified beforehand.

column77: Welcome to this highly livable, fun 3-bedroom Charlottesville home that's conveniently located in the middle of everything! One of my favorite things is the possibility for single-story living -- two bedrooms are on the main floor with a full bath, kitchen, and main living spaces. The other bedroom is across the hallway and has a new yellow velvet bed with memory foam mattress. The dining area is right next to the kitchen and also has a laundry space off of it. The kitchen has 2 barstools at the island and comes fully stocked for cooking a standard meal. The bathroom has a brand new tiled stand up shower and working antique clawfoot tub. Gather around the 9' dining table for delicious meals made from the completely stocked kitchen that features a farmhouse sink, quartz countertops, custom cabinetry and stylish lighting to pull this rustic modern kitchen together. column70: If Thomas Jefferson went to Burning Man and hung out with Tim Burton a little too long, add in some rustic southern charm and that's what you get at Estouteville. This 220-acre farm is located 15 min from Monticello and 20 minutes from Charlottesville and UVA. It is a farm filled with art and sculptures, an endless variety of relaxing and creative spaces including luscious flower gardens, a treehouse, two large ponds, and pathways of endless sunset views of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Guest access Guests are allowed explore about 150 ares on the property but not enter the other buildings on the property without consent. The pool is shared when open and pool hours are 11a-8p on weekdays and 12p-4p on weekends unless given permission. The gardens, maze, treehouse, and ponds are completely accessible to guests. Cattle and other livestock are not to be approached, fed, or disturbed. Thank you!

column81: Relax in our newly renovated modern cottage set on 2 beautiful acres! Our cottage is set in the country surrounded by trees, pasture, and a small farm across the street but is just 5 miles North of Charlottesville. Bringing you right outside of some of the most famous wineries and amenities of our area while surrounded by peaceful and beautiful nature. We live on the neighboring property in a renovated barn on our own private 3 acres. You will have complete privacy unless you need us! The space The entire house is for your use, including the fully stocked kitchen, fiber wifi, washer, dryer, two common areas, 3 bedrooms, two full bathrooms, and newly painted patio with bistro lights and a propane fire pit! There are three levels to the cottage. The main level is open concept and holds the living room, dining room, and kitchen. Upstairs has a very large master bedroom with a king bed, full bed, and an attached newly renovated full bathroom. We enjoy natural materials and interior design with modern touches. You'll notice hand hewn beams when you walk in as well as our custom built island and pine herringbone floors. Enjoy dining on our custom built live edge wood slab dining room table. Guest access The entire house and surrounding two acres are for your use. We live in the neighboring property in our newly renovated barn on our own three acres. You will have complete privacy. Likewise we ask that you respect our privacy and do not come to our home but rather message us if you need something. Other things to note Wildlife does live on and around the property. There is a small farm across the street and you will see the cows grazing in the morning. Almost every night deer graze on the upper pasture. This year we have at least 8 deer! Also some birds we see regularly include cardinals, bluebirds, woodpeckers, and hawks. We have a very sweet outdoor cat that may venture over to the outside of your cottage. He’s a 9 year old black cat named Grey who is very friendly but still has his claws so don’t let your littles pull his tail, etc.

Other things to note Bodo's bagels (Cville Staple!), and Shenandoah Joe coffee are located on Preston Avenue right up the road. Marie Bette Bakery on this street has amazing pastries and brunch. Ace BBQ/Biscuit on Henry Av. has great breakfast. Tip Top on Pantops (town favorite!) for your old school big menu breakfast. Whole Foods is a 5 minute drive off of 250, and there is a Kroger and Harris Teeter at the Barracks Road shopping center, also 5 minutes away. For a Health Food Store, Integral Yoga is located on Preston Avenue. Breweries close by: Random Row, Kardinal Hall, Random Row, and Starr Hill. (all 3 right on Preston Av.). Breweries on Scenic Route 151- Blue Mountain( great food too!) Devils Backbone, and Bold Rock. Best pizza is Lampo. Lelos pizza on Pantops for by the slice or pie take out Best Tapas is MAS (got to get there early!). Aberdeen Barn is another staple if you are craving the Best Prime Rib in old school white table cloth setting. Burgers close by are Citizen Burger and Jack Browns, all on the Historic Downtown Mall. Fine dining you cannot go wrong with the Ivy Inn or Duner's in Ivy/rt 250( little ways out of town but well worth the drive) Want grab and go ? The Market right on Preston Avenue for great Sandwiches and Fried Chicken. Commercial Favorites like Chipotle, Five Guys, and Chick-fil-A are all at Barracks Road Shopping center.

column66: Welcome to this cute, peaceful, and conveniently located 3-bedroom Charlottesville home! Easily get to the downtown mall (less than 2 miles), UVA and the hospital (3 miles), or to Rt. 29. Sunlit and cozy, recently furnished, with a great kitchen, blazing fast fiber internet, and a private back deck, this house will be the perfect place to call home during your time in Charlottesville. Available for rentals of 30+ days. The space Well-behaved dogs are welcome to join you for an additional fee -- no cats please! Please note that pets are not allowed on the furniture and an additional cleaning fee will be assessed if we have to remove hair from the couches or beds. Thanks!

column78: The High Note Craftsman Cottage is ideal for couples, business travelers, small families, or groups of friends who are looking to stay close to downtown Charlottesville. It is ideal for 4 with King and Queen beds but can also sleep up to 6 ---Sleeper sofa is a top of the line queen sleep made by American Leather. The space -Large open kitchen with all cooking essentials provided -Extra fast Ting Fiber Wifi -King and Queen memory foam mattresses -Private parking for two vehicles -Bluetooth speaker for music enjoyment -Smart TV with Netflix and HBO Max provided -15-minute walk to downtown or 3-minute drive ***Please note that while being close to downtown Charlottesville, the street can be busy during the day and be somewhat noisy. However, we've provided sound insulating windows which help to dull the traffic noise, but some noise should be expected on a busy street. At night there is generally very minimal traffic as well. We are pet friendly (dogs only*), but please confirm with us if you'd like to bring along your pup. Dogs are $50 total. Please note that we ask that pet owners bring along pet beds as we do not allow for pets to be on the beds or furniture. The back yard is NOT fenced in. Guest access Dedicated guest parking in the back of the home for 2 vehicles. Short walk and drive to downtown Charlottesville. Other things to note This is an LGBTQIA friendly space and we welcome people from all nationalities, races, cultures, religions, and neurodiverse backgrounds.

column80: One story living at its finest. Centrally located in Northern Downtown Charlottesville, this cheerful home offers plenty of space ideal for 4-5 guests with two beds and one bathroom. With a private driveway and single story, this home is perfect for any person or occasion. The space Amenities: • King and Queen beds • No stairs** Single story home • Dog Friendly! Allowed with prior approval and $50 per pet fee. Please clean up after your pet. • Good size kitchen with all cooking appliances and essentials provided • Fast Wifi • Smart TV with Netflix provided (other streaming options available to use with personal sign in details*) • Outdoor patio space with seating and large backyard • Sunroom which contains an additional twin bed and effective space heater for added warmth • Off-street parking space + free street parking in front of the home • Quiet neighborhood, yet still near downtown Destinations: • 5 minute walk to Rivanna River Trail • Marth Jefferson Hospital: 5 minute drive • UVA/Hospital: 10 minute drive • Downtown area/Ting Pavillion: 1.3 miles ***Please note that while being close to downtown Charlottesville, we are in a residential neighborhood and observe quiet hours of 10 pm - 7 am to respect our neighbors. Guest access Main-level access by keypad at front door. There is a separately secured lower-level apartment that is owner occupied. Owner works away from home full-time. While you may see owner come and go from the lower apartment (separate back entrance), there are no shared spaces. All of the spaces including the front and back yards are entirely for the guests’ enjoyment. A very sweet, fluffy, black and white kitty named Romeo lives on the property. Early check-in can often be accommodated for a fee of $50 and prior approval. Other things to note This is an LGBTQIA friendly space and we welcome people from all nationalities, races, cultures, religions, and neurodiverse backgrounds.

column81: No extra guest fees. Close to Wintergreen & Skyline Drive. Perfect location for a family vacation, ski trip, work-away-from home, or a bachelorette get-together. Child and family friendly. Dedicated fiber-optic internet. Fully equpped kitchen. Screened back porch equipped with patio furniture and outdoor heater. Firepit in the backyard. Expansive yard boasts swing set and playhouse. The space 12 miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway/Skyline Drive entrance; 16 miles to Wintergreen; 17 miles to Waynesboro; 30 miles to Charlottesville. Keypad entry into garage for contactless check-in. Kitchen equipped for cooking or baking your own meals. Coffee maker, coffee, tea, instant oatmeal and granola bars available. Grill outside on back deck. Relaxing haven at the end of a quiet drive. Cozy living area with original Peruvian art. Bedrooms full of character. Screened back porch with an outdoor heater. Large deck, firepit, swingset, and playhouse. Dedicated fiber optic line for internet use. No TV, but you may stream on your own device. Queen sized futon in living room for extra bed space. Desk for work or study in master bedroom. Pack 'n Play for small child may be set up in room of your choice. Guest access Guests are welcome to use entire main floor of home, garage, decks, fenced and unfenced yard space, and firepit. Firewood is often present on site and free if present during your stay. Availability of firewood on site is not guaranteed. Bring a bundle of firewood with you or purchase locally for an evening bonfire!

column76: Take it easy at this unique and tranquil getaway. Experience everything Nelson county has to offer, hiking, fishing, skiing, and kayaking. Or enjoy the breweries and vineyards on the Nelson 29 and Nelson 151 craft beverage trail. If a quiet retreat is what you prefer, please enjoy the wooded atmosphere and relax by the fire pit. The space Our “nest” is located at the northern end of Nelson county nestled into the woods. We live in the upper part of the house and you will have an apartment we made in the basement. There is one bedroom with a queen size bed. And a large room that encompasses the living/dining/kitchen area. The bathroom is off of that room. It’s very quiet here in the woods, except for the serenade of birds and crickets. Will you see a bear? It’s very unlikely, but it is a rural setting in the woods. You are much more likely to see deer and rabbits and many birds. Guest access Feel free to cozy up to the fire pit for a relaxing evening. Other things to note We do have two dogs, Lucy and Max, who do spend a lot of time outside, mostly on our porch. Lucy is still very much a puppy and gets very excited to meet new people. I apologize if she tries to jump on you. She is in training and if she is a nuisance please let us know and we will put her up. We also have an aviary with finches. Please let us know if you’d like a look at them. It does require climbing stairs. Although we love animals, in an effort to keep the space as allergy free as possible we do not allow pets. Since it is a basement apartment, the bathroom had to be elevated to accommodate the plumbing. This makes the standing height in the shower/tub height 6’-1”. There is also one step up into the bathroom. There are many activities to do locally and within a relatively short distance. Below I've listed a number of points of interest and their approximate distance from where you will be staying. Local Wineries and Vineyards Distance in miles Mountain Cove 9.5 Hill Top Berry Farm and Vineyard 12 Del Foss 9 Flying Fox 17 Pippin Hill 15 Afton Mountain 19 Valley Road 18 Veritas 19 Loving Cup 17 Hazy Mountain 19 Local Breweries Wood Ridge 5.5 Blue Mountain Barrel House 14 Wild Wolf 14 Devil's Backbone 16 Blue Mountain Brewery 18 Cideries Bold Rock 15 Blue Toad 17 Potter's Craft 21 Albermarle Ciderworks 16 Distilleries Virginia Distillery 6.5 Silverback Distillery 15 Other Points of Interest Rockfish Ranch 1 Fortunes Cove Preserve 10 Reids and Glenthorn Trail 16 Silver Fox Lavender Farm 16 Walton's Mountain Museum 14 Crabtree Falls 29 Wintergreen Resort 25 Stoney Creek Golf Course 15 Devil's Knob Golf Course 25 Humpback Rock Visitor Center and Farm Museum 28 Blue Ridge Parkway (Afton) 23 Blue Ridge Tunnel 23 Blue Ridge Parkway ( Montebello) 31 Drumheller's Orchard 11 Saunder's Brothers Orchard and Farm Market 15 Seaman's Orchard 17 Dickie Brothers Orchard 22 Infinity Downs Farm 14 Montebello State Fish Hatchery 33 Lynchburg, VA; Liberty University 44 Charlottesville, VA 29 Monticello 29 John Paul Jones Arena 27 Lovingston, VA 8 Food Lion Grocery Vito's Italian Restaurant Chen's Chinese Restaurant Lovingston Cafe and Bar El Mariachi Mexican Restaurant Indian Oven McDonalds Subway Trager Brothers Coffee Hear of Nelson (Local Artisan Shop) Front Street Garage Exxon and Shell Stations

column84: Relax with the whole family or a group of friends at this peaceful home in the country. Located in the heart of the Rockfish Valley enjoy great mountain views and a central location to all that Nelson County has to offer. Our cottage is on 5 private acres in the lovely Nellysford area right off of Rte. 151. Book a stay with us and enjoy the sound of the river, beautiful mountain views and access to the best hiking and biking, some of which are just outside our doorstep. HIGH SPEED INTERNET! The space A cozy, cottage to relax in with family and friends. High speed internet to easily work remotely or stream entertainment. Three bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Fully equipped kitchen for gourmet cooking. There are lovely covered front, side and back porches for relaxing outside. The property has a large fire pit in the private backyard with plenty of mountain views and access to the rockfish river. Pets welcome please respect house rules concerning them. Guest access Guests will have access to the house and property. We will send over check-in details the morning of your stay. Other things to note What's close by: Wintergreen Resort- 9.2 miles Devils Backbone Brewery- 2 miles Bold Rock Cider- 1 mile Veritas Vineyard - 13 miles Afton Mountain Vineyard- 13 miles Nellysford IGA - 2.1 miles Blue Mountain Brewery- 12 miles Pippin Hill Farm & Vineyard - 24 miles Blue Toad Hard Cider - 2.7 miles Hiking Trails in the area: The Plunge at Wintergreen - 9.5 miles Spy Rock - 22 miles Three Ridges ( access at Blue Ridge Parkway off 664) - 7.5 miles The Priest - 12 miles Humpback Rocks - 8.1 miles Access to Rockfish Valley Trails - 5 min walk

This spacious suite includes an ultra HD smart TV, in-room climate control, sleeper sofa, and dining area with mini fridge, Keurig, and microwave. Guests are free to explore the grounds - take a hike on the trails, enjoy a meal outside by the stream, take a walk down the driveway, or stroll to Veritas for a glass of wine. Rockwell can sleep 14-16 guests comfortably. The Dogwood Suite does share a wall with The Chestnut Suite and you may hear your neighbors. We have added extra installation to this wall. column102: Welcome home! Completed in June 2021, our custom modern farmhouse is filled with light, beauty, and comfort. Best of all, it is in the most desirable and walkable neighborhood in Charlottesville, just steps from downtown Belmont and the Downtown Mall. We are also located 10 minutes from the University of Virginia, 25 minutes from the Charlottesville airport, and within 15-45 minutes of dozens of vineyards, breweries, Skyline Drive, and Shenandoah National Park. The space When you pull up to the house, you'll see a spacious wraparound porch with a cushioned porch swing, couch, and chairs. Open the front door into our wide foyer, and take in the 10-foot ceilings and white oak floors. To your left is our office, with a custom green bookcase and brass library lights. Cozy up in the deep chair with a good book during your stay! To your right in the foyer, you'll find the guest bedroom with a queen bed and an attached full bathroom. Walk into the large living room with two couches and a chair. The gas fireplace is easy to operate with a remote control. Our floor-to-ceiling bookcase is filled with good reads, and the lower cabinets are stocked with board and card games. Behind the giant map in the bookcase you'll find a 65-inch TV with Netflix, Disney+, and more. The dining room boasts a custom dining table that can expand to seat 14. The triple glass doors in the dining room overlook our backyard, where you'll see an expansive bluestone patio, Weber grill, outdoor dining set, and toys for children, including swings and a basketball hoop. To the left of the dining room is the heart of our home: the beautiful kitchen. Every detail of this space was lovingly planned out, from the walnut island and marble countertops to the Wolf range and farmhouse sink. You'll find the fridge stocked with breakfast items for you to enjoy as well as standard condiments. On the main floor we also offer you access to our laundry room with an LG washer and dryer. Upstairs you'll find 4 bedrooms and 3 full bathrooms. The master bedroom has a king bed, and the bathroom includes a cast iron soaking tub and walk-in shower. The other three bedrooms offer a double bed, three twin beds, a crib, and plenty of space for our queen air mattress if needed. All bedrooms in the house have black-out shades for optimal sleep. The third floor of our house is a huge, open playroom filled with children's books and toys. It also has a memory foam queen mattress, which we can make up for guests. There is no bathroom on this level, and it is accessed through the master bedroom closet via a narrow, cleverly-designed staircase. Guest access Our guests will have full access to the entire house, as well as the shaded backyard and spacious bluestone patio. Ample street parking is available, usually right in front of our house. Early check-in (before 4pm) and late check out (after 11am) are almost always available for $95 each. Please inquire when you request to book. Pets are welcome! We charge a $95 fee that is due upon booking. Please do not bring any pets—even to visit—without letting us know. Other things to note When we stay in our house, we have 2 cats. We allow a maximum of 2 pets per booking and charge a $95 pet fee. If you bring a dog, please do not allow them on furniture or beds. We can provide a dog bed, dog crate (medium size), and a baby gate on the stairs—just let us know!

column79: Spend a morning hiking in the iconic Blue Ridge Mountains. Let loose at one of the plentiful vineyard, brewery, and distillery offerings. Take the family fruit picking at a local orchard or horseback riding on a scenic trail ride. Whatever your adventure, our 4BR/2BA retreat will welcome you home and make it hard to leave! Comfortably sleeps 8 guests. If you’re up for squeezing a bit and using the pullout sofa / air mattress, sleeps up to 10-11 guests. The space Upstairs: Hang out, eat, and watch TV in the upstairs gathering space, an open and spacious room that includes a full kitchen (gas range, dishwasher, and microwave), 8-seater dining table, and super comfy (pullout queen) couch. Rest up in one of the three cozy bedrooms (queen, full, full) and wash up in the full bathroom with a tub. Access the oversized and fenced back deck, where you can sit with friends and enjoy the mountain air and views. Downstairs: Catch some Zzs in the oversized master bedroom (king), get clean in the full bathroom with a tub, and play some board games in the rec room. Laundry room includes free washer/dryer with detergent and dryer sheets included. Iron also included. All linens included. All bath towels included. A pack and play is stored in one of the upstairs bedroom closets. A full air mattress is stored in the hallway closet. Numerous board games for use. **Committed to upholding strict cleaning procedures between guests. Fresh bed linens and towels provided. Detergent and dryer sheets available for washing machine and dryer.** Guest access Entire home. We use contactless self check-in using a smart lock. Your unique code will be provided to you before you arrive and can be used throughout your stay. Other things to note Please refrain from using either fireplace. Early check-in (before 4:00 PM) or late check-out (after 11:00 AM) may be available for $50. Please inquire and we'll let you know if it works with our schedule! If you are looking for a slightly smaller space, please check out our sister property, The Wine Down Ranch, that sleeps up to 6 guests and is only 2 miles away! **WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY: Our home is located in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, so we expect a variable amount of snow in the winter months. We encourage guests to make sure their vehicles have the ability to drive through a light to moderate amount of winter weather when staying during winter months. We accept mid-length to longer term stays, i.e., traveling medical professionals, relocating families, etc. Please inquire directly for more info!

column79: Looking to host a large group of family or friends in the beautiful mountains of Central Virginia then look no further. The Cabin on the Climb is close to many wineries, breweries, and cideries. The views off of the back deck are stunning. The kitchen is fully stocked and the home comfortably sleeps eighteen. You can easily drive to many hikes. The home is within an hour of UVA, JMU, Liberty, Lynchburg College, Sweetbriar, and others if you need to host a large group for graduation. The space You will enter into the large living area and dining room. The living area has a wood burning fireplace and large tv and stunning views of the valley below and the mountains. The dining table seats 8 comfortably. There is a half bath off of the living/dining area. From the dining room you enter into the spacious fully equipped kitchen. There is a laundry room for your use off of the kitchen. Downstairs in the basement are 2 bedrooms. One has a full pullout sofa and the other has 2 bunkbeds with queen beds on the bottom and twins on top. There are also 2 single beds in this room. The basement includes a large living area with sofas, a small table with 2 chairs, and a full bath with a shower (no tub). In the garage you will find a ping pong table that is sure to be fun for all! On the top floor of the home there are 2 queen bedrooms each with their own attached full bathrooms. The lofted area includes a game/poker table with seating for 10. There are two more queen bedrooms on this level as well as a full bathroom. Guest access The neighborhood is easy to drive with street names well marked. It is great for walking and exploring as well. The driveway can easily park multiple vehicles. Guests have access to the home and surrounding property. Other things to note Guests must be over 25 to book this home. Thank you in advance for your understanding. This home is located in a quiet neighborhood so we kindly ask that all guests maintain quiet hours after 10 PM and remain respectful of the neighbors at all times. Thank you so much!

Includes a fully-equipped kitchen, brand-new washer-dryer, over-sized bathroom, parking, and high-speed internet. The space This perfectly-located studio apartment is ideal for one or two people. It is detached from the main house, with its own separate entrance and programmable lock, so your privacy is ensured. Free off-street parking right next to the apartment is easy and convenient. The apartment is fully furnished with a new queen bed (photos pending), recliner, dresser, dining table and chairs, TV, and closet. The kitchen is fully equipped for any culinary adventure, with a fridge, freezer, stove, oven, and microwave. The full bathroom is packed with fresh towels and any essentials you forgot at home, and now features a dedicated washer-dryer! You will find fresh bed and bath linens upon check-in, fully stocked cookware and flatware, and bathroom amenities (if needed). Enjoy an HD TV with Chromecast so you can stream any of your personal media accounts. Wireless internet included. Guest access Your dedicated off-street parking leads directly to the walkway up to your private entrance. No worries about barging in on any one else late at night, or bumping into strangers in the morning. You are in a residential neighborhood, so personal transportation is recommended. Uber and Lyft are typically available, and there is a public bus stop about 1.5 miles away.

column81: Welcome to your private stay in the woods 10 minutes from downtown Charlottesville! Located just off Route 29 and Route 250 on 4.7 wooded acres, this guest suite is the perfect home base while you explore local vineyards, UVA, Shenandoah National Park, and so much more. Ample off-street parking, a private bathroom, private walking trails and a cozy screened in porch await you at this contact-free booking. Your hosts live in the adjacent home, so anything you may need is just a knock away. The space This lofted studio above our garage has an open floor plan for an airy, treehouse feel. Your private entrance is accessed through a screened-in porch you are welcome to use. Queen sized foam mattress with foam pillows, high quality bedding. While there’s no kitchen in the unit, there’s a microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker, hot water kettle and the gas grill on the back porch can be made available upon request. Additional bedding can be left for parties that request it. We are also happy to make laundry facilities available upon request. We will endeavor to limit use of the garage while hosting, but please note you may hear us open or close the garage doors during “non-quiet” hours. Guest access Totally private space for you: studio apartment. Spaces shared with host and/or our guests: Screened-in porch and seating, woods with trails to seating. The apartment and screened-in porch are strictly smoke and vape free. Gas grill, solo stove, outdoor dining area and fire pit may be made available upon request. Depending on size and scope of any gathering you wish to host here, we may request an additional fee. If we are planning to have guests over, we will let you know! Other things to note My partner and I live in the adjoining house; if you need anything additional, we're just a knock away. We are LGBTQIA+ identified/allies, BLM supporters & want all guests to feel welcome in our home; however, our home and trails require the ability to comfortably walk on gravel, go up and down stairs, and navigate around plants, tree roots, etc. Also, you might see our cat wandering the property — he loves people and would welcome a pet if you wish! While the guest unit is pet-free, if you want to have friends/family visit with their pets, you are welcome to do so as long as their pets stay outside of the unit itself, you dispose of all droppings in an outdoor trash can, and you provide advance notice. Ties are located throughout the property.
column88: Airy loft studio in the woods, 10min from downtown

column68: Beautifully decorated and well-stocked place with vaulted ceilings, skylights, indoor fireplace and private balcony. FYI, while all the essentials listed are the same, some of the additional items in the pictures have been removed or changed out. For more details please check picture captions. You are conveniently located within a 5-10 minute drive of all Charlottesville has to offer while also being able to leave town (for wineries or hikes etc) very easily with quick access to highway. The space This is a spacious 2 bedroom 1 bathroom condo with vaulted ceilings, skylights and beautiful hardwood floors. It has a private balcony facing many trees with dining table and Papasan chair for relaxing. There is a nice dining area with a record player and many records to choose from. There is also a working indoor fireplace to set the mood. Our place is beautifully decorated. The kitchen is well stocked for all kinds of cooking, including a blender, rice maker, egg cooker, slow cooker, etc. The Master bedroom is very spacious again with vaulted ceilings. It has blackout curtains to get completely dark to sleep in past sunrise. There is a laundry room with washer and dryer you may use (although cleaner will often leave a load in these so you’ll just need to remove what is in there first). There is a second small bedroom off of the living room with a tv and desk in it. There is a lot with free easy parking. It is a simple self checkin process. The place is easy to find with GPS. Other things to note Pets are allowed with a $100 fee per each pet for stays of 4 nights or fewer (pet fee will be greater for stays over 4 nights so please ask before booking if you'd like to check the longer stay pet fee amount). You MUST let me know about any pets in your welcome AirBnB message. *Pet fee is to be paid after booking. Pet fee is NOT included in the booking price that AirBnB collects, whether or not you mark pets in the reservation.* I ask you to NOT let pets on any furniture or beds and to pick up any waste in the yard. PLEASE MAKE SURE TO READ OVER HOUSE RULES BEFORE BOOKING

column80: Our quiet, comfy and clean three bedroom/two bath house accommodates up to 6 people with three beds. It is centrally located one mile from the UVA rotunda and 1.5 miles from the downtown mall. Our neighborhood is quiet, safe and easy to get around. *Pets allowed with prior approval and $50 fee* 8% occupancy tax included NO cleaning fee! The space I want to meet or exceed your expectations so please take some time to read the descriptions of the house, house rules and neighborhood so you know what to expect. *This is our primary residence that we are renting out at various times* This listing is pet friendly with prior approval and a $50 pet fee. I live here full time with my young son. The house is very clean (and comfy!) and well organized for your stay. The house is about 1900 sq feet with everything on one level. The bedrooms are all on one side of the house with a door that closes for quiet. The kitchen is well-equipped, open and spacious. It opens to the dining room and living room. The fridge will have some of our personal items in it, but it will have ample space for your use. Help yourself to basic spices as well as coffee and tea. The master bedroom has a king bed and a small en-suite, full bathroom and closet space. One bedroom has a queen bed with closet space. The other has a full bed. There is a full bathroom in the hall. The full size bedroom is my son’s bedroom. It is clean and organized. It does not have closet or dresser space. The bedrooms can get a little chilly in winter so a space heater and extra blankets will be available. There is a separate work space/office should you need to do a little work while you’re here. *The fireplace is not for guest use. The house has a large back yard and patio. The patio has a dining table with umbrella and gas grill. The yard is big with a tree swing, tree house and trampoline. Use with caution. Neighborhood kids sometimes use our yard as a thoroughfare to get to houses on either side. So if you see kids wandering…they probably aren’t lost 😉. We have a driveway that will accommodate 2 cars and ample on-street parking. Please drive carefully on the street and the driveway. Because…kids. Please keep “quiet time” after dark in the backyard and on the patio. If you are looking for a place to relax and grill out and swing on a back yard swing then this is the place for you! Guest access The neighborhood is very walkable and perfect for group strolls. Sidewalks are hit or miss. But the neighborhood isn’t busy so it is safe to stroll around with little kids and dogs. There are two parking spots in the driveway and ample on-street parking. Other things to note •The fireplace is not for guest use. •Use the tree swing, play house and trampoline with caution. They can be hazardous. •No microwave (as of now)

column59: This is the ideal location for College Visits, Reunions, Football Games, and anything at UVA. Stay in the heart of UVA nightlife in this newly renovated 2 bedroom apartment on historic Elliewood Ave. You face Biltmore and your kitchen is perched above Coupes in the back. Roll out of your apartment and down the steps to Trinity, Boylan Heights, and all of the Corner. The UVA Grounds are half a block away. Relive your college days or show your child what it will be like. The space The apartment was completely remodeled in the Spring of 2022. One bedroom has a queen bed and the second bedroom has two queens. All are hybrid foam hypoallergenic. Full laundry for your convenience. Waking up the local coffee shop 35 feet away. If Starbucks is your thing, it is only 100 yards away. Pizza across the street, Take It Away sandwiches 50 feet away, or dozens of others within two blocks. Take in a local beer....again, across the street, listen to music, or get outfitted with new UVA gear at Mincers. Our typical guests are alumni who can't believe there is finally a location like this available so they can relive UVA days, parents taking their kids on college visits who really want to see what campus life is like, and anyone else looking for nightlife and action while on vacation or attending a wedding. We are a very short walk to and from the UVA chapel. What we are not a good fit for children or anyone who would have an issue with a single flight of steep stairs to access the unit. We are not a good fit for people sensitive to late night noise. THIS UNIT IS IN THE HEART OF NIGHTLIFE. THERE WILL BE NOISE MOST NIGHTS. There is a train line that runs through the entire Corner, Hospital Area, and alongside the University. You will definitely feel and hear it as well. Other things to note The higher end restaurants of Charlottesville are located on the downtown mall. Parking there is both expensive and sometimes very difficult. It is a very short walk from the unit to the free trolley that will take you to and from the downtown pedestrian mall. Currently it runs Monday to Saturday from 6.40AM to 11.37PM. Sundays 8AM to 5.47pm. There is a public lot called The Corner Lot directly behind the unit. Tell them you are parking over night and most days it is $16. This can change with prime weekends. You must speak with them right after parking.Unless you notify us first, do not have guests that are not registered in the unit. Because it is so close to the nightlife, we have to ensure that it is used strictly for your convenience to go out, and not to be convenient for everyone else to come over. There are exterior, and exterior only, cameras that monitor this.

column66: The 151 Inn is centrally located in the heart of Nelson's Rt. 151 tourism trail. With restaurants, wineries, breweries, BBQ, apple orchards, horseback riding, golfing all within a few miles of us, we're the perfect location to relax after enjoying the local fare. We strive to go above and beyond other rentals. Please read our reviews and allow us the opportunity to share our hospitality with you. The space The 151 Inn is the little farmhouse in the country you've always dreamed about... think old farmhouse with a few updates. Our house offers you the comfort and privacy you have been looking for... don't worry about which room you'll be assigned or more importantly, who is sleeping in the next room; it's just you, your family and your guests. Don't worry, we have cookware for you to use. We also have a picnic table for dining outdoors. A home away from home, our little country house has been in our family for almost 100 years. The front of the house dates to the 1860's. The house has 3 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. There is 1 king bed, 1 full bed and two single beds. All pillows are hypoallergenic. Don't worry about bringing linens and toiletries, we've got that covered too. You will need to bring personal items such as toothbrush, toothpaste, hair brush... we have a hairdryer. The living room has comfy sofas, a recliner you will want to sleep in and a smart TV with Netflix access. Just off the kitchen downstairs, is the back porch which is filled with windows. It's a wonderful place to start the day with a cup of coffee/tea or relax after a long day with a local craft beverage We also have some board games and playing cards. There is additional information on our website, 151Inn or just search 151 Inn" and our website will pop up. If there are specific dates you are searching for a stay just let us know

column59: Description Hollymead House is a historic Inn in Charlottesville celebrating 50 years. Last purchased in 2018, underwent a 3 year restoration and re-opened in April, 2021. A luxurious stay of casual elegance, many amenities for a pampered stay. Close to wineries, breweries, UVa, Historic venues, downtown Charlottesville, hiking. New Owners and innkeepers are UVa graduate Pam and William who live on-property. The space This Guest room is located on the second floor of the Main Inn. Antique four poster bed with Sapphire Sleep hybrid Queen mattress, luxurious Villa di Lusso linens, duvets, pillows and bath towels. In-room basket weave bathrobes and Swiss PURE toiletries. Private bath includes bathtub, storage space. Large closet and dresser drawers. Breakfast is included in your stay and is served each morning in the Garden Room located on the first floor or may be taken outside on the brick patio or porch weather permitting. Guests have complete access to the the Main Inn’s first floor, which includes a cozy Library with fireplace for relaxing, reading, a game of checkers, chess, backgammon or board games. The 1812 Sitting Room and 1780 Hessian Room is also open after having been fully restored. More than an acre of land to enjoy! Our friendly cat lives in the Main home with us. Guest access We offer free on-site parking and luggage drop off on the circle. Each guest will have access to all outdoor areas and the first floor of the Main Inn. Only paying, overnight guests who have booked the upstairs room will have access to the second floor of the Main Inn to maintain privacy and limit noise. Other things to note This is a smoke-free and pet-free property. Each bedroom suits one or two adults.

column61: Experience the heart of Charlottesville from this fully renovated and spacious penthouse apartment located on the main strip of the historic Downtown Mall. Featuring 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, a queen sleeper sofa, an upscale chef’s kitchen, and exceptional Downtown Mall views from the floor-to-ceiling windows. Walk out the door and you'll have access to all the Downtown Mall has to offer; top-tier dining, shopping and music venues. Only a quick drive to UVA, wineries and breweries. The space Due to the nature of a historic building 2 flights stairs are required. If you are familiar with the area, it is located in the same building as Christians Pizza, Revolutionary Soup and The Alley Light restaurant. Other amenities and features: - Spacious living area with flat screen TV (YouTubeTV provided as an alternative to cable) and large, wrap-around couch - Gas fireplace separates the living area from fully the equipped chef's kitchen - The kitchen offers a refrigerator/freezer, oven, induction stove-top plus a 2 burner gas top, kitchen island with built-in cutting board, dining for 6, 2 coffee makers (drip and Keurig), electric tea kettle, dishwasher, prep-sink and wash sink - Floor to ceiling windows with remote-controlled blinds throughout - Behind the centrally located kitchen (think v-shaped walls centered in the open-spaced apartment) is the queen pull-out couch and built-in desk for any work needed to be done. The separation of the kitchen walls provides privacy for the pull-out couch. - Primary King bedroom offers a flat-screened TV, built-in drawers, large walk-in closet, views overlooking the mall, en-suite bathroom with: double sinks, walk-in shower, private commode and bidet - Queen bedroom featuring queenbed, large closet, windows overlook the pedestrian mall - 2nd Full Bath is located across from the single bedroom with a walk-in shower, sink and commode - No parking provided; Water St or Market St Garage is best

column74: Relax in our quiet home just past the action of Rugby Road; an easy walk to Rotunda/central grounds (We are VERY close to ARCH/ARTS grounds). *Current addition almost complete. Pics of new bedroom and bathrooms coming soon! Delight in this relaxing space with fresh local flowers from our urban farm in every room, toiletries in all 4 bathrooms, and a fully equipped kitchen. Enjoy the provided FREE simple breakfast or walk down to Bodo's on the corner in no time. 3 off-street parking spaces! The space This is our private family home that we host for select dates only. While we will make our home immaculate for you, our stuff will still be here (fridge/drawers/closets). There is an empty coat rack in each bedroom for hanging clothes and space for luggage. Please help yourself to toiletries in both bathrooms! Simple breakfast provided: coffee/tea, granola/yogurt, cereal/milk Accessibility: Only two steps at back entrance. Pull your car up the sloping driveway to enter french doors to the main space. There is a full bathroom with walk-in shower (no grab bar) and a full sleeper sofa on the first floor. We love to cook and the kitchen has everything you need to prepare a meal and avoid the lines/cost/and crowds and take your time with each other. Or get some local takeout and stretch out at the dining table (seats 6 but if you need to seat 8 we can leave out the leaf and extra chairs). First floor beds and bath: -Comfortable full size pull-out sofa -Full (but small) bathroom with walk-in shower. Please do not use the indoor fireplace. There is a great Solo Stove fire pit on the back patio that we welcome you to use! Second floor beds and bath: -Bedroom with full bed and ensuite full bath (additon almost done/pics coming soon) -Bedroom with full bed and adjacent full bath -Primary bedroom with ensuite full bath with 2 vanities and walk-in shower (pics coming soon) -Laundry closet in hallway Kitchen/great room: Full of natural light. Great spot to hang out together for a drink before/after the graduation festivities, football games, moving, etc. Cooking equipment and dining ware, pantry basics, and a few snacks for guests! Plenty of board games, chess, kids toys and books (upon request/otherwise we will tuck them away) Feel free to use the whole house with the exception of basement and all closets, where we store our personal belongings Outdoor: quiet outdoor patio with seating and firepit, fresh herbs and flowers (when in season). Please let us know if you plan to use the grill and/or fire pit and we will make sure there is propane and plenty of firewood. We are currently updating the patio and garden and will post pictures soon! Guest access Our home is walkable to the Rotunda/Central Grounds right down Rugby Road. It is a slightly longer but manageable walk to the new Dairy Central Market with LOCAL restaurants! A long walk or a short drive takes you to Barracks Road shopping center and the Downtown Mall. There are 3 off-street parking spaces in in the driveway: 2 side-by-side, and a 3rd if you pull past the gate. It would be possible to pull 2 small/compact cars forward for a total of 4 spaces, but we ask that you NOT PARK ON THE STREET as it is permit-parking that our neighbors need. The front door (steps) and back door (driveway/small steps) both have key pads. Other things to note This is a quiet street. While we are in very close proximity to student housing on Rugby Road, our neighborhood has young families and retired couples who appreciate your respecting the quiet atmosphere with regards to gatherings/music/etc.

column82: The stunning views from this 4BR home in the Blue Ridge Mountains might make you forget about all of the nearby attractions. Vineyards, Breweries, Cideries, and Distilleries Skiing, hiking, golfing Blue Ridge Parkway Appalachian Trail Farmers and Artisans Market on the weekend at the RockfishValley Community Center 20 Minutes to Wintergreen Ski Resort 25 Minutes to Charlottesville 45 Minutes to Harrisonburg The space **Coronavirus update: We have moved to the strictest recommended cleaning standards recommended by CDC and have set appropriate prep time before every reservation to give proper disinfecting time. The space: New home over 2.6 acres situated on a private road with spectacular mountain views. Using the keypad entry, enter the home through the side door and into the mudroom to kick off your shoes and hang up your jacket. There is a laundry room and a half bath on your left as you move towards the open-concept living area. There you will find a fully equipped kitchen with a large island that offers additional seating right next to the Dining Area. The living room offers ample seating to watch TV on the 55in LG Smart TV or listen to music or your favorite podcast on the Blue Tooth Speaker. Exiting through the back door in the kitchen will lead you in the direction of the Fire Pit. Through the front door, you will be greeted by breathtaking mountain views. For those that may need to turn in that last-minute school assignment or work project, there is a semi-private workspace with a desk and chair and high-speed internet (500Mbps plus Wifi) The Primary Suite on the first floor has an attached bath with double vanity, walk-in shower, and large soaking tub. A large 55in LG SmartTV is in the Primary bedroom as well. Also on the first floor is a Den/Sitting room that currently has a Queen-sized sleeper sofa and a daybed. Upstairs you will find two similar-sized bedrooms each with a Queen Bed that have brand-new mattresses, linens, and pillows. Between the upstairs bedrooms is the second full bathroom. Guest access Guests have full access to the home with the exception of the locked owners' closet in the primary bathroom. Other things to note A Cleaning Fee of $175 is added to each stay. Evidence of pets or large events will result in an additional fee to cover additional cleaning and maintenance expenses.

column90: This centrally-located townhome is right off I-64, just 1 mi from UVA & the Downtown Mall. John Paul Jones Arena is 5 mins away, Alamo dinner theater & Wegmans grocery are 2 mins. Monticello & the wine trail are 5 miles away. So, you’ll be close to it all here! Comfortable accommodations include 3 bedrooms, kitchen, living & dining room to ensure that you have all the space needed for a comfy stay! The master BR has an adjustable bed to take the pressure off your back, a PlayStation & Smart TV. The space This stylish townhome has a fully stocked kitchen complete with a stove, microwave, crock pot, Keurig coffee maker (coffee & tea provided), waffle maker & all cookware and serving items. The dining room is conveniently located right next to the kitchen. You'll have a wonderful shaded outdoor patio area where you can enjoy conversations, games, and dine outside on those nice weather days. The living room has an electric fireplace, smart TV and plenty of comfortable seating, including a fun swing chair! Keep the fun flowing with board games, an Alexa music speaker, & toy bin for the kids. Wake up rejuvenated and get your workout in with the 2 yoga mats provided. You'll have a convenient half bath & coat closet on the main level. Upstairs, you'll find a bathroom with a tub/shower combo with a rain shower head and handheld sprayer. Shampoo, conditioner, shower gel & bar soap are provided. If you need to work from here, we've got you covered! You’ll have a desk with a comfy chair & fast Wi-Fi. Here is a summary of the 3 bedrooms: Bedroom 1- (Blue Comforter Bedroom) Adjustable queen bed that raises & lowers to take the pressure off your back for the best night’s sleep! Desk with office chair Smart TV PlayStation with games Walk-in closet Dresser Full length mirror Extra pillows & blankets Alarm clock with phone charger Luggage Rack Bedroom 2- (Flower Comforter Bedroom) Queen bed Full Length Mirror Closet with shelves to hang & fold clothes Extra pillows & blankets Alarm clock with phone charger Bench Bedroom 3 (Teal Comforter Bedroom)- Queen bed with soft shag rug Closet with shelving to hang & fold clothes Extra pillows & blankets Luggage Rack Laundry- Full washer & dryer (detergent provided) Iron & ironing board Vacuum (just in case you need it)! *For those traveling with kids- We provide a pack-n-play, baby gate, stroller & outlet protectors for your convenience! *For those traveling with pets- We are pet friendly & welcome well-behaved dogs. It is a $125 pet fee per dog with a 2 pet max. It is really important to us that you enjoy yourself, have everything you need, and leave with a positive impression & lasting memories! If there is anything that would make your stay more comfortable, please let us know! Guest access You'll have access to all of the property! No shared spaces. Other things to note 5th Street Station is less than 1 mile away- it has a Wegmans, Alamo movie theater, & lots of great shopping & dining options. We offer an early check-in option: $35 for a 2pm check-in $50 for a 12pm check-in $35 for a 12pm check out $50 for a 2pm check-in & a 12pm check out $75 for a 12pm check-in & 12pm check out *Not always available. Please ask in advance* The max guest count of 6 assumes two people per bed. ***Please use code word “Pearl Jam” when booking so we know we’ve properly set expectations for you. ****

column41: Enjoy a single family brick ranch style home in the heart of Charlottesville! My home is within walking distance to UVA grounds and there is a bus stop a quarter of a mile away to take you to UVA, the downtown mall, or barracks road. Come experience the history, excellent restaurants, local music, amazing vineyards and breweries, and beautiful nature surrounding Charlottesville! The space As you walk through front door on the main level you will be in the comfortable living room. There is a dining room behind the living area which leads into the kitchen. The door to the backyard is from the dining room. Off the living room is a small den that is set up with a desk and daybed with a trundle bed underneath that rolls out. Down the hall leads you to a full bathroom with tub/shower. The master bedroom has a king size bed and the guest bedroom has a queen size bed. There is a door in the hallway that leads to the basement. The basement is set up as a studio apartment. There is a separate entrance on the right side of the house by the driveway. There is a full bathroom (stand up shower only, no tub). There is a laundry area with a washer and dryer and extra towels/linens. The basement has a large sectional sofa and tv. There is a small dining table which can double as a desk if you need to get work done. It has a kitchenette area with a mini fridge, microwave, keurig, and plates/bowls/glasses/utensils. There is a king size bed in the basement but it is not in a separate room. There is a queen air mattress available to accommodate additional guests. Guest access You will have access to the entire home during your stay! This is a single family house on a residential street. There is a driveway and plenty of on-street parking right in front of the house. There is a fenced in backyard with a brick patio right outside of the back door. You can enjoy grilling out and dining at the teak table or sitting by the fire with drinks and smores.

column73: This luxurious Keswick guest house was exquisitely renovated in 2021 to provide comfortable elegance and luxury in a quiet country setting. The guest house is located 6 miles from downtown Charlottesville, in close proximity to multiple vineyards and breweries, and within walking distance to Keswick Hall and the acclaimed Jean Georges restaurant. The gorgeous new heated pool is ready for you to enjoy on this quiet and luxurious property with easy access to all things Charlottesville! The space This fully renovated cottage includes a mix of antiques and modern furnishings thoughtfully chosen for luxury and comfort. The entrance is through a private courtyard with outdoor seating. Guests arrive into the updated and fully equipped kitchen with a dining table for two as well as two barstools for countertop meals. The living room is located just off the kitchen, and includes a convertible couch that is perfect for children or an additional 3rd guest. The bedroom is behind the kitchen, and features a king size bed (with blackout curtains and a sound machine to ensure the best night's sleep!) and a renovated ensuite full bath with a luxurious large shower. The cottage is located on a historic property that was originally developed in 1788 as a tavern/inn, and served as a center for regional travel, mail, and voting during America’s early days. Distinguished figures including Marquis de Lafayette stopped at the tavern on their way to visit Thomas Jefferson at Monticello. At one point, The cottage was the office for the doctor who resided at the property's main house. It has since been updated and expanded to serve as a luxurious and attractive guest house. With views of Montalto towards Monticello, this is the perfect location for a relaxing and getaway. Guest access *Please note the pool is a shared space available to the other guests staying on the property. The pool is gated, and will be locked at all times. The pool is open and available for use for the months of May through September. Other things to note Liability Waiver: You understand that swimming in the pool is at your own risk and that special risks may be involved with swimming. You accept full responsibility for any bodily harm arising from swimming and hold the owner harmless. You understand there are potential dangers that swimming may present to children who are not carefully supervised, as well as the danger to any person swimming if a person has health risks, or if a person swims while intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medications, or while pregnant. You agree to be fully and solely responsible for any accidents you may incur. You understand the risk discussed above and agree that you will assume all responsibility for yourself and for the consequences of those in your party. You agree to waive any claim whatsoever against the owner for accidents or claims arising from swimming, All Airbnb guest in my party acknowledge and agree that they have read and understand this waiver and they acknowledge that confirming below constitutes a binding and enforceable contract me Airbnb guest and Airbnb host.

The space This three story home has an open, spacious floor plan that allows for large groups to gather easily, but also plenty of private space to rest and reflect. The first floor has a sunroom with 14 sunlit windows overlooking the woods and a beautiful creek, two couches, TV, eating area and deck. There is also an enormous den with a fireplace, stereo, two chaize lounges and plenty of places to sit, as well as a third living room with a couch and two cozy chairs, perfect for reading by the fireplace. The second floor has a master bedroom with a king sized bed, master bath with rainfall shower and jacuzzi tub, a second bedroom with a queen-sized canopy bed and private bath, and a third bedroom room with a set of bunk beds and a private bath, as well as a fourth room, which functions as a yoga and meditation room or private work space. The basement level has another private bedroom with a queen bed, a private fireplace, a private full bath, an enormous wreck room great for kids to play in, a back deck overlooking the woods, and its own entrance for guests who may be coming and going at different times.

column72: This top floor of a two-unit Victorian is located close to downtown is perfect for work-from-home, travel nurses physicians, or just those wanting to experience the beauty of C'ville while living in the charming North downtown area. The King master bedroom sits in the front of the house and is flooded with natural light from the bay windows. This room does have a small closet for clothing storage. There is now a cane bed and matching cane 6-drawer dresser (both not pictured, added after first tenants arrived in June). There is small utility closet in the hallway that is great for cleaning supplies or luggage storage. The living/dining room will have a comfy sofa, dining seating for 2, and a Smart TV. This area leads into a galley kitchen that has a dishwasher and all other expected basic kitchen amenities. The kitchen will be fully stocked with cookware/dishware. The bathroom is located off the hallway of all of these rooms and has a tiled stand up shower and full size stacked washer/dryer. All fresh linens and towels are provided as well as all utilities and high-speed internet. Two parking spaces in a private lot are also provided located one house away from this home. column93: Luxury, design, and comfort meet lake and mountain views at Windtryst Estate, an exceptional 5000+ sqft custom home tucked away on a private 3.4 acre lot in Stoney Creek Valley of Wintergreen Resort⛷️. This stunning lake front home evokes Virginia's 18th C. architectural heritage, updating it with playful design. Serene, plush bedrooms, luxurious bathrooms. Billiards room, Fire pit, fish pond, sunroom, patios and porches, garage. Lakefront with trails. Perfect for multi-family groups. The space This stunningly unique, architectural home is the perfect backdrop for your special occasions, family getaways, or even your small group trips. It can sleep 15, but 5 or 6 people will also be supremely comfortable with 4 king beds, one queen, and 4 twins, plus crib & two rollaways. There are a variety of interesting spots to gather and plenty of areas to make memories including: 🎱 Billiards Room 🌸Outdoor Courtyard with a reflecting pool 🌤️All Seasons Sun Room with amazing view 🐠 Patio with fire pit with views of lake and mountains and so much more! KITCHEN + DINING 🍳The large, fully stocked kitchen has ample granite countertop space and everything you need to cook meals: • Dinnerware and Flatware for 15 people • Pots, pans, small appliances, spices, and cooking oils • Children’s plastic plates, flatware, and cups • Aluminum Foil, cling film, and Ziplocks • Garbage bags, cleaning supplies, and paper towels 🍝When it’s time to eat, there is a generous 6-person dining table in the kitchen, and an extra “kids” bistro table with two chairs and one highchair. The formal dining room (just through the butler’s pantry) seats 10 people comfortably. The Sunroom is also off the kitchen for additional dining space. THE BUTLER'S PANTRY The butler's pantry is a sweet little space between the kitchen and dining room. It offers plenty of things to use when you are feeling like a ☕ Barista : • Keurig single serve brewer, with Pods to get your started • Traditional coffee maker for a 12-cup pot of coffee, with ground coffee to get you started • French press • Pour Over • Coffee Bean Grinder • Filters • Dairy Frother • Sweeteners • Powdered Creamers • Tea Bags • Tea Infusers The butler's pantry also offers plenty of things to use when you are feeling like a 🥃 Bartender: • Stemless White Wine Glasses • Stemless Red Wine Glasses • Stemless Champagne Flutes • Stemless Martini Glasses • Cocktail Shakers • Wine and Beer Openers • Large Beverage Tub LIVING ROOM The natural light-filled living room has a vaulted ceiling and walls of large windows to enjoy the lake and mountain views outside. There is plenty of comfy seating to lounge or 🎲 play games together, or do a puzzle🧩. (And there are plenty of games and puzzles!) There is a 50” SmartTV with a ROKU to enjoy the same streaming services you have at home with our lightning fast wifi (please note: this home does not have a cable service provider). Amenities in the living room are: • Jigsaw Puzzles • Games for all ages • Children’s books • Lego Sets & more • A sprawling library of literature to peruse WIFI & WORKSPACE 🛜The internet connectivity is blazing fast at an average of 146Mbps, which was a herculean effort in this vast country estate. There are two bedrooms that offer spacious desks if you need to find a quiet place to work. VERY PRIVATE BEDROOMS The layout is perfect for 2 or 3 family groups. With five bedrooms, three on the main level and two on the upper level, none of them share a wall with each other, which provides maximum comfort and privacy under one roof. 🛌The North Bedroom (sleeps 2) is located on the main level, nearest to the kitchen. It has the largest ensuite bathroom. It is handsomely furnished with a King size bed, TV, large desk, and generous walk-in closet. 😴The South Bedroom (sleeps 2) is located on the main level, nearest to the garage. It is handsomely furnished with a King size bed and a comfy seating area and large closet. It has a “jack and jill” style bathroom with two entrance points. That bathroom would also be used by those sleeping in The Loft. 🛌The East Bedroom (sleeps 2) is located on the upper level. The smallest bedroom in the house, it’s still roomy, and handsomely furnished with a King size bed, and built in for storage. Its ensuite is a “jack and jill” style bathroom that is shared with the other upper level bedroom: The West Bedroom. 😴The West Bedroom (sleeps 2) is the other bedroom located on the upper level. Generously sized and handsomely furnished with a King size bed, it has a desk that provides an excellent workspace. This bedroom has the best lake views. Its ensuite is a “jack and jill” style bathroom that is shared with the East Bedroom. 🛌The Loft (sleeps 6) is located on the main level, tucked away past the foyer. Although quite elegant, this is the unofficial “kid’s bedroom”. There are two levels in the loft: on the main level there are two sets of twin bunk beds, as well as built-in drawers for storage. The upper level of the loft has a queen size bed** and a dresser. Those sleeping in the loft would walk down the hall to use the “jack and jill” style bathroom that connects to the South Bedroom. **Weight Limits in the Loft🏋🏽 Although this is the “kid’s bedroom” that doesn't mean adults cannot sleep in here, but for safety reasons weight is an important consideration: Manufacturer recommendation for the bunk beds is no greater than a 175 lbs load on the top bunk, and no greater than 200 lbs for the bottom bunk. Although the queen bed on the upper level of the loft is quite sturdy, the upper level of the loft in general has a weight limit of 500lbs.** ADDITIONAL SLEEPING OPTIONS • Two Rollaway Twin Beds that would be appropriate for children or teens to sleep on. These beds have a rather thin mattress and are not comfortable for an adult. • One Queen Size Air Mattress that inflates and deflates at the press of a button, this air mattress can be located in the walk-in closet of the North Bedroom. • One Guava Family Portable Crib for families traveling with a little one👶. It’s like a pack-n-play but far easier to set up/break down. There is a crib sheet with it, but only one, so we do suggest bringing a spare crib sheet. This can also be located in the walk-in closet of the North Bedroom. BATHROOMS + LAUNDRY This exquisite home has three full bathrooms and one half bathroom. All the bathrooms have been thoughtfully redesigned and fully renovated in the Summer of 2024. We supply a generous amount of toilet paper that is safe for septic systems, so please be mindful of only flushing approved items and not wipes, tampons, pads, or makeup removing towelettes, even if they say “flushable”🤦🏽‍♀️. The included amenities are: • Toilet Paper • Hand Soap • Shampoo • Conditioner • Body Wash • Linens: Hand Towels, Bath Towels, and Wash Cloths 🛁The North Bathroom is the ensuite of the North Bedroom. It has a walk in shower (with a 6”curb height), a freestanding jacuzzi tub, double sinks, and a dedicated vanity. 🚿The Main Level Jack and Jill Bathroom is the ensuite of the South Bedroom. It has a walk-in shower (with a 6”curb height) and a second entrance from the hall so that those guests that sleep in the Loft can use this bathroom. 🛁The Upstairs Jack and Jill Bathroom is the ensuite of both the East Bedroom and West Bedroom. It has a tub shower combo, and two dedicated sink areas to allow a little more space and privacy despite being a shared bathroom. This bathroom also has built in storage that serves a dresser as well as a very spacious linen closet. 🚾A Powder Room is directly located off the kitchen. It’s beautifully decorated, but not much else to say here besides it’s gorgeous and functional. 🧺The Laundry Room is on the main level and has large capacity machines that are available for guest use, as well as a full size refrigerator/freezer to store additional perishables and beverages that do not fit in the refrigerator in the kitchen. The included amenities are: • Laundry Detergent • OxyClean • Cleaning Supplies • First Aid Kit • Iron and ironing board • Dyson Stick Vacuum PETS Up to 2 well-behaved dogs are welcome in our home, but please note that there is no fence around the property. Also, even though our team thoroughly cleans between stays, consider our pet-friendly policy if you are highly allergic to dogs. 🐶 We provide two sets of food/water bowls. OUTDOOR LIVING SPACES Our property is a dedicated wildlife preserve🐝. Our native plants attract butterflies, lizards, deer, birds, and of course about one million squirrels. 🌳There is so much natural beauty to be enjoyed from any of our three very nice outdoor patios to sit on, as well as: • A beautiful reflecting pool in the courtyard • A propane fueled gas firepit table that overlooks the lake • A patio space with party lights and a propane fueled heating tower to warm up your group during the cooler months • A very comfortable, well-appointed 3-seasons room with sweeping lake and mountain views • A nearby walking trail to stroll past the lake PARKING A long, private driveway leads you to the house. There is comfortable parking available for 6-8 cars🚘, in front of the attached garage as well as around the circular driveway. The driveway offers ample and accessible space for a limo or larger transportation vehicles to pick up and drop off guests for winery, brewery, and other local tours. There is also a Tesla Level 2 60 amp charger available for guests to charge their electric vehicles. 🔌 EV charger is located inside the attached 2 car garage. Guest access When you book our home, you get access to the entire home. Now that that's clear, here's an overview of all the things in the area you will have access to. WINE & BEER: Windtryst Estate is located with easy access to the route 151, the infamous “Brew Ridge Trail”🍻, there is no shortage of fun establishments to explore, all year long🍷 • Iron & Ale (2.6 miles, 6 minutes) • Three Notch’d Brewery (3.9 miles, 9 minutes) • Devil's Backbone Basecamp Brewpub (3.9 miles, 12 minutes) • Bold Rock Cidery (5.4 miles, 11 minutes) • Brewing Tree (6.9 miles, 12 minutes) • Hill Top Berry Farm and Winery (3.1 miles, 8 minutes) • Wood Ridge Farm Brewery (9.7 miles, 16 minutes) • Blue Mountain Brewery (11 miles, 17 minutes) • King Family Vineyards (18 miles, 27 minutes) • Pippin Hill Farm & Vineyards (23 miles, 29 minutes) • Veritas Vineyards and Winery (11 miles, 19 minutes) • Afton Mountain Vineyards (12 miles, 21 minutes) • Hazy Mountain Vineyards & Brewery (13 miles, 20 minutes) • Seven Arrows Brewing Company (23 miles, 33 minutes) • Virginia ABC Store (3.4 miles, 8 minutes) ULTIMATE FOODIE STAPLES: 🍰Basic Necessities (4 miles, 9 minutes) 🥖Greenwood Gourmet Grocery (16 miles, 23 minutes) A LITTLE FARTHER: ✈️ Charlottesville Albemarle Airport (37 miles, 47 minutes) 🏛️ Charlottesville Downtown Mall (33 miles, 42 minutes) 🎾 Boar’s Head Resort (27 miles, 38 minutes) HIKING: 🥾Highlands Leisure Trail (14 miles, 24 minutes) • Upper Shamokin Falls Trail (17 miles, 29 minutes) • Appalachian Trail-Three Ridges Hike (12 miles, 19 minutes) • Crabtree Falls (21 miles, 36 minutes) ATTRACTIONS: • Blue Ridge Parkway (15 miles, 23 minutes) • Three Ridges Overlook (12 miles, 20 minutes) • Blue Ridge Tunnel (16 miles, 24 minutes) • Chiles Family Orchard (17 miles, 27 minutes) WHY WE LOVE IT: Wintergreen is so much more than a place to go ski⛷️. It’s a beautiful, nature-filled setting that is the perfect backdrop to restoring your soul, recharging your battery, and reconnecting with the people and things in life that truly matter. This area of Virginia, specifically Nelson County, is the ultimate four-season vacation destination in the US because it has so much to offer, for people of all ages. If you have never been, you should move it to the top of your list!💌 WHAT YOU WON’T HAVE ACCESS TO: Although we are homeowners at Wintergreen, we are not members of the resort and we cannot offer our guests access to certain Wintergreen Resort Amenities up on the mountain such as: ⛔ Wintergreen Resort Gym ⛔ Indoor pool and hot tub ⛔ Fishing in any of the resort owned lakes That being said, in our opinion, Boars Head Resort has superior facilities, a better full-service spa, and they offer day passes to the public, which Wintergreen Resort does not. And there is great fishing (with a Va license) in our local rivers and lakes. WHAT YOU WILL HAVE ACCESS TO: The Wintergreen Resort is 14 miles up the mountain from our home (23 minute drive). Our guests do have access to the following Wintergreen attractions & more details and applicable fees can be found through Wintergreen’s official website. ✅Winter Sports like Skiing, Snowboarding, and Snow Tubing ✅Two outdoor community pools; one in the valley and one on the mountain ✅Lake Monacan Beach (1 mile trail walk, or 3 mile drive) ✅Stoney Creek Golf Course (2.4 miles, 6 minutes) ✅Devil's Knob Golf Course (14 miles, 23 minutes) ✅Tennis Courts ✅Pickleball Courts ✅The Treehouse Other things to note There’s no such thing as a perfect home, each one has their quirks and our vacation home is no different. Here’s a couple quirky things to note that should be considered before booking: 🪜The microwave in the kitchen is installed higher than average. If you are under 5’6” tall you may find it difficult to use. 💦The house is on Well Water. There are two considerations regarding well water: Unlike being hooked up to town or city water, our water gets pumped into a water tank in the house. Be wise with your water usage, if you use too much water at once you will notice a drop in pressure and you will need to wait for the well-pump to replenish the supply. 🧻 The house has a Septic System. Please respect that and do not flush any tampons or wipes (even if they say flushable). 🐻 Our property is a Certified Wildlife Habitat"

column88: Hosts groups up to 13; relax with the whole crew at this private, peaceful getaway. You are just a short drive from some of the area's premier vineyards & breweries! With 5 bedrooms, 4 baths and 2 large living rooms, there is plenty of space for your family/friends, a fun bachelor/bachelorette, or wedding weekend! The Everley is a perfect home base for vineyard/brewery hopping, hitting the slopes at Wintergreen or staying in to enjoy the tranquility. The space Please note- This listing is only available when the whole property (this main house plus Guest House) are not rented for a weekend as we like to encourage whole-property rentals so guests have the entire acreage to themselves! If you are having trouble finding the listing for the entire property just send us a message through here and we will send the listing link. Up to 2 well-behaved, trained dogs allowed. We charge an additional $200 pet fee per stay. Everley Home: Enter the front door to a spacious kitchen and dining area with a dining table for 8 and additional bar stools at the counter. We will have an additional folding table in the fitness room that can be set up by the dining table with seating provided (lighter chairs on lower level that can easily be brought up from downstairs for 4-6) so your entire group can comfortably eat together in the space. There is a deck off this area with dining seating and for all the grill aficionados there is a Big Green Egg" grill and a separate standard 4 burner stainless steel propane grill. Down a hallway you will find two bedrooms and a full bathroom with a bath tub. Bedroom #1: Queen bed with 2 closets Bedroom #2: Two twin beds and a closet. A "bed bridge" will be provided that easily converts the 2 twins into the size of a King. There is an an en suite bathroom with a stand-up glass enclosed shower. This bathroom is also accessible through another door on the other side near the kitchen. Bedroom #3: Spacious Master suite with a King size bed

column84: Take a break at this peaceful oasis. With 3 bedrooms and 2 baths in the guest house, this guest house makes an excellent retreat for a small family or friends/couples traveling together. The Everley is a perfect home base for vineyard/brewery hopping, hitting the slopes at Wintergreen or staying in to enjoy the tranquility. The space Pull up to your own private driveway that can easily fit 6 cars. The front deck is very spacious and features a new 3 burner propane grill. Up to 2 dogs allowed- $150 non-refundable fee per stay. FYI This home is great for those with mobility issues that need single-level living. Upon entry you are met with an open concept living room dining and kitchen area that is great for entertaining! The dining area has a table for 4 and with an additional 2 bar stools to seat 6 guests. The kitchen is fully stocked and has an electric stove and dishwasher. There is a washer and dryer off this space and a large back deck and a fire pit. To the left of the living room there is a primary bedroom with a king bed and an en suite bathroom with a round soaking tub and separate shower. On the opposite wing of the home there are two bedrooms each with Queen beds. The two bedrooms share one full bathroom that is located between them. There is plenty of outdoor space that you and your group are welcome to enjoy the fire pit, three creeks that often create the calming sound of running water on the exterior of the property, and some grounds for games. FYI We have multiple security cameras on the exterior of the property, as is customary with large rural vacation rental homes. Guest access The property sits on 32 acres and guests can roam freely other than around the separate main house (plenty of space in between and a separate street address) if the main house is rented during your stay, which will be communicated to you. That small area is not integral to experiencing the home and the grounds. While we encourage you to explore the great outdoors, please be mindful of the fact that you are in a more rural wooded area and use caution as you would on any hike or nature walk. The homeowners are not responsible for any injuries that may be sustained while exploring and we encourage everyone to be as safe as possible! Other things to note Ladybug Clause: Yes, you are reading it right! If you're native to this general area then you are probably already aware but over the past few years the rural (and now urban) areas in and around Charlottesville have dealt with many ladybugs coming into homes. We are going to be testing out some non toxic solutions to help discourage them from entering the house, but they find any crack to come through and tend to hang out in windows and sunny areas. Because of this, we will keep drapes closed between guests and we will do our best to sweep as many up prior to arrival but do not be surprised if you arrive to some alive and dead ones in and around the windows. We do not want this to be perceived as a cleanliness issue as the home will be thoroughly cleaned by our amazing team between each stay!
