Option 1: (Sleeps up to 10) We have the option for 2 pop-up twins cots OR a Queen air mattress that can be added to the living area. Option 2: (Sleeps up to 10) Add 1 twin to the King Primary and 1 twin to the living area Option 3: (Sleeps up to 11) Add 1 twin to the King Primary and add 2 twins to the living area Option 4: (Sleeps up to 11) Add 1 twin to King Primary and add Queen air mattress to living area Need help planning your trip? Becky and the WKNDR Team are here for all of your itinerary needs! Whether it is a bachelorette party (our personal specialty)
column109: we are your go-to guide for all of it. From booking to stay
column110: we are here to answer any questions and be your own personal concierge. Your group will think you did all of the research when
column112: you can sit back and relax and let us do the planning! Don't worry
column113: we won't tell ;) We take this job V E R Y seriously and are always checking out every new place in town to know what to recommend and know what is best for various guests. From wine tours to foodie moments to the BEST breakfast sandwich that can cure any hangover
column114: we have you covered! Amenities: - Full-size washer/dryer off kitchen - Dishwasher - Blender - Toaster oven and toaster - Drip coffee maker with a plastic reusable coffee filter. - WiFi - Desk workspace in Primary bedroom - Private parking - Corner lot on dead-end street - Back deck with dining table and 3 sun loungers - 5 Burner propane grill on deck - Wood-burning fire pit and Adirondack chairs under back deck
column115: can be moved to wherever you want to hang! - Minutes to downtown - Close to major shopping and restaurants - Fresh linens/towels provided - Fully stocked kitchen for cooking - Adult card games stored in the entryway dresser Location: About 1 mile or 5-minute drive to the Historic Downtown area And 1.4 miles or 7 min drive to UVA campus Other things to note The house is located on the end of a short dead-end street- YAY! But- with that comes a few things to note- For accessibility purposes for wine tours
column116: we ask that you walk to the end of Woodfolk Drive to pick up your wine tour bus/coach at the corner of Woodfolk and Baylor Lane. Don't worry- this is less than a 1 minute walk! It is just out of consideration for our coach company drivers. Since the street has parking on one side and is narrow there's no way to have a large vehicle safely turn around down at the house. If you let us know your coach company before/after it is booked
column117: we are happy to personally call them and explain the set up! Parking- There is one pull-in spot and then 2 more cars can pull directly behind. This is all private parking. The rest of the parking will need to be done on the street which isn't an issue but we do require you to be mindful of a few things: 1) Fire hydrant located near the house- 15 feet of clearance before and after it. 2) You can't stack cars in the roadway even though it is a dead-end. In the event that the fire company/EMS ever needed to access the house
column118: they need to be able to get to the end of the road where the house is. All parking must be done on the righthand side when coming in. 3) Consideration for neighbors- we will leave some detailed instructions but you won't have any trouble parking multiple cars- we just ask you to be kind and mindful of our lovely neighbors! Don't park directly behind their pull-in driveways as it makes it difficult for them to get out. Late night noise- YES
column119: we absolutely want you to have fun! However
column120: we do require any outside/outdoor noise to die down after 10PM. This is just a general Good Neighbor Policy. A substantiated complaint or 2 from neighbors can have us shut down- eek! The neighbors all have my phone number and have been instructed to just contact us if they ever feel like they are being overly disrupted by our guests who come between when the owners stay. While we hope this isn't an issue
column121: it's best to be prepared! If I do send you a text saying "Hey
column122: y'all! Heard you're having a great time- can we please move the party inside since it's getting very late? Or limit it to "fireside chatter" outside?" Please know we are just trying to be great neighbors and we will not reach out unless absolutely necessary! :)"
column129: Trendy, Mountain Views, Close to Downtown

column37: Clothing storage: closet, wardrobe, and dresser
column78: LOCATION, charm, comfort, bright.... This downtown classic boasts of authentic character, blending the old and the new: preserving original charm with modern style and amenities. With a private driveway and single story, this home is perfect for any person or occasion. The space Wine Cellar Cottage is ideal for couples, business travelers, small families, or groups of friends who are looking to stay in DOWNTOWN Charlottesville. Close to both UVA and DT Charlottesville, this home is set up with 2 Queen Beds and an amazingly comfortable King Sleeper Sofa (no bars!). It sleeps up to 6! If you're looking for a quiet, comfortable home with modern charm near all the action in Charlottesville, look no further! -10 minute walk to downtown, and 10 minute drive to UVA and UVA Hospital -Good size kitchen with all cooking appliances and essentials provided -Extra fast Ting Fiber Internet -Brand new Queen memory foam mattresses -Private parking for two vehicles (dedicated driveway) -Smart TV with Netflix provided (other streaming options available to use with personal sign in details*) ***Please note that while being close to downtown Charlottesville, we are in a residential neighborhood and observe quiet hours of 10 pm - 8 am to respect our neighbors. Guest access Dedicated guest parking in the driveway for 2 vehicles. Short walk and drive to downtown Charlottesville. Other things to note This is an LGBTQIA friendly space and we welcome people from all nationalities, races, cultures, religions, and neurodiverse backgrounds.
column85: Wine Cellar Cottage | Walk to Downtown | Parking

column45: A 2nd story freshly renovated 2 bedroom/ 1 bath apartment, located within walking distance to UVA, hospital and downtown. 2 king size beds, and a sleeper sofa in the living room. Shared laundry with unit next door/ locking doors on each side. Street parking. The space This is a 2 bedroom, 1 bath apartment. Spacious living and bedrooms. King size beds. Guest access Stairs to the apartment are located on the exterior of the building. Please note there are several steps and it may be challenging for elderly, small children, and pets. Lockbox on the front porch Code sent with welcome message

column52: Private outdoor pool - open specific hours, saltwater
column55: Kick back and relax in this calm, stylish space. Our newest barn studio that boasts a wonderful Mountain View with an incredible sunset from your own front porch, but close to town. Our brand new Mountain View studio sits close to wedding venues such as The Clifton Inn and Keswick Country Club and numerous wineries are easily accessible. We are a 7 minute drive to Monticello. Peaceful yet convenient. This is our second Airbnb. Sister to The Hidden Gem. Both are housed in our “barn.” The space This is our newest and second airbnb on our property. This barn studio, the Milton View, sits on a 5-acre parcel that once was included in the adjacent 64-acre farm. It is located about 100 yards from our main house and also houses our other airbnb, the Hidden Gem, which is located on the other side. It's a great place to enjoy a peaceful morning sunrise with a cup of coffee on your private covered porch or a glass of wine in the evenings watching the sun go down. Although you will feel like you are in the country, we are only a short 15 minute drive to city center. We are two minutes from the renowned Clifton Inn, a popular wedding destination and 5-star restaurant. Thomas Jefferson’s Monticello is a 7 minute drive and wineries are all around the area. The Milton View boasts a custom tiled walk in shower, king size bed and polished concrete floors. I pride myself on providing a comfy and clean space. I provide my own favorite local coffee, ground fresh prior to your arrival. The kitchenette has a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. In season, enjoy our own private swimming pool while taking in the mountainous view (pool is seasonal.) All guests have access to use the pool. Please let us know if you will be using the pool past 6:30 pm as we like to swim laps then and can adjust. Also, Liability Waiver: You understand that swimming in the pool is at your own risk and that special risks may be involved with swimming. You accept full responsibility for any bodily harm arising from swimming and hold the owner harmless. You agree to use only plastic cups (provided) when drinking liquid in the pool area. You agree to be fully and solely responsible for any accidents you may incur. You understand the risk put forth above and agree that you will assume all responsibility. You agree to waive any claim whatsoever against the owner for accidents or claims arising from swimming. In booking this all guests agree to this Liability Waiver. Guest access Guests have access to our private pool located up by the main house. We ask that if you want to use the pool after 6:30 p.m. that you send us a message and request to do so (we like to swim laps after work usually around 6:30 or so…after that, no worries!) Other things to note There is a fire pit on the property for all of our Airbnb guests to use. Please note this is shared if other Airbnb guests would like to use as well.
column62: The Milton View with a pool

column51: Decompress after a day of exploring Charlottesville and relax with family or friends in our 2 separate barn studios. Each boasts their own private entrances and separated bedrooms and bathrooms yet in the same building so you can gather over coffee, wine or a fire pit and enjoy the sunsetting or sun rising. We are a 15 minute drive to Charlottesville center yet are situated in a peaceful country setting. The views are peaceful and beautiful. Wineries are close by and so is Monticello. The space 2 separate studios in the same barn. Ideal for girls weekend getaways or vacationing with friends. Since these 2 studios do NOT connect, not ideal for families with young children. Each studio has its own entrance, private balcony or covered porch, fire pits and both have access to use the pool. Guest access Guests have access to our private pool located up by the main house. We ask that if you want to use the pool after 6:30 p.m. that you send us a message and request to do so (we like to swim laps after work usually around 6:30 or so…after that, no worries!) Liability Waiver: Owners are not responsible for any incident, or accident that may occur while using our pool. You understand that swimming in the pool is at your own risk and that special risks may be involved with swimming. You accept full responsibility for any bodily harm arising from swimming and hold the owner harmless. You agree to use only plastic cups (provided) when drinking liquid in the pool area. You agree to be fully and solely responsible for any accidents you may incur. You understand the risk discussed above and agree that you will assume all responsibility. You agree to waive any claim whatsoever against the owner for accidents or claims arising from swimming or using the pool. In booking this Airbnb all guests agree to this waiver of liability.

column57:
Grey Pine Lodge is the boutique motel experience youre looking for!

BEST LOCATION
-Across the street from the popular Blue Ridge Tunnel trail
-1/2 mi to the Blue Ridge Pkwy, Skyline Dr, Shenandoah Natl Park & Appalachian Trail
-Just minutes from some of the top Brewery & Winery Trails on the East Coast

AMAZING EXPERIENCE
-Multiple Fire Pits
-Onsite 1 mi Hiking Trail
-Retail Shop w/ Firewood, Snacks, Essentials
-Ultra-Comfy Memory Foam Bedding
-All Natural Cleaning Products

Let’s be honest, we all want a King bed whether at home or on the go!  Our King Classic Suites provide guests the perfect home base for any length of stay, featuring an ultra-comfortable, memory foam king bed.

Room 116 is a pet-friendly room! Please add your pet(s) when reserving your rooms: 
-$75 fee will be applied
-Dogs only
-2 dogs max per room

Room 116 is located on the ground level and is ADA accessible featuring a curbless shower.

ALL Grey Pine Lodge Suites include:
-Private Ensuite Bathroom
-Freshly Laundered Linens & Towels
-Quality Shampoo, Conditioner, and Soap
-Mini Fridge & Microwave
-Wine Glasses & Wine Key
-High Speed WiFi
-43” TV w/ Free YoutubeTV and Casting Capability
-Workspace with Desk, Chair, and Lamp
-Full Length Mirror
-Clothes Hanging Rack
-Hair Dryer
-Dedicated HVAC with A/C and Heat
-Ceiling Fan

Guests have access to The Pine Shop, featuring:
-Complimentary Coffee & Tea Station
-Triple-Filtered Water and Ice in The Pine Shop
-Snacks, Beverages, Hiking Gear and Essentials
-Smores Kits, Firewood, and Fire Starter

Enjoy Grey Pine Lodge’s extensive 33-acre grounds, including:
-Pine Brush Trail, a private 1-mile hiking trail with great views
-6 separate Fire Pits with seating
-Picnic Area
-Front Walking Trail with Bridge
-Dog Waste Stations

You can’t beat our Location!
-Across the street from the Blue Ridge Tunnel West Trailhead
-1/2 mile to the convergence of the Appalachian Trail, Shenandoah National Park, Skyline Drive, and Blue Ridge Pkwy
-5 minutes to Nelson151 / Brew Ridge Trail breweries, wineries, and more
-1/2 mile to I-64 (exit 99)
-5 minutes to Waynesboro downtown
-20 minutes to Charlottesville
-75 minutes to Richmond
-1.5 hours to Northern VA

Grey Pine Lodge is family owned and managed by Hoover & Co Hospitality. We are a contact-free, self check-in motel for your convenience. There are not staff members on-site, however we are a quick call, text, or email away if you need anything before or during your stay!

Grey Pine Lodge is located on Afton Mountain in Waynesboro, Virginia, 1/2 mile north of Exit 99 on I-64. 

Its a Hikers Paradise! The Blue Ridge Pkwy, Skyline Drive, Shenandoah National Park, and the Appalachian Trail all converge 1/2 mile from our front door. The Blue Ridge Tunnel Trail is literally across the street! 

Fan of Craft Beer & Wine? Nelson151, Monticello Wine Trail, Shenandoah Beerwerks are all nearby and we can provide recommendations for transportation.

Downtown Waynesboro is a 5-minute drive with lots of local restaurants and things to do like Basic City Beer Co. and Blue Ridge Bucha, boutique shopping, and grocery stores. 

The lodge is also just a 20-minute drive to Staunton and a 25-minute drive to Charlottesville, both which have a charming downtown featuring preserved historic architecture, a vibrant art scene, and delicious local food and dining options.

If youre looking for a home base to explore some of Virginias top attractions, Grey Pine Lodge is your place!

column64: Welcome to La Maisonette Cville! This renovated home is within walking distance to restaurants and is .5 miles from Scott Stadium (Go Hoos!). Located minutes from the UVA hospital & a 10 minute drive to downtown. Whether you're visiting the area to see your loved one at UVA, checking out wineries & breweries or attending a bachelorette party, wedding, couples' getaway, or family retreat, La Maisonette is the perfect place to stay to experience the beautiful Charlottesville (“C'ville”) area! The space La Maisonette Cville features 2 cozy bedrooms and 1 bathroom, perfect for groups or families. Each main bed boasts a new 12 memory foam mattress
column65: ensuring a restful night’s sleep. Fresh linens and ample towels are provided for your convenience. Living Room: Relax in the spacious living room

column76: The Nook (whole house) is available for special dates (max 7). please message with your dates. The space The Dollhouse is perfect for a short stay (up to 30 days) for a family (max 6), such as a wedding, an alumni event, graduation, temp summer accommodation etc. No longer term stays, pets, events on site, guns, fires, unauthorized guests/subletting or unreviewed guests please. If you need a smaller space (max 3) please look at my other listing here on airbnb (The Nook), which has 1 bedroom and a sofa bed in an adjacent living space. Availability for that house is more open. The Dollhouse (current listing) has a delightful, spacious fully equipped kitchen and living area and new black stainless appliances, a furnished side porch, a dining room for 6 people, a guest room/study with en suite full bath with shower. This room has a queen Murphy bed, a single sofa bed and a work space, as well as a separate kitchenette with its own entry in back, subcounter fridge, microwave and basic appliances (coffee etc). The kitchenette also has its own dining table and a twin sofa bed. Upstairs, there are two bedrooms, one with a queen bed the other a queen sofa bed. The one with the sofa bed has another workspace. There is a third workspace in an alcove and a second full bath with shower between the upstairs bedrooms. In the back there is a patio with seating and garden furniture, and a nice garden by the side porch. The drive can accommodate up to 1 car, free parking 24/7. *Note there is no washer dryer but 2 launderettes are available within 2 mins walking*. *For stays of 2 weeks or more a refundable deposit and rental agreement are needed* *There are exterior only security cameras on property* Guest access All of it minus basement.

column43: Inspired by European inns and appreciation for regional art, Rose Jean offers 5 boutique hotel-like rooms steps from Charlottesville's downtown pedestrian mall. Located in a historic building c1920, the rooms at Rose Jean are designed to be a modern, independent lodging experience: so no front desk, onsite staff or formal check-in. All of the details from the restoration to the design have been carefully thought out, including the name, which comes from the proprietors' mothers. The space Each room is unique and spacious offering a luxurious King bed, an elegant bathroom featuring walk-in showers and heated floors, a smart TV, a desk, minifridge, and ample space to spread out. There are shared common areas both inside and outside. The inside entrance parlor invites conversation and lounging with a relaxed retro vibe. Behind the building is the shared outdoor space containing a blue stone patio with a large farm table, custom-built from the wood beams of the historic structure. A step down from the patio is a pea-graveled terrace with a circle of Adirondack chairs to enjoy one's company. The outdoor spaces are lined with gardens and well-lit with hanging bistro lights and LED's in the garden. The common areas of Rose Jean make it a versatile space depending on your visit. When traveling independently, the spacious areas offer a comfortable space outside your room to converse, drink and dine with other guests or on your own. You may also book the entire space, which can be an excellent venue for private parties and dinners with your loved ones and friends. Please inquire for details on renting the entire building. Regardless of your visit, Rose Jean provides an excellent option for unique accommodations in the heart of Downtown Charlottesville. And you do not have to go far for a drink and bite to eat at one of Charlottesville's favorite restaurants - Bang! The restaurant is literally next door :) Room #3 is on the second floor with vaulted ceilings, exposed wooden beams, and windows that overlook the front of the building. Guests also have access to the shared parlor and outdoor seating spaces. Notable Items: - King bed - Nespresso machine - 4 coffee pods, creamer, sugar - Mini-fridge w/freezer and ice trays - En suite bath with heated floors and walk-in shower - Shampoo, conditioner, body wash dispensers - Hair dryer - Garment steamer - Make-up wipes Please note there is no parking included with your reservation. We recommend utilizing the Water Street Garage or the metered lot directly across the street if spaces are available. More details for parking recommendations upon booking! Guest access Each guest is provided a unique code for the main entrance and to your individual room. Parking: Rose Jean is located 1 block off of the Downtown Mall and unfortunately, due to the high density downtown area, does not have private parking available. There are multiple paid lots nearby. We wiill provide more details for parking and luggage drop off recommendations upon booking.

column64: Get your own little slice of wooded paradise at this Nellysford, VA, vacation rental near Wintergreen Resort. This 3-bedroom, 3-bathroom cabin offers unfettered access to more than 40 acres of forested land, including beautiful Blue Ridge Mountain views and access to both hiking trails and the Rockfish River. You don’t have to sacrifice comfort and style at ‘Pachi's Ridge’, a retreat that boasts an updated interior, new appliances, and tasteful decor from top to bottom! The space Newly Updated | Screened Porch | River Access | 1,813 Sq Ft Bedroom 1: Queen Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Twin Bunk Bed | Additional Sleeping: Air Mattress INDOOR LIVING: Smart TVs, board games, books, jetted tub, desk, dining table, en-suite bathrooms OUTDOOR LIVING: Balcony, wraparound deck, gas grill, dining area, yard games, hiking trail access on-site, mountain view, swing, fire pit KITCHEN: Cooking basics, spices, dishware/flatware, dishwasher, refrigerator, stove, microwave, coffee maker, coffee/tea/snacks, blender, toaster, toaster oven, water filter, garbage disposal GENERAL: Free WiFi, keyless entry, central heating & air conditioning, ceiling fans, complimentary toiletries, linens/towels, washer/dryer, laundry detergent, iron/board, hangers, hair dryers, trash bags/paper towels FAQ: Step-free access, 2-story home, 4WD recommended in winter, fireplace (decorative only) PARKING: Steep gravel driveway (3 vehicles) Guest access Guests will have access to the entire property via keyless entry Other things to note - No smoking - No pets allowed - No events, parties, or large gatherings - Must be at least 25 years old to book - Additional fees and taxes may apply - Photo ID may be required upon check-in - NOTE: Four-wheel drive or all-wheel drive is necessary in the winter months to access the property - NOTE: This property sleeps 6 guests in 4 beds, with room for 8 total by using the air mattress - NOTE: The fireplace is not for guest use and only decorative

column55: Grey Pine Lodge is the boutique motel experience you're looking for! BEST LOCATION -Across the street from the popular Blue Ridge Tunnel trail -1/2 mi to the Blue Ridge Pkwy, Skyline Dr, Shenandoah Nat'l Park & Appalachian Trail -Just minutes from some of the top Brewery & Winery Trails on the East Coast AMAZING EXPERIENCE -Multiple Fire Pits -Onsite 1 mi Hiking Trail -Retail Shop w/ Firewood, Snacks, Essentials -Ultra-Comfy Memory Foam Bedding -All Natural Cleaning Products The space Our Queen Comfort Suites are an efficient option whether you’re passing through or just looking for a comfy place to rest your head while exploring everything the Shenandoah Valley has to offer! These cozy suites feature an ultra-comfortable, memory foam queen bed. Room 105 is a non pet-friendly room. For pet-friendly accommodations, please view Rooms 101, 102 or 109-116. ALL Grey Pine Lodge Suites include: -Private Ensuite Bathroom -Freshly Laundered Linens & Towels -Quality Shampoo, Conditioner, and Soap -Mini Fridge & Microwave -Wine Glasses & Wine Key -High Speed WiFi -43” TV w/ Free YoutubeTV and Casting Capability -Workspace with Desk, Chair, and Lamp -Full Length Mirror -Clothes Hanging Rack -Hair Dryer -Dedicated HVAC with A/C and Heat -Ceiling Fan Guests have access to The Pine Shop, featuring: -Complimentary Coffee & Tea Station -Triple-Filtered Water and Ice in The Pine Shop -Snacks, Beverages, Hiking Gear and Essentials -Smores Kits, Firewood, and Fire Starter Enjoy Grey Pine Lodge’s extensive 33-acre grounds, including: -Pine Brush Trail, a private 1-mile hiking trail with great views -6 separate Fire Pits with seating -Picnic Area -Front Walking Trail with Bridge -Dog Waste Stations You can’t beat our Location! -Across the street from the Blue Ridge Tunnel West Trailhead -1/2 mile to the convergence of the Appalachian Trail, Shenandoah National Park, Skyline Drive, and Blue Ridge Pkwy -5 minutes to Nelson151 / Brew Ridge Trail breweries, wineries, and more -1/2 mile to I-64 (exit 99) -5 minutes to Waynesboro downtown -20 minutes to Charlottesville -75 minutes to Richmond -1.5 hours to Northern VA

column90: Welcome to the Treehouse at Williams Creek! This newly-built, 3200 sq. foot home is secluded on 10-acres but just minutes to wineries, breweries, & other attractions. Highlights: hot tub + outdoor shower, 12-person indoor dining, outdoor dining/living space, fire pit, heated floors, well-stocked chef's kitchen two ovens. Just minutes to popular wineries, breweries, distilleries, farms, hiking, and other attractions. 30 min to Charlottesville, 15 min to Crozet. Featured in C-Ville Abode! The space UPSTAIRS: Walk in upstairs to amazing mountain views and trees (hence the name). To your left are three spacious bedrooms, one with 2 bunk beds, and two king bed rooms. The owner's suite has an en suite bathroom with a dual-head shower, two sinks, and private toilet. There is also a full bathroom with bathtub in the upstairs hallway, as well as a laundry room. There are TVs with Roku streaming platforms in all of the bedrooms except for the bunk room. In the owner's suite, you will also find a linen closet with extra sheets and blankets. There are plenty of towels, wash cloths, and makeup cloths, in all of the bathrooms. We also supply shampoo, conditioner, hand soap, and body wash. DOWNSTAIRS: The remaining bedroom (queen and pull-out sofa) is located downstairs along with the kitchen, 12-person dining table, and living area with Apple TV streaming platform. In the kitchen, you will find plenty of glasses, dishes, silverware, bakeware, spices, napkins, towels, paper towels, and other necessities. We also have a 6-burner gas stove and 2 ovens, as well as a dual carafe/k-cup coffee maker and a small coffee grinder. You will also find a welcome gift waiting for you in the kitchen! On the custom bookshelves, you will find books, board games, and some kids toys, curated by our children ;-) OUTSIDE: Walk outside from the downstairs living area to a patio complete with hot-tub, large outdoor sofa, fire pit, gas grill, 10-person dining table, and breathtaking mountain views. Hike down the hill to splash in Williams Creek, head for a stroll in the woods, or enjoy a glass of wine and a book on the patio while enjoying the view. In the Spring and Summer, you can pick the wildflowers that grow beside the house. We (your hosts) built this house in 2023! Rachel's husband, Chris, owns the construction company that built the house. We put a lot of care and attention into the design of the home, including the heated bathroom and concrete floors, and the materials used, including local soapstone and wood from trees on the property. After staying at Airbnbs around the world, we wanted to make this house as comfortable for our guests as possible. We hope you enjoy this very special home as much as we do! For more information about our home, check out the Fall 2023 C-Ville Abode Magazine (article titled Hillside Haven"). Guest access You'll have use of the entire home (other than 2 locked owners closets) and 10 acre property. Other things to note There is plenty to do on our property. But if you feel like leaving
column91: we are located just off 151 (aka the "Brew Ridge Trail.") From the end of the driveway

column51: This home sits on 7 acres on top of Chinquapin Mountain in Virginia. It is the ultimate meet-up spot to share for a getaway of fun, relaxation, and adventure! Whatever the adventure is- floating down the river in Charlottesville, a wine tour on Route 151, skiing at Wintergreen, or splashing around at the Massanutten indoor waterpark, this home is conveniently located to all of it. We love sharing our home and opening it up to make great memories! The space Come and gather at this spacious, relaxing, scenic space at the top Chinquapin mountain in Virginia. This home has a garage with a Tesla charging port and plenty of additional parking spaces in the driveway. The mountain home has an outdoor basketball court, fire pit, outside bar, and screened deck to use at your discretion. The home has 4 bedrooms- 1 king size bed, 2 queens, and a twin loft bed. There are also 2 pull-outs and a sectional to accommodate all party sizes. The space has 4 full bathrooms, all with showers and tubs for your privacy - and you can’t forget the jacuzzi tub in the master bathroom. There is a private office and library, if you have to get some work done in quiet. The kitchen is fully stocked and there is an eating nook or a formal dining room for your use. There’s a family room and a stocked game closet, and a living room that’s best for just hanging out and watching tv. All rooms are professionally cleaned after each tenant with fresh sheets and extra blankets. The porch has a screened in patio with a full bar and eating space. It’s also attached to the deck that has a fire pit and an awesome gas grill. Don’t worry about over packing- the laundry room has a washer and dryer available. There is also an upstairs toy space so the littles can have their own party! Guest access Front door has a key code for easy access that is reset after each guest and ring camera for your safety.

column61: This listing includes 2 dwellings on the same farm -- the Cottage and Cabin at Stonemont Farm -- Newly renovated in beautiful Keswick, Virginia nestled into the hillside of a historic 170-acre farm. The Cottage is 3 bed/2 bath - sleeps 8 and the Cabin is 1 bed/1 bath - sleeps 4. Stonemont Farm Retreat is perfect for enjoying a relaxing weekend while being a short drive to Barboursville Vineyards, Castle Hill Cider, Keswick Hall, Keswick Vineyards, Merrie Mill, and Southwest Mouuntains Vineyards. The space The Cottage: The front door of the cottage welcomes you into a sitting room with a beautiful bay window and pull-out sofa bed. This upper level also features 2 bedrooms with Queen sized beds, a full bath, dining room, laundry, full kitchen, and access to a large balcony with views of the pond. The stairs off the kitchen will take you to the lower level that has a second large living room, designated work space, third Queen bedroom, full bath, pull-out sleeper sofa, second laundry, and second kitchen! Walk out the back door to enjoy exclusive access to the fishing pond, grill, fire pit, and lawn space. Each space has been thoughtfully designed to provide comfort and relaxation. The Cabin: The Cabin welcomes guests with a large, covered front porch with rocking chairs and a swing ready for catching sunsets. Inside, you'll find a spacious, newly renovated living room with queen sleeper sofa, smart TV, vaulted ceilings, and endless natural light. The custom kitchen features new stainless steel appliances and everything to prepare meals, plus an eat-in style dining table that seats four. Just beyond the kitchen is the laundry room and full bath designed around the original clawfoot tub. The large, private queen bedroom is lofted above the kitchen and accessed via stairs in the living room. Guests will feel transported by the cabin's modern, light, and airy design while embracing the forests and fields on this historic property. Outside, guests have exclusive access to a grill, chiminea, and fire-pit to enjoy one's company by the fireside. Ideally located within 13 miles of Downtown Charlottesville, the University of Virginia, Keswick Hall, Gordonsville, Montpelier, and Monticello, this home is a perfect home base for a wedding weekend or getaway with family and friends. The back roads are a favorite for cyclists, and the Southwest Mountains’ nearby hiking trails are renowned among birdwatchers. Key Features: - Chiminea and fire-pit with firewood provided - Fishing pond at the Cabin (swimming not permitted) - Charcoal grill (bring your own charcoal) Other Notable Items: - Pets welcome - 2 dogs max at the Cottage - 1 dog max at the Cabin - $75 per dog - Mountain gravel road required to access; four-wheel drive vehicle recommended in winter weather conditions - The Cottage and Cabin were completely renovated in 2022 and 2023 respectively and feel brand new, however both are set in a rural landscape. Guests may encounter bits of nature seeking shelter indoors and will find comfort using the handheld vacuum to dispose of any insect intruders. Guest access smartlock code, check-in and arrival instructions will be sent to your Airbnb alias email before arrival - Parking is maximum of 2 cars at Cabin and 3 cars at Cottage. *Don't drive up driveway past Cottage.

column58: Enjoy this cozy basement apartment with a private entrance located within walking distance to UVA and a short 5 min drive to the Downtown Mall. Free on-street parking and it's central location to the University, Downtown Mall, local wineries & breweries and the Shenandoah mountains make it a perfect place for a Charlottesville getaway! The space The bedroom provides a Queen bed with comfy down comforter and plenty of pillows and blankets. All sheets & blankets are provided. A dresser and a garment rack provide plenty of room to store luggage and all of your personal belongings. There is a small kitchenette area that provides a small sink, mini-fridge, keurig coffee maker and a microwave and counter space. Coffee, sodas, water and small snacks provided. There is a small eat-in kitchen with a 2 person table to enjoy a meal. The living room has a sleeper-sofa and a Roku TV that offer free access to Netflix & Hulu. The bathroom has a small stand up shower and you will be stocked with complimentary shampoo, conditioner, body wash, cotton balls, Q-Tips and First Aid Kit. All towels and washcloths are provided. Guest access Guests will have access to the entire basement space. When arriving, please park on the side of the house - you will have your own gate entrance to the back basement entrance. There are 4 steps down to the entrance, but once inside everything is all on one level. Other things to note We live in the upstairs portion of the house with our 2 dogs - a terrier mix and labrador mix. We will make every effort to be as quiet as possible during your stay, but due to the nature of living upstairs, and the house being built in 1957, there may be some sound transfer. The dogs rarely bark, but we will do our best to minimize any instances where they would bark. We want your stay to be the most enjoyable, so please don't hesitate to let us know if there is anything we can do during your stay to make it even more enjoyable!
column65: Cozy Basement Apt, Walk to UVA

column69: Coffee maker: Keurig coffee machine, pour-over coffee
column91: Our house is located near UVA with 3 min drive to UVA (10 min walk) and 4 min drive from Scott Stadium (15 min walk). The house has a lot of space for large groups and there are many thing to make your stay memorable . The house includes Automatic Espresso Machine, PS5, Netflix, HBO Max, Apple TV+, ESPN+, etc. The house also is well equipped for families with kids and babies. We have exercise equipment such as rowing machine in the basement. You will have a lot of fun with the foosball table. The space Our house is located in one of the most convenient areas in Charlottesville with easy access and walking distance to UVA grounds. Our house has 5 bedrooms and 3.5 bathrooms. The house has 3 stories. The basement has 1 bedrooms and 1 full bathroom and has a direct entrance from driveway with no stairs. Entertainments such as PS5 and foosball table are in the basement. There are also exercise equipment including a rowing machine, adjustable arm twister and yoga mat. The main floor has two bedroom and one full and one half bathrooms, living room, dinning area and kitchen. The kitchen is fully stocked and there are appliances such as blender, toaster and air fryer in the kitchen. We also have a regular coffee machine, coffee grinder and an automatic espresso machine, which makes various types of coffee drinks automatically. Coffee beans and filters are provided. The deck has access from the main floor and it has a grill and outdoor furniture. There are 2 bedrooms and 1 full bathrooms located upstairs. The driveway can fit two cars and there’s plenty of street parking available. We provide towels, shampoo/conditioner, hand soap, etc for your stay. For guests with babies and kids: We have the following items available in the house to make the space more enjoyable for our guests with kids: - Crib - Small step stools for your little ones - Small plates and spoons

column62: Location, location, location! Lewis Mountain Retreat is located in a prime Charlottesville neighborhood and is pup-friendly! Less than a 15 minute walk from Scott Stadium, The Rotunda, and John Paul Johns Arena, this house is the perfect spot for college reunions, family weekend, bachelorette parties, and more! The space Lewis Mountain Retreat is a spacious 4 bedroom, 3 bathroom house with two living rooms, a fully stocked kitchen, dining space for 10, a fenced backyard and is pup-friendly! Please note that is located in a quiet, residential neighborhood, but is situated in a prime location to JPJ and UVA Grounds. Renters Insurance, Security Deposit and Rental Agreement required with this property. Inquire for details. PETS: This unit is dog friendly (2 dogs max) with a one month fee of $300, or $125/month, whichever is greater. MAIN LEVEL: - Living Room: Roku TV (log into your own streaming services), couch, 4 swivel chairs, coffee table - Dining Room: Seating for 6 - Kitchen: Eat-in kitchen with seating for 4, fully stocked with a fridge, electric oven, dishwasher, Keurig (coffee, sugar and creamer provided), microwave, toaster oven, wine glasses, and more - Bedroom 1: King bed, dresser, nightstands, Roku TV, closet, full length mirror - Bathroom: Single vanity, tub/shower combo, toiletries included - Bedroom 2: King bed, desk, nightstands, closets, full length mirror, private ensuite with single vanity, walk-in shower and toilet BASEMENT: - Media Room: Couch, chair, Roku TV, games, table with 4 arm chairs, and ping pong table - Bedroom 3: Two queen beds, dresser, full length mirror, closet - Bedroom 4: Queen bed, dresser, full length mirror, nightstands, wardrobe - Bathroom: Single vanity, walk-in shower, toilet - Laundry: Washer & dryer available for guest use BACKYARD: - Screened-In Porch: Conversation set, string lights, outdoor ceiling fan - Patio: Dining table for 8, wood-burning fireplace, fully fenced yard **Add a pup to your reservtion with a one-time $150 pet fee.
column69: *NEW* Lewis Mtn Retreat: Walk to UVA & JPJ

column64:
New! Welcome to a truly, beloved Virginia home, located in the very heart of Charlottesville, across the street from main UVA Grounds, Scott Stadium, and the John Paul Jones Arena. Situated in the idyllic Lewis Mountain neighborhood (behind Alumni Hall), this comfortably appointed home is approx ½ mile from The Rotunda and The Corner with shopping and excellent restaurants just a short distance by car.

The main level of the home features the living areas, kitchen, dining, sunroom, office, and one bedroom (Queen) with en suite bathroom. Upstairs guests will find the primary King bedroom and a second Queen bedroom that share a full bathroom. The lovely fenced yard provides privacy for gathering and is a heavenly spot for outdoor dining. There is a gas bbq for guest use.

Pets considered: please inquire. One dog (<50 lbs) is permitted. We please ask that they be kept off the furniture and are crated if left at the home unattended. An additional $75 pet fee required.

Main Level:
- living room w/TV and seating for 6
-dining room (seating 6)
- kitchen
- Queen w/ en suite bathroom
- bluestone sunroom joining office wing" w/love seat

column1: Second Level:
- King bedroom
- Queen bedroom
- shared bath
Outside:
- Off-street parking in front (3 spaces)
- brick patio with dining table for 6
- lawn/garden
- gas grill
- access to the laundry room (washer/dryer)
Though this is a new listing to the Guesthouses program -- the house has been rented for short term rentals before. Here are some snippets of prior reviews:

you cannot beat the location. We are already planning our next stay!
-May 2021: "Quintessential

column1: beds
column2: to enjoying breakfast in the beautiful garden...the location allowed us to walk everywhere from the Rotunda to the

column1: stadium. Thank you for making my sons graduation weekend such an unforgettable trip for the
whole family!

Don’t even know where to begin. Lovely. Lovely and did I say lovely!! 5 minutes to everywhere we
went! Can’t recommend the host or the cottage enough. Absolutely fantastic!
-October 2022

We had a truly wonderful weekend at this beautiful home. It is a short walk to the UVA bookstore
and lawn/rotunda and a 15-20 min walk to the football stadium. Couldn’t have asked for a better
location for game weekend! We fit 6 adults comfortably and would definitely stay again in the future.

Our Mothers Day stay was as close to storybook as it gets. Im
not exaggerating when I say the front and back gardens were out-of-a-magazine perfect with lilac,

column57: The upstairs private bedroom for two has a queen bed and northeast and northwest facing windows. A full bathroom is shared with the owners. This 1920's house is just a few minutes walk from Belmont restaurants, and just another 5 minutes to the downtown mall. Walk in any direction to enjoy Charlottesville neighborhoods, and quick access from major roads. We are a husband/wife couple with open hearts and minds and we enjoy meeting people. Check-in time is after 3 pm and no later than 10 pm. The space The bedroom is quiet and comfy, with a queen bed, chair, and a dedicated desk space. The old house boasts character and time with many original materials and features like French doors and original wood floors. The bathroom is shared with the owners. A living room, dining room and kitchen downstairs is available for use. Bring your own food and coffee and you are welcome to make light meals in the kitchen. The front porch has lounge chairs and tables for relaxing or even working. Wifi throughout the house. It’s generally quiet here even though we work from home and are around often. The host does practice piano during the day and also conducts business remotely from an office space near the guest room. Guest access Whole downstairs house in addition to your guest room and shared bath upstairs. During your stay We enjoy meeting new people and making sure you are comfortable. We follow your lead on levels of interaction and respect your privacy. Other things to note If you are a musician with some skill on the piano, we would love to hear you play. For those who need practice time, please let us know your needs and we'll explore best times. We have friends and family over during the day and evenings but observe reasonable hours.

column80: You will reside in a quiet neighborhood proximal to one of the nicest walking parks in the City. The room is (12'x12’) with new Queen bed and an adjoining private full bathroom that you access from the hall. Just the shower is sometimes shared w/owner in your absence (or on your schedule). Wall mounted TV (Netflix) & workstation (650 Mbps) in room. You will have shared access downstairs to the kitchen, dining & living room including pantry, W/D and Sunny patio w/ grill. We share condiment's. The space This newly remolded home was completed with Airbnb in mind. Your room is 12x10 with a new queen mattress on an adjustable frame for the best sleep ever. Control your room temperature with electric radiant heat. Central air HVAC in summer. Spruce up or relax in the adjacent full bathroom with tub-to-ceiling tile and slate ceramic tile floor is dedicated to our guests. The carpeted room has a Dresser Drawer and white 4 drawer writing desk. Enjoy the new compact 3.3 CuFt. room fridge with separate freezer compartment, so you can store your favorite frozen treats. Downstairs you will find the kitchen with granite counter, hood vents to the outside, quarts sink with garbage disposal. Short order cooking is set up with supplied utensils. Please wash dishes in real time or rinse and place them in the dishwasher and we can run when full or upon your departure. Feel free to use common condiments in the refrigerator and spices in the pantry. Stackable washer/dryer is contiguous to the pantry. Enjoy dinner outdoors on the sunny patio (evening sun) or fire up the grill. The dining room is spacious with 4 seat table; the living room is adorned with wood burning fireplace w/ brick hearth and contains no owner clutter. This semi-attached home overall is buffered from noise from the adjoining unit via a cinderblock firewall. The floors are solid and do not squeak. The neighborhood is quiet, and the neighbors are friendly. Wireless Internet Speed is 650 Mbsp with cabled port downstairs. My printer is wireless and connected to the network if you need a courtesy print. Enjoy a morning walk in the park just a block away. Less than one mile (along bus line) to Food Lion grocery and shopping, restaurants with big box Wegmans, Dicks Sporting Goods, and Timberwood Tap House. Guest access There is a lock box on the front gate, and I will share the combo through messaging the day of your arrival. We dedicate the driveway to our guests arrival and through their stay upon request. There is also parking directly in front of the house on a very quiet, wide and low trafficked street. Access to the bedroom/private bath is directly up the stairs. During your stay My wife and I would enjoy meeting you. We have no children or pets. We are available by text, phone and in person if home. There are no dumb questions. Other things to note Make yourself at home. Enjoy cooking outdoors on gas grill. Enjoy the new compact 3.3 cu.ft fridge with extra storage space, including a wide door rack that can accommodate 2-liter bottles and a separate freezer compartment, so you can store your favorite frozen treats. column62: Charming private basement suite with your own entrance close to downtown Charlottesville, I-64, and UVA campus. A licensed, inspected, clean place to stay without the cleaning fee! The space The suite has a full-size bed, oversized sofa, roll-away bed, full bath, 2 large TVs, Wi-Fi access, Keurig, mini fridge, microwave, toaster, and eating and sitting area. Outside there is a patio table and chairs to enjoy the wooded fenced backyard and visiting deer. Just beyond the gate at the bottom of the yard is a trail leading to the Rivana Trail and Moores Creek. Pets are welcome! Please let me know if you will be bringing a furry friend before you arrive so I can ensure they have a fabulous stay too. (There is a $25 pet fee.) Early Check-In/Late Check-Out is usually available upon request. Additional fee may be added in some instances. Other things to note While you are here you may encounter Keeper the dog and Jack the three-legged cat. They will probably try to convince you they are unloved and never fed. Do not fall for their trickery! You may also see the occasional grown child scrounging for food and clean laundry when they manage to escape their college campus. Do not fall for their pathetic appearance. I promise, they too, are well cared for.

column79: Nelly’s Oasis, a newly renovated garage with a modern interior, is comfortably situated in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. This peaceful getaway sleeps 6 for the perfect time away with family and friends. The space This home offers two beautifully furnished bedrooms (each with a king bed and their own full bath), a game area, a large kitchen, and a living and dining space that opens directly to the front courtyard. A fire pit on the back deck offers a place of restful solitude, perfect for late night gatherings around the fire’s glow. Looking for more space? We have another house on our property! Fo Shizzle Chalet is a freshly updated classic chalet that comfortably sleeps up to 10 guests. Book Nelly's Oasis and the Fo' Shizzle Chalet for an optimal getaway accommodating up to 18 guests! Both properties have their own private spaces and are separated by a large privacy fence and landscaping. Send us a message and let us know how we can best accommodate your group! Come enjoy a weekend of beautiful Blue Ridge Mountain bliss, nestled in Nellysford, Virginia. Nelly's Oasis Floorplan- Main Level: Oversized Family Room, Kitchen, Dinette, Coffee/tea bar, Full Bathroom, Pull-out Queen Sofa Bed, Industrial Doors, Laundry Room with Washer and Dryer Second Floor: Bedroom 1 (King) w/ Full Bathroom, Bedroom 2 (King) w/ Full Bathroom Guest access * Self check-in with keypad * Park on the driveway, please do not park on the grass Other things to note Route 151 is well known for 26 wineries, breweries, ciders, and distilleries. We are lucky enough to be in the heart of it all! Always check online to confirm hours, services, reservations and live music! Things to see and do in the area: + Golfing and biking at Stoney Creek (2 minute drive) + Swimming at Lake Monocan (2 minute drive) + Bold Rock, Devils Backbone, and Hill Top Winery (2–8 minute drive) + 151 Brew Trail — wineries and breweries all within a 15 minute drive + AppalachianTrail/Blue Ridge Parkway (20 minute drive) + Hiking — Humpback Rocks, Three Ridges, The Priest, Crabtree Falls (25–35 minute drive) +Fly Fishing— Book gear and tours with South River Fly Shop and Rockfish Gap Outfitters +Wintergreen— Has a lot to offer during all seasons. Winter: ski, cross country ski, snowboard, tubing, snow shoe, and indoor pool. Summer: hiking, mountain biking, walking trails, and swimming at lake monacan. Please contact the resort for public hours and prices. +Weddings —We are less than 12 minutes away from wedding venues: Afton Mountain Vineyard, Hazy Mountain Vineyard, Veritas Vineyard, Valley Road Vineyard, Maren Estates, The Blue Ridge Farm, Cardinal Point Vineyard, Swannano Palace, and more! There are good times ahead! Enjoy your stay at Nelly's Oasis. For the safety and security of our guests and home, there are two security cameras located at the two main entrances. We are a small, family-owned business and appreciate every customer. We'd also like you to know that 10% of our profits are donated to local charities and non-profits throughout Virginia. Thank you for your contribution to these important causes!

column53: Relax with the whole family at this peaceful cabin. This guest cabin is located at the Outstandish Farm on the north side of Charlottesville, VA. The cabin is situated on 80 gorgeous acres that include walking/biking trails, a creek, and lots of room to play. We have chickens and guinea fowl and a friendly farm dog. The animals will all try to convince you to let them sleep inside the cabin with you, but please don't! While we love animals, we like to keep the cabin animal-free. The space The cabin is a cozy one and a half story design, with the master bedroom being in the loft. While the loft and stairs have a sturdy railing, the cabin was built in the 70's, and the safety code was not the same as it is today (primarily the space allowed between rails). Please look at the pictures and use your judgement if you are booking with young children. The kitchen comes stocked with all the cooking equipment you will need, if you desire to cook your own meals--even a blender and food processor! We often have traveling nurses stay here for 12 weeks at a time so it is set up with everything you would expect for day-to-day cooking--not just the bare minimum. Outside, there is a run-down, but mostly functional tennis court and basketball hoop that you are welcome to use. Just a warning, that our boys (ages 9 and 11) may come out and ask to play with you, especially if they see kids. Feel free to cool off in the creek behind the cabin, or even test your hand at gold-panning. Did you know that prior to the California Gold Rush, this region was a hot spot for gold-mining? Whether the cabin is your base or your destination, you will have plenty to do.

Dog must remain crated while inside unattended and leashed outside as we have no fence. Guests are responsible for any pet damages. Guest access The apartment is located above a detached garage so you have the entire space to yourself. column69: Welcome to Charlottesville! Enjoy your own two room private suite and bathroom in our home with a queen bed and optional air mattress in the second room. You'll have the freedom of a private entrance and bathroom, a TV with all streaming services, Sonos sound system, WiFi and access to the front porch. There is a driveway and plenty of street parking and we are situated in the most walkable part of Charlottesville between UVA and the Downtown Mall. The space Our guest suite is a cozy 2 rooms plus bathroom off the front porch with a private entrance. One room is a bedroom with a bureau with hanging space, the other is a living room with a flat screen TV, sectional couch and chair. Both rooms and bathroom are freshly painted and get some nice late afternoon sunlight. Guest access You will have access to the guest suite, the two rooms and bathroom. You may park in the driveway. column50: This listing is for renting the entire Rose Jean building (5 guest rooms) and indoor/outdoor common areas. Great for larger groups, private dinners and events! Inspired by European inns and appreciation for regional art, Rose Jean offers 5 boutique hotel-like rooms steps from Charlottesville's downtown pedestrian mall. Located in a historic building c1920, the rooms at Rose Jean are designed to be a modern, independent lodging experience: no front desk, onsite staff or formal check-in. The space Room #1 is located on the first floor with windows overlooking the front porch. Guests also have access to the shared parlor and outdoor seating spaces. Room #2 is located on the first floor with windows overlooking the side patio. Guests also have access to the shared parlor and outdoor seating spaces. Room #3 is on the second floor with vaulted ceilings, exposed wooden beams, and windows that overlook the front of the building. Guests also have access to the shared parlor and outdoor seating spaces. Room #4 is on the second floor with vaulted ceilings, exposed wooden beams, and windows that overlook the front and back patio. Guests also have access to the shared parlor and outdoor seating spaces. Room #5 is on the ground level and the only room out of the 5 that has its own separate entrance. It is accessed around the left side of the building and through the back patio and terrace on the right backside of the building for maximum privacy. Guests also have access to the shared parlor and outdoor seating spaces. All rooms come with the following amenities: Notable Items: - King bed - Nespresso machine - 4 coffee pods, creamer, sugar - Mini-fridge w/freezer and ice trays - En suite bath with heated floors and walk-in shower - Shampoo, conditioner, body wash dispensers - Hair dryer - Garment steamer - Make-up wipes Please note there is no parking included with your reservation. We recommend utilizing the Water Street Garage or the metered lot directly across the street if spaces are available. More details for parking recommendations upon booking! Exclusive catering is available through The Space Downtown. Guest access Each guest is provided a unique code for the main entrance and to your individual room. Parking: Rose Jean is located 1 block off of the Downtown Mall and unfortunately, due to the high density downtown area, does not have private parking available. There are multiple paid lots nearby. We wiill provide more details for parking and luggage drop off recommendations upon booking.

column74: Clean, freshly updated farmhouse-style cottage in the heart of northern Nelson County wine country! The Little Farmhouse is ready for you to host your group and be the hero for being the one who found this gem. Within a mile from Veritas and at the base of Afton Mountain, the property has been stylishly updated for your enjoyment. The Little Farmhouse is just a short drive from the new Afton Mountain Tunnel and all the 151 breweries, cideries, and wineries the region has to offer! The space This 1960’s cottage has been fully updated with modern farmhouse style. The upstairs is a completely open floor plan for entertaining your group, plus the basement is outfitted so the property can sleep 8. The laundry room contains a high capacity washer and dryer that can be quietly closed off from all the activity of the household. There’s even a separate gaming area in the basement if someone from your group wants to escape the rest of the activity. Also included are three smart TV’s, board games, ceiling fans, Keurig and regular coffee makers, stainless steel appliances, cooking basics, and modern farmhouse decor. Complimentary wifi, toiletries, hairdryer, ironing board, and central heating and air conditioning. Outside, there are peaceful views of the nearby woods, firewood is provided for the fire pit, and there is wraparound porch to the front and back so you can entertain outside. There is a cute little dining area out back if you enjoy dining outside. There is parking for three cars. Guest access There are three keypad entry doors to the property. Other things to note If you’re looking to accommodate a larger property, we have four other listings on this street.

column60: Enjoy the breathtaking views of the Blue Ridge Mountains on this 26 acre Olde English Babydoll Sheep farm right from your window. Our farm is a haven of peace and serenity in a secluded but centrally located area just 18 miles northwest of Charlottesville. Wake up to delicious farm fresh breakfast from our eco-friendly farm. Take pictures of fluffy sheep and angora rabbits grazing on rolling hills. Hike our private trail. Breathe in the fresh mountain airs. Sleep in. Slow down. Relax. The space This listing comes with two sweet tiny cottages that can accommodate up to three guests. There are a total of three beds. Children and infants are always welcome. Please let us know if your group exceeds three guests. The first cottage has a queen bed and full bath. There are west facing and east facing windows so you can celebrate and enjoy both the sunset and sunrise each day from the comfort of your bed. You can draw the curtains if you prefer to sleep in. There is a small antique dough box with fresh towels, games, and snacks. There is a small mini fridge with an ice tray and cold beverages. There is a full bathroom in first cottage. Please note that the bathroom is connected to a septic system which contains living organisms that digest and process waste. Do not put harsh chemicals, antibacterial soaps, or grease down the drain or toilet. Do not flush paper towels, sanitary products, etc, basically anything that isn't toilet paper. Across the driveway is the second cottage which can be used as a remote workspace, office, or additional guest space. There are two single futons in this cottage to accommodate additional guests. We love the large floor to ceiling picture window which reveals our meditation pond and the Blue Ridge Mountains in the distance. Both cottages are light-filled with beautiful views of rolling hills, and mountains. Please note that there is only ONE BATHROOM located in the first cottage. Your friends/family staying in the second cottage will need to share the bathroom in cottage 1. This is a working farm. We live and work on this farm. While we respect your privacy, you may see us working outside, and our animals grazing in the fields, and by the cottages. Our focus has been designing a creative, inspiring, and functional space for our guests, while maintaining a sustainable agricultural operation. We have a zipline and a treehouse in the woods. Zipline use and tree house use are at your own risk. There is no kitchen. There is a small fridge in the cottage. We will provide a farm breakfast on request free of charge. We have a seasonal menu of hot soup, salad and appetizers from our kitchen for light snacks/lunch/dinner. Please arrange meal request with host prior to stay. There are two country stores/delis within a 15 minutes drive, and many excellent restaurants in Charlottesville within a 30 minutes drive. Please check out our local guidebook for more details. https://www.airbnb.com/s/guidebooks?refinement_paths[]=/guidebooks/4918681 Guest access Private trail in the woods Hammock Fire pit Outdoor seating area Japanese garden Swings Hammock Zip line in the woods Tree house in the woods Small fridge Wifi Other things to note Enjoy a picturesque drive along our beautiful farming community. Our farm is: 1 min from a beautiful hike along a creek with mountain view 5 min from the Glass House Winery 7 min from Moss Vineyard 7 min from Hark Vineyard 10 min to an unofficial walking entrance/ horse trail to the Shenandoah National Park 12 min to Maybelle's Market 15 min to Hunt Country Store 25 min from Charlottesville Airport 30 min from University of Virginia/ Downtown Charlottesville 40 min from Skyline Drive Shenandoah National Park Please check the Guidebook section of our Airbnb page for some initial suggestions of activities in the area. https://www.airbnb.com/s/guidebooks?refinement_paths[]=/guidebooks/4918681 And finally, if you like to meet some of our fiber animals, visit our Babydolls and angoras on 1nstagram under the handle: littleforest_babydoll

column72: Welcome to the newly appointed Everett Estate: Where Modern Luxury Meets Historic Charm. Boasting picturesque mountain views, this 6,700 square ft home underwent a year-long renovation to modernize & revitalize both the home & the expansive grounds. With 10 all-suite rooms and 1 top floor studio apartment, this boutique inn was expertly designed to host up to 30 overnight guests and weddings and events of up to 125 guests. Interior Design: Becky Seager | WKNDR Design of Charlottesville The space Everett Estate: Ideal venue for weddings, retreats, reunions, or group getaways. All 11 suites offer private baths, complimentary WIFI, Keurig coffee makers, Smart TVs and more. Explore the Charlottesville area with us! When you choose to rent the entire Estate, you not only gain exclusive access to our charming historic setting, but also enjoy a host of additional amenities and services. With personalized itinerary planning, you can make the most of your stay, while common areas provide the perfect space for relaxation and gathering. Ensuring the comfort of your guests, there are additional bathrooms available outside of the guest rooms, and for culinary endeavors, a commercial kitchen awaits. Our private meeting room can accommodate smaller functions and events. It's worth noting that all events and weddings are do-it-yourself affairs. We offer a preferred vendor list to assist you and are open to discussing alternative options with your own chosen vendors to maintain standard practices and exceptional quality. Discover the blend of modern hospitality and historic charm at Everett Estate—we can't wait to welcome you! The Layout: First Floor Parlor- Moody living area with purple walls and conversational seating. This room has a full bath with a stand-up shower- perfect as an extra get-ready space to be used by your guests when you have a full house or if you have someone traveling in day-of for your wedding or event. There is also a separate ADA compliant half bath located inside of the parlor. Dining Room- Four separate 4-seat dining tables are great for card games, cocktails or meals. There is a double half bath off of this area with 2 individual stalls and a shared vanity. This is opened up for all wedding/events to use. Make it a unisex, men's or women's bath- we will have signs to accompany your choice. Original 110 high functional wood pocket doors separate the dining area from another living space

column70: New Listing! Spacious, family-friendly home in an excellent location for your next Charlottesville getaway. This 3 bed, 2 bath house is located on a quiet street in the Belmont neighborhood conveniently close to the Downtown Mall, UVA Grounds and I-64 for quick access to the areas vibrant attractions and wineries. Start your mornings with the sunrise over Carter's mountain while gallery-white walls and a lovingly curated collection of original contemporary African art The space Renewing green welcomes guests at the door and signals the start of your stay. The main level of the home offers spaces for gathering with a large family room sectional (plus sleepers sofa), dining table for eight, plus kid's table! The open concept kitchen keeps everyone together with space for many cooks. Through the dining room glass doors, guests will enjoy outdoor patio seating plus a propane grill. Office space for two is just off the kitchen as well as a powder room. Up the stairs on the second floor, guests will find the Primary bedroom with King bed, private balcony, and dual-sink vanity bathroom with separate shower and tub. This level has two additional bedrooms, a second King bedroom and Twin bedroom with two twins, that share a second full bathroom. There is also a laundry closet on this level that guests may use. The top, third floor is a generous flex space with a large sectional, TV and room for play. The homes gallery-white walls are the perfect backdrop for an incredible collection of primarily East African paintings. In the living room, guests will find vibrant pieces including Life is Beautiful by Nigerian artist Nike Okundaye, a framed batik of women in traditional Ugandan gomesi dresses by Lukandwa Dominic, and Friends in Love by Ronnie Ogwang (Uganda). Fresh Kenyan landscapes by Coster Ojwang bring the outside into the dining room and office where you'll also enjoy a large abstract painting by Deng Chol (South Sudan). The bedrooms feature works by Yisak Sahle (Ethiopia), Michael Soi (Nairobi), Lulu Kitolo (Kenya, Pamela Wingard (US), Zekiros Teklehaimanot (Ethiopia). The third floor features a view of the Indian Ocean by Fred Abuga (Kenya) and a dreamy-blue circle-of- life opus by John Bosco Muramuzi (Uganda). You'll also find many original pieces by the children of the house scattered throughout - a reminder that we are all born artists. Guest access Easy access off main corridor into Charlottesville from I-64, which also allows easy access out of Charlottesville to vineyards, breweries, hiking, etc. Walk to the Downtown Pedestrian Mall in 10 minutes. Smartlock entry with unique code.

column69: Welcome to The C'ville Snug, a charming terrace level apartment with a private entrance and off-street parking nestled in the heart of Charlottesville. This newly renovated 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom unit offers a comfortable and well-appointed space, ensuring a delightful stay for all guests. The space Conveniently located in the quiet Fry's Spring neighborhood, The C'ville Snug is just a mile away from Scott Stadium, making it an ideal choice for sports enthusiasts attending UVA events. The UVA hospital is a short 2-mile drive, and the Historic Downtown Mall and John Paul Jones Arena are both within a 2.5-mile radius. 5th Street Station which features Wegmans, a movie theater, bars, restaurants, and much more is an easy 1.5-mile drive. Whether you're visiting for a game, exploring the city's rich history, or attending a wedding or festival, this central location puts you right in the midst of the action. As a guest at The C'ville Snug, you can expect modern amenities and thoughtful touches throughout. Stay connected with high-speed fiber optic Wi-Fi, and make use of the convenience of an in-unit washer and dryer. The Snug features two spacious bedrooms, providing ample space for a small group or family. The eat-in kitchen is well-equipped, although please note that there is no dishwasher. However, you'll find everything else you need to prepare and enjoy meals at your leisure. One of the highlights of The C'ville Snug is the abundance of natural light that filters through the windows, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. You can also take advantage of the cozy patio area, complete with outdoor seating and charming string lights, where you can savor a cup of coffee or unwind after a busy day in Charlottesville. To make your arrival easier, we provide a few essentials to get you started, including coffee, toilet paper, paper towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, and hair dryer. We want your stay to be as comfortable and convenient as possible. The C'ville Snug offers the perfect home base for any Charlottesville event, you'll find yourself in the center of it all. Experience the best that Charlottesville has to offer while enjoying the comfort and convenience of The C'ville Snug. Book your stay with us today and create unforgettable memories in historic Charlottesville. Guest access Please note that to access the unit there are 5 outdoor steps. There is one off street parking space available but plenty of street parking directly outside the Snug. It is never an issue to find a spot. Other things to note Pets welcome on a case by case basis. Please message for details.

The closest AirBnB rental to Newcomb Hall and the Lawn, it’s also an easy walk to stadiums and Downtown with its array of dining and retail options . Gather friends on the beautifully landscaped three-level terrace or enjoy a cocktail next to the roaring fireplace on the pergola overlooking UVA’s Dell. The space The UVA Manor House offers proximity and luxury amenities for guests enjoying University related events or looking to take in all that Charlottesville has to offer. Sleeping up to 7 people with 3 bedrooms, each with its own en-suite bath, and comfy sofa bed available in the downstairs suite. column84: Unique octagonal house with stunning views of the Blue Ridge Mountains of Virginia. Located 2 miles from I-64, 15 minutes to downtown Waynesboro and an easy 25 min drive to Charlottesville and UVA. Open floor plan, perfect for gathering, and long-range 180 degree views from nearly every room. Fully equipped renovated kitchen. Quality linens and bedding. Rustic, yet modern decor. Home features large fireplace, outside fire pit, wifi, and board games galore. Stargazing and birdwatching heaven. The space Just off the Blue Ridge Parkway, there stands a remarkable octagonal house, perched on the top of Afton mountain. This newly renovated architectural gem harmoniously blends with the natural surroundings of the Blue Ridge Mountains, offering a truly stunning panorama of the Rockfish Valley, overlooking many popular local vineyards and breweries. Birdwatching galore, a perfect place to perch and observe many species. The interior design pays homage to the mountainous surroundings, with a blend of natural materials and earthy tones. Exposed wooden beams traverse the vaulted ceiling, evoking a rustic ambiance. At the heart of the house lies a spacious living area, featuring comfortable seating arranged around a massive stone fireplace. The panoramic windows encompassing the space offer uninterrupted views of the mountains, as if bringing the outdoors in. The newly renovated, well-appointed kitchen stands adjacent to the living area, boasting modern appliances and ample counter space with a large island at its center serving as a gathering spot for family and friends. There are basic spices, condiments, olive oil, flour, sugar and salt in the cabinets along with various teas and some coffee. All the pots, pans, and casserole dishes you would need are in the island drawers. Wine Cooler by the sink. The deck offers a 270-degree panoramic view of the Blue Ridge Mountains, rewarding visitors with an outstanding vantage point from which to witness glorious sunrises, sunsets, and the stars at night. Up stone spiral stairs is the private master suite, featuring a Layla mattress king size bed with beautiful views, reading chair and large custom-built master shower. On the main level is the second bedroom which features a Leesa queen size bed, workspace, reading chair, and a large closet. This room has direct access to the main floor bathroom. There are towels, shampoo, conditioner and body wash. **Not pictured is our newly installed ceiling fan. The large main floor bathroom has a retro sunken bathtub/shower, with a custom soapstone floor. The bathroom has access off the hallway and direct access from the guest room. There are towels on the rack for guests and Public Goods Shampoo, Conditioner and Body Wash in the tub/shower. Laundry facilities share this space. There are Blueland washing machine tabs for guests to use. We use Blueland products for cleaning, the washing machine and the dishwasher. The living room TV has Roku set up for you to log into any apps you'd like. We can guarantee you will not want to leave! Guest access You will have the entire place to yourself. A special key code will unlock the keys for the door during your stay. Our spacious driveway allows for up to 4 cars, with plenty of room to spare. Once parked, follow the deck around to the front of the house to find the front door. The keybox is to the left of the second sliding door on the deck. There is a downstairs used for storage that has a separate entry. This is homeowner access only. You will be the only people staying at the house. Other things to note Please drive slowly up Elk Mountain Road. There is a posted 20 mph speed sign, please honor that. Residents and animals roam this street often. Winter weather in the Blue Ridge Mountains can occur from December through March. During the winter, please be prepared to possibly drive in fog, snow and ice. This requires 4-wheel drive, good tires and snow chains. It is the guests responsibility to be prepared for hazardous road conditions. There will be no reimbursement or rescheduling as a result of weather conditions.

column74: Clean, charmingly rustic, well-appointed and in the heart of Virginia Wine Country, Cheval Circle" is just a short drive from many of Nelson County's most popular destinations
column75: including dozens of wineries and breweries and the Afton Mountain Tunnel. Enjoy the beautiful mountain views and the quiet horse farm just across the meadow! The space We named this property “Cheval Circle” after the French word for horse “cheval” and the house Scott’s family grew up in. column68: Welcome to the Cozy Annex, our family-friendly 1 bedroom, 1 bathroom that can accommodate 3 guests nestled in the heart of Charlottesville Conveniently located in the 10th & Page neighborhood with many local attractions within walking distance: The Dairy Market, Kardinal Hall, Rockfish Brewery, West Main Street and the Downtown Mall to name a few. Just a quick 7-minute drive to Scott Stadium, John Paul Jones Arena & UVA. Easy to zip out to Monticello, Carter Mt Orchards, vineyards and breweries The space The Cozy Annex is a lovely home that was remodeled with guests in mind. It has off and on street parking. If you're in town for a football game it is walk-able to the stadium (1.4 miles)and you don't have to sit in traffic or pay for parking. Bedroom 1 - One queen bed (up to 2 people) - One twin Bed ( One person) - Lamp with built in side table - 49 in TV - Side Table - Additional Lamp - Window AC unit - Door that closes for separation between room and common area Common area - Breakfast bar - 2 chairs - One lamp - Corner table with two chairs usable for work or eating. Kitchen - Two burners - Sink - Microwave - Small fridge (half size not full size) if you need additional fridge space please let us know. - Cooking utensils - Plates, bowls and silverware The Cozy Annex is located minutes away from the best restaurants and shops here in C-ville. The downtown mall, the University, and the shops/restaurants located on west main and Preston are just a short walk away . It does not get any more central than here! Amenities: 1 queen bed, 1 single bed, Iron and board, full bathroom, linens for 2 beds, basic toiletries, blow dryer, smart tv. Fully equipped kitchen and one private parking place as well as street parking. Guest access The front patio is shared space with the main house. Other things to note Notes: 1) Two night minimum required on weekends (unless only one day is available on the calendar). 2) Check in 3:00 pm, check out by 11:00am 3) We do not allow pets,if you have a service pet, booking with us means you agree to our pet guidelines and will follow them, located in the notes section. 4) We do have outdoor cameras (NOT INSIDE) 5) For long terms stays we do not provide cleaning services during the stay. Your unit will be cleaned prior to your arrival. If you would like cleaning during your stay there will be an additional cleaning fee for each cleaning.
