column70: MODERN LUXURY! Ideally located in heart of Charlottesville, 10 mins from UVA, ½ mile from historic Belmont & a mile from the Downtown Mall. Enjoy the convenience of walking everywhere in this stylish modern 3BR 2.5BR home (space for 2 cars in the driveway)! A 15-min. walk to all award-winning Belmont restaurants. Minutes to the Monticello trail, Belmont Park, Quarry Park w/walking trails, Interstate 64, Wegman’s, tons of breweries and local wineries. Approved pet non-refundable $150 deposit. Guest access Whole house
column77: Cozy Belmont home with Mtn view

column62: This 1930's brick Cape Cod is conveniently situated on Rugby Road, offering a seamless blend of historic charm and modern convenience. Thoughtfully renovated and professionally designed, Rugby Retreat is a true gem that boasts proximity to both UVA Grounds and downtown Charlottesville. Whether you are a family in town visiting your student, alumni headed to a football game or guests attending a wedding - Rugby Retreat is perfect for your next visit to UVA and Charlottesville. The space Inside, you'll find high ceilings, elegant arched doorways, and expansive windows that fill each room with abundant natural light. The private backyard and spacious front yard further enhance the appeal of this property, providing ample space for relaxation and outdoor activities. This house features three bedrooms and two and a half bathrooms. On the first floor is a newly renovated kitchen, traditional dining room, large living room, and sunroom with a TV. The second floor offers a primary king bed with en-suite bath and 2 queen bedrooms that share a bathroom. On the 3rd floor is a private loft area with a TV and a desk, perfect for lounging or a quiet workspace. (please note the stairs are narrow and ceilings are low in the loft area). The backyard offers a large patio area with outdoor seating and a gazebo attached to a covered patio with a day bed - perfect for an afternoon read or an evening glass of wine with friends and family. Parking: there is off-street parking provided on the driveway, enough for 3 vehicles. The driveway is railroad style i.e. other cars must move for the 1st car to get out. Pulling in and out of the property is a bit tight due to stone walls on either side of the entrance. Additional Details: - Charcoal grill: charcoal not provided - TV in 1st floor sunroom & primary bedroom - DirectTV streaming app is provided to access live TV - Standard drip coffee maker: filters & coffee not provided Guest access Guests will receive a text with arrival information 4 days prior to the arrival date. Included will be the unique code that is only active upon standard check in and check out times. If you're interested in early check in, please reach out the week of arrival for availability, additional fees apply. - Maximum of 3 cars.
column69: Rugby Retreat |3 bd, 2.5 ba | Heart of UVA Grounds

column54: Welcome to our centrally-located, private, walk-out basement! Our newly remodeled space is a perfect location to be able to walk to UVA Grounds, the UVA hospital, or Downtown Charlottesville. The space This is the basement of our home with it's own private access, full bathroom, 1 bedroom with a queen bed and newly remodeled living space. The newly remodeled living space has a full kitchenette with fridge, sink, pebble-ice maker, and 4-in-1 air fryer toaster oven. This is our family home, so it is set up to accomodate families with children, or couples just looking to relax and enjoy Charlottesville food and attractions. We are within walking distance of UVA, the Downtown Mall and UVA hospital. Our living room sectional can be converted into a full sleeper for 1-2 guests. We are eager to make your stay as easy and enjoyable as possible! Guest access You will access the space via keypad lock in our backyard to the walkout basement.

column78: Quiet property in a mountain hollow with views all around. Hot tub year round and inground pool seasonally available. No light pollution makes it a great location for stargazing. Located 1 mile from interstate 29, 30 minutes to Wintergreen Ski Resort and 10 minutes to the Nelson 151 beer trail full of breweries and vineyards. Many antique shops in the area and plenty of trails to hike. Security Camera is onsite for the property entrance/driveway.

column37: A great country home in beautiful Albemarle County! Gives the feeling of complete privacy, peace and seclusion while still only being 15 mins drive to HollyMeade Shopping Center (Target, Harris Teeter, Bonefish Grill etc) and CHO Airport and only 25 mins to Downtown Charlottesville and UVA Grounds (campus). You are also a 15 minute drive from the Swift Rung Gap Entrance Station to Shenandoah National Park and Skyline Drive. There are 4 wineries within a 10 minute drive (one is only 4 mins!). The space There is a nice front porch with beautiful Mountain Views, a huge grass backyard with nice swing set, 3 fire pit areas with comfy outdoor seating areas. There is also a small river on the property so you can hear water running and are welcome to swim or fish in when it's deep. (The depth fluctuates depending on rainfall and season) There are 3 acres of yard with a small back deck and 3 different firepit areas with comfortable seating! Also the front covered porch is nice to sit on and view the mountains. One of the firepits is gas, the others are for burning wood. There is Corn Hole set for you to play and a Charcoal Grill and Smoker! Other things to note As you may lose cell service when you get close to the place, please make sure you take a screenshot of the check-in info and WiFi password beforehand. Firewood, charcoal, lighter fluid, propane or other fire starters are not provided. If you would like to use the firepits or charcoal grill, please bring all the supplies you would need for this. One firepit is gas powered and uses a refillable propane tank. If this tank is empty and you wish to use this firepit, you are welcome to bring the empty tank to a local propane tank retailer to switch out for a full tank and reinstall. If firepits or charcoal grill are used by guest, you are responsible for cleaning them after use so it's ready for next guest. The cleaning crew does not clean firepits or grill. As it is a rural location, DSL internet service is the only option available. While fast enough for most all normal WiFi purposes, DSL is lower speed than normal cable internet offered in the city. I want guests to be able to check-in as early as possible. Due to the large amount of linens to be laundered between guests and the short amount of time do it, the washer/dryer will often have linens in them so that another load can run after cleaner leaves. You are welcome to use the washer/dryer, but will sometimes have to take out a load in order to do so. If you specifically know you will use the washer/dryer during your stay and don't want to have to do this, please let me know prior to check-in and I'll tell my cleaner to leave them empty for you. Only the number of guests that you book for are allowed on the property at any time. If you would like to increase your guest count, the nightly rate may go up and you would need to pay this difference. Pets are allowed with a $100 fee per each pet for stays of 4 nights or fewer (pet fee will be greater for stays over 4 nights so please ask before booking if you'd like to check the longer stay pet fee amount). You MUST let me know about any pets in your welcome AirBnB message. *Pet fee is to be paid after booking. Pet fee is NOT included in the booking price that AirBnB collects, whether or not you mark pets in the reservation.* I ask you to NOT let pets on any furniture or beds and to pick up any waste in the yard. PLEASE READ HOUSE RULES BEFORE BOOKING
column44: Riverfront Country Home with Blue Mountain Views

column50: Prime UVA location! Walk to UVA graduation or any UVA event from this charming ranch. This renovated, 3-bedroom, 3-full bath home sits in a quiet, idyllic neighborhood adjacent to Grounds. Plenty of natural light, amazing porch overlooking the Dell & free parking. Features: refinished hardwood floors, new baths, LVRM w/fireplace, stainless appliances, & comfy beds w/quality linens. Walk to campus from backyard, all sporting venues, the Corner. Minutes to Barracks shops, Rt 29, 250, I-64. The space Welcome to Dellview! This renovated brick charmer features all the modern conveniences expected while thoughtfully keeping the charming, original 1950's details throughout, such as, beautifully refinished original hardwood floors and original brass door knobs. Located adjacent to Grounds, you'll be in walking distance to everything UVA, graduation, sporting venues and the hospital. And a few minutes drive to Barracks Road Shopping Center and the downtown area and you'll be centrally located to visit all the vineyards and breweries the area has to offer. Upstairs Spaces: The home boasts 2 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, separate office/TV room, living room, dining room, kitchen, covered porch. Bedroom 1: King bed with memory foam topper and quality linens. New en suite bathroom with walk-in shower. Bedroom 2: Queen bed with memory foam topper and quality linens. Private backyard view. Bathroom 1: Ensuite to King bedroom. Fully renovated with doorless, walk-in shower. Includes shampoo, conditioner, body wash and fresh towels. Bathroom 2: Hall bath, fully renovated with large walk-in shower. Includes shampoo, conditioner, body wash and fresh towels. Office: Dedicated office space for 1 or 2. This space also includes a comfortable loveseat for TV watching. Feel free to carefully move the TV to the living room's fireplace mantle for viewing as a group. The SmartTV allows you to log in to your favorite apps during your stay. The living room/dining room have plenty of natural light and seating. The rooms are separate yet open to each other, perfect for small gatherings. The kitchen boasts the best view in the house from the large windows that overlook the backyard. It exudes vintage charm while blending in updated modern conveniences, such as stainless steel appliances and a coffee bar. It is fully stocked with all the necessary essentials. The freezer does not have a working ice maker but we will provide a fresh bag of ice for your stay and/or ice trays. Our favorite spot is the covered porch that overlooks the private backyard, and the University Cemetery and the Dell-an 11 acre park setting that includes tennis/pickleball courts and the new Contemplative Science Center. With the most comfortable outdoor furniture, this porch becomes an additional room to enjoy all year round. Amazing bird activity to enjoy while having your morning coffee or sipping a glass of wine. Terrace Level: Includes Bedroom 3, TV sitting area, full bathroom, mudroom and an exterior entrance to grill and covered bluestone patio. This level provides more living spaces for additional family or friends to enjoy. It has a separate entrance and full walkout to a covered bluestone patio, grilling area and Adirondack seating for enjoying the private backyard. Don't be surprised if you see neighborhood deer or a fox sneaking through the yard. Bedroom 3: Queen bed with new memory foam mattress and quality linens. Private backyard view. Terrace Bathroom with walk-in shower, fresh towels, shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Sitting area with Smart TV. Exterior entrance to bluestone patio and grilling area. Off street driveway parking is provided for 3 cars. Extra street parking is free on the weekends and after 5 pm on weekdays. Guest access Keyless combination entrance at the front and back doors. column76:
Enjoy the comforts of a baby and child friendly home within 5 minutes of UVA, downtown, and I-64!
This is our family home, so many toys and books are available throughout the house for kids. All spaces are kid-friendly and ready for fun!

Our home is a partial split level, allowing us the luxury of multiple common spaces with the convenience of being within a few stairs of each other all the time. 
The main floor boasts a semi-open floor plan with an eat-in kitchen. The front living room gets wonderful morning light and is a great space to relax, play with toys, or read a book. The couch in the living room is plenty deep to serve as an additional sleeping spot if needed.
The downstairs den is a cozy space that can fit a large group of people comfortably. Watch TV, play board games, or enjoy the wood-burning fireplace in the wintertime. The couch in the basement can also serve as an additional sleeping spot if needed. The washer and dryer are also located in the utility room in the basement.
There is a queen bed in the primary bedroom, a crib (easily exchanged for a queen air mattress) in the first guest bedroom, and a twin bed (can also add an additional toddler air mattress) in the second guest bedroom.

Please help yourself to all necessary linens, toiletries, etc., which can be found in the guest closet and linen closet upstairs. In addition, you will have access to all dining ware, spices, and cooking needs. While we do have a fully-stocked pantry, we ask that you be mindful of what you consume.

You determine the level of communication! We are happy to meet you and show you around the house, or can send you directions to retrieve your key. We will both be available via phone and email during your stay, and are quick to respond.

Great family-friendly neighborhood. We have a neighborhood playground located a 5 minute walk away. Safe, tucked away but still close to downtown and walkable to grocery store.

We try to be flexible with check-in and check-out time on a case-by-case basis. Please message us, and we may be able to accommodate an earlier arrival or a later departure.

column67: Enjoy a peaceful and centrally-located house atop the Blue Ridge Mountains with expansive views. Watch unforgettable sunsets from the great room and deck. There is a picnic table, benches, walking trails and room to play. We border the Blue Ridge Parkway and are only 3 miles from the Shenandoah National Park and Appalachian Trail. We are 2 miles from Interstate 64 which gives you quick access to destinations such as Universities, wineries, breweries, Charlottesville and Washington DC. The space There are 4 bedrooms and 6 beds. Each of the 4 bedrooms have beautiful, peaceful views from the large windows. The cupola or theme room has a twin day bed with a twin trundle bed underneath. Enjoy the bear themed room on the fourth floor. There are books to read and games to play in the cuddly bear room. The kitchen is fully equipped with all your cooking needs. Enjoy eating supper on the glass dining room table or outside on the deck while watching beautiful sunsets over the Allegheny Mountains to the West. There is a gas grill on the deck beside the kitchen. Enjoy a cup of coffee or a good book in the quiet den which also has lovely views of the woods and flowers outside. Outside there is a firepit surrounded with stools made of logs. On chilly evenings, enjoy roasting marshmallows and making smores. There are several peaceful places to sit and relax on the property. Enjoy walking our nature trail (about .3 miles) which goes through a mature forest, some rock outcroppings, and a wildflower meadow. Guest access All rooms are available to guests except the office which will be locked. The basement is unfinished and used as storage however there is a small gym area with some workout equipment that can be used. Other things to note We have high speed fiber internet.

column71: Enjoy easy access to everything from this perfectly located home base. 5 minutes from CHO airport. Interested in history, taste VA’s finest wines/breweries, lots of outdoor activities, hiking the Blue Ridge, eating at amazing local restaurants with top chefs, attending theater productions, or concerts, coming in for a wedding or another events, visiting UVA, or coming to work in the area short term, this is a perfect place to unwind and relax after a day of exploring, fun or work. The space “The Studio” is located in the lower half of our home on an acre lot. It features a well lit private, inviting entrance. The property has a small wooded area, which has a creek that runs through it, and a small pond at the rear of the back yard. It is not uncommon to see deer, birds and other animals out in the yard. Enjoy your morning coffee as you watch the sunrise above the pond. In the summertime, if you leave the window open at night, you will hear frogs down by the pond and the quiet sound of water trickling. On a clear night enjoy viewing the stars. The surrounding small neighborhood is quiet, if you like taking small walks or a run, if you stay to the edge of the roads in the neighborhood, you would’ve gone a half a mile. There are only two roads in the neighborhood and only one entrance to go in and out of, so very safe for walking or running. Guest access Anything to the rear of the house you may enjoy other than the deck. At times we may be working out in the yard but for the most part we want you to enjoy your stay, so we will try to keep that to a minimum while you were here. Other things to note Within just a mile are an emergency room, 24 hour Wawa and Sheetz conveniences stores/gas stations, Food Lion and Harris Teeter grocery stores, Walgreens and CVS pharmacies, locally owned restaurants and coffee shops, fast food places, a Starbucks and banks. The Charlottesville Airport (CHO) is only a five minute drive. Within about 20 minutes you can be at The University of Virginia and historic downtown Charlottesville. James Madison University in Harrisonburg is an hour’s drive. The city of Richmond (capital of Virginia) is about an hour and 15 minute drive. You can be in the Blue Ridge Mountains within 30 minutes or put your feet into the Virginia Beach surf in about 2 1/2 hours drive. The Blue Ridge Parkway and the Skyline Drive within the Shenandoah National State Park are local favorites — both are just a half an hour drive. Two ski resorts, Wintergreen and Massanutten, are within an hour. Numerous wineries, breweries and distilleries are nestled along the foothills of the mountains and in town, all within 10 to 60 minutes. There are four former United States Presidents’ homes within 30 to 60 minute drive. Washington DC, the National Capital and the Smithsonian National Institute museums can be reached in about 2 1/4 hours.

column50: Discover a meticulously refurbished home in the Shenandoah Valley where opulence intertwines seamlessly with the awe-inspiring panorama of the Blue Ridge Mountains, offering an uninterrupted 180-degree vista. This sanctuary epitomizes a lavish escape, boasting an array of indulgent amenities that exceed your highest expectations. Located a short drive to everything Brewery Trail / Route 151 have to offer. 10 minute drive to Shen National Park & 25 minutes to Wintergreen Ski Resort. The space Welcome to Blue Ridge Beau, a beautifully renovated bungalow nestled in the heart of Afton, Virginia. Offering a tranquil retreat with breathtaking views of the Blue Ridge Mountains, our cozy haven is an ideal Location & Attractions: Perfectly positioned near a selection of Afton's finest vineyards including Flying Fox, Veritas, Blue Mountain Brewery, and many more, Blue Ridge Beau provides the ultimate convenience for wine enthusiasts looking to explore the local wine scene. The enchanting landscape offers various activities from scenic hikes to leisurely afternoons tasting wines. Accommodation: Our bungalow features tastefully decorated interiors that blend modern amenities with rustic charm, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. With three bedrooms, a fully-equipped kitchen, and a spacious living area, you'll find everything you need for a perfect stay. Outdoor Living: Step outside to discover our outdoor amenities, designed for relaxation and entertainment. Soak your cares away in the hot tub, gather around the fire pit under a canopy of stars, or enjoy meals on the patio, all while soaking in the stunning mountain vistas. Amenities: Hot Tub with Panoramic Views Cozy Outdoor Fire Pit Private Outdoor Patio Proximity to Vineyards Fully-Equipped Kitchen Comfortable Living Spaces Free WiFi & Parking Experience Afton: Whether you're a wine lover, a nature enthusiast, or simply in need of a peaceful retreat, Blue Ridge Beau is the perfect base for your Afton adventures. Let the beauty of the Blue Ridge Mountains inspire you, as you enjoy the comfort and charm of our bungalow. Book your stay at Blue Ridge Beau today and prepare for an unforgettable escape to the beauty and tranquility of Afton, Virginia. Guest access The house is located on a 2 acre property with its own private driveway and ample parking for up to 7 vehicles. There is a remote entry with individual code that will be provided upon reservation. Other things to note The primary suite is located on the main level with attached ensuite and large walk-in closet. The 1/2 bath on the main level includes a full functioning washer & dryer for our guests during their stay. Upstairs there are two bedrooms and a full bathroom. One bedroom is a KING. The other bedroom has a QUEEN and TWIN. The hallway bathroom has two vanities and a 6' long shower. High speed fiber optic internet is provided. The property is located centrally to 151 but a mile down off of a quiet road with sweeping views of the Blue Ridge Mountains and cow pasture/farmland. Dog friendly, but HYPOALLERGENIC NON-SHEDDING dogs only, two dogs max.

column70: Newly and lovingly created, spacious studio apartment designed with the comfort of our guests in mind. Enjoy this calm, stylish and private space, centrally located for convenient access to all things Charlottesville. We are located in a quiet and family oriented neighborhood with mature trees and wooded trails within walking distance. The space Our studio apartment is attached to our home and is a separate and private space. It is generally quite quiet since it has double built walls and ceiling with blown in insulation. Our family does reside in the attached home so it's possible you may occasionally hear us in the yard (which we reserve for our families use) or on rare occasions some sound from inside the house. Our families living spaces are on the opposite side of the attached home and there is little to no sound transfer. We strive to be respectful of our guests space and privacy at all times. This is a ground level space. There are no living quarters above or below. As this is a neighborhood, you may hear children playing and/or lawns being mowed and you'll likely see walkers, joggers and bike riders around the neighborhood. I strive to use non-toxic cleaners and keep a space that is clean and chemical free. I use an air purifier between guests and leave it in the space for your use if you wish. A selection of cozy, non-slip slipper socks are available in order to help you feel at home and to help keep the soft, plush wool rug clean and comfortable for all. There is a queen size bed with cotton sheets and an all season down duvet and down pillows. If you have a need for down alternative options please let me know in advance. The space is ideally suited to singles and couples. For an additional fee I will provide an air mattress and bedding for a 3rd person. The space is not suitable for young children and is a pet free space. Guest access You will have the entire studio apartment space to yourself with separate entrance. This includes a small, private deck with privacy fence and seating, accessible through the French doors at the rear of the apartment. The driveway and your parking space are right outside of your front door and a keyless entry allows for ease of arrival and settling in at your convenience. Other things to note -There is a blue tooth speaker in the space. -High speed fiber optic internet. -A smart TV with guest access to Amazon prime video, Netflix, Disney and Apple TV. Please use Guest access! -A few board games and a small variety of magazines and books in the peacock cabinet in the living room. -Extra throw blankets for cozying up on the couch. -Mini split system with remote for heating, cooling and fan. -Coffee grinder -Queen size bed -Room darkening curtains on windows and French doors.

column40: Located in Historic Beautiful Belmont neighborhood, only a 6 minute walk to the Downtown Mall. There are many critically acclaimed restaurants all within a 1 minute walk of the place. The space This is a roughly 700 square foot 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment with a living room and a bonus room (dining room/seating space). It has a huge balcony with an additional 250 square feet of space, with a view overlooking Downtown Belmont. PLEASE READ: This is an Historic older building so please keep in mind while it has tons of rustic bohemian charm, this is by no means new or modern. The entry stairway leading to unit and the common entryway foyer are quite run down and old looking. There are nicks and marks on walls and floor of unit. It only shares floor with one unit, and part of the kitchen wall with a side unit (bedroom does not share wall with neighbor), but you can hear muffled sounds from neighbors (as they can hear you), akin to most apartment buildings without concrete or brick walls. It is clean, very inviting and nice-looking, but if you are looking for new quality with few imperfections, this is not it. Other things to note Pets are allowed with a $150 fee per each pet for stays of 4 nights or fewer (pet fee will be greater for stays over 4 nights so please ask before booking if you'd like to check the longer stay pet fee amount). You MUST let me know about any pets in your welcome AirBnB message. *Pet fee is to be paid after booking. Pet fee is NOT included in the booking price that AirBnB collects, whether or not you mark pets in the reservation.* I ask you to NOT let pets on any furniture or beds and to pick up any waste in the yard.

Highlights of the kitchen include: ✧Fully stocked with cookware and dinnerware ✧Dining table with seating for 6+ ✧Coffee maker with coffee, creamer, and sugar provided Master Bedroom: Retreat to the upstairs master bedroom featuring a luxurious king bed, ample storage, and a smart TV. The en-suite bathroom offers convenience and privacy with all the necessary amenities. Highlights of the master suite include: ✧King bed with luxury mattress ✧Smart TV ✧Private bathroom with shower and fresh linens Mini Bunkroom: Our unique 'mini bunkroom' is a delightful space for kids, offering a fun and cozy environment with two twin beds and a low height ceiling that kids adore! Additional Bedrooms and Bathrooms: One downstairs bedroom features a king bed, while the other bedroom offers a queen bed. The shared full bathroom is conveniently located on the first floor and includes a shower/tub combo and washer/dryer. Outdoor Space: Enjoy the expansive outdoor area with a private hiking trail (use at your own risk) leading to the top of the property, where stunning views await. A small creek in the front adds to the serene ambiance, and the open space is perfect for outdoor activities and relaxation. To the side of the house, a converted garage structure provides a kid and teenager hangout with chairs and foosball! Lastly, a deck with propane firepit and grill provide a fun space to enjoy the outdoors with a juicy burger or s’mores. Highlights of the outdoor space include: ✧Private hiking trail ✧Small creek in the front ✧Plenty of open space for activities Location: Nestled in the heart of Nelson County, our home is close to a variety of attractions including breweries, wineries, hiking trails, and ski resorts. Experience the best of the region's outdoor adventures and local charm. Attention to Detail ✔ Cleanliness is a top priority, and we ensure a sparkling clean home for your arrival. ✔ Washer and dryer available for your use, along with ironing board and iron. ✔ First aid kit provided for minor injuries. ✔ Premium linens and basic paper goods included.0 ✔ Coffee, creamer, sugar provided. Guest access Guests will have access to the entire home and property, excluding a small locked owners closet. Entry is via a keypad on the front door, with a unique code provided in your check-in email. Other things to note Our home sits on a hill, and the driveway is somewhat steep, but the parking area at the top is level. We welcome house-trained dogs, making it a perfect retreat for your furry friends as well. Being as our property is in nature, one can sometimes expect to encounter wildlife in the area including deer, turkeys, bears, snakes, and other critters. Book your stay now and experience the ultimate getaway in Nelson County, where adventure and relaxation await!

column64: Ski and snowboard at Wintergreen mountain this year without the price tag! Drive 20 minutes to hit the slopes, then sample the many wineries, distilleries, cideries and breweries that make this little slice of Virginia famous. Stay in this lovely, spacious home with open floor plan, beautiful views and high speed broadband fiber internet (up to 1 Gbps upstream & downstream). 2 BR, 2 BA, two living rooms, kitchen, laundry room, and spectacular views. The space Both bedrooms are queen beds with brand new mattresses. Every room is full of natural light. The bathrooms are stocked with shower products. The kitchen is equipped for cooking and includes coffee maker/coffee, Keurig/Kcups, blender, crock pot, and microwave. There are spices, oil and sugar for guest use. Dining room table for dining and playing games. The laundry room includes detergent and dryer sheets. Electric wall fireplace by downstairs couch for cold days! Guest access You have full access to the cottage and the neighborhood. Enjoy lovely strolls or bike rides through the neighborhood and local roads. Other things to note Enjoy a local hike, like Lower Shamokin Falls or Pauls Creek Trail, then try out the best smoked turkey croissant sandwich and potato salad in the county at The Blue Ridge Pig in Nellysford. Take a bike ride on the Piney River Trail and stop by Bold Rock for a delicious local cider. Or, warm up with a latte at Trager Brothers Coffee in the Rockfish Valley community center and a fun look in the rock shop! Local Music: Waynesboro - The Foundry Charlottesville - The Jefferson, The Southern, Ting Pavilion

column70: 2 Bd/1 Bath - Walk to Charlottesville’s best restaurants/bars/bakeries on Main Street (3 min. walk - one of the closest you'll find)! Pets are welcome - no crazy pet fee and rear, fenced backyard to roam in! Walk to UVA (20 min), UVA hospital (15 min), the Downtown Mall (10 min), or the Amtrak train station (5 min)! One off-street parking spot, with additional paid parking available at the Amtrak parking lot (3/12/50 per hour/day/week, ~3 min) Please make sure to review all photos/descriptions! The space 100-Year-Old Cottage in the historic Starr Hill Neighborhood located off Main Street with rear fenced-in backyard. 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom Accommodates 2-4 comfortably. Check In: 3:00 PM Check Out: 11:00 AM Bathroom Shower: The house is 100 years old, and the one and only bathroom reflects that! Please note that the shower is 3ft x 3ft and is functional for most people but could be a bit snug for others. Otherwise, the bathroom is very clean and in great condition. Bedrooms: Each bedroom is equipped with a queen-sized bed, complete with linens, multiple pillows, a cozy comforter, and extra blankets. You will also find a tower fan with a remote control, as well as a ceiling fan to ensure a comfortable temperature. For convenience, there is a suitcase rack and a full-length mirror. USB charging ports for phones are also available on each bedside table. Living Room: Living room includes Samsung Smart TV with Amazon firestick remote - Netflix & HBO included. One Bluetooth speaker on table and high-speed internet are also available. Kitchen: The kitchen is spacious and well-equipped; features include a gas stove, microwave, and a Keurig coffee machine (we provide pods to get you started). We also have a toast oven/air fryer, a work station, and a wide selection of pots, pans, plates, cups, and flatware. Additionally, we have bakeware and (pretty much) everything else you might need (except for food). Before you go shopping, please check to see what we already have! Pets: One leash, dog bowls, and bags are provided for your convenience! Backyard: Large, gated backyard - (make sure both gates are closed and) feel free to let your dog roam around! Outdoor furniture on back patio and Weber charcoal grill (in the shed) are also provided. We do have the backyard sprayed regularly for mosquitoes and ticks. If you think of something that you feel like you might need, please let me know and I'll do my best to accommodate!

column31: Upgrade your stay with our Deluxe King Room at The Doyle. This spacious retreat features a luxurious king-sized bed and a comfortable sofa bed, perfect for families or extra guests. Enjoy modern amenities, including complimentary Wi-Fi, a flat-screen TV, and a stylish bathroom with premium toiletries. Located in the heart of Charlottesville, our Deluxe King Room combines elegance and convenience for an unforgettable experience. The space Discover The Doyle, an 80-suite boutique hotel perfectly situated within walking distance of the University of Virginia and the vibrant heart of Charlottesville. Our elegantly designed suites provide a blend of comfort and style, making every stay memorable. Enjoy a culinary journey at our onsite restaurants and unwind with a drink at our chic bars. Whether you're here for business, leisure, or exploring the local culture, The Doyle offers the ideal retreat with the best of Charlottesville just steps away. Guest access Experience the future of hospitality with our front desk-less model at The Doyle. 24 hours before your arrival, you'll receive a custom code for easy room access. On the day of check-in, you can virtually check in as early as 6am, ensuring a smooth and personalized experience. Upon booking, you'll gain access to our guest portal, offering detailed information about your stay, the check-in process, and local attractions. Skip the lines and start relaxing right away with our innovative approach to hospitality. At The Doyle, convenience and comfort are always at your fingertips. Other things to note During the virtual check-in process, you'll be required to submit your information separately in our guest portal. Here you will sign a rental agreement outlining the terms of your stay and submit a refundable security deposit of $250 via credit card. This deposit, if unused, will be returned within 7 days after check-out. For security purposes, we collect and verify government-issued IDs and a matching credit card before check-in. Additionally, to ensure a smooth and secure check-in process, we will collect your email address and phone number. MID-STAY CLEAN: Mid-stay cleaning services are available for an additional fee of $60 per cleaning. We’re thrilled to offer a pet-friendly space for you and your furry friends to enjoy. column36: This is a quiet 2 bedroom 2 full bath on the top floor overlooking a very pretty street only 2 minutes walk from the Downtown Mall. Comes with crazy fast WiFi. It has a fully equipped kitchen including a dishwasher and a Keurig coffee maker. The Master Bedroom has a full bath en suite and is quite big with lots of light coming in. Other things to note PLEASE READ HOUSE RULES BEFORE BOOKING I want guests to be able to check-in as early as possible. Due to the large amount of linens to be laundered between guests and the short amount of time do it, the washer/dryer will often have linens in them so that another load can run after cleaner leaves. You are welcome to use the washer/dryer, but will sometimes have to take out a load in order to do so. If you specifically know you will use the washer/dryer during your stay and don't want to have to do this, please let me know prior to check-in and I'll tell my cleaner to leave them empty for you. While you are welcome to use washer and dryer, I do NOT provide laundry detergent.

NO cable or satellite channels in the rooms. GRACE AUDIO 18

column68: This newly renovated 2nd story apartment is ideally located in the quiet and historic Woolen Mills neighborhood just 0.4 miles from Riverview Park, 1.2 miles from the Downtown Mall, and 2.5 miles from UVA Health. Featuring 650 sq ft of living space, a compact yet fully-equipped kitchen, all new appliances, comfy queen bed with high-quality linens, dedicated workspace, and easy street parking, this calm and stylish space is a perfect jumping off point for your upcoming stay in Charlottesville. The space This apartment is the top floor of a duplex, with the lower unit currently rented to a long-term tenant. The apartment features a private entrance with electronic key pad, and no spaces are shared between the two units. The apartment is well decorated, very clean, and comfortably equipped with all new appliances and furnishings. There is a small but thoughtfully designed galley kitchen, which is fully stocked with an oven/stove, large microwave, full-size refrigerator, and high-quality cooking tools and tableware. Additional counter space is provided by a stand-alone pantry cabinet in the main living area. A water purifier is provided. The open living room/dining features a comfortable couch, large TV, and dining table with seating for 4 people. The remainder of the home includes a bedroom with a comfortable queen bed and small closet, a second room which functions as a laundry room and office, and a small bathroom with a tub shower. The apartment enjoys a lot of natural light through its many windows as well a nice view of the surrounding neighborhood. Heating and cooling are supplied via a modern, quiet mini-split system with separate units in the bedroom and main living area. Parking is free and always available on the quiet residential street in front of the building. Please note the apartment is on the 2nd story and the entrance is located at the top of a flight of steps.

Restaurants: Fine Dining:  The Alley Light (0.9 miles, 19 minute walk): A cozy spot offering a variety of delicious small plates and cocktails.  C&O Restaurant (0.7 miles, 12 minute walk): Known for its elegant setting and exquisite menu, perfect for a special night out.  Fleurie Restaurant (0.8 miles, 16 minute walk): Offers refined French cuisine in an elegant setting.  The Ivy Inn Restaurant (5.5 miles, must drive): Upscale American/Greek fare with a focus on local ingredients in a historic setting. Casual Dining:  Hogwaller Burger & Brewery - Bar (0.2 miles, 4 minute walk): A great place for gourmet burgers and a wide selection of beers.  Riverside Burger - A Charlottesville institution for Smash Burgers & Fries. (0.2, 4 minute walk)  Tavola (0.9 miles, 18 minutes): Authentic Italian cuisine with a warm and inviting atmosphere.  Mas Tapas (0.9 miles, 18 minute walk): Enjoy a lively atmosphere and a fantastic selection of tapas.  The Local (0.9 miles, 18 minutes): A favorite for locally-sourced American cuisine.  Beer Run (0.8 miles, 17 minute walk): Great for craft beer lovers and casual dining.  Public Fish & Oyster (1.3 miles, 27 minute walk): Fresh seafood and a great oyster selection.  Lampo Neapolitan Pizzeria (0.7 miles, 13 minute walk): Fantastic wood-fired pizzas in a cozy environment.  Petit Pois Restaurant (0.8 miles, 17 minutes): A charming French bistro with classic dishes. Ethnic Cuisine:  Himalayan Fusion (0.6 miles, 13 minutes): Serves Indian and Nepalese cuisine with a variety of flavorful options.  Monsoon Siam (0.8 miles, 18 minutes): Excellent Thai cuisine in a relaxed setting.  Guadalajara Mexican Restaurant (0.5 miles, 10 minutes): A popular spot for tasty Mexican food. Bars:  The Historic Downtown Mall (0.7 miles, 14 minutes): A vibrant pedestrian mall with shops, restaurants, and entertainment.  The Whiskey Jar (0.9 miles, 20 minutes): Southern-inspired food with an extensive whiskey selection.  The Alley Light (0.9 miles, 20 minutes): Also a great spot for craft cocktails. Places of Interest:  Monticello (4.5 miles, 12-minute DRIVE): The historic home of Thomas Jefferson, offering tours and beautiful grounds.  The Paramount Theater (0.7 miles, 16 minutes): A historic theater that hosts concerts, films, and live performances.  IX Art Park (1.1 miles, 23 minutes): A dynamic public space with art installations, events, and activities.  University of Virginia (1.8 miles, 35 minutes): Explore the beautiful campus and its historic landmarks. Music Venues:  The Jefferson Theater (0.7 miles, 16 minutes): A historic venue featuring live music and performances.  The Southern Café and Music Hall (0.8 miles, 18 minutes): Intimate venue with a variety of live music acts.  Ting Pavilion (0.5 miles, 12 minutes): Outdoor venue hosting concerts and events. Things to Do:  Virginia Discovery Museum (1.1 miles, 22 minutes): Great for families with children, offering interactive exhibits and activities.  Wine Tour: Charlottesville is surrounded by beautiful wineries offering tastings and tours.  Riverview Park (1.3 miles, 28 minutes): Enjoy a scenic walk or bike ride along the Rivanna River Trail.  Charlottesville City Market (0.7 miles, 16 minutes): A lively farmers market offering fresh produce, local crafts, and more (Saturdays only).  McGuffey Art Center (0.8 miles, 18 minutes): Art gallery featuring local artists and rotating

Within walking distance to The historic Downtown Mall and all the best bars and restaurants.The Pavillion is a (7) min walk and the mall starts there. You’re by the AMAZING Rivanna Trail and Hogwaller Brewery (AMAZING Burger & Music)…You’re by every main artery to the hospitals and wineries/breweries. You have the best restaurants and Mall within blocks of your location as well as the ICONIC Riverside a block away. The space Brand new buildout. Close to everything with private parking. Ideal location for all you would/could and want to do - in Charlottesville. We have close proximity to every major artery serving all parts of Charlottesville and Albermarle County. We’re blocks away from some of the best pizza, tacos, burgers (Riverside) and trails. We are your convenient, comfortable, one stop shop for everything that this area has to offer and done so, at a value. Hope to host you soon😊

column41: The 4-star Oakhurst Inn is a lovely property nestled in Charlottesville, Virginia. Its location close to the University of Virginia makes it ideal for those visiting their student friends or family. This inn also offers a variety of attractive facilities, including plenty of outdoor spaces and a lobby with a fireplace. Throughout your stay, you are ensured comfort, convenience, and an air of small-town charm. ✔ Lobby Bar - Open Daily 4pm-9pm ✔ Espresso bar ✔ Restaurant - Southern Classics The space The rooms at Oakhurst Inn are designed with comfort, style, and elegance in mind. Guests can enjoy a private bathroom with complimentary toiletries, a hairdryer, and a shower. For entertainment, there is a flat-screen TV with cable and satellite channels. ✔ Maximum occupancy: 2 ✔ 1 Queen bed ✔ Flat-screen TV ✔ Ironing facilities ✔ Air-conditioned Guest access Guest have complete access to all hotel facilities. Other things to note ▶ Mandatory fees — An incidental deposit is required at arrival. This will be collected by credit card. You should be reimbursed within 7 days of check-out. Your deposit will be refunded in full by credit card, subject to an inspection of the property. ▶ Other fees — Breakfast and lunch are available - prices vary for menu items, ranging from $6 to $20 (tax included) ▶ Parking — Paid parking on site for $15 per night, plus tax ▶ Pets — Oakhurst Inn offers a limited number of pet-friendly rooms for an additional $75 per pet per night plus tax — Up to two dogs are allowed — Dog bed and bowls will be provided ▶ Most popular facilities — Outdoor swimming pool w/ sun loungers — On-site cafe — Coffee/tea in the lobby — 24-hour front desk — Free newspapers — Helpful staff — Great location ▶ Activities — Monday Night Live Jazz Trio in the Chateau Lobby Bar — Golf course within 1.9 mi (additional charge) ▶ What to do — Check out over 100 shops and restaurants in Downtown Mall - 8 minutes away — Catch a game in the state’s oldest football stadium, Scott Stadium - 3 minutes away — Visit Thomas Jefferson’s home for a glimpse into one of our founding father’s life and legacy - 14 minutes away — Take a tour of the University of Virginia, which was founded by Thomas Jefferson himself in 1819 - 3 minutes away — Go on a journey through the vibrant forest trails of Ragged Mountain - 10 minutes away ▶ Food & Beverage — Breakfast and Lunch served from 7 am to 2 pm Monday through Friday, and Weekend — Brunch served from 8 am to 2 pm Saturday and Sunday
column48: Charming Stay | Happy Hour. Coffee Bar. Near UVA.

column60: Welcome home to this elegant and spacious Charlottesville townhouse! Containing 3 separate master suites with en suite bathrooms, on-site laundry, a well equipped kitchen, a dining room, and a huge living room, you will have all the luxuries of a large and well-appointed house in a setting that can't be beat! Located adjacent to The Shops at Stonefield, a premier Charlottesville outdoor shopping center, you will be steps away from green spaces, restaurants, grocery stores, shopping, and more. The space This unit is a secluded upstairs Master Suite located on the back side of the townhouse. Large windows on the back wall provide lovely natural lighting. The high ceilings of this home add to the spacious feel and the room has a large walk-in closet and a full bathroom with walk-in shower conveniently located inside the bedroom! Laundry can be found just outside your bedroom door. The other two master suites in the house may be rented to other professionals (usually medical) and the main floor of the townhouse contains the shared areas of living room, dining area, and kitchen. This floor will be cleaned professionally biweekly at no cost to you! Well-behaved pets will be considered for an additional charge of $250. Guest access You will have access to the whole house with the exception of the other guests' bedrooms and bathrooms. During your stay I live close by and am happy to help with anything that is needed!

column39: *PLEASE READ* Brand new listing so setup is still being finished. Photos are accurate of what's setup so far and it will be fully setup for everything you would need to use and enjoy all rooms by March 20th, however finishing touches may not be finished (like wall decor,, amenities, etc). It is listed at a discounted price for the first 5 days so please take advantage! I will update the photos as the place continues to be finished. Please note $150 pet fee per pet to be paid after booking. The space Located in Historic Beautiful Belmont neighborhood, only a 6 minute walk to the Downtown Mall. There are many critically acclaimed restaurants all within a 1 minute walk of the place. Designed in a rustic bohemian style, this place definitely represents Charlottesville! This is a roughly 700 square foot 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment with a living room and a bonus room (dining room/seating space). It has a spacious front and back balcony deck, with a view overlooking Downtown Belmont. PLEASE READ: This is an Historic older building so please keep in mind while it has tons of rustic bohemian charm, this is by no means new or modern. The entry stairway leading to unit and the common entryway foyer are quite run down and old looking. There are nicks and marks on walls and floor of unit. It only shares floor with one unit, and part of the kitchen wall with a side unit (bedroom does not share wall with neighbor), but you can hear muffled sounds from neighbors (as they can hear you), akin to most apartment buildings without concrete or brick walls. It is clean, very inviting and nice-looking, but if you are looking for new quality with few imperfections, this is not it. Other things to note Pets are allowed with a $150 fee per each pet for stays of 4 nights or fewer (pet fee will be greater for stays over 4 nights so please ask before booking if you'd like to check the longer stay pet fee amount). You MUST let me know about any pets in your welcome AirBnB message. *Pet fee is to be paid after booking. Pet fee is NOT included in the booking price that AirBnB collects, whether or not you mark pets in the reservation.* I ask you to NOT let pets on any furniture or beds and to pick up any waste in the yard.
column46: 6 min Walk to Downtown Mall, Rustic Bohemian Digs!

column31: Discover the perfect blend of comfort and elegance in our Deluxe Double Queen Suite at The Doyle. Ideal for families or groups, this spacious suite features two luxurious queen-sized beds, modern amenities, and stylish decor. Enjoy complimentary Wi-Fi, a flat-screen TV, and a well-appointed bathroom with premium toiletries. Located in the heart of Charlottesville, our Deluxe Double Queen Suite offers a relaxing and convenient stay, with all the city's attractions just a short walk away. The space Discover The Doyle, an 80-suite boutique hotel perfectly situated within walking distance of the University of Virginia and the vibrant heart of Charlottesville. Our elegantly designed suites provide a blend of comfort and style, making every stay memorable. Enjoy a culinary journey at our onsite restaurants and unwind with a drink at our chic bars. Whether you're here for business, leisure, or exploring the local culture, The Doyle offers the ideal retreat with the best of Charlottesville just steps away. Guest access Experience the future of hospitality with our front desk-less model at The Doyle. 24 hours before your arrival, you'll receive a custom code for easy room access. On the day of check-in, you can virtually check in as early as 6am, ensuring a smooth and personalized experience. Upon booking, you'll gain access to our guest portal, offering detailed information about your stay, the check-in process, and local attractions. Skip the lines and start relaxing right away with our innovative approach to hospitality. At The Doyle, convenience and comfort are always at your fingertips. Other things to note During the virtual check-in process, you'll be required to submit your information separately in our guest portal. Here you will sign a rental agreement outlining the terms of your stay and submit a refundable security deposit of $250 via credit card. This deposit, if unused, will be returned within 7 days after check-out. For security purposes, we collect and verify government-issued IDs and a matching credit card before check-in. Additionally, to ensure a smooth and secure check-in process, we will collect your email address and phone number. MID-STAY CLEAN: Mid-stay cleaning services are available for an additional fee of $60 per cleaning. We’re thrilled to offer a pet-friendly space for you and your furry friends to enjoy. To ensure a comfortable and clean environment for all guests, a pet fee will be collected: Fee: $50 per stay Maximum Pets Allowed: 2 per room

column44: Little Mod Hotel is a 1960s-inspired hotel located in Charlottesville, Virginia. Its interior is true to its theme - vibrant and colorful, with nostalgic decor such as vinyls and record players to set a charming, old-timey vibe. Besides its theme, this hotel's location makes it a great choice, as it is near landmarks such as the University of Virginia and Mount Jefferson. ✔ Food truck serving breakfast and lunch ✔ Pet-friendly policy ✔ Picnic area ✔ Great location ✔ Friendly staff The space The rooms at Little Mod Hotel are designed with nostalgia and comfort in mind. They feature air conditioning and carpeted floors. Guests can also enjoy a private bathroom with free toiletries, a hair dryer, and a shower. For entertainment, there is a flat-screen HDTV with cable channels as well as a record player with vinyls provided. Units also offer a telephone for those who are bringing work with them. ✔ Maximum occupancy: 2 ✔ 1 King bed ✔ Mini fridge ✔ Down comforters ✔ Dedicated climate control Other things to note ▶ Mandatory fees — An incidental deposit is required on arrival. This will be collected by credit card. You should be reimbursed within 7 days of check-out. Your deposit will be refunded in full by credit card, subject to an inspection of the property. ▶ Other fees — Breakfast and lunch are available - prices vary for a la carte items from $6 to $18, tax included ▶ Parking — Self-parking is available in a garage at 104 14th St NW (200 feet from the hotel) - fees vary ▶ Pets — This property is pet-friendly for an additional non-refundable fee of $75 per pet, per night (plus tax) — Max. 2 pets per room, dogs only — Dog bed and bowls will be provided ▶ Most popular facilities — Restaurant/Food truck — WiFi available in all areas — Non-smoking rooms — Facilities for guests with disabilities — Tea/coffee maker in all rooms — Breakfast and lunch ▶ Activities — Dining at Mod Pod — Picnicking — Bonding with pets ▶ What to do — Tour the University of Virginia (UVA), which was founded by Thomas Jefferson and contains his Academical Village, a UNESCO World Heritage Site - 5 minutes away — Take your kids to Virginia Discovery Museum, where they can enjoy interactive exhibits in art, history & science - 7 minutes away — Hike Mount Jefferson and enjoy views from its peak - 10 minutes away — Play a friendly game of tennis at Snyder Tennis Center - 4 minutes away — Catch a game or concert at John Paul Jones Arena - 5 minutes away — Visit Monticello, home of the late 3rd US President Thomas Jefferson - 14 minutes away ▶ Food & Beverage — Breakfast to lunch: Daily from 7:30 am - 2:00 pm - Currently on summer hours (Closed Monday and Tuesday)
column51: Hip Abode | 1960s Vibe. Food Truck. Pet-Friendly.

column69: Kick back and relax in this private, peaceful setting. The Cottage at Deer Ridge Farm is nestled in a clearing on 220 acres surrounded by a forest of beautiful hardwoods. Minutes from many wonderful local wineries, as well as several places of historical significance : Monticello, Highlands, and Michie Tavern. A short drive will take you to The University of Virginia, as well as the Downtown pedestrian mall, which is full of wonderful restaurants, eateries, shopping and live music venues.
column76: The Cottage at Deer Ridge Farm
